title: Big Apple Lodging Gem
text: Recently returned from Manhattan, and was so pleasantly surprised by the quality of The Michelangelo.  Even though it's in the busy Theater District on a very hectic street, the room was quiet and large for NYC standards.  Comfortable bed and pillows, great shower, easy walking to attractions, but it's the staff that makes this hotel perfect.  You'll be greeted by friendly and helpful doormen, pleasant reception staff, and aided by Concierge whenever needed.  Based on my prior lodging experiences in NYC, this one is now at the top of my list.  If I return to the Big Apple, I'll stay here again.

title: Quiet refuge from the excitement
text: Second time staying here and I hope to be back again and again. This place is like a tranquil respite from the city outside. So calm and serene when you enter the lobby. Rooms are quiet. Service is exceptional. Staff sets the bar for all other hotels to meet. Was here with my adult children for holidays and the location of this hotel is the best to see all the sites. Fantastic experience!

title: Location, Facilities, Service All amazing
text:
We travelled to the city for a holiday and it was the best place to stay. It is right on times square and within walking distance from the Rockefeller center, the location also has good public transport links including a direct E line travel to Jamaica, the location where you get the air train.

The hotel itself is amazing, the doormen immediately took our bags and brought them up to our room, the WIFI is very strong and while I didn't go into the gym there, one of the people who I travelled with said she "Loved it" 

Each day when we would get back one of the doormen would open the door for us, while it's small and thier job, it was a great thing to have ever day, They did Thier job incredibly well. Another thing to mention, when we got back to the room the maids had remade the beds and restocked our towels, again I know that is Thier job, but they did it so well. 

On the final day in the city they allowed us to store our bags in a specific bag storage room as we had checked out with one day left to do stuff in the city.

title: Noise, no room coffee, frozen sleep, and poor service cancel out comfy bed
text:
Staying in Manhattan for a week of working out of Times Square office. Have tried several other hotels within five blocks of 50th and Broadway but so far have found only one that would not cause me to flinch if I had to stay there again - however, it was too expensive for my company's policy this time, and the Michelangelo had decent reviews. My experience, however, does not leave me wanting to stay here again. The gentleman that checked me in was very nice and professional. I asked about coffee in the room and he said there isn't any, but that since I was staying for the week he would have a Keurig brought to the room. I asked if they might have ear plugs and he said he'd have some delivered.

After checking in and getting to the room I found it pretty cold. Since I'm normally concerned about a room that is too hot, this didn't frighten me - I figured I could turn up the heat, and I checked the heater under the window and it was definitely working. There was a large modern floor unit air conditioner in the room with a large air hose taped into a window, which let in a lot of noise from the outside, and the window itself couldn't be sealed shut with the hose in it, so it was leaking a lot of cold NYC air into the room. Again, I figured I could turn up the heat. 

I wanted a shower after the day's flight and noticed that I could hear voices coming through a grate in the bath/shower enclosure. I could definitely make out the conversation clearly. Before heading out I went to wash my hands and noticed the spigot water flow is practically up against the bowl, so there is almost no way to put your hands fully under the running water. Poor design and installation. 

When I returned after getting dinner there was a Keurig on a counter, and I figured I'd better try it out before assuming it would work in the morning. It didn't, and ended up with water coming out the bottom and flooding the counter and onto the carpet. I used towels to contain it and called down to ask them to come look at it and confirm it works or replace it. I was told they would come up right away. I then left again to go out for a  walk and came back an hour or so later to find nothing had been done, and there were no ear plugs in the room. I called down again, and this time a new machine was brought and the broken one taken away. 

The room never got warm, I was moved the next day, to a much better room, but still super loud with street noise.

title: A wonderful, calm oasis in the middle of Times Square
text: Beautiful, old-style hotel. Huge rooms, comfy beds, walk-in closet! Black out shades AND fabric curtains keep the light from the outside screens from coming in. Quiet rooms. Delicious breakfast. Outsanting service from check-in to check-out. Truly a gem in the middle of the chaos that is Times Square. Close to theatres, public transportation, Rockefeller Center.

title: Best Location and Spacious Rooms
text: I have stayed at the Michelangelo many times. The staff is friendly, but my primary reasons are the spacious, well-supplied rooms and the location--near the theatre district and good restaurants but not right in Times Square. My most recent visit was with my sister who looked at a case of historic objects in the lobby. The Michelangelo was once the Taft Hotel--WHERE OUR PARENTS SPENT THEIR HONEYMOON!

title: Family trip to New York City
text:
Having read positive reviews we decided to stay at The Michaelangelo for our family trip to NYC. This would normally be out of our price range but it was a special occasion, celebrating 18th and 50th birthdays. 
The hotel was perfect.  Wonderful relaxed feel as you walk in, which is in stark contrast to the nearby madness of Times Square. 
Great central, midtown location for visiting all the must see sites.
All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. 
They advised us to book our taxi back to the airport earlier than normal as the president was in town at Radio City which is yards away from the hotel and the traffic would be heavy due to road closures. 

Would highly recommend a stay at The Michaelangelo!

title: Best of the best
text: The hotel is clean, rooms are very comfortable and the location is ideal for sightseeing. It is the exemplary service that made the difference during our stay here during the St. Patrick’s Day weekend.  Walther at the front desk was so pleasant and kind and helped with so many details when we checked in. Teodore at the front door was also so welcoming that you felt like the whole place was family. I lost count of how many friendly, pleasant staff greeted us or helped us. As far as location, while they offer room service as well as food in their lounge on the first floor, an excellent alternative is the Majestic deli a block away.  We will stay here again most certainly!

title: Amazing hotel
text: My stay at The Michelangelo started with a very warm welcome at the reception. The staff here are very helpful, kind, and friendly. Breakfast and lunch were both timely served and delicious. Rooms are clean, well equipped. Location is great, at the centre of Midtown Manhattan, but sometimes can be a bit noisy due to the area. Still didn’t experience much of an issue as my room was facing to the side road. Definitely will come back again!

title: A lovely, comfortable hotel with friendly staff
text:
This was my first stay at the Michelangelo but it will not be my last! From the warm greeting by the doormen to the friendly, helpful service at the front desk by Angel and June to the delicious martini made by the barman Luna, my first impression was great. And the room was very clean and well appointed. The hotel was very quiet. The only thing I heard was the closing of other rooms' doors, which is pretty common in any hotel. I honestly felt like the only person there! Breakfast was delicious, the area was central, the bed was comfy...just a lovely place. 

For anyone who has fragrance issues, the in-room shampoo and conditioner had a slight fragrance but it washed out right away. The soap was a bit more fragranced, so I wish I had brought my own. But nothing else in the room had any fragrance...very appreciated by my sensitive nose!

title: So quiet, and great location!
text: You can't beat the location of the Michelangelo.  On quiet W 51 Street, we never heard a peep of traffic or street noise during our stay.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  The room was so comfortable and the bed was also extremely comfortable.  The hotel is very close to Central Park and Times Square, but also several subway stations for getting around town.  Highly highly recommend this hotel for a weekend in NYC!

title: Wonderful service and experience at the Michelangelo in New York!
text: The Michelangelo proved to be a great stay. The room was beautiful and the experience was only enhanced by the lovely, helpful gentlemen at the front desk, Angel, Walter and Henry! We will definitely be staying here on the next trip into the city.

title: Superb at Great Prices
text:
Excellent hotel with superb service. This cannot be beat for the price.

Beautiful, well appointed rooms. Did I mention service? It was exceptional from valets, to front desk, to maid and room service.

Well stocked mini bar, fresh water provided daily. Full bar in the lobby. Great, convenient location.

title: Great option Great location
text: It is always a pleasure to go back to The Michelangelo, very well located and close to many interesting places and restaurants.  The hotel has a very helpful staff, starting from Marco the GM who always pamper us. Rooms and Suites have plenty of space and are very comfortable. Breakfasts menu offers a great variety with very generous portions.

title: It's a Gem..Stay Here!
text: We really enjoyed our stay. All of the staff we dealt with were incredible. Teadoro was so helpful and friendly. We checked out during the marathon on 7th Ave and he ran down to 6th to get a cab to pick us up and take us to the airport. Our 2 queen room was very large. Some of the furniture seems like it could be replaced but the beds were super comfortable and our room was nice and clean. We cannot wait to visit again.

title: Recommend this hotel
text: The staff was amazing. Literally everyone we spoke to was extremely friendly and provided amazing customer service.  The staff at the bar/kitcken were awesome.  The door staff were the best.  I can't day enough good things about the superior service that was provided to us. This is our second time staying at this hotel and we will definitely return back.

title: Excellent
text:
We stayed for 6 days
The location is excellent, everything is within walking or metro distance, the hotel smells delicious and is always clean
The people who work there are the most outstanding, always with the best service attitude.
Highly recommended
We would always return

title: Fantastic stay and looking forward to returning
text:
This was our second stay at the Michelangelo and it did not disappoint.
Our trip was a bit special as we were celebrating my wife’s birthday so we wanted somewhere we knew. We were greeted at the main entrance and our bags taken. Check in was a breeze and we were delighted to be upgraded to a junior suite. Needless to say the room was fantastic: spacious and luxurious.
The hotel is elegant and well maintained. 
We like staying in Midtown as we can walk just about anywhere (and we were walking about 10 miles a day). Although it is close to Time Square, it is far enough away to avoid the craziness. Central Park is less than a 10 minute walk away so we could get in a few morning runs. Basically, the hotel and location are great.
The staff are wonderful and couldn’t do enough for us. From the bar staff to housekeeping they were exceptional. We will definitely be back.

title: Recent business trip
text: Had a business event at Carnegie Hall and decided to book here for the first time.  From the front door, front desk, housekeeping, breakfast team, to the evening bar service, every team member was consistently pleasant and addressed you with eye contact.

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text:
After navigating the busy New York traffic for almost 2 hours from JFK Airport, we arrived at this beautiful art deco hotel. The location was simply perfect, minutes from Times Square and within walking distances to many attractions. 
Check in was straightforward and all the staff were very friendly and smiley.
Our room (junior suite) was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The mini bar however was very expensive and the room can be noisy at times from the streets below as the windows are not double glazed. However we slept comfortably every night without being woken up by the street noise.
We didn’t have breakfast at the hotel as there are many cafes/diners nearby. We particularly enjoyed Cosmic Diner round the corner.
Tea/coffee making facilities in the room would be a nice addition but this wouldn’t stop me from recommending this hotel.

title: Great old hotel with new problem
text: We always enjoy staying at the Michelangelo. However, the $50 per night facility fee was not obvious on booking directly through their website, and was not even mentioned on the confirmation email received at time of booking. It did list taxes and a small additional fee, but no mention of the large facility fee. This will hurt the brand.

title: Great in some ways, terrible in one.
text:
Most of the staff very nice and facilities have an "old New York" feel to them. Location is excellent. Rooms were also very quite. We had a suite, and unfortunately it was one of the "less bright" suite options with interior windows. The "brighter" suites were not available through house-keeping until late in the day.
This being said… The manager covering the front desk was rude and confrontational. I had a situation where my parked was called by the front desk prematurely. They said I was an hour over the 24 hour timeframe and had to pay an additional $60 for an extra day.
As such, I requested that if I have to pay an extra day, I'll keep the car in the lot while I explore Times Square and have breakfast. Apparently the parking garage is a separate company, and despite the front desk attendant calling for the car prematurely, the manager stated that "it is the way it is" and ! "have to pay now and get my car back." I spent over $900 on a room, taxes, and an "extra" parking day. I am disappointed most about how I was spoken to. The manager stood away from the front desk opening mail while talking, minimal to no eye contact, in plain street clothes. So much for hospitality...

title: The Michelangelo is a home away from home
text: I have been staying at the Michelangelo for well over thirty years.  It has become a home away from home.  While the facilities are excellent, it is the long serving staff of the Hotel that make the big difference.  I don't know any hotel that has kept the core of its staff as long as The Michelangelo or that has a staff as helpful and committed.

title: Nice stay at the hotel
text: Overall great location for me. The staff was great. It is an old fashioned hotel. The room is quiet you can’t hear the street. It is very spacious, clean yet the plumbing makes noise from time to time. I don’t have any complaints.

title: Do Not Hesitate to Stay Here
text: The location and charm of this hotel cannot be beat!  Biggest room I have ever had in NYC.  Great staff, especially Joseph, the doorman, and Shawn behind bar.  You can walk to all the must-see sights from The Michelangelo.  I will be back!

title: Spacious and clean room, solid choice for Midtown
text: Some friends and I attended an event in midtown so we found The Michelangelo.  Comparable in price to other midtown hotels, this room was quite a bit. more spacious than anything else. Also, this is a few blocks north of Times Square so it is more discreet than being in the bustle of the square. The hotel is less pretentious than some of the other 4-stars and the lobby and restaurant are a nice sanctuary. The staff were very accommodating, friendly, and open. Decent Italian-style pizza, and a low-key lounge and restaurant.  A very good stay.  I would consider this again when staying in Midtown!

title: Great Stay!
text:
Thank you again, Michelangelo and your top notch staff!  Nestled away right in the heart of Manhattan, there is a jewel of a hotel on 51st Street!
Thank you, Mr. Luna Jimenez!
A very enjoyable, very wonderful stay and another new and wonderful cocktail to enjoy!

title: the place to stay in Manhattan
text: This hotel really makes you feel welcome.  Staff is friendly, helpful,and no better bar/lobby to relax.  Wonderful place to meet friends, have a great snack or meal, and wonderful cocktail.  The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well appointed.  The place to stay in Manhattan.

title: STAY HERE
text: The hotel is clean, quiet, comfortable, convenient, and all around a wonderful place to stay! The staff is friendly - especially Teodoro (doorman), Brian (bellman), and Luna (bartender) - and so helpful. They all made a point to remember my husband and I and referenced earlier conversations we had with them indicating they were really paying attention when we spoke. We will absolutely stay here again!

title: Theatre District Gem
text: We have stayed at this property on several occasions and it never disappoints. We had three rooms for our family and they were all well appointed and spacious. It’s a remarkably well situated hotel and makes hitting shows and other attractions easy. We encountered several people this stay that were a pleasure at every interaction. The bellman Teodoro was an absolute standout. You can tell he loves his job, greets you warmly, goes out of his way to deliver great service, he was a pleasure. Edwin was another bellman that just accommodated our requests and made you feel taken care of. We had multiple check ins by text during our stay to make sure everything was good and we appreciated that level of detail. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Fabulous!
text:
EXCELLENT!
Will Go Again!
The Rooms Are Spacious, Clean and Comfortable. 
Excellent Staff (Doorman, Bellman-Edwin, Reservation / Check-in Staff and Housekeeping Services). 
We Also Enjoyed the Lobby area Restaurant &  Bar. 
 
I Cannot Say Enough Good Things About the Michelangelo!
  
Bravo!

title: unjustified claim
text:
I stayed in the Blakely hotel and they charged me 75$ extra because I checked out at 1330 instead of 1100 as they claimed without my permission
They set their own rules withers you like it or not
Just because they have your card details they charged me without my approval

title: Great location and good value
text: Great location and friendly and attentive staff.  The hotel has large rooms and my sister and I stayed in a twin which had two queen beds loads of space and good quality decor. The bathroom has a separate vanity area which worked well for us. The bathroom is tired but functional but could do with an update. This hotel is great value very traditional and we loved the large room size and ability to get into Central Park or Times Square in a 15 minute walk. Late check out was not accommodated unless we paid £50 for every hour from 12 pm which was the only disappointing aspect as it felt a little greedy!

title: Top notch hotel experience
text: I have stayed at the Michelangelo for many years.  They always greet me with a smile and a sincere "Welcome Back".   A testament to the Michaelangelo is the length of time the employees have worked there.  10 years is on the low side.  I actually would like to try one of their other establishments in Italy someday.  Reserve a room and enjoy!

title: I have stayed at the Michelangelo many times over the past several years   to attend a conference nearby.
text: I love this hotel! With its old world Italian charms and beautiful chandeliers that make the most lovely music when the breeze blows through the doors provides ambience. The rooms are spacious and well appointed and are kept very clean with daily service. Most of all the staff is so accommodating, professional and always willing to go the extra mile to make your stay the most enjoyable. I would highly recommend a stay here.

title: Great Hotel for business stay
text:
A great hotel with excellent staff
Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping 
Special mention to the valets and doormen 
Very clean hotel and very clean and comfortable rooms
Their restaurant is excellent and food was delicious 
Thank you

title: Amazing Night! Cool Hotel!
text: This was not my first day at the Michelangelo hotel. Every time I go the service is great. The hotel staff treated us really well and helped my fiancé, and I celebrate our engagement! We will be back!

title: Love the Michelangelo
text: This was our first time at the Michelangelo and I was very impressed.  Upon arrival we were greeted with enthusiasm from Brian and our check- in was simple.  Our room was really great.  The bed and linens were very clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was also wonderful with plenty of space and amenities.  We will come back again for sure.  Don't hesitate to make a reservation at this property.  The staff makes you feel special.  All in all a great stay!

This hotel was amazing and so was the staff. The doormen Edwin & Nick were so nice & helpful with all things especially information. We were able to upgrade our room & get an early check in. The view was nice & out room was fabulous with so much  space,  which also came with complimentary robes! Every time we left our room we came back to being spotless. The location of this hotel was perfect you don’t have to walk over 20minutes to main attractions. Overall this hotel was a 10/10 experience from the friendly staff, clean room, nice location, & good bar drinks! :)

title: Comfortable and Elegant
text: I enjoyed this hotel, it has a very classy look to it and countless elegant touches like mirrors, chandeliers, and pretty carpets.  The hallway walk to the room was one with many twists and turns but the room was nice. The bed was very comfortable, the tub was quite large, and the location was easy to get to the subway, central park, or a number of other places.  I would definitely stay again.  (Though I wish I asked the name of the cranky front desk woman - I would not stay if everyone was like her and she is the reason it isn't 5 stars, she was just mean.  But all of the other front desk folks were kind, classy, and caring.)

title: Well situated boutique hotel
text: Gracious, hospitable staff. Prompt and courteous doormen. Comfortable, well-kept facility. The only issue is with the web site which did not have clear options for checking reservation or modifying it with out calling the hotel.

title: A lovely Hotel
text: The Hotel is in a great location, close to so many of New York’s attractions. The service from all Hotel staff has been excellent. Cleanliness of all facilities is also excellent. The Michelangelo also offers much larger rooms in comparison to others in NY.

title: 10 Stars!
text: I live in New York City but have always wanted to stay at the Michael Angelo.  I've stayed at many hotels and this is my absolute favorite!  The minute I walked in I was welcomed by Milagros who is the star of the show.  She was very nice and checked me in quickly.  Angel and the rest of the staff were great too.  The hotel is elegant, starting with the lobby and the rooms were gorgeous and very clean.  I asked for an upgrade and was told I was already upgraded to a studio.  The hotel was booked solid but you would think it was empty.  Not much people coming in and out.  It was very quiet I fell asleep quickly.  If you want to be close to Times Square but not in the middle of the caos this is the hotel for you.  Walking distance to Times Square about 5 minutes.  Check out Famous Original Rays pizza it's about a block away.  Pizza is amazing.  There are other eating options close by.  Can't wait to return to this hotel, you will not be disappointed!

title: Great position
text:
We booked very last minute and chose this hotel for its position and through our I Preffered Membership.  Other Trip Advisor members had said room size was large especially for a city
I had booked a King sized room but we were delighted to be  given an upgrade on our arrival.  The room was a great size just a shame that the bathroom was quite small if I have one fetish it’s shower curtains!!  Also it would be nice to have a tea/coffee machine in the room.   Our overall stay was really very pleasant

title: The Marvelous Michelangelo
text:
The location was great and my room was beautiful and spacious. Very well taken care of.

The staff was helpful at all times- making reservations, checking in and out and in the lounge.

Enjoyed having coffee in the lounge in the AM and the ambiance of an old hotel with beautiful details. I will certainly stay here again.

title: Welcoming and comfortable!
text:
Teodoro is the most wonderful, professional and attentive doorman!  He makes you feel as if you have arrived back home.  We always enjoy visiting with him.

Our room is always clean and our request for feather free is nicely accommodated.  The room darkening drapes are great!

The location is perfect and in walking distance to our favorite restaurants, theaters and shopping.

title: This is not dog friendly hotel. Unprofessional, front office management do not know how to communicate with guests.
text: I would not suggest this hotel to people who travel with dogs, not dog friendly, management of front office do not know how to fulfill guests needs, do not know how to communicate, do not listen, unprofessional. I travelled the world, first time such a bad experience.

title: Amazing!
text: We had the best service ever, everyone was really nice. The rooms are AMAZING, and the bed and pillows are like a dream. I highly recommend this hotel!  I promise you will not regret coming here. They make sure you are well taken care of the moment you walk through the door.

title: Welcoming, comfortable, outstanding staff
text:
Outstanding staff, lovely good size room with extra bathroom amenities not seen too often anymore, excellent breakfast and evening food is also good. 
 Very convenient for theatre. Quick places to eat in the immediate area not so good as would be expected in the main tourist area of NYC and reviews of brunch places inaccurate.  We didn’t ask the staff for recommendations so that was our fault. 

I am a former New Yorker and have stayed at a number of hotels all around town. This is the winner and we will return often to our new “home.”

title: The Michelangelo NYC is my go to.
text: I️ regularly stay at The Michelangelo.  It is in a prime location and the staff is always helpful. It seems to be filled with repeat visitors who are warmly welcomed.  The staff does not have a lot of turnover and it is nice to see familiar faces.  I️ will continue going to the hotel as it is clean and reliable.

title: Great stay !!
text: Giving The Michelangelo a top rating:  Chose it based on TripAdvisor ratings.  We booked a “superior king” - quiet, spacious and well laid out, very comfortable bed & linens.  Nice amenities and mini-bar [only disappointment = no coffee maker in room:  morning coffee is available for purchase in the bar area in lobby (there is a $10/day beverage credit as I understand it)], and room service was prompt and very friendly.  All staff warm and genuinely helpful (shout out to Luna in bar and Walter behind early-morning front desk).  Absolutely fantastic location for theater-goers, and walking distance to many other Manhattan attractions.

title: Favorite hotel in Manhattan
text: This was one of many stays at the Michelangelo. Excellent location. Has the feel of a boutique hotel with attentive, always pleasant staff.  The bar/restaurant is intimate and lovely.  Would highly recommend

title: Wonderful January Stay at The Michelangelo New York
text: Spent three nights in January.  Wonderful hotel with exceptional service every step of the way.  From the Door Man to the Front Desk -- with a special shout out to Walter Faranda at the front desk., who went above and beyond helping us in every way  Will return and highly recommend.  Perfect location too!

title: Excellent Choice in the Theatre District
text: My niece and I came to NYC for the day to see two Broadway shows.  Although our room was not ready when we arrived, the bell hop checked our bags for us, and the hotel texted me when the room was ready.  Given how expensive hotels in this area are, I'm glad I picked the Michelangelo!  The rooms are VERY large; bigger even then some standard rooms in regular hotels.  The furnishings were on the elegant end of the spectrum.  Each room is given 2 free bottles of water a day, and then there is the expensive minibar, too.  My only complaint was that one of the bed's mattress needed to be replaced, but it wasn't terrible.  The location cannot be beat.  It's across the street from the Winter Garden theatre, and at most 5 blocks from other theatres you may want to visit.  As it's right off of 7th Ave., it's easy to  navigate around Times Square and the Theatre District.  I would definitely return when coming to Broadway shows again in the future.

title: Excellence in Action
text: There is no place in Manhattan we enjoy staying better than the Michaelangelo.  Excellence is personified throughout the stay.  The staff exude a feeling of pride and it shows in their work ethic as well as their clear commitment to customer service and making the Michaelangelo your home away from home, maybe even better. Staff are service oriented and delightful!

title: Great Location but there are a few issues
text:
I have stayed at this location twice.  I will start off with the positives.  The location is great.  It is a "quiet" spot very close to everything (shopping, theaters, times square and central park).  The bell staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are HUGE especially compared to New York standards for the price point.  We were offered an upgrade upon arrival from two queens to two king beds. The beds were very comfortable.  The water pressure was great. There is a full mini/snack bar.
Now for the negative. Our room was not ready when we arrived, which is typical.  However, we were told it would be ready shortly and they would text or call when ready.  An hour and half later, we still had not received confirmation that our room was ready. So we went back to the front desk, just to find out that had been ready for over an hour. When we arrived to our room, while checking out our view, we pulled back the curtains to find a mouse trap sitting on the floor. I know that NY has been known for a rodent issue, but we were not expecting to see a mouse trap.  There is not a coffee or tea pot in the rooms. When we checked in, the told us that we had a $10 drink credit at the bar each evening.  However, we were never able to take advantage of this perk since they closed the "bar" area so early.  And, when we were checking out, we asked for a late check out.  Mind you, this was on a Monday, they said that the latest we could do was 1:00 and they would have to charge us.  I was told by the front desk "it isn't me charging you, it is our system."
My overall opinion is that the hotel is just OK.  Exceeds in some areas, but lacking in others. Not the worst I have stayed in NY and not the best.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: Perfect location for Central Park, mid town, Rockefeller Plaza, Carnegie Hall, Bryant Park, Lincoln Center and Broadway activities.  Walk to Grand Central Station trains, subways or just take sidewalks everywhere.

title: Christmas Holiday in New York
text: The Michelangelo is the best place to spend the Christmas holidays in New York. The most beautiful places in the City are all within reach. Great breakfast and impeccable service. Recommended for anyone wanting to enjoy NW from an excellent location

title: Very nice hotel
text: The staff are so nice and welcoming. The room was very clean. The location is perfect in the middle of time square and close to everything! We loved it and it would have been better if there were a coffee maker in the room because we had to wait for the coffee shop Infront of the hotel to open each morning in order to get coffee.

title: Perfect hotel, if you’re willing to spend a pretty penny
text: there’s absolutely nothing to complain about this hotel. It is a stunning building with very friendly and helpful staff beautiful comfortable and clean rooms in prime location. You definitely have to pay for all of those things but if you can, I think it’s worth it.

title: Best Thing in Midtown
text: Great hotel. Spacious rooms and wonderful Staff. From check-in to Check out they know exactly what you need. The beds are divene and extremely clean as are the rooms. The location is the best in town . You cannot go wrong at the Michelangelo.

title: Super hotel, with super staff in a super location
text: Brilliant hotel with alot of character. great location, staff were super helpful. Hotel room was a spacious corner room for 4 people and it was more than we expected. Highly recommend and if we come back to New York we would only stay here

title: A Hotel With Italian Pizzazz.
text:
In centerfold Manhattan, near Times Square, the Rock and surrounding attractions sits the Italian inspired  Michelangelo New York hotel. My spiffy Junior Suite occupied a whopping 550 sq. ft. footprint with a luxe king bed and homey living area. The bath was marbleized with a deep soaking tub. The Lounge is a dispensary of fine Italian cuisine the likes of: Chicken Milanese, Cacio e Pepe, a variety of pizza's and more.
It felt like pizza night......so that's what I had...........superior crust. The property includes a fitness center but it is light on amenities as well as being light on the wallet given NYC standards.
So, if you desire a hotel with Italian glam and provides a base camp for the attractions of NYC.........then try the ............Michelangelo New York Hotel..............
....a hotel with Italian pizzazz.

title: Poor value
text: Good hotel in a great location.  Staff was great.  The room furnishings were tired and worn looking - didn’t look nearly as good as the website pictures.  So, for the price, not really worth it.  You’re not getting the suite you think you booked

title: Exceeded our expectations
text: We stayed from Nov 15 to Nov 23, and our experience was on another level.  In terms of service, they truly exceeded my expectations.  The treatment of the employees was excellent, higher than expected.  All of them: Dileska (front desk), Maria, and Joel made us feel like we were in our home, and the service was exceptional, including the service of the manager Steven, who was very professional, and the employees in charge of the food and cleaning as well.  All the staff were always very attentive and willing to accommodate our requests, and always looking to make us feel comfortable.  The breakfast was excellent, and despite the limited space, the employees always tried to accommodate us at all times.  I also just want to add a note that has nothing to do with the service, and that is that in the rooms at the back on the 1st floor you can hear the elevator mechanism kind of loudly from time to time.  However, the front desk staff did everything possible and accommodated us in another room.  That made a big difference.  Definitely if I stay in Manhattan again I will choose TownPlace Suites by Marriot again.

title: NY Marathon
text:
The hotel is in a central area, served by all available transport.
New York is a unique, magical city, it captivates you, all this made more
special from our stay at the Hotel Michelangelo.
The entrance hall is beautiful and welcoming, with huge plants and flowers in all corners.
Very spacious room (there were 4 of us) very functional for everyone
detail, very comfortable king size beds, room made up even twice a day for our entire stay.
The cleaning service was impeccable, they tidied up and cleaned everything every day (I won't explain, but I have never seen such accurate service)
Very large and functional bathroom.
All the staff were super friendly and always ready to give advice for any unexpected events or for simple information.
Our only regret is that we could not stay in the hotel longer
long.
We will definitely return

title: Impersonal treatment, old and outmoded hotel, dark room with small windows, little daylight, bad air, noisy ventilation
text: Impersonal treatment, old and outmoded hotel, dark room with small windows, little daylight, bad air, noisy ventilation, at least it was clean and the location near Times Square is comfortable for exploring NY.

title: Excellent staff and service
text:
This hotel is in a great location--close to 5th avenue and all major stores and museums.
The staff goes out of their way to make you feel at home.  The breakfast is excellent.  The servers are full of energy and enthusiasm.

title: Disappointing honesty
text: Left Phone charger in outlet in room.  Called next day, the gentleman who took call was going to check with housekeeping.  I told him specifically where charger was still plugged in.  Never heard back from him or anyone else.  Sad, spent almost $3,000 for 4 nights there and this is the attitude they have.   I gave the place a 3 due to this experience.  Not honest people working there. Rooms were dated too.

title: Excellent location and great big rooms
text: We enjoyed a Christmas Season holiday in New York. The location of the hotel was perfect, right by the Radio City Hall, Time Square and the all the Broadway shows. This hotel does not have a real restaurant and the breakfast was not up to the quality of this hotel.  The rooms are clean, big and confortables and the doormen are just lovely. The prices should include breasfast that is of higher standards.

title: My Favourite New York Hotel
text: I love staying at the Michaelangelo! The rooms are beautiful and clean, the staff is friendly and incredibly helpful and the location is perfect for everything I want and need to do in the city! I would definitely recommend staying here on your next visit!

title: An Oasis in Midtown
text: An oasis in Midtown! It was such a treat to stay at the Michelangelo. Old world details in the lobby, light finishes to the guest room hallways. I loved that my room felt very homey, and the tub was wonderful! Walter and Walther at the front desk were very welcoming and the concierge, Divine, made the perfect recommendation for dinner. The hotel offers a la carte breakfast options in a very nice room that again felt like a respite from the business of the City. You enter this hotel and feel that you leave the chaos outside behind. I was not familiar with it before staying here for business, but I hope to return!

title: Best hotel in the city
text:
From the greeting to the check out everything was amazing!!! Location is superb as well. Staff is awesome and so pleasant. 
Clean and well sized rooms. 
Wouldn’t stay anywhere else while visiting the city!! 
A+++ rating in my opinion.

title: The Best
text: Second time here. The location is beyond compare. Very nice hotel with great service and great staff. We will continue to stay here any time we want to be in mid-town. We watched the Macy's parade, which was just down the street. All of the Broadway shows are nearby and Rockefeller Center and Central Park and Times Square  are just outside the front door.

title: Dated…….
text: The hotel is dated…..The bar was just basic and nothing special and no real feel of a hotel lounge. The rooms were very spacious and great pillows and bedding. The front desk staff and the bellmen were very helpful and professional. Location is perfect and not right in the middle of the theatre district but very close by…

title: Gracious and spacious Old World Charm
text: We had an amazing mother/daughter stay in adjoining rooms that were very generously sized, offering plenty of room for wardrobes and purchases of 4 teenagers and 4 moms.  The hotel is in a fabulous location within walking distance to most uptown attractions.  The old world design was especially inviting when we returned evenings after dinners & shows (just 2-4 blocks away).  Luna and Carmen provided warm welcomes and fabulous libations, with guidance on selections or offers to create any custom cocktails to our likings.  We will certainly reserve this classic and elegant spot if we return to the city again.

title: Nice location, clean room, questionable billing practices
text:
Reviewing The Michelangelo is complicated. Pros: the hotel is conveniently-located in midtown; the rooms are relatively roomy and comfortable; the cleaning staff are excellent. Cons: none of the hotel rooms provide coffee; YOUR ADDITIONAL SECURITY DEPOSIT IS SIMPLY ADDED TO YOUR FINAL BILL.

I emphasize this last point. My wife and I stayed for two nights and did not touch any of the ample amenities to purchase in the room. We were charged over 130 dollars without a requested explanation. After providing an additional email requesting justification for the charges, we now have a 10 dollar credit pending to our VISA account. The simple principle of charging an additional fee (i.e., keeping most of the deposit) without providing any justification is enough to suggest you stay elsewhere. Even in NYC, you can find honest hotel reception.

title: The Michelangelo NYC
text:
Lovely old school hotel with a great staff and lovely spacious rooms. Our stay was perfect and the one of the best things of this hotel is the location. It is close to everything, Central Park, Time Square and subway.
Although in the center of some of the big tourist attraction, we were amazed by the calm you can enjoy in the room which is a valuable point after on long day or evening in the craziness of the city.

title: The BEST!!!
text: Every time I go to New York, I stay at the Michelangelo an it never disappoints.  It is elegant; the rooms are lovely.  The service provided by everyone is always superior.  I would never stay anywhere else.

title: Amazing stay!
text:
A small but very comfortable and exclusive hotel. Excellent location, staff, food and facilities.

We traveled through NYC marathon and it was an excellent option for a quiet rest without the hustle and bustle of large hotels.

title: Drinks in the lounge
text: My friend and I were in search of a more quiet place to have a drink after a play and ended up at the lounge at The Michelangelo. Carmen who was the waitress and bartender was absolutely wonderful to us! First of all, she made a mean drink and secondly, she did it with a smile and kindness.

title: A Great Place to Stay in Midtown
text: The Michelangelo Hotel is well maintained and the rooms are of above average size with walk-in closets.  The location is fantastic near central park and the theaters.  The hotel and the rooms are well maintained.  My room was very clean room and freshened up every day of my 4 day stay.  That staff was attentive and friendly.  The room prices were moderate for the location and the quality of the hotel and the rooms.  I highly recommend this hotel for a good place to stay in midtown.

title: The only place to stay in NYC
text: Whether I'm in town for business or personal, I always stay at the Michelangelo. The staff is amazing, the lobby is gorgeous and the rooms have character. Plus the location puts you in the heart of everything. If you want to really experience NYC and enjoy your time, book your stay here.

title: Great location, very expensive for what it was, tired and in need of upgrading.
text: It was a great location but massively expensive for what it was.  We had a junior suite and you couldn't sit on the sofa as the cushions kept falling off and the chairs were also very uncomfortable.  Hotel is very dated. A waste of a junior suite.  That being said we didn't spend much time in the room so not a major issue just felt like a waste of money.

title: Great hotel for Business Travel
text: Michelangelo is our go to when our group is in NYC for business meetings. All of our executives prefer it due to the location, large/luxurious rooms and customer service. We will definitely be back in the future.

title: I'll never stay at a different hotel in NYC!
text: The Michelangelo is a gorgeous historic hotel in the heart of the theater district conveniently located a few minutes from the subway. Everything about our stay was wonderful and we, literally, will never stay elsewhere when in NY. The restaurant and bar service and food/drink selections were excellent. Staff was professional, courteous and helpful - especially Walter. They provided helpful recommendations to nearby restaurants and were ready to assist with anything we asked. What a gem!

title: My review
text:
The Michelangelo was amazing. The staff is so personable and helpful. Everything was explained and if I needed anything, including directions, they were happy to help. 
The hotel was clean and very beautiful.  
The price was more than I normally would pay but the area was perfect and I could walk to a lot of areas without getting a taxi. 
Restaurants and venues were very close. 
My bed was very comfortable.

title: Great stay!
text:
My wife and I stayed here five nights and truly enjoyed it!  The hotel has an "old world" feel, is well appointed and comfortable.  We were in a king suite room, so had a couch and chairs, it was worth the upgrade cost.  All of the service was exceptional and very professional.  Edwin and Henry, two of the bellmen, were very helpful and friendly.
The rooms could use some minor touchups and updates.
We would highly recommend this hotel for its ambience, location and comfort!

title: Excellent
text: Fantastic location to most attractions and subways. Lovely friendly helpful staff. Special mention to Cesar, Theodore and Walter who are true gentlemen. Very clean hotel. When we arrived we were upgraded and given a bottle of Prosecco for my husbands 60th  birthday. If you have never been to New York, this hotel is what you imagine from seeing the movies. Thank you for a great stay.

title: Great hotel.
text: When we arrived, we were tired and grumpy. We were checked in immediately and, to our surprise, we found that our room had been upgraded! In addition, we were given a $10 credit at the bar which was appreciated! Our suite was pleasantly appointed, comfortable and spotless. The staff was helpful and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: Our accommodations were first class and the service provided by ALL staff members was truly outstanding! We look very much forward to staying at The Michelangelo again the next time we're in New York.

title: Great service, great room, great location.
text: I highly recommend. The location, just off 7th, makes it easy to get to everything from museums and theaters to restaurants and Central Park. Between the location and the design of the hotel, coming and going was easy, whether it was going down the street to get a coffee, walking to Central Park, or going to restaurants and other attractions. I liked the fact that their main door doesn’t open onto 7th St, so that you could step out of the hotel without immediately having to fight a crowd. The room was really nice, clean, comfortable, and really quiet--I heard nothing of the city or other hotel guests. The hotel staff and quality of service were amazing. The door staff were helpful and friendly from the moment I arrived until they helped get my luggage to a taxi. The front desk was readily available and able to quickly get answers to questions. The restaurant staff were great. Even the cleaning staff were friendly. My one suggestion is that if you need to be able to plug in your laptop and phone at the same time, bring a small out charger that allows you to plug your laptop and other devices into a single AC outlet. There are limited AC outlets, and the light fixtures don't have the extra AC and USB plugs built into them that most hotels now have. Make sure you book directly through the hotel. They have their own in-house reservation person who's really helpful.

title: Run away, don't stay here
text: This old hotel has too many issues to charge the price they do. No hot water during an early Saturday morning, weird smells, ac/heat inoperative and had to be adjusted throughout the night. The bellman was exceptional however.

title: Home away from home at The Michelangelo hotel
text: The staff and stay at this hotel was superb.  Not only did they make my first time to NYC a most memorable one, but they were able to make a home away from home experience.  I thoroughly enjoyed getting to know the staff individually, hearing their stories and understanding the heart of the intentional connections at The Michelangelo.  Henry Diaz, Walter Faranda, Joseph D'Angelo, Gene Lee, and Caesar S. to name a few of the staff that contributed to this.  The beds were VERY comfy, linens were WHITE, room cleaned every day and never felt unsafe at this location.  Being close to everything was helpful as well...the subway, Times Square...you name it.  Thank you you for a fantastic stay.  I'll definitely be back!

title: Amazing value and friendly staff.
text: The staff at the hotel were all extremely helpful and attentive. Everyone had a smile and went out of their way to make sure my experience was the best it could be. Getting a taxi was easy with the help of the doorman. The location is perfect for walking Manhattan and felt very safe. The rooms aren't as updated as some others in the area, but they are clean and large for NYC standards. I was only staying for a short trip but will definitely be returning!

title: Excellent Hotell
text:
Myself, my sister-in-law , and 4 nieces spent 7 days at the hotel ! All 3 of our rooms were all fabulous ! The staff was wonderful and professional in all their prospective
 positions. To mention and compliment a few particular employees; Walter Fernanda, Henry Diaz, Gene Lee , Caesar S, and 
Joseph D’Angelo. Compliments also goes out to our room stewardess, unfortunately didn’t get their names, but they also did a superb job in cleaning and organizing our rooms ! 
The experience at the Hotel was far and beyond any expectations we could have asked for , Thank you making all of our stays so comfortable and memorable ! Thank you again !

title: Awesome hotel and crew
text: Big shout out to : Henry Faranda, Gene Lee, Cesar S, Joseph D'Angelo ..plus the outstanding  cleaning crew! Our girls trip was amazing! Oct 7-14th and all these individuals were part  of making our trip outstanding! The customer service was top notch! Our rooms were beautifully cleaned daily... they hotel is gorgeous!! The beds are beyond comfortable! And he location is close to everything! Put this hotel top on your list of places to stay... you won't  be disappointed!!!

title: Impeccable two night stay
text: We booked a two night stay to round up our 1 week NYC trip at the Michelangelo. Studio with king size bed, 46m2. Comfy bed, spacious room and absolutely quiet with great location just a few blocks off of times square and hells kitchen. Staff very friendly.

title: Camino a casa
text: Buen y bonito hotel. Antiguo edificio e instalaciones pero bien mantenidas. La calidez del personal, en especial la camarera Susana y los botones destacan. Muy bien ubicado a un paso de todo el Midtown. Sí creo un poco caro para lo que ofrecen, en especial las comidas y el frigobar. Pero cumplió nuestras expectativas

title: Great service, great location
text: Great location in Midtown, Ultra helpful staff, Jimmy in the restaurant took care of our large group (11) each morning for breakfast. We had an EXCELLENT experience.  There were 5 adults and 6 kids, we had three rooms, and we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Michaelangelo.

title: An Oasis
text: An oasis in the middle of Manhattan.  Relatively small and quiet.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Including Divine the concierge, Ferraro the smiling doorman, and Edwin the bellboy.  Some day wewill return

title: Great stay!
text: Great location, you are within walking distance of everything. The hotel was very clean. Room was clean and spacious, we had plenty of room. All staff was helpful and polite,  Henry Diaz was the best!! I would recommend staying here!!

title: A Classic Hotel
text: Beautiful classic hotel with great hotel staff and perfect location in Times Square with a nice walk to Central Park. Morning coffee isn't included but refills are allowed and they do offer breakfast.

title: A perfect choice for a Midtown Manhattan hotel visit.
text: The Michelangelo is a very useful hotel to stay at if you are visiting Manhattan and wish to emphasize the theater as the main purpose of you trip. It is very conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 51st Street so that you can easily walk to all the Broadway theaters and their close by restaurants. The rooms are large, with comfortable king beds, well equiped bathrooms, and lots of hot water. The air conditioning worked quite well. The rooms are very fairly priced in the $450 range, although it would be useful to just publish the actual prices, rather than low balling the headline prices and then adding a variety of extra fees like the "resort fee". No beach, ocean, or even swimming pool in this Midtown establishment!The staff is very pleasant, particularly the bellmen and doormen, and the housekeeping is very professional. It is a hotel choice which would solve most guests' N.Y. hotel choice.

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: We had a wonderful week in NYC and wouldn't stay anywhere else.  This is our fourth time here and we loved it as always.  Spacious rooms, squeaky clean, good bed, big marble bathrooms.  The staff, from the reception desk to the doormen, are attentive and helpful and genuinely want you to enjoy your time there.  You can walk to theaters, you're surrounded by restaurants, near public transportation ... but far enough from the chaos of Times Square.  We love coming back to our NY home away from home!

title: Good location - but dated
text: The Michelangelo hotel is in a superb location and close to Times Square without the noise. Rooms are a bit dated but reasonable size for New York City. The gym was disappointing and it’s really small. Lobby bar was not great and a bit soulless. Overall good.

title: EXCELENTE UBICACION
text:
Estuve alojada con mi hija hace una semana. 
LO BUENO: La habitacion grande, el baño clasico. los ascensores rapidos.
las camas super comodas. la ubicacion inmejorable
LO MALO: el personal de la puerta de entrada muy desagradable, saludabamos cuando saliamos y al entrar y no respondian al saludo. Ni hablar de ayudarnos con las valijas el dia del check out. Nos vieron super cargadas y no nos ayudaron.
Volveria por la ubicacion y tamaño de la habitacion.

title: Absolutely Amazing
text:
We had an amazing experience. 
The front desk was so kind and attentive. It was our anniversary and birthday- unexpectedly we had chocolate strawberries, nuts and champagne waiting for us ! The room was spotless . The service and housekeeping was outstanding Location was the best .  We will definitely come back !

title: A wonderful stay at The Michaelangelo
text: We enjoyed a great stay at The Michelangelo Hotel. The staff were excellent in particular we’d like to mention Edwin the Bellman, Theodore the Doorman and lovely Carmen the bar server. Everything was so comfortable and welcoming. Great room size and super location. The food is excellent too. Highly recommend.

title: New York Old fashioned comfort Hotel
text: This is a beautiful Hotel in a great location in New York. Our 2nd time here. But prices doubled since a year ago and we had to wait for a deal. Still not cheap but it fitted our requirements. Would highly recommend

title: Overall
text: Good location, but as others stated, the rooms need updating especially the curtains and lighting. We also felt for the cost of a 4 star hotel it would have been nice to offer a few free bottles of water upon arrival especially when it was over 90 degrees outside. No perks ar all offered at this hotel.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: First time we stayed at the Michelangelo. True class act. We were celebrating my birthday. There were balloons, sweets and a chilled bottle of bubbly waiting for us when we checked in. Room was beautiful and very spacious. Front desk was extremely accommodating and professional. Will definitely be back. Great location, great experience.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: I was very disappointed with how run down the Michaelangelo has become. Our family has stayed here for decades, the last visit 6 years ago. It was our “go to” hotel in NYC. The room was old, smelled of mothballs, and is in desperate need of modern up dates and repairs/renovations. There was mold on the window sills from peeling paint, the bathroom faucet leaked, faded dark stains on the light carpet, dinged up trim paint, dilapidated dirty silk curtains- overall the room was tired and dirty. There are no usb ports in the room at all. The beds are comfortable, variety of pillow styles, but that’s about it. Sadly, until this hotel invests in some renovations and upgrades, this will be our last stay- bittersweet.

title: Wonderful experience fabulous hotel
text:
Loved our stay. Fabulous hotel with great amenities. Location campy be. Great nearby restaurants easy hop on the subway versus Highline . can’t say enough about the attentive staff. Great bar in the lobby with happy hour drinks .
Easy walk to fabulous local restaurants

title: Excellent NYC Hotel
text:
The Michelangelo is my favorite place to stay in midtown.  Location is great- close to Time Square, but away from the craziness, walkable to the Park and shopping. Parking is convenient and well-priced.  The rooms are HUGE by NYC hotel standards!  From standard rooms to suites, I've never had a bad room. Ample work space, fast wifi, lush bathrooms (the huge soaking tub is major sellng point for me), great amenities, and comfortable beds.  This hotel is SAFE.  Housekeeping is wonderful. My most recent stay (8/30 to 9/2, room 729) brought me the absolute sweetest room attendant.  The Front Desk staff is always knowledgable and helpful. The Bell Staff is like none other!  Everyone greets you each time you arrive, they hold doors, carry bags, turn on lights when you check in, show you how to operate the thermotat, etc, and are overall old-school hotel staffers.  They are so wonderfully friendly and helpful, I wish I knew every single one of their names to applaud them all.  Edwin helped me quite a bit this trip. 

Note: When I checked in for my most recent stay I was informed of a daily beverage credit at the lobby bar.  I wasn't able to take advantage of this; the bar was never open when I was on site. If this is a must for you, plan accordingly. 

Love, love, love The Michelangelo!

title: Ripped off with extra cost of $800. Incidentals which were additional fees
text: It was a great trip until we checked out at 4:30 in the morning and we’re told that we owed $800 Canadian for incidentals in our room. When we booked we were told that our bill was paid in full when we checked in they did a $500 incidental fee on our visa and said oh this is just in case you use anything I said no we won’t be using anything, they told us there are two bottles of water free in the room every day. Then upon checkout we were dinged with an outrageous bill of $800 for their fees, etc. we were not informed that this was going to be a must when we checked in they never commented that there would be other fees, or could be other fees upon leaving , it was nothing but a big rip off and ruined our trip New York you disappoint and I have read in New York articles. The Taurus are feeling very ripped off. I have a print out of the outrageous fees that you charge and how you scandalize your tourists who come to your city. You should’ve had the decency to tell us when we checked in there will be additional fees and what those fees will be as an outline last time in New York for me, even though this was my fifth time there at least at the Marriott when we stayed there, we were told upfront there would be an extra cost per day, but in exchange for that… We were given vouchers for drinks in the restaurant breakfast in the restaurant and also vouchers to take the tours. That was a little easier to swallow but in Michelangelo you did not get it right and I do expect that I will hear from you with an offer to re-examine this policy, regardless of what other hotels in New York do.  Thank you.

title: 20 Years staying here!
text: We love this hotel so much! We have been staying here for over 20 years. There is no other place I would stay in the city. The fact that they have had most of the same staff the entire time speaks volumes. Everyone from the doormen to housekeeping remembers us, which is just magic! Luna and Carmen of course knocked it out of the park again!

title: Beautiful hotel room & helpful staff
text: I've stayed in numerous hotels in NYC, and the Michaelangelo has been my favorite. I would absolutely return for another stay. The lobby is beautiful, and there are plenty of comfortable places to sit and rest. When I arrived, my basic, economy room was not ready, so the front desk staff upgraded me to a Junior Suite at no additional charge. The room was spacious and stunning! The bar tender at the lounge was helpful and friendly. Theodoro the doorman is the best. He makes you feel welcome and can point you in the right direction if you need assistance. The hotel is located within a block of the 50 Street Metro station, and you are within walking distance of Times Square. If you want to walk a little more, you can get to Central Park on foot too.

title: Great hotel in good location
text: This was our first stay at this hotel and it was a great experience. The hotel is beautifully appointed, clean, and comfortable - especially the bedding. The location is ideal. The staff was very helpful and kind. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Localização e bom atendimento
text: Localizado no coração de NY e com um bom atendimento da equipe, nao somente na estada, mas para assuntos e deslocamentos em geral na cidade. Apesar da proximidade da regiao mais badalada, os quartos sao silenciosos

title: Amazing Service
text: My wife and I came here to celebrate our anniversary as we had booked a few things to do in the city and this place got a lot of good reviews. Those reviews were definitely not lying, from the decor to the service it was all a 10/10. It’s a clean, beautiful hotel and the staff was great! What made it even better was our bartender Carmen. She was welcoming, professional, fast and definitely knows how to make a badass drink. She catered to us and suggested different foods and drinks for us to try which all were spot on. She knew what she was doing and even gave us a little insight to New York and how to get to places as this was our first time visiting. All in all I would definitely stay here again, especially if Carmen will be bartending for us again!

title: Great location, unique hotel, wonderful bar
text: I love staying at this hotel because it's not the same Hilton or Marriott you see all over the world.  It is unique, old world, and only in Manhattan.  Don't miss the cocktails at the bar with Carmen - she is a lovely bartender with exquisite service.

title: Great location for Broadway shows!
text:
I had a wonderful stay at The Michelangelo with my mother and my teenage son.  We were in NYC to see Broadway shows and the Michelangelo is perfectly located to walk to the theaters. It is at the north end of the theater district so you can get away from all the noise and congestion of Times Square. 

There was a challenging situation with a guest near my mother's room and when she spoke to management about it, they addressed the issue and also gave her complimentary breakfasts during her stay.

I'd like to specially mention Jimmy, Jose and Juan who served us breakfast in the mornings. They were friendly, kind and excellent servers. I also want o mention the overnight bellhop who has worked there for over 30 years.  I didn't write down his name, but he was a wonderful help when we had to leave early in the morning. 

We would definitely stay at the Michelangelo again and recommend it!

title: Awesome location
text:
The best hotel if you want to be close to Time Square. Very central, my suite was very nice. 
The personal was very professional and available to help at anytime. Unfortunatly did not get chance to try their breakfast and others amenities like the fitness room.

title: Carmen and Luna are the best!
text: The bar is great, Carmen and Luna are attentive and smiling - great bartenders and provide incredible service, the hotel is older and a bit worn but the food is great and the people are very friendly and helpful.  Can’t beat the location!

title: Beautiful hotel in great location
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Michelangelo. All the staff that I interacted with were very helpful and friendly, check in check out were seamless, rooms are beautiful... I specially appreciated the tub and the comfy bed! I highly recommend this property and look forward to returning for a future trip.

title: The Perfect Spot to Stay in Manhattan!
text:
We enjoyed the Michelangelo Hotel very much. Perfect location for exploring Manhattan, room was just right, hotel staff were fantastic (special call out to Luna, bartender at the lobby bar). This is an old school hotel with the right atmosphere, amenities, staff and location for being in Manhattan.

Will be sure to stay there the next time I am in town. 

G. Wright - Toronto

title: Perfect location for the Manhattan experience
text: The Michelangelo is the perfect location for any visit to Manhattan. The rooms are much larger than what most other hotels offer for the same price. You are only a couple blocks away from Times Square, Broadway, and Radio City Music Hall. Not to mention many other locations most tourists would want to see. The beds are super comfortable.  The tub was huge and the shower was very nice. Had multiple HBO and Cinemax channels to chose from. Considering the price and location, I don’t think there is a better place to stay anywhere in NYC.

title: Old expensive hotel
text: Got a portable air condition on room. Toilet leaking all aver bathroom. Lots of street noise. Reported to front desk, nothing happened. Bad smell from vendors on the street. And this was the upgraded room! Can't imagine how the original would have benn

title: Class, Comfort, & Convenience !!!
text:
The Michelangelo is a step back in time to the way Grand Hotels used to be!
Doormen, Bellmen, very courteous & responsive staff, spacious comfortable rooms. All for the same price previously paid for small box rooms with no atmosphere at other NYC hotels!
Walking distance to theaters, restaurants, convenience stores. Parked the car on Friday afternoon and did not need it until we left on Sunday.
Special kudos to the breakfast wait staff & Best Wishes to Jimmy who is "in training" until he retires! 😀

title: Well located hotel in NYC
text: The Michelangelo was an excellent place to stay in NYC. Its location couldn't be better. We were close to Time Square (without actually being in the Time Square chaos), Central Park, Penn Station, and Hell's Kitchen where we found lots of great, reasonably priced restaurants. Our room was roomy, comfortable, and clean. Multiple pillows gave us options of soft or firm. The bathroom was also large and clean. The room was serviced every day. Our room was on the interior--no view, but very quiet. Highly recommended.

title: Bang for the Buck !
text: Best Value for the $$$ in NYC.   Spacious room. Great AC. Excellent water pressure.     Front desk, bell staff both excellent. Even great out front assisting me with getting a car to get out of dodge.  Definitely will come back and stay at the MichaelAngelo

title: Superb old style hotel and service
text: We loved our recent trip to NYC, and especially the Michelangelo hotel.  This hotel retains its old charm, with modern conveniences, cleanliness, and quality.  The front desk staff, concierge, and bellmen were all great.  We wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!   THANK-YOU for your continued service.

title: Lovely hotel, great location
text: We had an excellent stay at the Michelangelo. The rooms were spacious and clean (we had three people in two rooms). The lobby and bar turned out to be the perfect place to meet up with family. The location is mad - Times Square - yet the rooms are extremely quiet and peaceful, and the subway and other amenities are super convenient. We would stay there again, although we did not pay full price so there is a chance it would be less appealing.

title: Perfect location gem.
text: There are a lot of hotels to choose from in NYC. The Michelangelo is by far, my hotel of choice. Let’s start with the staff, whether  it’s Edwin the bellman who welcomes you, or Joseph who will check you in, the service is excellent and professional. Not to mention, the smile. Great location, very nice rooms and suites, and not noisy or crowded. I’ve sent many friends and relative to this hotel. All raves.

title: Michelangelo Hotel in Manhattan New York City
text: Large and very comfortable rooms. All amazingly wonderful employees in every department.  Effortless reservations.  Delicious food and fabulous people working in the restaurant.   We do not stay anywhere else when we come to visit NYC.

title: Excellent service
text: Absolutely wonderful experience thanks to the friendly staff. Had an issue with the room door, and they were quick to respond and resolve the issue, even went as far as upgrading our room. Outstanding!

title: Big hand for Michelangelo Hotel New York!!!
text:
·🥰 -Check in was perfect
-Location a big 10!
- All Staff very experienced and professional from opening the doors when entering the Hotel till cleaning team.
-front desk very helpfull when you call them late in the evening always solution minded!
-Room 737 was bigger than expected, super clean and hygiene i give a 10 out of 10.
-Bed was perfect we slept without any issues, no noises inside or from outside.
-Bathroom also big with a lot of mirrors which is very nice.
-Quick call we received watercooker and coffee machine
-Fitness room very small but usefull with towels, water from dispenser, AC, Crosstrainer, Treadmill, weight till 20 lbs.
-Check out was perfect
-No issues at all next time we will 100% book this wonderfull hotel.
-Big hand for this wonderfull team!

title: If you want space, get it HERE!
text: The Michelangelo was a score of a find. We have a child who is a crazy sleeper. We always look for rooms with a little extra space. We booked a suite, and it was SWEET! We had a living room with a couch and loveseat. We thoroughly enjoyed having space to spread out. This hotel is quaint and nostalgic.

title: Excellent hotel from top to bottom!
text: This was the perfect hotel for our long weekend in July. It is close to Broadway theaters and shopping. Built in 1926, it has been well-maintained and updated, while keeping the feel of elegance. Every staff member, from the door man to the front desk personnel, was incredibly friendly, helpful and available. The quaint restaurant off of the lobby had very good food and service. Our room was very clean, with plenty of towels, soaps, a blow-dryer, and thick terry bathrobes. There's also a well-stocked frig, with wine (red and white) water, soda pop, and a variety of snacks. (keep in mind consumption of these items is charged to your room). They accommodated our luggage  after check-out as we had a later airline departure. From beginning to end, The Michelangelo Hotel was the best! Looking forward to another stay in the future!

title: Perfect stay
text: It was an amazing stay at the Michaelangelo. The room was spacious & clean. There is a beautiful bathtub to unwind in after a long day. Edwin, the bellman, was super nice and helped me with my bags and waited with me until my Uber arrived.

title: Michelangelo is a masterpiece.
text: We were surprised with a complimentary room upgrade upon arrival ic added to our delight. The staff was attentive and location perfect for the multiple broadway shows we came to see. We were a little afrsid it would be noisy bring so close to the action but it was very quiet as the rooms are well insulated.  We will put The Michelangelo on our repeat list.

title: No place like NYC!
text: There is a lot to like at The Michelangelo NY - location is great!  The hotel has a stylish welcoming feel.  Our room was clean, very comfortable, and exceptionally quiet - bed and pillows were excellent.  The data signal to the room was spotty, but Wifi worked great.  The entire staff was top notch from the front desk to the bellman to the doorman.  They took care of our bags so we could get a jump on taking in the city.  Greeted us with smiles every time we passed through the lobby and always opened the door for us when leaving/returning - nice touch!

title: A long weekend in Manhattan
text:
Spectacular service and ambience
Entire staff, including Edwin Berman, were exceptionally polite and helpful
Delightful breakfast locale on site.
Beautiful, marble lobby
Comfortable room, nice workout room with fresh equipment on lower level
Convenient midtown location

title: An escape in NY
text: If you’re looking to stay near Times Square and the theatre district but want an escape from the madness, The Michelangelo is your place. Wonderful staff and very nice rooms. Stepping into the spacious, clean, comfortable room is a nice reprieve from NY’s busy streets.

title: Night out without KIDS
text: The hotel is perfectly situated in the theatre district which will allow you to walk to restaurants and/or broadway shows. The hotel is affordable, clean, and quiet. There is a doorman to welcome you back into the hotel. Will definitely visit again as this hotel is the perfect getaway for the weekend and vacation from the children at home.

title: Lovely Hotel in a Perfect Location
text: I stayed at the Michelangelo for 3 nights in late July. It's in a perfect midtown location, walkable to just about everything. I had no trouble walking to the High Line, Central Park, Natural History Museum, the NY Public Library and 4 Broadway theaters. The hotel is beautiful, with excellent air conditioning (a must in the muggy NY summer). My room was very large, with a comfortable king size bed, and lots of counter space in the bathroom. The staff were all friendly, rushing to open doors when I entered or exited the hotel. I'd stayed here several years ago when it was called the Park 51. It hasn't changed much, but everything is still in beautiful condition. I'd happily stay here again.

title: Meh
text: Low value for the money. The TV didn’t work in any of our rooms. The AC struggled. Restaurant was open sometimes, but slow and inattentive staff. Front desk isnt really interested in making your stay comfortable.

title: NY Trip
text: The service and cleanliness of the hotel was exceptional. The team did a great job from the first day when we have arrived there. The room was very spacious and clean. I am definitely looking forward to my next trip staying there.

title: Very clean, spacious, and luxury hotel in Manhattan
text:
We stayed there for a 3 night stay in July and we are very satisfied. We stayed in a king suite and the room was large, clean, and tidy. It had 2 bathrooms as well.
Staff was very friendly and helpful. We remember Theodore, who is a front doorman helped us get a taxi going in the rain. 
Hotel is very close to time square, Rockefeller center, st. Patrick's cathedral, etc. We are glad that we chose this hotel and we will be back when we visit NYC again.

title: Michelangelo is Our Home in New York
text:
We just got back home about an hour ago from a quick one day trip to NYC to see Camelot and also Parade.  And, of course, our home base in New York is always the Michelangelo Hotel at 51st & 7th.  Perfectly located for easy access especially in the Theater District.  First of all, New York has bounced back from COVID and is open and bustling with activity.  It looks great; like the pre-COVID days.  Lots of people and businesses have re-opened.  Restaurants are open and it is all wonderful.

I should also say that we always call our friend Lakeman for transportation from LGA to the Michelangelo.  We look forward to seeing Lakeram each time we visit.

The Michelangelo is looking really good.  Lots of attention to detail and personal service.  We have been saying at Michelangelo for nearly 10 years (maybe more).  Staff is friendly.  We were greeted out front yesterday morning by Tedoro who recognized us and told us he was happy we were back.  And Edwin the Bellman took good care of us.  Lots of hellos and friendly greetings all the way from the curbside to the check in desk.  Michelangelo is open with no signs of Covid.  Lobby lounge is fully operational.

Everything about the Michelanelo is clean and smart and in good working order.  It is nice to stay where you are known and appreciated.

This time we stayed in Room 409 which was a delightful room with a comfortable bed and a small sitting area and in room bar area.  The room was very close to the elevator and very quiet. Our only regret is that we did not stay any longer.  But we will be back in October and will stay longer then.

Just to finish off, the Michelangelo is where ywe enjoy staying for our theater visits to NY.  Our first show was a Camelot matinee at Lincoln Center.  Michelangelo is 1 block away from the #1 train (red line) and Lincoln Center is about 2 stops in the Uptown direction.  Subways in mid town are very crowded, which is a good thing.  On the return, we took the M7 bus from right out side Lincoln Center down 7th Av. to across the street from the Michelangelo.  Total transportion cost was $9 roundtrip for 2 people.

In the evening we walked to Parade on 45th street. The congestion in Time Square is exhilarating and is what makes NY New York.  Ray's Pizza is on the way and a great place to have a nice slice of NY pizza before the show.  We also enjoy the Majestic Deli which is a block away from the Michelangelo.  Great selections for breakfast, lunch, dinner or just a snack.

We enjoy travelling to New York and we enjoy standing at the Michelangelo.

JIM

title: BEST HOTEL in NYC
text:
Another amazing stay for my birthday at this wonderful hotel.  I don't know where to begin, because every single person you encounter here makes you feel at home and welcomed.  The thing I love the most about this hotel is HUGE ROOMS!!!  I would bet they have the largest rooms in NYC for the value and price, and have really nailed down the "old school luxury" vibe. I'm personally not a fan of "shiny glass and steel" like most of the newer hotels, so that's why I always choose to stay here.  The front desk team (especially June) are really fantastic.  The unsung heroes here are the doormen.  They greet you, big smiles, every single time.  

I would just advise you to stop searching and just book at this hotel for all your future trips.
