The location is perfect, a few blocks down from Central Park, and on a really quiet corner far enough away from the madness of Time's Square.  Thank you so much to the Manager Marco and his entire team for making my birthday trip (two years in a row) amazing.

title: Loved everything about this hotel!
text: We were so sad to transfer hotels after our time here was up. This was such a great place to stay! The staff are kind and friendly,  the beds are so comfortable, the location can’t be beat, and you don’t hear any of the noise in your room. We will always return here when in NYC.

title: VERY OVERRATED, gross room, hidden fees everywhere
text: Gross stained carpets, blood.... like really. Insane parking costs, 5 days was over 350 usd... the whole entire hotel is outdated. Loudest air conditioner i have ever experienced. No fridges, we had to take have the mini bar out so we could keep medication cold. Few Mice in the hallway. This was the biggest waste of what originally was supposed to be around 1790 canadian dollars and with all hidden fees ended up amounting to 2200 Canadian. Will never stay here  again. Have stayed at 4 seperate hotels in NYC by far the least classy service I've experienced. The staff was nice. Hidden fees, cleanliness, shady parking situation at lot 401. This place was a huge let down by the 2nd day of our 5 days I considered cancelling and relocating to the roxy in lower manhatten or even across the street. Never again

title: Great week at the Michelangelo
text: Our family stayed for one week at the Michelangelo in early July.  We had an excellent stay.  Service was outstanding.  Any issues or concerns were dealt with promptly.  Everyone was very pleasant and greeted us warmly when we were arriving and leaving hotel each day.  When we had a travel issue they worked with us to extend our stay at the same rate (even though posted rate was much higher at the time).  Rooms are great, very sizable.  Bathroom was perfect with a large walk-in closet as well. Beds were very comfortable. Location is great. Hotel is very clean and well maintained. We were happy with our choice for our family of four.  Would be happy to stay there again next time we're in New York.

title: Great location, room, and price
text: This was our second stay at Michelangelo and, again, we had a great stay!  You can’t beat the rates and the location is perfect for theaters, concerts, shopping, and Central Park.  The employees are all very helpful, especially the bartender and doorman.  The room was very clean and quiet and we love the art deco decor.  We will be back.

title: Excellent
text: Perfect location if you come for a broadway show. Walk to most locations and subway station is close if you choose to get around that way.  Upgrade to a Jr. Suite, the extra room is perfect and let’s you spread out and relax after a long day exploring the city.

title: Hidden Gem in Midtown NYC
text: Great old school hotel in midtown, large rooms, very clean, great location and super friendly staff.  Furnishings are more vintage than newer modern hotels but everything in great shape and really enjoyed our stay.

title: An old school gem in mid-town.
text: A boutique hotel with old school ambiance, and a staff that is as helpful and accommodating as one could wish for.  The rooms are more spacious than most in NYC, as are the bathrooms and walk in closets.    A special shout out to Edwin the bellman who always seemed to appear exactly when you most needed his assistance.   The location is in the heart of all things midtown: Central Park is a seven minute walk in one direction, Rockefeller Center seven minutes in another.  Most  Broadway theatres are walkable, as are a plethora of restaurants and coffee shops, MOMA and St Patrick's Cathedral.   Be sure to take a peek at the collection of historical hotel bills in the curio near the elevators; fascinating.

title: Definitely Recommend
text: The staff was welcoming and accomodating every day of our trip and helped make our honeymoon extra special.  The concierge was very helpful with our questions.  The room was spacious, clean, and surprisingly quiet given its proximity to Times Square.  Realy a gem due to its convenient location to Times Square, Broadway shows, Rockefeller Plaza, great restaurants, and several subway stations.  We really have no complaints at all and would definitely like to come back.

title: Always a great experience
text: I first stayed here over 20 years ago. I have been going back ever since. They always treat me well and the rooms are great. Much larger than you will find in other hotels in the city. It is convenient to Times Square and all the Theatres. A real gem.

title: First time stay and couldn't be happier!
text: My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at the Michelangelo.  From arrival until departure, everything was great.  Greeted with a very friendly welcome upon arrival and an upgrade to a Jr. Suite with champagne in the room. It was great to see a hotel with "back to normal" housekeeping!   Location is perfect for everything you would want to do in NYC, especially Broadway Shows.  Great diners and coffee spots close by as well. The Michelangelo is our home away from home in NYC!

title: First & last visit
text:
The room was shabby genteel -- curtains literally in tatters from sun exposure on the silk, chrome plating worn off on bathroom fixtures.  Rooms have a lot of square footage, but it's poorly laid out so much is unusable.  Maintenance had to be called twice during a five day stay:  once for a strobing LED lightbulb noticed at check in, again when the toilet backed up.  Both were fixed promptly, but overall impression is a financially struggling hotel skimping on maintenance.

Haughty and manipulative front desk staff.  Room isn't ready at check-in time, but for a price, we can upgrade you and not make you wait an hour..  Felt like a strategy to extract money.

Even at the discounted Booking.com price, you can do better within a few blocks, (e.g., the Warwick where I went when my return flight to Chicago was canceled).

title: Little gem in the heart of midtown
text: Great stay at the Michelangelo, the staff were all particularly pleasant from the doormen to the concierge. Rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean. Location is a few blocks from Times Square and within walking distance to Central Park.  I will definitely return.

title: Wow! Will definitely stay here again and again.
text: My husband and I found ourselves here unexpectedly for 3 nights when an airline snafu left us stranded and he randomly booked us a room here. I've stayed in numerous hotels in midtown and this one is my new favorite. Terrific hotel. Everyone here is absolutely lovely and Walter F. is a hero. He upgraded us to a junior king suite. Thank you Walter F.!!!

title: Great Boutique Hotel next to the Theater District
text: I've stayed at the Michelangelo a number of times because I love the small hotel experience.  The check-in area looks like your livingroom.  They serve breakfast in the bar in the a.m. and cocktails in the p.m.  The rooms are spacious and the beds are TO DIE FOR!!!  The staff is absolutely wonderful, particularly the doormen/bellmen and really friendly and helpful.  It's in the middle of the theater district with LOTS of activity outside, but the windows must be double paned because it was wonderfully quiet in our third floor corner room.  I HIGHLY recommend The Michelangelo.

title: Well appointed romantic hideaway
text: Well appointed, romantic hideaway close to Central Park, the Theatre District and Times Square. A cozy bar offers breakfast as well as sips and nibbles in the evenings. On point staff are welcoming & helpful. Cabs are easy to catch or subway is 2 blocks away for the daring!

title: Loved our stay!! ❤️
text: Staff was very helpful and attentive. It’s close to time square, Central Park, subway and shopping. Definitely coming back! Our room was very spacious and didn’t feel crowded. We had the two Queen beds room.

title: Okay But Dated and Damaged
text: We had an okay experience at this hotel. Although we had a spacious room featuring some nice touches and finishes, the overall feeling was a bit dated and not what I was expecting. Our room also had stains on the carpet, wall dings, and the fabric was ripped on the valance. The most disappointing thing was the view of a brick wall out the window. Hallway carpet also had a rip along a seam which tells me the problems are not limited to just our room. At the end of the day, I was expecting quite a bit more given the web site photos and reviews. Would not recommend this property as there are far too many other hotels in the same price range that offer a better experience.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: The Michelangelo offers the biggest and most comfortable rooms in the city and the loveliest staff: everyone is smily, kind and always ready to help. This is really and always my home far from home. Looking forward to go back.

title: 5 Days in NYC
text: I brought my son and daughter for their 1st trip to NYC. I picked the Michelangelo because it was the only hotel that had a 2 King bed option at a reasonable price. The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful. The room was clean. The Michelangelo is in the middle of Times Square, so occasionally we’d hear a blaring car horn; but that’s to be expected. The shades over the windows effectively blocked out the flashing lights of the city. The housekeeping staff did a fantastic job and replenished our towels, took out the trash and made our beds daily. The only slight hiccup was that our check in time was delayed by 20 or 30 mins. Other than that, we had an enjoyable stay. The location is also very convenient to a couple of different subway stations. We relied on the subway for transportation for the entire week. On our departure, Kenric was very helpful and gave us great advice on how to get to the airport. Also, my daughter lost her wallet just before we left. The housekeeping staff found it and will be shipping it to us. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. I would recommend The Michelangelo.

title: Outstanding hotel of highest quality
text: This is an exceptional hotel located very centrally for city activities.  The overall ambiance is world class and the rooms are quite large for the city and the price we paid.  Staff is professional, helpful and friendly.  Will return to this hotel on future visits to NYC.

title: Best place to stay when visiting New York.
text: I highly recommend, it is in a great central location as some of the main attractions are within walking distance and the others are a bus ride away from the main bus stop a short walk from the hotel.

title: Muy mal Hotel
text:
En general es hotel es muy mal mantenido, deteriorado y sucio, los aires acondicionados tienen un alto nivel de ruido por lo que no dejan dormir, las habitaciones presentan fallas en los enchufes.
El personal es poco amable, es una muy mala opción.
No lo recomiendo

title: Great location and wonderful staff - a warm atmosphere to enjoy NY travels.
text: The Michelangelo is like an old friend.  It is in a prime location and is small enough to feel cozy and familiar and yet spacious enough to not feel cramped.  The staff is always very helpful.  Edwin (the Bellman) and Henry, his colleague, are wonderful.  Everyone is accommodating.

title: New York visit
text: The Michelangelo hotel exudes old world charm, with modern amenities. The staff are both friendly and professional and gave us a familiar and friendly greeting, remembering us from previous visits. The only possible criticism I would offer is that we would really appreciate an in room coffee maker, perhaps a Nespresso or equivalent. Everything else was excellent.

title: Great location. Needs makeover.
text: The hotel is in a prime location. The pictures look nice but it is really in need of a major makeover. Beds were clean and comfortable but our bathroom sliding door would get stuck closed! A real pain. Lobby plants near dead. Staff begs for tips. Awkward! Hallway carpets torn in areas. You are paying for the location not the caliber here.

title: WONDERFUL Stay! Would HIGHLY recommend the Michelangelo!
text: We absolutely LOVED staying at the Michelangelo Hotel! From the staff to the accommodations, very nice! The front desk staff were so helpful when we asked for directions or recommendations. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job and were very kind as they greeted us every morning and night. The doormen and bartenders and waitstaff, all so gracious. Our room was always clean and felt like a relaxing refuge after a long day of sight seeing. New York was so welcoming to us girls from Louisiana and the Michelangelo was definitely a big part of that! Thanks for your excellent hospitality!

title: Classic with comfort and location.   Give her a try!
text:
My third stay at The Michelangelo for work in the last 12 months and couldn’t be happier.   For me, location is great - for tourists, close to Times Sq, Central Park, St. Patrick’s, and Broadway shows.  

The rooms are spacious, beds comfortable, great shower, and AMAZING staff.   After a stressful work week, it was lovely to be greeted to such a welcoming and friendly staff.  A special thank you to Shirley on the 7th floor.  

I travel a lot and love a hotel with character.   The Michelangelo has it.  I avoid the big name chains, especially in NYC.   Waiting for an elevator for more than 5 minutes isn’t my idea of fun.  

Try the bar for a cocktail and dinner - I ate light with a caprese salad, but was very happy!!!

Thank you to all who made a sh*tty week that much better.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: I've been staying at the Michelangelo for over 20 years.  It's got a great location, the staff is very genuine and helpful.  The rooms are the largest I've found in NYC.  Some rooms have 2 King beds with 2 make-up/prep areas.  I've stayed at the Park Hyatt, St. Regis and Peninsula and all have small rooms.  The Michelangelo beats them in size and price.  I love the Michelangelo.

title: The perfect place to stay
text: The hotel is filled with old world charm, the rooms are quite lovely, the staff is amazing!!!  And....you are right smack in the middle of everything.....theatre, Times Square, Central Park, a bizillion great restaurants, Radio City Music Hall, Carnegie Hall....all within walking distance.  It just doesn't get any better!

title: Perfect, except no coffee in the rooms…
text: This is a lovely hotel very close to Times Square but an oasis of quiet.  Our room was on a low floor, but we had very little noise from outside.  We splurged on a 1- bedroom  king suite and it was enormous with a large living room area, a king bedroom and 1-1/2 bathrooms. Fluffy bathrobes.  Paulina kept our room spotless.  Our only complaint is there is no in-room coffee so if you are an early riser who likes coffee you will need to leave your room to find some.  I would have given 5 stars if we had coffee in the room.  It would be a great room for people traveling with children.

title: Great Stay
text: Fantastic location and very attentive staff. Clean, comfortable room, great pillows, all amenities provided including very well stocked bar. Had a great experience at the Michelangelo and will definitely return.

title: Outstanding Hotel & Staff
text:
We had an absolute beautiful stay at The Michelangelo! From the moment we arrived, Teodoro, at the door graciously greeted us & was most helpful!!! He even walked us halfway across the street to guide us to a restaurant!!!!
Front desk, Walter, was most courteous & helpful with a smooth checkin! One room was even ready early!!!
Housekeeping was great, location fabulous, & the entire staff went above & beyond!!!
Rooms for NYC are really spacious!
We will most definitely return!

title: Beware the Residence Fee
text: Property is very convenient location, but be sure to book a high floor or interior room to avoid street noise.  The maid service is excellent, rooms a bit dated.  Beware the Residence Fee - $45/night for "internet, phone and gym."  This fee is a disappointing new addition/junk fee as the gym and amenities are nothing to write home about.  If the property was thoughtful about this fee, it would at least include hot water/coffee in the lobby as one of the amenities in the package.  Instead, it has opted to not have coffee/hot water in the room and charge for it at the lobby level.

title: My ‘Go To’ in NYC
text: I love this hotel. Incredible location and old school client service.  Tenured staff and it shows.  This is our ‘go to’ spot in NYC.  Close to Broadway.  If you like to walk the city, everything is within range.  Great value.

title: Old and worn hotel
text: This hotel is in a good location and the staff was very helpful and pleasant.  The lobby has an old world vibe - but has seen better days.  It is very faded and worn.  But the lobby is miles better than the hallways or rooms.  Our room felt old and shabby.  Dark room, heavy drapes ( that I did not want to touch) and a very old bathroom.  This did not resemble what was shown in the photos.  I felt very depressed in our room for 4 nights.  If we had not been with another couple I would have moved to a different hotel.  I thought by booking a Star hotel it would be nice inside -  but this hotel makes me never want to book with Star again.

title: A warm welcome
text: We celebrated our Sapphire Wedding anniversary in New York and received a warm welcome with greetings from reception, a room upgrade and a complementary bottle of Prosecco on ice in our room, what a lovely start, and much appreciated!  Staff at this hotel are friendly and welcoming, and the service at breakfast is efficient.  The food choices and quality were good too.  There is an old world charm about the hotel, shabby chic and well cared for. It is ideally located close to Times Square, so reasonable walking distance to many of New York's attractions and very convenient for Broadway theatres of course.  Highly recommended!

title: Good standard at excellent location
text: Very nice hotel at an excellent location. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious even for 4 adults. The hotel was clean and nice and the restaurant provided a good a la carte breakfast.

title: Old world elegance
text: Centrally located in midtown Manhattan, this hotel felt like a comfortable home away from home. Very comfortable bed, scrupulously clean room and hospitable staff and service, make this hotel a perfect choice for a wonderful stay in New York City.

title: Amazing location
text:
This hotel is in the best location central to all main tourist attractions. 

The room was cosy and had the most comfortable bed. Nice temperature and old fashioned vibe. 

Only let down was no complimentary water in the room. 

Staff were friendly and polite. 

Behind the hotel is a local sandwich shop called toasties that did cheap tasty breakfast.

title: Excellent service; Spacious and beautiful rooms
text: The rooms are the largest I've ever seen in New York and were absolutely beautiful! The staff was professional and courteous - especially Edwin, the best bellman ever!!! The location was also just right for great restaurants and shows. It is also very close to St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: New York New Yrok
text: We loved The Michelangelo Hotel. Great Service and a fabulous location. Also very easy to access a taxi from the hotel. The rooms were spacious although only one sink in the bathroom.  We would definitely stay here again and look forward to our next trip.

title: Love the charm!
text:
Very convienient to Times Square and has a lot of charm. we would definitely stay here again. Staff did a great job and the rooms were clean and taken care of. great bedsheets too. where can I buy some? :) 

T

title: A slice of paradise in the middle of it all!
text: A beautiful hotel run by people that genuinely care about your time with them.  Highly recommend it.  Close to everything you are in town to see.  Stayed 4 nights and wish we could have stayed longer.  A great choice.

title: Romantic Good Sized Rooms and Elegant
text: We booked this hotel because of elegance and near Lincoln center for medical school graduation. Marble lines the floors of this hotel and we were very pleased with the quality of service and size of hotel room.

title: Luxurious Italian Style in the very heart of New York
text:
We were in New York for a special occasion and  had pre-booked 5 nights at the Michelangelo, some months in advance, getting a very good rate for a King Studio through Booking.com.  I emailed General Manager, Marco Gianni ahead of our stay asking for any complimentary upgrade that might be available for our celebratory occasion.

We pre-booked a transfer from JFK, again with Booking.com (£59) and were greeted at the arrivals hall and whisked into Manhattan in a smart black SUV. 

On arrival, the Hotel presents as a large traditionally-built brick building at the corner of 51st Street and 7th Avenue.  We were cordially greeted by the doorman and assisted with our luggage into the chandelier-hung hallway, and through golden bronze doors into the opulent foyer.  The foyer was both spacious and elegant.  Marble flooring, impressive chandeliers, crystal wall-lights, oil paintings, a grand piano and sumptuous seating areas. We were efficiently checked-in and given a complimentary upgrade to a Junior Suite (#709).

We took one of the three elegant golden elevators to the 7th floor and found our suite just a few steps away down the hallway.  On entering we were in a marble-floored vestibule with floor to ceiling mirror behind some glass shelving, upon which some books and an ornamental plate had been placed.  Moving through we found ourselves in our large seating area, with sofa, armchair, coffee table and two reproduction wooden chairs.  Uniquely we had a walk-up bar, with three stools, refrigerated mini-bar and a tray of chocolates and snacks for purchase.  Very kindly we had been left a bottle of Prosecco on ice and a half-dozen chocolate-dipped strawberries.  The refrigerator is big enough to also store your own items alongside the pay-to-consume mini-bar products.

To the side of the bar, a sliding door led to the bathroom, with well-lit vanity mirror above the washbasin, shaving mirror and a good selection of toiletries and amenity items. A further sliding door led to the w/c and large bath-tub with over-bath shower. There were complimentary bathrobes, slippers and a good array of white fluffy towels.

The Junior Suite had a large and very comfortable king-size bed, bedside tables, several table-lamps, an armoire which opened to reveal a flat-screen TV (with free channels, pay to watch movies and information services) and more drawer-space.  There was a large double-wardrobe with mirrored doors, electronic wall safe, iron, ironing board and laundry bag.

The air conditioner was effective and easy to operate.  The view from the Junior Suite's three windows, was past two wings of the hotel to 7th Avenue.  Double-glazing meant that the noise of the City was barely audible and we enjoyed very peaceful nights sleep.

The hotel is very conveniently situated about a 5 minute walk down 7th Avenue to the bright lights of Times Square and a 2 minute walk to 7th Avenue Subway Station. There are very many diners nearby for breakfast, the iconic Ellen's Stardust Diner is just opposite, Applebees and Juniors diners are just over the road.  There are plenty of bars nearby and Full-Service restaurants in and around Times Square, including the must-visit Virgil's Barbeque and it's sister establishment Caramine's  Italian Restaurant just a  few blocks away down 7th Avenue on 44th Street.  The theatres of Broadway are near the hotel. The Rockerfeller Centre and shops of 5th Avenue a 5 minute walk.  Central Park is a 10 minute walk up 7th Avenue.

In all, a very comfortable and charming hotel, with great staff and Italian style, set in the vibrant heart of New York.

title: A solid choice but with some updating needed.
text:
The hotel has many positive points and a few negatives. 

Firstly, for New York, the rooms are large and spacious with huge comfy beds and good quality bed linens. The room we had, a king studio, was extremely quiet and we slept extremely well. The windows were well insulated from the street noise. The staff we encountered were all very personable, helpful and courteous. Housekeeping was excellent and our room was kept extremely clean and it was lovely to return to it after a busy day sightseeing. 

The location of the hotel is excellent and was near (but not too near!) Times Square, Central Park and many subway stations to get you up and down Manhattan island. 

The only downside we felt, which is personal opinion, is that the fixtures and fittings were a little tired. Light switches, lamps and particularly the shower mixer were old and all could do with updating. In addition, the air conditioning unit was very noisy so not sure how this may play out in the warm summer months as it may be difficult to sleep with it on. 

However, if you’re looking for a comfortable hotel with lovely staff that is centrally placed then booking here would be a good move. Just don’t expect ultra modern decor or amenities.

title: Avoid.
text: Wouldn't recommend staff rude asking for tips. Room dirty a layer of dust on every surface underneath the radiators filthy and looked sticky. The bottles left out of the mini bar were dirty also. We didn't get fresh glasses after using ours and had to wash them day by day ourselves. Upon packing to leave we moved the chair to discover blood stains 5 of them. The staff when informed of this made no reply just carried on checking out. We had a child with us also she could have touched the stains. Sickening!!!

title: Great hotel in a great location with nice rooms!
text: The hotel is in a great location and as we all know, location is the key.  The staff is great and everyone is very friendly and helpful.  Edwin our Bellman went out of his way to help us.  We stayed in and Executive Studio and had an adjoining room for our daughter which was thru a foyer.  Our room had a door, her room had a door and the suite of two rooms had a door.  It worked out great.  These rooms are about twice the size of most hotel rooms and it makes it really nice to have some room.  Large bath area, walk in closet, and a large bedroom area with sitting chairs and a desk.  I will back.

title: Great Hotel --- Luxury and Great Service
text: Wonderful upscale hotel, comfortable rooms and great service.  Special thanks to the Bellman (Edwin) and Doorman, who were both very helpful and attentive.  We will definitely go again the next time we are in NYC.

title: Perfect place to stay!
text: My wife and I stayed here for a mini-honeymoon. Location was PERFECT for easy walking to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, and restaurants. Room was spacious (for NYC), clean, and quiet, and hotel staff was amazing. We will stay here every time we come back to New York. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel.

title: An amazing week in The Big Apple!
text:
The Michelangelo Hotel is very comfortable, in an excellent location, with friendly staff and lovely decor. We stayed a week and would recommend at least a junior suite as the king studio did not include a coffee pot or mini fridge. However we asked for both and luckily they were available so housekeeping brought them to our room! 
Time square is a block away, we walked to the Empire State Building, Central Park, and Rockefeller Plaza. Easy access to underground and public buses surrounding the hotel. A great hotel!!

title: Disappointing Stay at the Michelangelo Hotel
text:
We recently stayed at the Michelangelo hotel in New York, and unfortunately, our experience was quite disappointing. 

Let's start with the positives. Almost all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was spacious, the beds were comfortable, and the linens were very nice. The location was excellent and close to the theater and Times Square. Unfortunately, that is pretty much where it ended. 

The hotel itself looked quite dated, and even though we upgraded to the king suite, it too was very outdated. The furniture was very old and worn out. The toilet flush barely worked, and to our surprise, there were no wine glasses in the mini-bar. We had to call down to the front desk for some, but they never arrived, and we had to go down to the lobby to ask for them. They did indicate the wine glasses were supposed to be there, but maybe it was an oversight by housekeeping. The bath products provided were of poor quality. Additionally, there was no coffee or water in the room, which was surprising considering the high price we paid for our stay and the fact that it is a star-rated hotel. We paid around $650 for the night (and that did not include breakfast) and $90 for parking per night. We were there for 26 hours, so they charged us for 2 nights parking. 

Overall, we would not recommend staying at the Michelangelo hotel in New York, as the lack of attention to detail in room amenities and outdated decor did not justify the high cost of the stay. We realize it's about supply and demand, and that could justify the cost, but it certainly does not justify the star rating.

title: You could not do better than the Michelangelo
text: We recently stayed here for several days and have rarely had a more relaxed stay at a hotel. Everyone from the moment we entered was ready to assist us whenever we needed someone. The staff was especially helpful in providing us suggestions of places or events. This was a wonderful stay, and we would seriously encourage anyone looking for a special getaway conveniently located in the heart of the theater district to come to the Michelangelo.

title: Great location, big rooms, wonderful service
text: Location is great, close to the Broadway and Rime Square. Nearly to the public transport. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious with big and comfortable beds. The windows are old and do not isolate properly noise from outside. The personal is very nice and helpful. Beautiful interior decor. Some people from the staff are speaking Italian. No problems with internet connection. Would recommend for whom is visiting NYC for a couple of days or even a week as us.

title: perfect location for theatre & museums
text: We chose the Michelangelo for its location and the size of the rooms in the photos. The location was absolutely perfect for us, since we intended to go to 4 shows in 4 days plus museums and Central Park during the days. We have been to NYC a few times previously, and this location was the best. The room size is astounding! huge! with comfortable beds, and good service. Dining options abound nearby. We would certainly stay there again.

title: New York visit ,March 2023
text: The hotel is very well situated in midtown close to many of the must see attractions..The staff were  all very friendly and helpful especially the Bellman  Edwin and Theodore .Our room was cleaned every day to a high standard.The suite was  large and a very comfortable bed was provided as well.We were also given an upgrade on arrival which was appreciated.

title: Charming, quiet hotel within easy walking distance of Broadway
text:
This is my second time staying at the Michelangelo on W 51st street in NYC.  I had such a positive experience a year ago, while staying with my daughters, that I chose to stay here again, this time with my husband for an overnight. 
 
There is a very convenient parking garage adjacent to the hotel, with a reduced 24 hour rate if you have your ticket validated by the hotel. It is valet service.
The concierge was quite welcoming and although we could not check in until 3:00 p.m., we were able to have all of our information entered into the system, and our bags held in a secure location, so that when we returned, our key was ready, and the doorman delivered our luggage to our room.  Walter, the concierge, took care of this for us and was a delight to work with. 

Our room was quite large, and included a small sofa, chair and coffee table in addition to the king sized bed.  A  large armoire hid the television, which swiveled, so that one could watch it from the sofa, or the bed.   There was a bar, with two chairs, which I found a bit unnecessary for an overnight, but someone might find it useful, particularly if one chooses to dine in.  There was also a small fridge hidden behind a cabinet, as well as a room safe in the closet.

The bathroom came with generous supplies of shampoo/conditioner/body soap and lotion as well as  a  hair dryer.

We did find the room to be a bit warm for sleeping, despite trying to lower the temperature.  The windows do not open.

We hear no hall noise in the room, which is really quite unusual for a hotel, and an extra nice feature.   Wi-fi is free but unsecured. 

The hotel is within easy walking distance of many of the local Broadway theaters, as well as Time Square.

title: Great stay!
text: We will definitely stay again at The Michelangelo! The room and bathroom were spacious and clean, and the staff was very accommodating.  The location was close in proximity and walkable to most of the things we did. Highly recommend!

title: Great place and ask for Walter!
text: A very good place to stay, nice rooms, good hotel bar, good location, easy to subway... But what made the trip special was the staff! From the moment you walk-in the staff was great, the door man was terrific (not like the rude dude next door!) housekeeping was wonderful and especially the gentleman at front desk named Walter. We had 7 rooms in our party and he took great care of all of us! He was ALWAYS there with great suggestion on whatever our needs were. Thanks again Walter!!!

title: Such a great hotel
text: My friend and I stayed at the Michelangelo at the end of February and had a GREAT stay. The hotel was lovely and in a great location. The room was spacious and beds were comfortable. Our room looked out onto 7th Ave which we loved. The staff were all kind and friendly. Special thanks to Teodoro who was always friendly and helpful upon our return to the hotel. Just a great place to stay. Will be back in October with a large family group and I am looking forward to that stay!

title: Theater Area
text: Great hotel.  Disappointed to see that they discontinued their complimentary breakfast. Room was spacious, well appointed and immaculate.  Was given a free upgrade to a suite.  Convenient location to theaters.  Three great steakhouses on same block.

title: Quick layover in NYC
text:
I booked this hotel after a flight cancelation. Very last minute. When my husband and I checked in, they were very accommodating and were able to give us a very late checkout for the following day at a reasonable cost. The room was perfect, big and quiet. We have stayed in NYC many times and found this hotel to be one of the best in midtown. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. Edwin was very kind, helping us with our bags.
The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring.

title: Highly recommend
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were very nicely furnished.  The location is central to Times Square and other popular locations. Beautiful lobby  area as well.

title: Grazie
text: We booked The Michelangelo based on location and because it's a Preferred Hotel.  When we arrived the first room offered ( although an upgrade ) was dark as it was an interior room. The second room had more light, but looked much smaller and frankly a bit shabby.  Then the manager Elizabeth suggested we come back in an hour because all rooms weren't yet available, since it wasn't quite check-in time. We had lunch, they called when our new room was ready - and what a difference ! SPECTACULAR.  A lot of light, spacious and high floor as requested.  It was an anniversary trip,  so the accommodation meant everything to us :-)  The next morning, they sent up a bottle of Prosecco to congratulate us and it was very much appreciated !  We travel a lot and have found that good hotels are eager to have happy guests - sometimes you just have to ask for what you want. Grazie to all the staff and especially Elizabeth.

title: Hidden Gem in Midtown Manhattan
text: The Michelangelo is a lovely hotel in the Theater District. The staff members are consistently warm, kind and helpful, the rooms well-appointed and well-kept, and the breakfast wonderful. This has been our NYC stop since the late 90s. We cannot recommend it highly enough, although it could use a little spiffing up.

title: Very unhappy.
text: The two rooms we had were not fully clean and well kept. The room temperature was way too cold, stayed at 63 degrees, and never changed, even when we tried to warm up the room. It was a horrible night

title: Great family hotel
text: The space for our family of 4 (two teens) was tremendous. We originally booked a Double Queen but were able to upgrade to the Double King. Plenty of room for suitcases, stretching out, and getting ready. Loved that the sink was separate from the tub/shower/toilet area. Walk-in closet was great space too. Extra vanity space was used as was the desk and side chairs. Loved have multiple windows in our corner room -- added to the feeling of space. It was a large room by most standards and humongous by NYC standards! We didn't eat in the hotel (so many option right outside the door). The lobby area was nicely appointed, again, spacious, and would have been a fine area to rest and wait if needed. Doormen were always super friendly and we were always warmly greeted. Cannot beat location if you are looking to do something in and around Times Square -- also wasn't a bad walk up to Central Park. All in all, would definitely recommend and would come back again!

title: Our go to hotel in midtown.
text: We really enjoy staying here ! Quite relaxing elegant, great to come back to a large clean room that’s old school charm . Staff is very helpful and always with a smile . Perfect location to everything . We have stayed here many times and it never disappoints!

title: Well below par.
text:
The Hotel  is depressing. Dark and dingy.
The room was dirty and furniture and walls cracked. The thermostat, safe and two lights in need of repair. Place should be closed or condemned.  The resort fee was a joke. It provides no real benefits. No complimentary water in the entire hotel.  Entire hotel in need of renovation

title: Home away from home
text: We have enjoyed our stays at the Michelangelo since 2003. The hotel is conveniently located and is staffed with extraordinary professionals. The doormen, the bellmen, front desk and lounge staff are most accommodating. The lobby and lounge areas are a quiet oasis from the hustle outdoors. We always have an enjoyable visit.

title: Quiet hotel right by the theater district!
text:
Great location to all the tourist attractions. Will definitely return.  The staff was really great! So friendly. Shoutout to Edwin and Teddy for making us feel even more welcome! 
Will definitely return for another stay when we return to NYC!

title: A Great Stay
text: There are so many things about the Michelangelo that go into making a stay there great. First, you can't beat the location for New York attractions, especially Broadway shows. Then there's the hotel itself: comfortable, well-furnished rooms that are kept perfectly clean. Finally, the people who work there really do an admirable job of making guests feel welcome. (Walter, who was at the reception desk when we arrived, deserves special mention.) I don't think you can go wrong staying here.

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text: The location was excellent. The room was larger and quieter than I expected. The staff was wonderful to work with from the doormen to the desk staff and the cleaning staff. Meals in the small restaurant were very good...the pancakes and french toast in particular. The rates were very reasonable for New York. I can't image staying anywhere else in future trips to Manhattan. The friends that I traveled with had the same experience as I did.

title: The best staff and best location!
text: Great value to be right in the middle of everything Broadway and Midtown have to offer. Room size is generous. We cannot say enough good things about the wonderful staff, in particular Henry and Teodoro who are extremely friendly and professional. They take pride in their work and it shows. Will not hesitate to continue staying here any time we travel to NYC.

title: Loosing its luster
text: The Michelangelo was always our hotel of choice when visiting New York but after our most recent experience it will no longer be  Upon arrival we asked about the $35  parking arrangement  that is promoted on their website only to be told by the very abrupt front desk associate that it no longer applies.(Then remove it from the website!!).  There were coffee stains on the rug in our room and stains on the bed skirt. When I called to ask about the residence fee since no one reviewed its benefits when we checked in, I was told it was for the in room phone (Who uses an in room phone!!!) the internet and gym access. In the past the benefits were much more valuable. When we reviewed our bill we had a charge on it for the minibar that we never used. I wrote to the hotel manager and received a very benign response from someone else whose comment was ""Your feedback has been sent to the relevant department" Yes. The location is terrific and the doormen are more than courteous and gracious but Im sorry to say that the former venerable Taft is going downhill quickly.

title: Excellent place
text: The Michelangelo is a hidden jewel of New York. The location is perfect for a multiple of reasons. It is perfectly located between the heart of Broadway the Roc and Central Park. The Rooms are some of the quietest and well appointed in the city.

title: Great hotel with personal service
text: We stayed twice at The Michelangelo New York the past few months - once the night before the NYC Marathon and once again on New Year's day. The rooms we had on both occasions were large, clean, and very comfortable. When in the city, we tend to avoid the Times Square area and the hotel is certainly close to it - an easy walk away - but still far enough that you can avoid it if you want. One of the benefits of the hotel's location is that it is a short walk to a number of different subway lines making it very easy to get anywhere. But the main strength of the hotel is the staff - everyone we encountered were friendly and helpful, and some of them have worked at the hotel literally for decades. Highly recommended hotel!

title: NYC
text:
Having stayed at the Michelangelo for many years on our trips to NY, we have never had any problems or complaints. However, this trip we saw many differences in the quality and offerings of the hotel.  There was no room service and to even get a cup of coffee was only offered in lobby bar at the cost of $7:00!  At over $500 a night I expect a cup of coffee.  While most hotel bars are open during the day for relaxation and comfort,, this bar did not open until 5:00.
We always enjoy the staff and they never disappoint!
Unfortunately we will be looking elsewhere on our next weekend in NYC.

title: Huge Comfortable Rooms, Some of the best for the price in NYC
text:
The Michelangelo is a part of the Starzione Collection, a European based boutique collection and you can feel the Italian influence as soon as you breeze through the door… Old glass armoires with china line the hallways, a really nice old-school touch that zags from many modern hotels idustrial feel. It feels and smells and looks like home, in the middle of Times Square. 

The star of the show in the Michelangelo are the rooms… Where else in Manhattan can you get 400+ sq ft in a standard room for a decent price? It feels homey… a true sanctuary… something rare in NYC’s often disappointing hotel scene. Carpeted floors feel clean, desk is large enough to actually get some work done, corridors feel residential rather than commercial. I loved it. 

I would highly recommend this room product for anyone who needs to stay in Midtown (otherwise, chose a different neighborhood, but that’s a different discussion). Great for business travel!

title: Reservations are a nightmare!
text: I haven't had the opportunity to stay yet, but based on how hard it is to actually amend a reservation I'm thinking about canceling. If you book online, you have to go back and forth on email with customer service to change anything. I tried calling, but they told me an online reservation can only be changed online. Even when I tried explaining how the cost was coming up different, they simply told me to email customer service. I think I'm on my 14th email, and the reservation stil isn't right!

title: Perfect NYC hotel experience
text: Spent a week staying at The Michelangelo over Christmas.  Perfectly positioned and close to Times Square, Bryant Park, Central Park and a couple of subway stations.  Felt like we were staying in a 5 star hotel - it was so plush and lovely. We loved the massive rooms with a huge wardrobe. I used the big bathtub every night to soak weary muscles and loved the fluffy bathrobes. Staff are lovely and very helpful. We had drinks in the bar a couple of times and it was warm and cosy. They make a nice latte too.  Also a shout out to the lovely cleaner Susan. Loved that we could look out our window at 10.30pm everynight and see Hugh Jackman at the stagedoor!! For Aussie travellers, you can ask for a kettle (they don't have them in the room. We bought our own tea and milk otherwise there are no in room facilities besides the mini bar fridge. We also found a laundromat a couple of blocks away as the laundry prices are high.  Overall a fantastic hotel and I would definitely return on my next visit. It actually was a big part of why we loved our visit so much.

title: So nice we did it twice
text: My husband and I have stayed at the Michelangelo twice for Christmas visits to NYC. The first time was pre-pandemic Dec 2019 and the second was just this December 2022. This time we had considered staying in a different part of town, but after researching hotels we felt that the Michelangelo offered a better experience. The rooms are a commodious size, the location is perfect for Broadway play viewing, and times square tree, etc. Most importantly the staff are so kind and eager to make your stay enjoyable. We got a junior suite both times. They have a very comfortable king bed and a well-appointed sitting area as well as a luxurious bath. The layout of the rooms were different but both nice. The room is pretty quiet for this active area. This time we had a difficulty with the heat system. We didn't even get a chance to mention it to the front desk. We asked the housekeeper for an extra blanket and immediately a technician was at our door to solve the problem. Also I had forgotten an article of clothing at the hotel when we left and the manager himself ( Mr. Adeniyi)  made sure that it was returned to my home. I highly recommend this lovely hotel.

title: My stay
text: I enjoyed every part of the hotel experience the theme was something from back in day where I never experienced a hotel so detailed in the rooms painting location setup and lay out I will definitely come back to this hotel my next stay in New York this is definitely one of my favorite spots now to stay when I’m in New York

title: Great time in beautiful hotel!
text: Highly recommend. Lovely, elegant lobby and rooms, polite staff, phenomenal location! Good value, walk to everything. Will be delighted to stay there again. Highly recommend th Michelangelo Hotel in New York City

title: Excellent Service
text: This hotel was an older establishment with superior service. The furnishings were clean and well presented. We enjoyed our stay and on a return trip to New York we will definite give it our utmost consideration.

title: Like coming home!
text: For 20 years I have been staying at the Michaelangelo. ALWAYS a great experience, all staff are friendly, helpful and experienced. The rooms are large, beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable, and the location is perfect for theater, restaurants, shopping, MOMA, rockerfeller center & Times Square! This is the “hidden gem” of NYC hotels!

title: Excellent
text: Fantastic stay in New York. Staff and hotel are perfectly located. Amazing. We had 2 amazing suites, worth the extra money. Staff did everything they could for us. Have stayed here three times before. Well worth it.

title: Location Location Location
text: This is more of a boutique hotel. Service level is excellent. The doorman was very friendly, the front desk clerk, Joseph, was very welcoming, and Henry, the man who took our bags to our room, was exceptional. Beyond the high service level, the hotels location, especially if you are seeing a Broadway show is perfect. Convenient to Times Square, the Stardust Diner, Broadway, and it's a lovely walk up to Central Park from here.

title: Michelangelo at Christmas Time
text: Hotel is in a central location and a great base for the major tourist attractions. Lobby area is well kept, classy and was nicely decorated for Christmas. On first glance, I thought the room looked a little dated but it was well kept, clean, spacious and so quiet! The star quality of the hotel is definitely the staff - everyone from reception, doormen, housekeeping were so friendly and attentive - they never walked by without a “hello”. We would definitely consider using The Michelangelo as a base again in future, and I hope management know how great their staff are!

title: NYC at Christmas ❤️
text: This is a fabulous hotel in the middle of Times Square and the Theater district. The room was great and spacious. Breakfast was delicious as well as the drinks from the bar in the evening.  All employees were friendly.

title: Nice, Quiet Hotel in Times Square
text: This hotel was amazing. The location is very convenient. The staff were very friendly! The room is larger than most NYC hotels we have stayed at. The bed and pillows were so comfy! The hotel was very quiet. We didn’t hear any noise from the neighbors or out in the hallway. You could not hear any noise from the road. The curtains made the room so dark in the morning we were able to sleep in. This was the perfect hotel room to rest in after a long day in the city. The bathtub/shower was very spacious. This hotel was totally worth the extra money and we will definitely be back! Oh and checkout wasn’t until 12pm!

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
text: Love this hotel.  It is convenient to virtually everything.  Easy walks to Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, Fifth Avenue shopping, Great Restaurants.  Easy Subway, Bus and Taxi access to everywhere else.

title: Exemplary
text:
Stayed 10 days over Christmas .
The entire experience was superb.
For 22 years I have relentlessly supported Marriott as an elite Bonvoy member however following my stay at this property I will never consider the “cookie cutter “ impersonal , rule based authority imposed by large chain properties. 

This hotel has opened a whole new experience destroying any preconceptions that the large chain operations offer more it is simply not the case in fact the opposite . The large hotel conglomerates,are in my opinion, following this stay impersonal, disingenuous and hyped by marketing hypocrisy.

The Michelangelo Hotel is grand but intimate, the service non intrusive but impeccable, the rooms of large proportions offering a quiet retreat from the chaos of Times Square that surrounds.

The decor is ageing opulence.

The breakfast is wonderful with an extensive a La carte menu coupled with attentive service that is imparted by the dedicated F&B team .

My room was a one bed king suite which was huge by any standard with two marble bathrooms . Housekeeping service outstanding .

The location could not be better .

If you are expecting a pristine , bland cookie cutter pedestrian chain hotel this is not for you. From my perspective this hotel offers perfection , no crowds, no noise , caring staff and a timeless intimate quality that is rare to find anywhere in this day of “chain sameness “.
I cannot recommend this hotel more highly . I will be returning without doubt .

title: Oasis in busy area
text: We have stayed at the Michelangelo for many years, and have always had a wonderful experience.The service is great, the location is perfect, and the pleasure of entering this quiet Oasis in Manhattan in a sea of chaos never fails to please.

title: Convenient location and spacious rooms
text: This has become one of our favorite hotels. It is located in a great location near Rockefeller Center and the Broadway theater. The rooms are more spacious than most hotels and the staff is friendly and helpful.

title: Stayed with new friends
text: Great stay as the staff especially Walter Faranda made everything easy, with a feeling of warmth, almost like visiting a friend. Each person we met made us feel like they were really happy they could make our stay one we should and will repeat.

title: Absolutely Fantastic
text:
What can I say--this hotel has it all. Big rooms, wonderful staff and facilities and a GREAT location. We were always greeted by the front desk staff and the bellman; we even got to know the cleaning staff. One of the best hotels and the best price points of any of my many trips to NYC. Oh yeah, here is the topper.

I left about $300 cash on the bed when I changed wallets the cash got under a fold in the bed blanket. So, I get a call on my cell phone a few hours later that the cleaners had found the money and put it in a safe place in a drawer by the bed. Are you kidding me--honest and caring people do that and the Michelangelo is just that. I am so very impressed ( by the way, I tracked down the maid and gave her a $20 tip for her honesty).

title: Old school hotel with large rooms
text: We stayed for a week in November 2022. A little more expensive that some nearby hotels, but the large room was worth it. We stayed in a studio king, which is something like 500 square-feet in size. Paid just over $400 per night. We booked directly with the hotel and did not have to pre-pay. We could cancel up to 48 hours before check in.  The staff seems composed of longtime employees dedicated to providing an exeptional experience. Obviously, its a great location for attending Broadway shows.

title: A Genuinely Enjoyable Stay
text:
My wife had wanted to go to New York for years, and she picked this hotel due to it's proximity to Broadway, Times Square, and Central Park.

Good Choice!

There are literally dozens of broadway and off broadway productions within easy walking distance.  There are multiple good restaurants within easy walking distance.  The back door of Winter Garden is immediately behind the hotel, and we got to see Hugh Jackman come out and greet fans multiple times (you could tell by the screaming that he was out!)

Now for the hotel itself: This is one of the older but very nice hotels.  The bathrooms are updated, the rooms are comfortable, and we enjoyed our stay.  We were greeted by the staff whenever we returned (multiple staff members) and felt very comfortable in the hotel with their staff and clear attention to detail.  

The hotel was clean, well-kept, and given it's proximity to downtown, reasonably quiet.

I like hotels like this one, and was glad my wife found it.  If you'd like a comfortable stay, this is a good place to get a reservation at.

Free WIFI is included (and instructions that were easy to follow provided.)

All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent
text: Fantastic experience: Rooms are spacious. Staff are kind, helpful, and personable (and funny: lots of welcomed laughter!). Services are on point. Location is ideal. Everything exceeded expectations. Will be my go-to for NYC from here out.

title: An iconic NY Hotel
text: I have been coming to the Michaelangelo for 4 decades. Always a wonderful stay and close to everything. Shopping, Grand central station, Central Park, Broadway. The staff is friendly and always a welcome smile.

title: Class Act
text: We love staying at the MichaelAngelo Hotel. The location is perfect, close to the action of Times Square but far enough to be quiet. The rooms are about 300 sq ft and very clean. The staff is helpful, polite and knowledgeable about the city.

title: Always Glad To Return To 51st & 7th
text: We stayed at the Michelangelo last weekend from Friday to Monday.  We have stayed here many times and always look forward to our return.  The location is perfect for Broadway shows, great restaurants and access to public transportation.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  We will be back in January.  Michelangelo is our home away from home in New York City.

title: Couldn’t be happier!
text: From the moment you enter the hotel you feel like royalty.  The entire staff was so friendly and accommodating.  Everything about our stay was so perfect that we booked a return visit the day we got home.  The location is perfect to go anywhere you want to go.  And the accommodations are  amazing.  Beds, pillows, couches, decor, robes, towels, everything was fantastic. And the room service for breakfast was the perfect ending to our stay.  Absolutely cannot wait to be back in March :).

title: My forever hotel
text: I’ve been traveling to NYC for 60 years, 50 of which I’ve been responsible for booking my own accommodations. I have never stayed at the same place. However, I am done looking- The Michaelangelo is now my “go to” hotel. I liked everything about it - the staff, location, amenities, housekeeping, comfort, and decor. A special shout out to Angel and Henry. Can’t wait to return.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Myself and my partner booked the Michelangelo Hotel for our first ever trip to NY and it didn’t disappoint. The food and amenities which came with the hotel were, as expected, pricer than other hotels outside in the Times Square/Broadway area however, we absolutely expected this given the location and type of hotel we booked. 

We expected a luxury stay and we absolutely got that. The food was delicious at the downstairs restaurant however, portions were smaller than expected given the prices on the menu. The rooms were larger than we anticipated and the rooms felt clean with the exception of a broken curtain. The king sized bed was also extremely comfortable given it’s a hotel bed.. you absolutely get what you pay for. We had a large bath shower in our room too which was super spacious.

The staff were all helpful and friendly however we did get a bit of a strange look when we turned up after travelling in hoodies and loungewear but overall a great experience. The concierge, Henry was an incredibly lovely, friendly man and was more than happy to sit and chat with us and also rushed to our every need. He was pleasant to be around and an asset to the hotel to say the least. 

Overall, I would stay at this hotel again, the location is fantastic however NY is a loud city so you are bound to hear the traffic regardless of whichever room you stay in during the night. The hotel, while feeling slightly dated, felt clean and luxurious and I wouldn’t hesitate to book in the future.

title: Happy Honeymoon Stay
text:
The hotel was located a short walk from the Theater District,  30 Rock or Central Park.
Rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and attentive.  Marco the manager was especially accommodating. 
Looking forward to coming back for a longer stay !

title: GREAT hotel.   Will definitely return.
text: This was the absolute best find for our weekend in NYC.   Location, location, location.  The hotel is charming European style; the room was huge by NY standards; great lighting in the bathroom (bad hotel bathroom lighting is a peeve of mine); so quiet and peaceful inside after walking through the noise, crowded streets of the city.   Great breakfast restaurant.   The staff is very helpful and friendly; special shout out to the doorman who, after loading our luggage into our car, stopped the traffic on the street so we could pull the car out safely.

title: Perfect for any New York stay
text: Excellent location with spacious & comfortable bedrooms, everywhere was very clean throughout the hotel & (considering the location, it was quiet through the night. Gym was well equipped & tidy. Staff were very friendly & helpful. We would stay here again

title: Coming back!
text: Just took a quick trip up to New York and stayed here. We stayed in the 1 bedroom Grand suite, it was fantastic. The people that work there are top notch, especial June. Literally just booked three suites for the family in May...not even back a week lol.  We typically go to NY 2-3 times a year and may have found our home. Best bang for your buck for a true 4 star hotel!

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
We stayed here end of August with my 5 year old daughter and stayed in the art deco suite which was lovely, amazing bed and lots of space for us all.
I would like to raise special attention to the lovely doorman who greeted us everyday with a lovely smile and a "welcome home" he was a real credit to the hotel
Overall I would recommend this hotel the location is excellent and very clean

title: Amazin hotel and Service
text:
I was in NYC for the weekend for a break after a business week in USA. Amazing welcome, room ( free upgrade) and service. Very top location. 
I thank the Hotel Manager Mr. Marco Gianni for letting us have a beatiful stay. Very well recommended.
Chiara

title: A for effort
text: There were a lot of positives about the hotel- staff was helpful and nice; room was larger than any I’ve had in NYC and included 1.5 bathrooms; room was quiet; bed was comfy. I really wanted to love this hotel, and I feel like the staff did their best to enhance my stay, but overall the hotel just seemed really dark and dated. The air was also set to not go below 68, which is a deal-breaker for me. I totally understand why a hotel would put this in place, but for me, I need it cool at night to sleep well. It’s a nice place, just not for me.

title: Wonderful
text:
Wonderful best best best, will always stay here
Rooms quiet clean and roomy beautiful; breakfast superb; near all Times Square, theaters restaurants 5 th ave; the staff WONDERFUL WONDERFUL, breakfast was fabulous every morning, clean hotel

title: A decent hotel with a great location.
text: I felt like royalty in the Grand Suite (offered at a discounted rate). People say it is expensive in the hotel but, compared to others in Times Square, it's average. It's a great location (literally round the corner from theatre distract). The man behind the counter was fairly abrupt, borderline rude, but the rest of the staff were lovely. Check in and check out was a breeze. Also worth pointing out that it felt pretty quiet there too. All in all, very happy and I would stay there again.

title: Exceptionally rude, expensive
text: Stayed there for three nights - booked by my friend but paid by me - not through Tripadvisor. The best that can be said is that it's an excellent location, clean, safe - for nearly a grand it should be! Then the downside: It's very expensive (morning bagels are charged at $19!). Despite the price it has no aura of luxury, the room was dark and the AC exceptionally noisy. My friend has stayed there several times before, yet his request that we have adjoining rooms was ignored and I was on another floor. The main issue however, was that they were very rude to me. With no warning, I was locked out of my room after two nights simply because administratively they didn't have my credit card on the room booking - they had my friend's. That struck me as pretty astounding (why not just buttonhole me at reception? Or better still, book me in properly, on my own credit card, at check-in!) However, when I tried to ascertain that my card alone would be on the booking and that my friend's card would not be mistakenly charged as well (a real possibility given automated billing), a man in a hotel black suit was called from behind the scenes and started shouting at me. I was astounded. I paid nearly a  thousand dollars to stay at a dark and not luxurious hotel only to be locked out of my room then have a man shout at me in the lobby. This was real NYC attitude. Contemptible. And yes, this is a genuine review - not a hatchet job; and yes, it went down as I describe here - this is not a self-serving account and I am not embroidering. I believe the man who originally served me at the desk was rather ashamed of his senior's attitude for what it's worth.

title: Labor Day Weekend in NYC
text: This is my 5th time staying at the Michelangelo Hotel in NYC.  It is an excellent boutique hotel with an Italian flavor in a great location.  It is my number one hotel for business or leisure when visiting NYC.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great stay at The Michelangelo
text:
Picked this hotel due to former good reviews-so glad we did.

Plus points are many but include:

Location-just off Times Square-just perfect for walking to the main attractions-also subway station only 1 street down. Loads of diners, restaurants, bars in the immediate area-loads of choice.  However as the hotel is in a side street, it is a little oasis in a storm! Walk inside and you are in a haven of calm!

Rooms-just lovely-spotlessly clean -bed changed daily-and the most comfortable I have ever slept in!! Extremely clean and serviced by very friendly staff. Great bathroom with a powerful shower too!

Staff-all were great-and really made our stay. Many of them were of long-standing and were happy to chat about how they loved working there. One staff member had worked there for over 35 years and told us about the history of the local area and the changes he had experienced over the years-really interesting-a “tour” on its own -and a good sign that the hotel inspires loyalty by retaining staff. 

Bar/breakfast room-this had been closed for quite a time but re-opened the week we visited. Although there are lots of choices locally it was nice to come back to the hotel after a hard day’s sightseeing and finish off the day with a relaxing drink!
Didn’t have breakfast there ourselves but plenty did. Looked -and smelled good-but area is small-so on a first come, first served basis. 

So an excellent choice if coming to NYC-so glad we picked it and would highly recommend

title: Topissime !
text: 6 nuits passées fin août 2022. Je confirme tous les éloges des autres commentaires : emplacement idéal (5 minutes à pied de Times Square, 10 minutes de Central Park pour le footing du matin, métros et bus, tous à proximité), chambres immenses même en formule basique (Executive), salle de bain ultra confortable (baignoire king size), la meilleure literie que j'ai jamais connue, propreté irréprochable de la chambre et des parties communes qui sont parfaitement entretenues, moquette ultra épaisse à l'américaine, déco et mobilier à l'italienne un peu vintage mais ça procure à l'hôtel un charme réel. Et enfin, personnel hyper pro, des concierges aux bagagistes, notamment quand il s'est agi de changer de chambre en plein milieu de séjour du fait de travaux nocturnes très bruyants par les services municipaux New-Yorkais, juste sous notre fenêtre (au passage, on est passé d'une chambre qu'on trouvait topissime à une autre encore plus grande et sans surcoût). De tels atouts qui confine aux 5 étoiles pour 160 € la nuit, on a cru rêver toute la semaine ma femme et moi. Dans les points négatifs, tous très mineurs : l'insonorisation vis à vis de la rue n'est pas parfaite mais rien de grave et surtout, on n'entend rien de chambre à chambre. La clim est également un peu bruyante mais il suffit de la couper la nuit (un concept que les Américains ne connaissent pas : couper la clim). Prestations annexes (mini bar, petit déjeuner, VOD) très chères, mais c'est New-York et on peut choisir de ne pas faire appel à ces prestations. Donc, non seulement je recommande +++ mais je suis à peu près certain que j'y retournerai afin d'avoir la garantie d'un séjour à nouveau réussi à New-York.

title: Ottima posizione ma sente i segni del tempo
text:
Situato in una posizione molto
favorevole vicino a Times Square,
Rockefeller Center e alle fermate della
subway da cui tutto si può raggiungere.
Camere spaziose e abbastanza
silenziose anche quelle sulla 7ma.
Lo abbiamo visitato dopo alcuni anni e
purtroppo non è stato fatto nessun
intervento di manutenzione o di
rinnovamento e onestamente lo sfarzo
iniziale ha lasciato il posto ad una
assoluta necessità di intervento. Un
cambio degli arredi, tende salotti etc
sarebbe auspicabile oltre che ormai non procrastinabile.

title: Exceptional Service
text: We were exhausted from our red eye flight and hour and a half cab ride from JFK. They were able to get us our room early so that we could wash up and take a nap. I ordered breakfast to wake everyone from their nap and they came and set up a table in our room. The food was delicious. The staff was always there to help with the stroller or just to chat while waiting for a food delivery. This will be my hotel every time I’m in New York.

title: Perfetto!
text: Stanze spaziose, pulite e ben arredate; poi, ciliegina sulla torta, nel bagno è presente il bidet, che per noi italiani all'estero, è veramente il quid in più. E infine location meravigliosa: a un isolato dal Moma, a due passi da Rockfeller center e a  pocho isolati da Times Square. Che altro dire?

title: NYC
text: We enjoyed our two night stay here. Beautiful accommodations and wonderful service. I highly recommend. Excellent location.Close to theater district, Times Square,Rockefeller Center and many great restaurants!

title: New York Trip
text: Great hotel, wonderful location. Furniture a bit old and saggy. Was very uncomfortable to sit on, in fact, slanted forward, could not enjoy sitting on the couch. Bed and room were wonderful. We had a junior suite and the extra room was worth the price. Location, Location, Location. Excellent location. Close to everything and if we wanted a taxi or Uber, not expensive. May stay again if there are more updated rooms.

title: Best hotel I have stayed in New York
text:
This hotel is definitely a good choice. Location is spot on for all attractions with Times Square just minutes away.
The staff are friendly and nothing is too much trouble.
Rooms are huge with large bath .
No tea and coffee facilities are the only downfall for me.
Would highly recommend this hotel for location price and comfort

title: Quiet room, great location
text: The Michelangelo was recommended by a friend, and we stayed there for 2 nights.  It is an old hotel.  Our room was very dated - carpet had stains, furniture was pretty shabby.  However, our room did not front on the street, and was very quiet at night, which was a real plus.  The location was really great - close to a tour we'd booked, a couple blocks from restaurants, Times Square - close enough to walk to, but far enough so as ot to have the hustle and noise.  A friend we travelled with had a different room, which had been redone - it was clean, had hard floors (no dirty carpet), and much better furnishings.  We did have breakfast at the hotel one day, and it was about the price you'd pay at a restaurant - but a great convenience, and the eggs were cooked to order (not a buffet).  Based on the location, we'd probably stay here again.

title: Really nice hotel, Great location - Hotel Wifi absolutely useless
text: Fantastic location close to everything a first time or regular visitor might want; middle of Theatre District, next to Times Square, Central Park a short walk away.   Lots of Subway stations very close.   Staff were very good.   Room (711) was huge and great for a multiple day stay.  Two negative issues I personally experienced .....  Hotel Wifi is worse than useless; constant dropping out, staff tried to help ... without success ...... we had no similar problems any other hotels during travelling 5 week Nth America holiday or with any external free Wifi sites.    Additional minor problem controlling air conditioning ( seriously needed during mid July visit) ..... it seemed to have a mind of it's own turning on and off without apparent regard for the set thermostat temperature.   Other than these two issues ...... Highly Recommend this hotel

title: Zu diesem Preis gibt es deutlich bessere Hotels in der Stadt
text: Bereits nach dem Bezug der Zimmer fanden wir Kondome im Nachttisch. Leider schien das vom Personal niemand sonderlich zu interessieren. Alle drei Zimmer die wir hatten, hatten lediglich „Fenster“ in einen Innenhof der kaum mehr als zwei Meter vom nächsten Gebäude weg war. Sauberkeit der Zimmer hätte jeweils auch deutlich besser sein können. Obschon bereits im Vorfeld bezahlt fielen noch sehr hohe Gebühren an je Zimmer. Das einzige Plus waren die für Manhattan eher grossen Zimmer.

title: Great hotel
text: Beautitul hotel located in the perfect location just a few stesso from time square, the teather district and all the fun the city can offerte. The rooms are huge, perfetto for families and super confortable for anyone else. Definitatly will be back.

title: Excellent Hotel/Customer Service
text: This was our 1st visit to NYC! My daughter and I were celebrating her 15th birthday! This hotel was beautiful! Very classy and very customer oriented! The location was right next to Times Square and convenient for all the shows and activities we had planned! Not once did we have to open the doors to the hotel because they always had someone working the doors, standing in the miserable heat! And always with a smile!! And housekeeping was phenomenal!! We were very spoiled during our visit!! Will definitely plan on staying here again on our next trip out!

title: Excellent people Excellent property
text: The staff was awesome. Vanessa and Joseph stored my New York cheesecake overnight for me to fly out with the next day. I had a room upgrade to accommodate my son and I. We will not stay anywhere else when we return to New York for our annual trip.

title: The BEST of the BEST for many reasons
text:
Where do I even begin? I just spent an amazing week at this hotel, and now it will be my "go to" place when visiting NYC.  The entire experience was amazing, but I'll break my review down into categories.

Location- You can't beat this spot.  A couple of blocks south of Central Park, Times Square, yet nestled on 51st and 7th where the streets are actually super quiet compared to other spots.  You are so centrally located here that you can walk quickly to anywhere.

Team-  From the Manager Marco, the Ops Manager Hamadi, to the countless other team members we encountered, everyone was a SUPERSTAR!!!  Ask yourself this simple question. When was the last time you were engaged into a conversation with a member of housekeeping?  Much less, told sincerely by housekeeping "THANK YOU for choosing to stay at our hotel."  WOW!!!  Every single morning when we encountered housekeeping on our floor, they greeted us.  The doorman, the bellmen, the front desk team, everyone was top notch.

The Room- If you can afford it, please book one of the Grand Suites.  It will be well worth your money, and it's over 800sf with plenty of space to stretch out.  It was like living in our own little mini-mansion for week.  Super clean, modern, remodeled, and even had TWO full bathrooms.

Take it from someone who travels non-stop for work, and has stayed in hotels across the globe, you should absolutely make The Michelangelo a destination on your list!!!!!!  Tell them Robert sent you :)

title: An absolute gem
text: We've stayed at Michelangelo a number of times.  It is in the best location, and has the best people working there, you will find in the city.  Easy walk to Times Square, Broadway Shows, Rockefeller Center, tons of restaurants.  The rooms are spacious, clean, and well appointed.  The people who work there are the same people year after year, and they treat you like friends and family.

title: Rude front desk staff
text: There was an issue and it could have been approached differently. We were there for my husbands birthday and the Asian lady at the front desk messed up the entire vibe of the trip. My husbands and I will not be returning.

title: A good experience
text:
This is a gorgeous hotel with impeccable service from friendly staff
We upgraded to a suite, which was an excellent size with two bathrooms and a very comfortable bed
It was quiet and relaxing which is just what we needed after a frenetic three weeks travelling around the US
The only disappointment was that there was no on-site bar/restaurant .. always nice to mingle with other guests. Also, no room service, which was just plain weird!
It was tucked away from the manic atmosphere of Times Square in the most perfect position

title: Very nice and quiet room, service, doorman, and location
text: Ok, to get a large room with 2 king beds with double paned glass to keep noise out is amazing!  AC was nice and cold.  Staff was excellent.  Only complaint was the ridiculous shampoo bottles - so NOT environmentally friendly and hard to open to boot.  We must have gone through 10 of them at least over 5 days.  Overall though, great hotel and location.

title: Amazing location, elite service, 100% recommend
text: An oasis in the middle of Times Square. The 5 star service started the second we arrived and lasted the entire time we were there (4 nights). Smells amazing, everything super clean and a perfect location for a trip to NYC. 100% would recommend.

title: Splendid
text: We came to see our daughter perform and everyone at the hotel treated us like family and like royalty! The location was perfect for Carnegie Hall and Broadway shows and an ideal starting point for everything else we had to do.

title: Chief’s Midtown Experience
text:
This was my first time to New York City and it did not disappoint.
The restaurants, landmarks, shows, baseball game, people etc. are what makes the town thrive.
But without our accommodations in the perfect location with an excellent staff, our trip would not have been the same.
We will definitely choose the Michelangelo for our next visit.

title: Fabulous!
text: We went to NYC for a family vacation and to see the sights, our first trip.  I picked this hotel as it got great reviews and was centrally located.  It definitely lived up to the expectations.  Our room was very large and on a corner with 2 king beds a large bathroom, walk in closet.  Plenty of space to relax.  It was very clean and the beds were so comfortable, down pillows.  The room was quiet, no noise from the street.  The staff at the hotel were so polite and helpful.  They really made us feel welcome.  We loved the location, easy walk to attractions without being right in the middle of it.  We will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

title: Great stay in a great location.
text: Great location and HUGE rooms by Manhattan standards. Hotel is pretty old but clean and comfortable. It’s also very convenient to Times Square and the subway without being in the thick of Times Square madness. I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Perfect location to enjoy vibrant Midtown NYC
text: Just checked out of the Michelangelo Hotel following a 4 night stay and honestly, it’s hard to fault the accommodation.
