We had a studio room with 2 queen beds, a walk in wardrobe type area, dressing space, lovely bathroom with a bath and and shower, and separate sink area.  Plenty of towels and toiletries are provided and replenished daily (in the previous hotel on this trip you had to constantly request these).  Lots of power sockets and USB points too.  The hotel could not be more perfectly located for what we wanted which was easy access to stores, shows and walkable to multiple attractions such as Hudson Yards/The Edge etc.  The only Ubers we took were to reach Downtown and to get to the ‘Friends’ apartment building in Greenwich Village and - added bonus - it is located opposite the stage door of the Winter Garden Theatre which at the time of writing has Hugh Jackman starring in ‘The Music Man’.  The staff are super friendly and helpful, the concierge team especially, and rooms / hotel as a whole are cleaned to an immaculate standard.  It’s a shame that the bar is closed still as many guests who we made polite conversation with said it would be a welcome feature, a pleasant space to enjoy a nightcap which is otherwise only attainable by visiting a bar close by or buying/having a drink in your hotel room…..not quite the same vibe though!  There is a breakfast service that runs from 7-11am that occurs in the bar area, and this seemed busy every day of our stay. Being located where it is though, there are also countless cafes and restaurants (including Ellen’s Stardust diner) just minutes away.  When we return to NYC, this will be our go-to hotel and for my job, another consideration for events and conference hosting now that the US are less restrictive about entry requirements!

title: Superb hotel
text:
Hotel is very well located , close to Bus and Metro stations. Hopefully  their restaurant will operate all day long soon. We upgraded to a great, beautiful and comfortable suite.  Great for relaxing after spending whole day in beautiful and intense NYC❤️
Staff working here is outstanding as well❤️

title: A gem in the heart of Manhattan
text:
This was our first visit to the USA. We stayed here for 4 nights 16th-20th May as part of my wife's birthday celebration. A luxurious, elegant & classical Italian style hotel with superbly comfortable beds and beautiful rooms. The lobby is stunning and a great place just to chill out. The photos on their site really don’t do it justice! All the staff from reception, housekeeping and porters were very friendly and helpful. 

The room we were in was incredibly spacious, and after a day of sightseeing, a long soak in the large bathtub was just perfect! The beds are so comfy, we were out like a light as soon as our heads touched the pillow (and usually it takes me a while to doze off, so this was a nice little bonus for me!) Housekeeping were brilliant and the room was spotless. 

It's around a 5-minute walk to Time Square and the same to Top of The Rock so quite central to midtown attractions and near to a few subway stations. Despite its location, you won't hear any of the hustle & bustle of the city so you’ll get a great night’s sleep!  
100% recommend this hotel and we’ll definitely book when we next visit NYC. A gem in the heart of Manhattan.

title: WOW! Incredible hotel!!!
text:
Wow! AMAZING hotel, right in the heart of Manhattan, centrally located, perfect for Theatre District, Central Park and so much more. The hotel is pristinely clean, beautiful lobby, amazing staff, who quickly checked us in after our long flight. No queues, and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was stunning, beautiful outlook from the 7th floor over 7th Avenue, we had the added bonus of being able to see the stage door of the theatre that Hugh Jackman is performing in, so got to see him arrive and leave on a few of the days we were there! Our room, a king studio (Room 711), was huge by New York standards,  the bed was wonderfully comfortable, with really good quality bed linen. Separate seating area, walk in wardrobe/closet, vanity area was separate from the main bathroom, just wonderfully laid out. Room was incredibly well soundproofed, we couldn’t even hear the roadworks that were taking place outside on one of the days we were there. Housekeeping did a brilliant job each day of cleaning the room.
Two very small downsides to the room though………air conditioning unit was a little bit noisy, but we soon got used to it, and it worked incredibly well considering it was 90 degrees outside. The other disappointment was the prices for the very well stocked minibar, which seemed excessively expensive, so we avoided consuming any items from it, and just stocked up at one of the many local shops nearby.
Overall, a brilliant hotel, wonderful staff, great location…..we will definitely return again!

title: New Yorks classiest great value snd superb location Hotel
text:
Safe, comfortable and good value. A really classy old fashioned hospitable hotel with great staff.
Excellent location within walking distance to 42 st, Rockafella’s , Central park and times square. We walked to Chelsea and the Met museum plus the shops on Maddison and 5th Avenue.
So if you are looking for a really large well appointed and central to all the best of the City, at sensible prices. This is the hotel for you.
It doesnt have a restaurant, bar or spa. But it has all of that minutes away. The best Hotel ive stayed at in New York.

title: Fantastic Hotel for NYC Theater District
text: Very convenient , professional and friendly staff were fantastic. Location is perfect - center of the theater district with plenty of bars & restaurants around within short walking distance.  We will stay there again - we were impressed.

title: Beautiful, extremely quiet hotel with superb staff
text: We had a family emergency and had to book NY accommodations for six days only one day in advance of departure. Prices for all hotels were sky high but Michelangelo had high user ratings so we chose it. Our room was elegant and dead quiet. The bed was superb. I can’t say enough for the friendly, professional staff. The hotel was a real haven at a difficult time.

title: Superb Hotel
text:
Fabulous hotel! Would not hesitate to stay here again. 
From the moment we checked in we loved this hotel. Staff went above and beyond, were friendly and knowledgeable. Room was very large (especially for new york!) Very large comfy bed, seating area amd bathroom with bath. This hotel is amazing!

title: Wonderfully Convenient for Broadway Theater!
text: After numerous past stays, The Michelangelo remains our top place to stay while in NYC for theatre.  Very comfortable, clean, and centrally located for Broadway shows and good restaurants.  The staff is outstanding and treats you like family.  Can be a bit pricey, but look for Internet deals.  We always really enjoy our time at The Michelangelo, and will be returning in the future!

title: Flying visit to NYC
text:
The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and Broadway. We booked early and got a great room rate. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. Staff were helpful and polite.
We would definitely use again.

title: Convenient location, comfortable quiet rooms, good service.
text:
We recently had a 5-night stay in a Junior Suite, and here are our comments.

Our room was spacious and quiet. The king size bed was trampoline-like so quite unsuitable for light sleepers who are easily disturbed by the movements of their partners. The hotel graciously provided a complimentary cot for our stay as a result.

Our room did not have a coffee maker nor a corkscrew. The latter was brought up with a quick phone call.

Despite being emphatically told by central reservations that the Michelangelo has a swimming pool, there is none. It is quite difficult to actually get connected to the front desk when one calls the hotel. There is a small fitness center which is adequate. On three occasions, we mentioned to the front desk that there is no soap dispenser in the fitness center bathroom, but it never appeared during the whole week we were there. How is someone to wash their hands?

The free wifi is reasonably fast and works well, but it requires daily signup.

Hotel location is convenient to Broadway theaters and MOMA. Also very close to the #1 Subway line which is the main line north and south in Manhattan.

All in all, a fine stay.

title: Spacious, quiet rooms and attentive staff
text: My fourth stay at the Michelangelo Hotel was the best yet. Easy check-in, fast elevators; every time I walk by a nearby chain hotel on Broadway I thank goodness I'm not spending half my vacation waiting for an elevator like those poor tourists.

title: The staff make the hotel a great place to stayl!!!!
text: My husband booked this hotel through a package offered by British Airways. My first impresion was that of an old fashioned classy hotel. Our check in was friendly and courteous(Jospeh) and our bags were taken upstairs by Nick. The room was large, clean and airy. I had requested a kettle and that was brought to the room . We had an issue with street noise ,so I called reception and the lovely Kenrick was happy to change our room . Our second room was much larger and thankfully we had no noise issues. We later learnt it was a junior suite.We did have a slight problem closing the safe,June on reception arranged for that to be corrected in our absence. The main vibe we got from the staff ,was if there is a problem , please let us fix it. We had room only but I understand breakfast was available for a fee. The location is amazing,you couldnt have asked for anywhere better. Upon departure Theodore arranged for a cab , so we felt very spoilt. Would I return to this hotel? Absolutely, the customer service is spot on and genuine.

title: Amazing hotel and amazing location
text: Stayed for 4 nights in a junior suite. Roomy, clean, very pleasant. Great shower, really comfortable bed and hoot room set up. Perfect location with Times Square, 5th avenue and Central Park all very convenient and short walks. Really friendly and helpful staff.

title: Avoid the zoo at the big chain hotels!
text: The Michaelangelo is a lovely historic hotel in Midtown near Times Square and the theatre district. I travel to New York frequently for both pleasure and work. I love the intimate experience of the Michaelangelo especially after staying at Riu Midtown 2 weeks ago. We had a lovely large and quiet room. Check in, check out and luggage storage is so easy. No lines. I got a discounted rate since it was a lengthy stay, but their prices are in line with their competitors.

title: Great customer service
text: Really impressed by the speed and resolution of a minor issue with the team and their support. proactive and maintained great communications throughout. well done all and see you all soon. best wishes.

title: A pleasure to stay here
text: I was sad to check out of this wonderful hotel yesterday after a wonderful 5 days in NYC with my family, I booked here as I have a preference for classic/historic hotels rather than modern steel/glass sterile affairs and the Michelangelo certainly delivered, there are so many original classic features I could have walked around all day. We had a double Queen executive room which was huge with a superb level of comfort and quality, Hotel staff were all excellent and I'd like to highlight the doorman Cesar for being particularly helpful and pleasant. Lack of bar/restaurant seems to be an issue for some people but there is ample options nearby, I will return!

title: Cute boutique hotel
text:
Nice people at the door and front desk, especially Joseph.
Negatives are the restaurant downstairs only serves breakfast, and when we tried to order room service one afternoon, they said room service is only for breakfast. Totally inconvenient.
Saturday morning as my son and I were exploring, I realized we didn’t have a dinner reservation. I called concierge.  He told me he was going to be very difficult to find any reservations for Saturday night. I asked him to do his best and gave him. He never called us back with any information whatsoever. I guess that we were meeting for dinner ended up finding a reservation at a wonderful Italian restaurant about a block and a half away at 8:15 which worked perfectly but the follow-through and service on the part of the hotel was not there.
I checked out a day early because of a job conflict it was never told I had to be out of the room by 12 o’clock I was at my daughters graduation I was charged $100 late fee which they would not remove.

title: Michelangelo Hotel - the Gem of Midtown
text: This small, Italian owned hotel has so many things going for it that it is hard to list them all, but I will try. First is location, within an easy walk to Broadway theater and to MOMA and other midtown attractions. The hotel itself is elegant without being stuffy, The rooms are large, by Manhattan standards, and well-appointed, Many suites available and at competitive rates. The full breakfast offered in the lobby is excelllent. The best attribute is the warm and welcoming staff. I had not been to the hotel in over two years due to Covid (they were closed for 19 months), Everyone from the doorman to the staff at the desk greeted me like an old friend. It was wonderful to be back in NYC and particularly at this hotel. I will not stay anywhere else when visiting the city.

title: Nice and good hotel, excellent service
text:
Enjoyed our stay at the hotel (a full week, Executive Room). The rooms are spacious in an old-fashioned but very comfortable style. However, the lack of a kettle and the possibility of making coffee, as well as the lack of a refrigerator, clouded the good experience overall.
All the employees we met were very friendly. For us the location was very good.
In addition, sitting at breakfast table is very uncomfortable due to the inadequacy of the table and chairs for use in a restaurant.

title: Wonderful Nine Day Stay
text: We was very pleased with our nine day stay at the Michelangelo.  The staff was extraordinary, especially Nick and the team of servicers in the breakfast area.  The room we stayed in needs a bit of minor work.  Some of the blinds are frayed and the pulls are broken.  Some of the baseboards were damaged.  The room also needs a coffee maker (although we got one on request).  In general, these are minor issues compared to the extraordinary service and cleanliness of the hotel; as well as the value per dollar spent.  BTW, the hotel needs to promote that it has a new Peloton Bike in the itness center!  It is a nice upgrade to the facility that needs new equipment.

title: The BEST!!
text:
After my flight home was canceled I was desperate to find a place for the night. After being turned away from two hotels and checking out of a third after 30 minutes (the Manhattan - revolting experience- but that’s another story!) I found WALTER FARANDA who quickly got down to business to help me and my three teenaged daughters. At first, it appeared there was nothing available for the four of us- but after a little communication with his staff, Walter was able to accommodate us with a BEAUTIFUL room. 
The stress of having my flight canceled with no place to stay was awful. But Walter was literally my savior. And I must say that I wished I never had to leave. The room was spacious, luxurious and clean and the service was the best I’ve experienced in Manhattan. 
I am a customer for life.  Thank you Walter and all the staff at The Michelangelo!!

title: Great stay in heart of NYC
text: We just finished a great stay at the Michelangelo Hotel.  Service is amazing.  The rooms are very nice but could use a refresh.  You can't beat the location and the amenities are wonderful.  We will be back.

title: Hospitality is their motto!
text: This hotel has the largest rooms we have ever stayed at in New York! The service from the front desk, to the wait staff for breakfast, bellhops and cleaning services was off the charts! Walter at the front desk was especially knowledgeable and helpful! We will be back– this is now our go to hotel in New York. Also, very close to the theaters!

title: Disappointed in coming back to the Michelangelo
text: We have stayed at this hotel many times before and always had terrific service and very clean rooms and I remember having turn down service at night. We did not have these things at this stay and were very disappointed!!

title: New York Girls trip
text: The staff of the hotel were very helpful.  The hotel is in an excellent location and the rooms are very nice and well maintained.  The restaurant is open only for breakfast service and no room service at this time.  Went to see a few Broadway shows and hotel was very convenient but far enough from the Times Square noise. Also some very nice restaurants very close by.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Very comfortable long term stay
text: Great location, excellent, friendly and courteous staff especially Henry, Theodoro and Rajiv.  We enjoyed our very comfortable,upgraded Junior Suite accommodation facing onto the Winter Garden theatre for the 3 weeks of our stay.  We would return there in a heartbeat and the only reason why we have awarded the Michelangelo 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the limited dining and bar facilities which we hope may be available again soon. The front of house staff were so pleasant and welcoming and gave us VIP treatment.

title: Changed my room type with out informing me
text: I was there on 47th wedding anniversary weekend. I had a king room confirmed and they changed to a queen when I got there. it was a terrible room. Dark, no windows, and they didn't act concerned when I asked to be put back in the room I reserved.

title: Average
text:
Excellent situated, good spacious room. Not very friendly and service minded reception staff.
Old bathroom, needs refreshing. If you do not want more than a good bed and a perfect address this hotel is ok.

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing location
text: Just a few steps from almost everything. Great location and a beautiful place with a classic-old vibe that make it more interesting. Definately worth to stay here! The staff is super friendly and some of them speak Spanish.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: The personal service is outstanding from start to finish!   If you are attending a show at the Winter Garden Theatre, this is your spot.     Great restaurants within walking distance, as are St. Patrick's, Times Square and Rockefeller Center.

title: Terrific place to spend a week
text: We loved this hotel. It’s beautiful, immaculate, well located, appropriately priced, and staffed by really nice professionals, from the doormen, security, front desk, and restaurant crew, to the housekeepers. It was also very quiet so we weren’t bothered by street noise - not an easy feat in NYC. Our rooms were right next to the elevators yet we slept beautifully. We used the fitness center a few times, and it was clean and well stocked, including a Pelaton bike. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text:
We stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel while visiting NYC for my first time, and it was fantastic!  The King Suite room was large and comfortable.  The sitting area was well-appointed, the full and half-bath were both large and kitted out nicely, and the bed was so great I'm trying to find out what it is so I can buy one for home.

Additionally, the location was just wonderful!  It was just off of Times Square, so very centrally located and easy to get to.  There are several subway stops nearby, and we were able to get Lyft rides in under 5 minutes when we needed them.  We only ate breakfast there one day, but it was good if a bit pricey.  Service was exceptional, and the one issue we had (heater was blowing cold air) was fixed so quickly we were amazed.

I couldn't recommend this lovely hotel more!

title: Not a five star hotel, but stil decent
text:
The 3/5 score is given on the basis of this being a 5star hotel.

The hotel clerarly needs a renovation and looks and feels old. Food was good at the hotel and the rooms were comfortable enough.

Decent hotel, but if you are looking for a five star hotel feeling for a vacation, this is not that hotel imo.

title: Very Nice hotel
text: Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of match. Very Nice location close to times square and Broadway. Walking distance to Very Nice restaurants. 7 floors. We got a beautiful and charming room. Nice staff. Theodore the doorman always Nice and smiling. Very satisfied with our stay here

title: Renewing love for NYC
text: Convenient location for our destinations, theatre, restaurants, walking. Room size, comfort, elevator access, amenities (other than too deep a tub for our shower preference) all terrific. Service staff at every level superb!

title: Remarkable staff
text: Besides be the perfect location for a midtown vacation,and besides being a hotel with great rooms for the price, what makes it great was the staff. Cesar at the front was like coming home to family. And the cleaning staff made coming back to our room a treat. Everything fresh and clean. Breakfast was served by happy people who make you feel welcomed. I can’t wait for the full restaurant and bar to reopen. We can’t wait to return

title: Lovely Hotel But Has Issues
text: This hotel has been the Michelangelo since sometime in the 1980s and it unfortunately shows. While the architecture is charming late 1920s and the furniture is really lovely, the old carpets, the ancient phones, the exceedingly tired old bathroom fixtures (which barely work anymore) show how very badly this place needs a complete renovation. Add to that the lack of any room service paired with a defunct bar, and you really don't have a 4-star experience. As if this weren't enough the prices for the breakfast are just ridiculous. Breakfast for the two of us was $80 (including tip)! And we left still hungry because the portions are quite miniature. The one outstanding feature at this property is the friendly staff. Other than that, I just don't see why people stay here.

title: cozy little place in NYC
text: This hotel is a find! Small, clean, feels luxurious. Prices are reasonable for nice sized, clean room. Staff was kind and helpful from the first step in o the lobby. Great location! If I had to sight a small bump, it would be the price of the very nice breakfast available in the lobby. Very good, just pricey even for NY. But so convenient! I will stay there again and I hope again and again!

title: Nice Hotel and great location
text: This is our 2nd stay here (the last one about 5 years ago) and the rooms have been updated since then and are really nice.  The rooms are still very large by NYC standards and the water pressure in the shower was also very good by hotel standards.  Although we had no view out our window, this was a blessing because we had absolutely zero street noise and on top of it, the hallways (and other guests) were absolutely quiet so we got some of the best nights of sleep in a long time.  The doorman, concierge and front desk staff were all very pleasant.   Great stay for the price and will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

title: Hôtel très confortable au coeur du quartier de Times Square
text:
L'emplacement est parfait (angle 51e rue et 7e avenue), l'hôtel a une décoration à la fois rétro et chic. Le confort dans les chambre est très bon (grand lit très confortable) avec une superficie inégalée à ce prix à Times Square. La propreté est impeccable avec un service de chambre rigoureux.
Pour résumer, je recommande vivement cet hôtel à Times Square pour son emplacement idéal et ses prix très compétitifs pour de telles prestations.

title: A superb St Patrick's week in New York
text:
We had a fabulous stay at Michelangelo Hotel for St Patrick's week.Very friendly and attentive staff.
Hotel located on 7th Avenue 51st street easy acces to to Times Square and Central Park, with a wide and varied selection of bars and resteraunts. 
We can highly reccomend this fabulous hotel, our junior suite was on the 6th floor, very spacious and comfortable with no outside noises to disrupt our comfort.

title: Perfect Stay Near Theatres
text: Room 718 provided perfect accommodations for my, my wife, and grandson from March 6 through March 11.  The room overlooked 7th Avenue, was spacious offering two king sized beds, a bathroom with two mirrored counter areas, plenty of ports to charge phones, and even a walk-in closet.  The beds were as comfortable as ours at home.  All staff were pleasant, helpful, and solicitous.  Of course, the location situated us in walking distances from theatres.   The bar has not reopened and the restaurant served only breakfast; however, those did not pose problems for us.  Also, booking on black Friday, the hotel gave us excellent rates.  I would not hesitate to book at The Michelangelo on our next  trip to NYC.

title: Wish we had found this hotel years ago!
text:
From arrival to departure, the Michelangelo did not disappoint.  It is very near Times Square but not caught in the commotion of it.  We never heard any street noise, even though we faced 7th Avenue.   Perfect for location for the theaters.

The building is beautiful; marble and chandeliers in the lobby.  The entire hotel seems to have gone through a quality restoration.  We were upgraded to a junior suite!  Immaculate and comfortable with a marble bathroom, huge bathtub and slippers and robes.

Their number one asset, though, is their friendly, professional staff. Every person we saw greeted us as though we were guests in their home, each and every time we saw them..  Any request was immediately filled.  We are late sleepers and not once did a maid knock on our door for room servicing, yet every day our room cleaned when we returned.

We cannot wait to return.

title: Sliten luksus
text: Hotellet ligger perfekt til midt i Theater District, kort vei til Times Square og det meste. Fine marmorgulv og fine, men litt slitne rom. Vi bodde en uke på suite med eget soverom. Rommet var fint og hadde to bad. Men til å kalle seg 5-stjerners hotell er det fortsatt et stykke å gå. Hotellet har ingen restaurant, ingen room service eller minibar på rommet. Prøvde å få kjøpt en flaske vann i resepsjonen til å ha på rommet, men fikk beskjed om å gå på butikk og kjøpe den selv. Vi følte at hotellet var litt nedgradert post Covid.

title: Wonderful staff, perfect location!
text: Enjoyed my two night stay at this lovely hotel. The staff are helpful and truly love working here from what I can tell. Everything you read about Henry is true! He's a sweetheart! The staff at the front desk are delightful as well. Breakfast was very good and convenient. Stayed in Room 719 which is on a corner, huge and very clean! The king size beds are extremely comfortable. You can catch Hugh Jackman coming out of the stage door and into his car directly across the street every night. The location is perfect and the room is very quiet. There are a lot of good places to eat nearby. Central Park is just a short walk north and the subway entrance is just around the corner. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: Happy to recommend this hotel. Could maybe do with a freshen up, but overall very pleased. No kettle or coffee machine in the room, maybe could have asked for one, but would have expected on to be there anyway. Also the fridge mini bar was locked so could not use that. All else good, generous room sizes  for NY I think, well at the price we paid.

title: Great deal/great hotel
text: Between reading mediocre reviews and eyeing the amazing deal on rooms at The Michelangelo, I decided to take a chance and stay here.  We were delighted with our decision and with our stay.  Our room was spotless, spacious, extremely comfortable and quiet.  We understood the covid protocol in place (limited food) and were quite happy getting coffee at Gregory's around the corner and dining elsewhere for food, which had always been our plan.  The staff was extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful.  The hotel location is great, parking in the garage next door couldn't have been easier, and overall we had a 10 out of 10 visit to New York City.

title: Lost its luster
text: Rooms are in dire need of updating.  Nightstand table was chipped all over.  Toilet would not flush unless I held the handle for a minute.  Shampoo and bath amenities were the worst I've seen in a long time.  TV was tiny.  The one saving grace is that the rooms are large by NYC standards.  Will stay elsewhere next time.

title: Definitely going back!
text: Spacious, beautifully appointed common areas and bedrooms; comfortable bedding, attentive service.  Perfectly suited in midtown for all walking points.  Walked 20+ miles during 2+ day visit, heading in all directions. Heads up: no complimentary coffee in rooms or lobby.  May purchase coffee in restaurant; other more economical options outside and within steps of the hotel.

title: Excellent stay
text: We stayed in a 2 king bed room this week. I'm a light sleeper and I was concerned about possible noise outside of the room. The hotel was absolutely quiet and peaceful.  You cannot beat the location if you are visiting to see a Broadway show. The beds were remarkably comfortable. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be staying here again when we return.

title: Not impressed
text:
No bar or restaurant open only for breakfast no mini bar no coffee tea making facilities in room although they did offer us a kettle but  I would have to shop for tea coffee sugar milk and buy my own cups  they said it’s because of covid .well I did pop into other hotels whilst on our 5 day visit and all there facilities were open.
A Warning they take your bank card when checking in and take £350 straight out of your account some of this is for room breakages some for local tax ?
Because of lack of facilities they should of given us some money back not added more 
They said we’re get half back on our card when checking out we’re still waiting for it to appear back into our account.
The rooms our big and bed very comfortable and kept very clean 
The hotel is in an excellent location just a few  minutes walk from Times Square and  Broadway only 10 from Central Park Rockefeller and other attractions.

title: Everything was perfect
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in February. 

The staff were brilliant from start to finish and everything you walked in reception you were met with a friendly face.

A special mention for Henry as well.

The rooms were extremely large for a city hotel and that is a major plus.

Position is great. Set on a quiet road but only two blocks from Times Square.

So many restaraunts close by!

5 stars from me!

title: Not worth the money for what you get
text: Online it said there was a bar and restaurant. We get here and they only have breakfast option in morning. No bar or restaurant open due to covid. Room is beautiful and bed is comfy. It’s located near Times Square. Those are the positives. minibar option in room is locked due to “covid”. Asked if they had vending machine so we could get cokes. No vending machines because of “covid”. We have to walk a few blocks to get snacks or drinks. No room service due to covid. I paid waaaayyyy too much money for just a pretty room. I am very disappointed. So many other hotels nearby that would have cost much less with the options we wanted.  Lesson is to always call the hotel BEFORE YOU BOOK to confirm details.

title: Forget the Air B&B, Just Stay Here
text: The Michelangelo Hotel sits at the corner of 51st and 7th.  It is a classy, old European style hotel that provides lovely rooms and excellent service.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite that had two baths (one full and one half) with a soaking tub and a bidet.  The room was large, very comfortable, super mattress and comfy chairs and couches.  Even though the hotel looks old it is super clean and very well taken care of.  The old look comes from a lot of red velvet and gold trimmings.  The lobby is elegant with a huge flower display and lobby restaurant.  The staff us very friendly and the morning breakfast is not to be missed.  A big plus is a modern samovar that makes any type of coffee you desire.  This is a small hotel by New York standards which, when taking into account its great location, is a true rarity.  Bear in mind we were there in February and the city is hardly even half full.  That means that the hotel was quiet, cabs were plentiful and the shows and restaurants were very easy to get into.  New York is very diligent in keeping Covid down, so come spring and summer and the city fills up, you won't be able to get near this hotel,  I strongly suggest you book now if you think your going to the city.  Another big plus, as mentioned in previous reviews, The Music Man is right across the street.  If you want to have a wonderful time you will remember the rest of your life, see this show.

title: Midweek Escape to New York City
text: After taking time to review my short list of hotels in the midtown/theater district, I canceled an earlier reservation at another hotel chain and reserved a Winter Special room at the Michelangelo. This was based on the hotel’s website, which included photos and an enticing video. Upon arrival, the floor staff were courteous and went out of their way to welcome my husband and myself. The front desk agent, however, was a different story and this held true for check in and check out. It was the same agent. Minimum eye contact, answered any questions we had but not especially welcoming. It was a slow period, so it wasn’t as though we were “holding up the line”. I asked if he had a “nice room waiting for us” and his response, “always nothing but the best!” It wasn’t the best. The windows along the 3rd-floor hallway leading to our room looked out on an attached construction site with “Hard Hat Area” and “no trespassing” signs taped to the hallway side of the windows, facing passing hotel guests. Now, why would we consider trespassing? Inside our room, wine glasses, a fridge and courtesy bar were nicely displayed but the fridge was unplugged and the courtesy bar empty. Probably the best part of our stay was a wonderful breakfast In the Lobby restaurant lobby (separate charge). Attentive and courteous service and beautifully prepared dishes from an extensive menu with impeccable and attentive service. We are seasoned travelers and understand the restrictions this pandemic requires, but we did feel that things inside the hotel felt more lackluster than necessary. This was our first getaway in 2 years and we love all that NYC has to offer. Our hotel stay took just a bit of the rosy glow  off our trip!

title: Don't stay here
text:
I would give this hotel zero stars if I could. 
This hotel does not know what customer service is. 
I have telephoned this hotel on 10 separate occasions. Only once has someone answered. 
I have emailed the hotel 5 times. No one has responded to my emails. 
On 20th January I booked this hotel for my holiday in middle of February. On my 4th call to the hotel I discovered the restaurant is only open for breakfast, the bar is closed and no room service is available. Information like this should be displayed on the website. There are plenty of other hotels in NYC with open restaurants and bars. 
Due to the lack of response to my emails (and phone calls) I cancelled my reservation on 25th January. The hotel have not confirmed my reservation is cancelled and reading previous reviews of the hotel, I am now extremely concerned they will charge my credit card despite the fact I have cancelled within their terms and conditions. 
Don't cause yourself the stress this hotel has caused me. 
All I am asking for is an acknowledgement to one of my emails. Is that too much to expect Michelangelo?

title: GOING TO THE MUSIC MAN--THIS IS ABSOLUTELY THE CLOSEST HOTEL
text: I had the great pleasure of returning to the Michelango Hotel this past Saturday (Jan. 22).  It has been more than 2 years since I have been to the Hotel and to New York City.  The purpose of the trip was simple--my wife and I wanted to see The Music Man at the Winter Garden Theater.  What you need to know is that the Winter Garden is immediately across 7th Av. from the Michelangelo.  You definitely cannot get closer.  I have been staying at the Michelangelo for almost 10 years.  It is a wonderful hotel with kind and attentive staff at all levels.  The rooms are clean and roomy.  It was so good to be back.  Safety procedures for COVID remain in effect and that is good.  Your next trip to NY may begin at an all brand new LGA airport.  What a great start.  Do be sure to enjoy the Michelangelo; it is a great place.  And, when you go to see The Music Man, as you must, be sure to exit to the left as you are facing the stage after the show is over and you will see you home away from home.  You can be tucked in bed within about 10 minutes.  Enjoy.  jim

title: The Michelangelo hotel 5 stars!
text: Best hotel, near theaters, restaurants, Time square, Radio City music Hall, and 30 rock, Walk to everything! Safe, The staff is amazing, The hotel is clean and the rooms were large enough for three, girls trip. The only thing I was missing was coffee in the room in the morning. The restaurant is open for coffee and breakfast, but that’s it.

title: Excellent stay in NYC!
text: We very much enjoyed our three night stay at The Michelangelo Hotel in NYC over the MLK weekend. The staff was amazing, the room was spotless and well cared for, the beds and sheets were absolutely amazing - we even looked to see the brand name! We would definitely stay here again - can't wait!

title: Does Not Honor Advertised Flexible Cancellation policy
text: I made a reservation at the Michaelangelo Hotel for January 8.   I made this reservation on 11/7.  The flexible cancellation policy advertised a 24 hour cancellation no charge.  On 11/18, I had to cancel my reservation.  I received a Cancellation Notice via email immediately.  I thought all was well until I saw a pending charge on my card for the reservation  early January. I emailed and called, emailed and called. No responses to emails, and calls are hanged up on.  After many call attempts and emails with no response, I finally saw the charge removed.  Finally!!   But now today, January 15, I see another pending charge for $60.05?  For what???!!!  I don't know what is wrong with this hotel, but if you need to cancel, you're going to have a difficult time, and why would you want to stay in a hotel anyway, with no customer service, getting hung up if you need to call, or no responses to email.  I would not recommend a stay at this hotel.  Something is very wrong here.  I realize in this day of covid, staffing is short but if they have the time to charge my card, they should have the time to cancel mistaken charges.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
We stayed here for a week over New year and loved everything about the hotel.

The location is great, close to a few subway stations, within walking distance to lots of places, close to shops, bars, restaurants. I'd definately recommend it.

The guys on the door and reception friendly abs helpful.

The room was huge with really comfy bed, seating area, dressing room and bathroom with a big bath.

title: Wonderful location
text:
The placement relative to Broadway could not be better.  You are close without being overwhelmed by the lights and noise of Times Square.  We were right across the street from Winter Garden for Music Man.  

The rooms are larger by NYC standards.  They could be a tad cleaner.  The carpet needed attention.  The staff is minimal...as well as the amenities.  But it is understandable with all the restaurants in the immediate area.  The pricing was reasonable.

We will definitely stay there again.

title: Quiet hotel in NYC midtown
text: I stayed at this hotel during Christmas 2021. My room was a very spacious king studio with a very nice bathroom, a huge bed and plenty of cupboard space. Even though it was right next to 7th avenue it was actually quite quiet. The hotel itself was very clean and nice and the staff very helpful. They could maybe do a light renovation and paint some walls and ceilings but this is minor stuff. All in all I had a great stay and wouldn’t hesitate to book here again.

title: Almost a 5-Star hotel, but not quite
text: The entrance and hallways were beautiful. We stayed during Christmas so it was decorated very lovely. The inside of the room was very nice as well except for the cleanliness of the bathroom. There was a vent in the bathroom that looks like it hasn’t been cleaned in years…full of dust hanging from it clearly visible to a housekeeper. In addition, there was some mole on the shower tiles (not a lot, but enough to notice) along with mole under the rim of the sink. This is something that could have been easily fixed with bleach. To have such a beautiful hotel with a bathroom that is sub-par for cleanliness is a shame. The room was very clean so no complaints there. You should also know that the hotel rooms do not have a refrigerator or coffee maker in them for those that may want to keep your water cold or enjoy a cup of coffee before you leave your room. The hotel is in a great location and in walking distance of Broadway, Rockefeller, and much more.

title: Not as advertised
text: Really was looking forward to the stay, but at checkout once added all the fees way more than what was quoted.  The rooms were dark, the refrigerator didn't work, sink leaked, no amenities .. limited breakfast available for a very high price -6.00 for a cup of normal coffee.  Very disappointed.

title: Excellent experience and staff
text: I took my elderly parents to NYC for a broadway show and perhaps the best part of the experience was the care and service provided by the staff. The suite was well appointed, roomy and clean. The location was wonderful and we enjoyed ourselves.

title: Still great.
text:
We stayed in the Michelangelo many years ago and remembered it fondly so we rebooked for a Christmas outing with our kids.  Our family of 4 had PLENTY of room, and the staff were incredibly gracious and hospitable.  We used to have an old Lexus LX.  This hotel reminded our teens of that car. While it may show a bit of age, it is a quality product that was built to last.  Here are my favorite things:

The staff is helpful and friendly
The rooms and bathrooms are clean, fresh, and huge
The location is fabulous if you plan to go to a broadway show.
Offers nearby parking (a minute walk away) for a reasonable price), 

Here is what is less than perfect:
The lobby could use a refresh
The coffee is overpriced in the lobby ($6 I think for a very small very basic cup) with no oat milk and there is not coffee in the room - but there are PLENTY of coffee places within a one minute walk.

We would definitely stay here again.  THANKS for a great weekend.

title: No customer service
text:
This hotel is supposed to be a very nice hotel. That said, my experience has been less than good . We had reservations for three rooms for  December 24-27 and because of the current situation in New York City decided to cancel. Oddly, there is no way to cancel online without actually talking to a person. I tried multiple times  to call their reservations line, and it immediately hangs up. There is no way to reach a person. No one answers at the front desk. So I sent an email on 12/21 to the customer service reservations email as I was directed from an email instructing them to cancel my three reservations. No reply. I assumed it was taken care of and I had no other way to contact them. Yesterday I was charged the entire amount for three reservations despite the fact that we aren’t there and have tried multiple times to cancel. What am I supposed to do? A hotel of this caliber should have some level of customer service though I fully understand the trying times that are going on. 

I have now left a message with the manager’s voicemail explaining the situation. I will contest with a credit card, which I assume won’t be a problem. But I shouldn’t have to go through all this at a five-star hotel in Midtown New York.

title: Good customer service
text: We were unable to stay here unfortunately, but I wanted to do a review of the good customer service I received when I had to cancel. Both employers I spoke with were kind and professional. I imagine their jobs are very challenging these days, so I was very impressed. We will rebook!

title: A Treat
text:
What a lovely hotel. Absolutely beautiful and the service was superlative. Upgraded without request!
Large corner room with views of street but utterly noiseless. 
Room had every amenity.
Loved the tinking chimes of the chandelier in the rlevators and “ding” of the elevator bell. Totslly historic.
As we left early in the morning they were diligently cleaning the banquettes-which already looked pristine.
Best doormen/bellman i have ever met.
Wish we couldve stayed longer. Hope to be back

title: Great Location - perfect for our stay
text: Hotel was great.  Room was spacious,  location perfect and staff was excellent.  Wasn't noisy or bright, and there was plenty of space for our family of four.   Only complaint could be that it was a little dated, but really did the trick for our 2 day stay to see the Rockettes at Radio City and enjoy a couple of days in the city.

title: Still a reliable first-class property
text: For several decades I have been putting up my family from Ohio at the Michelangelo, and in early December they spent three nights there as a base to see Christmas in the big city. The place really hasn't changed over the years, but nothing in the public areas and rooms are worn, frayed, or tacky. The doormen and front desk staff were very friendly and attentive--Walter at the front desk was especially helpful. The lack of room service and in-house restaurant was a problem, but practically all of the hotels in mid-town lack these amenities due to COVID. My only suggestion would be that the hotel should provide guests with a listing of surrounding restaurants and delis that either deliver food or have take-away menus.

title: Little Gem in a perfect location
text: Absolutely loved this hotel, our new favorite in the city.  So many great little things about the place add up to a true oasis right in midtown.  Excellent service with great doormen and front desk staff.  Thanks to Joseph, Teodoro, Cesar, Edwin and the entire staff.. No food service yet, but coffee right across the street along with tons of restaurants.  Location is great, right at the edge of Times Square on 51st & 7th, so much calmer than the 40's and very walkable!  Hell's Kitchen, Central Park, Columbus Circle, The Rock, MOMA, Madison & 5th Avenue all within walking distance.  I think we only took a cab twice and we never had to use the subway!   Rooms are huge and quiet and the bed is really comfortable.  We faced Seventh Avenue and rarely heard  noise (visited right before Thanksgiving).  The elevators were the best.  The place is full of marble and the elevators have crystal chandeliers in them!  But they are great because you never wait more than a few seconds for them.  Only 8 floors and 3 elevators, such a treat in New York!  There are plenty of hipper, cool hotels in the area with postage stamp rooms and paper thin walls  and horrible elevator waits if you like that sort of thing, but give me the Michelangelo any day.  PS:  Don't forget to tip the excellent staff!

title: Location, Space, and Service- you can have it all!
text:
Outstanding rooms, location, and service-

Walter always was calling us by name by the second day and the entire staff made us feel like we were regulars.

Easy walks to popular destinations as it’s between Central Park and Times Square-

Rooms are large- ours had a foyer and a living room- but even my brother’s room, which was more the standard, was roomy and very nice.

Walter gave us more info on the display case and history on the hotel- including that it was used in “The Graduate” and of - among other things- Sinatra singing downstairs.

We’re not in NYC often, but whenever we come back, this will be the first place we’ll check for availability.

For us, value was outstanding (if not unbelievable) as we got a multi-day “reopening” special discount - so I can’t say much about what normal value might be- but booking directly with the hotel appears to be the way to go if controlling costs.

We loved it!

title: A wonderful hotel reopening after the pandemic
text: We have stayed here before and loved it, so I was happy to see it was reopening after the pandemic (or in a different phase of the pandemic. I give it 4 stars primarily because it is not yet offering all amenities, but the price to stay is also lower than usual to compensate for the loss of services. Rooms are probably twice the size of a typical hotel room in NYC. Location is outstanding, very close to Time Square but not in the middle of it, close to subway stations and a few blocks from Central Park. Rooms are incredibly quiet given the location, and I slept like a baby. I have to mention Henry, the bellman, for his positive and helpful service. Other employees were also courteous and helpful. I look forward to staying again.

title: A GEM in the City
text: We were pleasantly surprised by this boutique hotel in Midtown. What a gem . . . a big shout out to Walter at the front desk; Teodoro at the entrance; and Henry with bell services. They were so helpful and pleasant. Will definitely be back!

title: Way below what it used to be. Find better.
text:
The Michelangelo used to be a classic despite its aging feeling. They claim to have reopened but let’s be clear: they haven’t really. They claim 4 stars but do NOT provide the basic services required by this rating. 

Among the most annoying things is the total absence of food service, no breakfast, not even a coffee maker in rooms!!!  Even Motel 6 has coffee makers. No free water in the rooms either. The lounge/bar area is closed. So basically you get a room. Period. 

Do they tell you all this when you book? Of course not. 

Do you think that management cares? Well… I expressed my disappointment at the front desk and by email. Or course no response. 

Over the past two months I went to the Dominik, the Lotte and the Four Seasons in NY. I appreciate that reopening after covid isn’t easy and not all hotels are fully back. But clearly some make more efforts and succeed at delivering a nice experience.  The Michelangelo does not. 

We have the choice of hotels in NY. I won’t return.

title: A gem!
text: I had a great time here.  I had two different rooms having moved to one with two beds for the last night so that my friend could stay with me in the city, and both rooms were huge for NY standards and it was a great luxury to have a bathtub, which is unheard of in NY now.  I slept well in both rooms and was surprised how quiet it was.  The staff are very committed to you having a good stay.  They were so nice.  In terms of location, the hotel is a very short easy walk to Central Park and right on 6th Ave, so it is quite convenient.  Special thank you to Joseph and Henry - you guys are the BEST.

title: Henry is the best!
text: We always stay at the Michelangelo when we go to NYC. The location is great for proximity to Broadway & Central Park South. The rooms are dated but that’s not a big deal because the staff & service make up for it. Especially Henry, one of the door persons, is just wonderful. He’s worked at the hotel for 33 years! He loves his job & you can tell. We look forward to seeing him each time we stay. His joy is contagious. He’s helpful, welcoming & genuinely cares about the guests. There are countless hotel options nearby but we always stay here because seeing Henry makes our stay so pleasant!

title: Old fashioned or old and dusty?
text:
There are pros and cons of this place but I don’t plan on coming back. 

Pros: 1) room was on the large size for NY standard 2) the staffs were nice 3) it’s in Times Square. 

Cons: 1) It was not clean. The shower had precious guests hair on them. Our room wasn’t vacuumed and collected other guests body hair on the cotton slippers offered by the hotel. 

2) The hotel is in need of serious renovation. Everything seems old, broken and outdated. Minor things were broken like shower handle holders or tub grouts or chipped mirror. It is not a big inconvenience but not a great experience. 

Things were old and dusty. In the lobby and other public areas, decorations collected dust and doesn’t seem to be maintained well.

title: Cena en michelangelo
text: Hemos cenado hoy 26/1/2021 rico,abundante y muy sabrozo,excepcionalmente,muy bien atendidos,100 % recomendable,gracias por la atención de Edison y su personal, el lugar  es muy ameno y se escucha linda musica ,,esperamos poder volver a visitar El Calafate!!!

title: Fab hotel in fab location
text:
Stayed at the Michelangelo for my husband’s 60th. They were kind enough to upgrade us on arrival to a wonderful suite which was a real treat.
The location doesn’t get any better than this, the rooms were lovely and quiet yet a stone’s from everything. Tour bus stop was directly on the corner and you really could walk everywhere from here.
A great stay thank you and we will be back. 😀

title: Excellent location
text:
i regularly stay at the Michelangelo primarily because it has a great location.  The rooms are always clean and comfortable.  This time I visited with friends so we had two suites which were close by.  It was their first experience at the hotel and they were very pleased.

The manager is always very helpful and accommodating.  The housekeeping and front door staff are very friendly.  They seemed to be missing some of the regulars from the front desk who were fab.

The air cons are noisy but I usually switch them off so this doesn't bother me too much.  The only thing missing is a kettle / tea&coffee staton which would be a welcomed addition to the rooms.

title: Trip for fun
text: My family has stayed at The Michelangelo in years past and have always been a big fan. The rooms are a great size and very comfortable! Doorman Henry always remembers us and makes us feel so welcome and makes sure we are taken care of which is so appreciated! The location was unbeatable we were able to walk to our broadway shows and then the next day walk to Bergdorfs and central park. Will be back soon!

title: Guaranteed Excellent Stay
text: This hotel is stunning! Of course it meets all expectations of a 5 star hotel, including very clean, comfortable and friendly staff, but its a a whole amazing experience being there. And the restaurant is delicious. Great location too. I highly recommend staying here whenever in New York!

title: Excellent Hotel and Experience
text: My wife and I stayed here on a recent vacation and very much enjoyed the hotel. All of the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. We met an employee in the lobby named Chris, he was very helpful with making local recommendations for our free time. We had a beautiful exterior room and enjoyed the central location. I highly recommend!

title: Nice quite hotel...love it!
text:
My wife and I were on a business / get away weekend....

Wonderful stay...great staff!...step out to the hustle and bustle.but you can always dive back into you beautiful ...quite ....wonderful hotel.

And I can’t say it enough....very nice staff.

title: Food was delicious and beautiful hotel
text: My room was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The star of the hotel is the restaurant near the lobby. The pizza and mortadella sandwich were some of the best in the city. Will absolutely be dining there again on my next trip

title: Beautiful Hotel in the heart of New York
text: Visited the Michelangelo Hotel bar in the lobby level with family and what a treat it was! From the moment we stepped in, we were greeted with warm , genuine smiles from the staff. We had a round of refreshing cocktails and delicious homemade pizzas. We had a fantastic time and cannot wait to get together again and return! It's a hidden gem in the city that is worth visiting!

title: Enchanting stay in old New York
text: Super friendly staff, beautiful decor and very clean rooms. We went there to visit my sister down the street and were very impressed with the hotels attention to detail, staff going the extra mile to suit our needs, extra towels, blankets, toothbrushes, etc. Nice views too.

title: Truly Delightful
text: The staff are warm and welcoming from the bell persons to the Front Desk and bar staff. If you’re looking for an amazing stay in New York City the Michaelangelo is a beautiful place to vacation and enjoy the sights in the city. The property is stunning especially the marbling and fixtures in the bathrooms.  Truly a phenomenal experience staying at the Michaelangelo.

title: Michelangelo Hotel New York
text: I recently went to the Michelangelo Hotel in New York. Spent time in the lounge having drinks with friends and catching up!! We had a great time, excellent service. I would definitely recommend the Michelangelo to my friends!!

title: Fantastic hotel in NYC, best location!
text:
I love The Michelangelo Hotel in New York City, friendly service and classy decor. The lobby staff and Chris, the Asst. Director of Operations, were very welcoming with me and my family. We had an amazing time in the city and at The Michelangelo. 

It is in a great location and near of Time Square and Central Park. 

We will definitely stay again in The Michelangelo Hotel every time we visit New York City. 

100% recommended to everyone.

title: Amazing hotel with great service
text:
I just wanted to say that the Michelangelo Hotel was amazing. I went Memorial Day week in May 2019. I had drinks at the lobby bar and had a fanatic experience. All the employees were friendly and very knowledgeable. The front desk as well as the managers were amazing and very helpful. Great place to stay great staff. 

Thank you for a great stay

title: very pleased, will return and def recommend!
text: big traveler for work and was very satisfied with my experience at the michaelangelo.  from checkin to checkout, very welcome feeling from the staff and comfortable/clean room. would def recommend, will be coming back and big thanks to the staff for making this is productive, comfortable, and enjoyable trip.

title: Visit
text: I had drinks at the bar and Gerald was great! Lounge was beautiful I would def come back and stay at the hotel the workers were wonderful and very polite. I definitely recommend this hotel and it’s spotless

title: Amazing hotel!
text: I have stayed in several different hotels in NYC and the Michelangelo Hotel is by far the nicest!  The staff was amazing.  It was a very relaxing comforting environment.  They always made you feel welcome every time you walked through the door.

title: This place is a disaster at every level.
text: From the manipulative, conniving sales staff to the impotent management, this place was a comedy of errors that did everything in their power to ruin our wedding weekend. We arrived to security asleep in the lobby and our floor reeking of marijuana. Our suite had stained carpeting and was extremely dark. The next day, construction noise at 7 AM (that we were assured was not taking place) forced our guests to switch rooms. Several other guests complained about it, too. Mice (plural) ran through the bar right in front of us. Another guest had to be moved for a water leak. They gave a package addressed to me to another guest that I had to chase for two days. The security guards continued to snooze in the lobby and the management continued to do nothing about the issues. The Director of Operations called me at one point after we complained at the front desk about the building up of issues. She left me her "direct line" - when I called it back, it went to the voicemail of a man named Vikram. That was endemic of the level of professionalism at this property. The bartender on our first night was a very pleasant woman. The next two nights it was an absolutely unhinged maniac who berated my guests and yelled at them that their presence in his half-empty bar was not as important as his three small tables of theater guests. He then proceeded to yell all kinds of things including that he was union and there's nothing anyone could do to him. This happened in full view of the front desk staff, who said he would report it to management yet the next day nothing was done. When we returned to our room after our marriage, the temperature was an unbearable 83F and we had not touched the thermostat. Upon checkout, we waited to speak to the manager and it was a complete waste of time with him stalling and claiming he knew nothing and had to make investigations. Over a week later, nothing he said would be followed up on has been done. No one has contacted us. We received no bar credit (which we were supposed to receive after the mice ran through) or credit for any of the hassles. Days later I had a guest calling to say they'd been charged for parking when they had no vehicle. At every opportunity to make something better, these people decided to make it worse. There isn't one employee we encountered who had either the ability or the willingness to change the course of this nightmare. Choosing this hotel for our wedding group was a colossal mistake and I am ashamed that I had my family and friends book there. At the last minute we decided to stay two extra days in the city but we left and went to another hotel so the nightmare would end. The second we walked in the door of that property, they spotted that we'd just had a wedding and upgraded us, gave us a bottle of wine and bar credits and the contrast in service and professionalism was astounding. Hotel Michelangelo was just a disaster on every level.

title: First Time in NewYork
text:
The location  is as good as it gets. Everything a first time visitor to New York city wants to see is either in walking distance or is easily accessible by the subway. Kendrick, Gerard and Henry made our stay both comfortable and memorable! The service was very personal and we love that. Thank you The Michelangelo Hotel for a terrific first visit to NYC!!!
The only thing not perfect was that the room needed a bit of updating,  including  the drafty windows and window coverings. But I would come back.

title: Comfortable and good location. Service could be better
text:
Location excellent 
Rooms very comfortable and ours was very quite
Luxurious in spite of being a bit dated
Door men unfortunately were rude and not helpful so we’re bell boys.  Almost lost our flight because of one of them, which unfortunately ruined the whole stay for us.

title: Ideale ligging
text:
Dit hotel ligt in Manhattan. Times Square en Broadway liggen op een paar honderd meter van dit hotel. 
De kamers zijn ruim en worden goed onderhouden.
Ontbijt : er is voldoende keuze. Wordt u aan tafel gebracht. Koffie, fruitsap à volonté.
Diverse metrolijnen in de onmiddellijke omgeving. 
Dit hotel kan je onderbrengen in de duurdere middenklasse.

title: Beetlejuice Vacation
text: The hotel was very nice and a great location. Everything we wanted to visit in NYC was less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel.  Our room even had a view of the Stage Door for Beetlejuice The Musical.

title: Fantastic Lounge/Lobby Bar.  Great Food
text: My wife and I ate there for our anniversary before a Broadway Matinee. This is a  beautiful hotel with an excellent Lounge/Lobby Bar.  The food was fantastic, cooked fresh and ,in a nice surprise, delivered to the table by Chef Mondaca.  The wait staff was very attentive and a pleasure always making sure we were taken care of.  Even if you do not stay at the hotel, drop in for some delicious and beautifully prepared food before your Broadway show.  It is right by the Theater District.

title: Home away from home!
text: No visit to New York City is complete without a stop at The Michelangelo. From the warm and welcoming front office team to the always clean and quiet rooms. The Michelangelo has it all, including exceptionally delicious Italian cuisine and wine. Even if you can't stay at the hotel, stop by and enjoy the taste of true Italian hospitality in the heart of New York City

title: Unmatchable Luxury
text: The Michaelangelo is like taking a step into the past when hotels we're all about luxury and class. A beautiful hotel with an amazing staff, especially Marco, who made my visit memorable. Highly recommend it

title: Nice hotel in a good area
text:
A nice clean hotel on a good place in NY!
Nice to stay for a visit! Everything is reachable by feet!
Only one minus: don’t drink anything on the bar!
6 dollar for an espresso is not normal!!!! In italy you would be killed!

title: a favorite in NYC
text: Our many experiences staying at the Michelangelo continue to be top notch.  From the friendly staff to the size of the hotel rooms to the overall experience, this is one of our favorite places to stay in NYC!

title: מלון מצויין בסיגנון המאה הקודמת
text: המלון ממוקם מאוד אטרקטיבי ומאפשר גישה נוחה לכל האתרים במנהטן.החדר היה מאוד מרווח , נקי ונוח, השרות מהיר ואדיב, כולל ארוחת בוקר, כולל שימוש בטלפון בלי הגבלה (גם לשיחות בינלאומיות) וכל זאת במחיר הגיוני. נחזור אליו בשמחה.

title: Amazing!
text: I couldn’t have been happier! My room was beautiful. The lobby second floor was a great place to relax. Great location. Kind and helpful staff. Prices worth every penny. I can’t wait to go back for my next trip!

title: Outsanding
text:
Great staff, all very nice and attentive. 
Amenities are a bit expensive
Love the soap.
The location is perfect to just about everything

Would like room available sooner. 
The hotel is very clean and welcoming.

title: It's ok. Great location but with some drawbacks.
text:
Firstly, the positives:
- Great location 
- Comfortable bed 
- Spacious room

Negatives:
- Noisy airconditioner.  
- Light from the Times Square signs outside bled past the curtains, so the room wasn't dark.  
- The whole hotel is a bit dated. Some of the fittings have slightly been worn down. It needs a bit of love.
- No coffee facilities in the room.
- Deliberately deceptive "residency fee" which is not included in the initial quoted price per night on Hotwire when hotels are compared on price. It's only visible right at the end before you pay. After tax, this comes to almost $50 per night extra on top of the room fee. I say it is deliberately deceptive, because the only reason they don't include it in the room fee is so that they can rank higher/cheaper on listings such as Hotwire while still making a larger profit when it comes to the final fee you have to pay. I challenge the hotel to reply and come up with a reason for not including this in the room rate that doesn't include "some other hotels also do this too". They say it covers things like wifi even though their website says wifi is complimentary. If this fee was optional, I would understand, but it's not. Note that this practice is illegal in many other countries. Travel rating organisations such as the AAA actually deduct rating points from hotels who do this because of the deception.  

Summary:
Stay at this hotel if the location is of utmost importance. Everythings else is so-so.

title: Mitten in New York
text: Das Hotel liegt in der Nähe vom Times Square und damit super für Theatergänger und auch sonst mitten im Geschehen. Vom Stil her ist es in typisches amerikanisches Luxushotel, wie sie halt so waren, aber auch etwas in die Jahre gekommen. Das Zimmer war für New Yorker Verhältnisse gross - genug Platz für 2 Koffer, das hat man nicht überall. Das Hotel ist so gebaut, dass es die Fassade viele Buchten hat. Bei meinem Zimmer hat sich der Wind draussen gefangen, so dass ich die ganze Nacht ein Rauschen hatte, wie im Flugzeug. Na ja, ein wenig leiser. Man sollte also, wenn man eincheckt, schauen, ob man auch dieses Rauschen hat, und dann ein anderes Zimmer verlangen.

title: Solid Smaller Mid Town Favorite
text: I have been going to the Michelangelo over a period of years now and it really has not changed much.  A small bar off of the lobby, comfortable rooms and only minutes from the mid town action. This is not the fanciest or the hotel with most amenities but it has everything you need for a predictable and comfortable stay.

title: Great location, classy and stylish
text: Stayed for 3 nights on 5th floor in room 520 which was over the main entrance side. This meant that it could be a little noisy with the taxi horns heard late into the night but not too bad. The room itself was a deluxe king and was very big possibly the largest of our 6 previous visits to NY. It did not look tired as some have said and there was lots of storage space and the wi fi was perfect. The closest subway is either 50th street or if wanting another line a mere 5 minute walk to Rockefeller. As much as we both know how tacky Times Square is you simply have to turn the corner and there it is and it always makes a cool picture. My only issue was the area that was allocated to drinks and breakfast which seemed very small and I am not sure if I missed it but was there another bar or restaurant in this hotel? as I never found it. Door staff were very helpful and stored our suitcases for our late flight and got us a cab with no issues, Thanks guys. I would certainly recommend this place if you have never been before as it is so central and close to all the classic NY spots including Central Park which is a 10 minute walk away.

title: Noisy but Nice
text:
My wife and myself are spending four nights at the hotel in February 2020. 

Hotel is in a great location just up 7th Avenue from Times Square. The entrance and lobby area are very grand.

We were warmly welcomed by the doorman and reception staff. 

Our room was great to start with but we were awoken at 6:30am by jackhammer demolition work in the adjacent building. I spoke to the hotel manager's office and we weee moved later that day and, to their credit, provided with a complimentary bottle of wine.

Unfortunately the last two mornings the same thing has happened at 6:15am and 6:05am ! 

This is not the hotels fault however it is disturbing their paying guests and, from what I can determine, is against NYC regulations. I have therefore contacted the council but the hotel should also do this on their customers behalf.

This is a shame because the hotel is great in other respects. If intending to stay her.e in next few months I suggest you request a room away from the east side of the hotel.

title: Thumbs up!
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful!  The service was excellent and the rooms were beautiful, large and clean. It was also very soundproof, you could not hear anything outside of the room.  This made for good sleeping conditions and the bed was very comfortable too.  Overall, a great place to stay!

title: My go to hotel in nyc
text: My wife, daughter and I checked in last night after a six hour drive and received a very warm reception. The staff is extremely welcoming and friendly. This is a class A hotel that appreciates your business.  The location, large room size and cleanliness are a few more reasons to stay. Would highly recommend if you are looking in nyc.

title: Return Visit to Michelangelo
text: Stayed at The Michelangelo over President's Day / Valentine's Day weekend.  Needless to say, NYC was jammed.  We had plans for Broadway shows, an event at Carnegie Hall, dinners at Le Bernardin and Tratoria Dell Arte among others, and a visit to MOMA.  The Michelangelo could not be in a better location and we were able to walk to all of those events even though it was very cold that weekend and we are in our 70's.  It was also a short ride to get to the High Line, Hudson Yards and the gentrified Meat Packing District which we hadn't seen before.  The Michelangelo has a true European vibe.  We had a full suite (with two bathrooms !!!) and paid a fraction of the price that we would pay at the better known hotels where we usually stay.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the concierge was quite helpful for directions and restaurants in the neighborhood.  It is a smaller property without a fancy restaurant, but they do have breakfast, lunch and dinner available with a somewhat limited menu.  The bar is comfortable and open late and was a good place to meet people from locals to international travelers.  It draws an interesting and nice crowd.  We would highly recommend this hotel for its atmosphere, location and value.

title: Dated and stuffy
text: I have been staying here for 20 years now. But what probably used to be a solid 4 star hotel is more likely now a 3 star hotel. The air in the place is stuffy. It smells like lots of febreeze is being used. It has a great location and pretty good breakfast but could use a good makeover. My daughter has dust and mold allergies and they were going crazy. I don't think it was dusty.

title: Grand old hotel with a lot of history located on 50th in the heart of midtown between Radio City & Times Square.
text: The hotel is historic. It’s a beautiful old building. It used to be known as the Taft Hotel. It is luxury to the extreme. What do I mean by extreme? It has bidets in the bathrooms and crystal chandeliers in the elevators. At times a little worn but that’s it’s charm. The building is from the 1920s. The staff are all pleasant and the doormen have great personalities. I love it. The only complaint I can muster is some of their biggest suites have windows that all face inside dark courtyards. When they were renovating the hotel I can’t imagine why they chose to place some of the hotels most expensive rooms facing the interior of the building so that you can’t see outside or the skyline. Just a dark brick wall through every window. This is not the case in all the rooms but it’s just the way these old hotels were built. They all have courtyards to provide plenty of windows and natural air. Naturally, some rooms will face inside. But if you like the color red and appreciate gold, crystal and marble you’ll love this place. The Michelangelo is part of an Italian hotel chain and one of the chain’s only US based properties.

title: Always Spot on and never disappoints!
text:
When in NYC The Michelangelo is always our first choice! The employees of this hotel are the heart and soul and make the experience! The rooms are big for NYC and tastefully appointed. Ask for an inside room and you will sleep like a baby. Located a few blocks from from Time Square and Hell's Kitchen this hotel makes the perfect spot for dining and theatre. Because Michelangelo is a small boutique style hotel service and your happiness is their #1 concern.

We've been staying here for over 18 years and it never disappoints!

title: The Michelangelo Never Disappoints‼️
text: Once again, I had the pleasure to stay at my fav hotel in NYC. It’s always cozy and lovely. My room was spacious and perfect for my 3 might stay. The staff always greets us kindly and help us with everything we need for our stay. For business or pleasure, you’ll never go wrong. Sleep like a baby tucked away a short distance from Times Square!

title: Not what it used to be
text: The hotel staff is excellent, especially the front desk, but the hotel needs an update. We had a Jr. Suite, and the room was tired. The windows were very drafty and noisy. The furniture was fine, but the mini bar and some molding were chipped and looked tired in general. They serve breakfast in the Bar, but it was way under staffed. The servers had to clear the tables, and were clearly stressed. There were no plates or even paper napkins on the Mini bar. The internet in the business center was not working. We have stay here several years ago and it was 5 stars. Now I would only give it 3.

title: A hidden gem close to everything
text:
Our recent stay here was amazing. The service was top notch; they went out of there way to help me print tickets to an event.

The bartender (Gerard) recommended a few restaurants for dinner. We picked one and liked it so well, we went back the next night.

It's close to 3 different subway lines so getting around was super easy.

I highly recommend!

title: Superb Hotel in Heart of NYC
text: We just returned from a mid-week stay in NYC at the incomparable Michelangelo Hotel. This is my 7th or 8th visit to this hotel and each time I am extremely impressed with this unique property. The property has an old European elegance vibe and the location is excellent - close to transit, restaurants, shopping and near enough to Time Square and the theatre district. We love the spacious rooms (especially the larger bathrooms) and the furniture in the rooms - old world charm. The staff at this hotel are all exemplary professionals from the doormen who help you in and out of the hotel to the front desk staff and the maids. Customer service is excellent and staff go the extra mile to ensure your stay is perfect. Special shout out to Susanna the maid on the 4th floor this weekend! The doormen are the super heroes of the hotel as are the front desk staff. Absolutely love this hotel and will return in March and again in June. I have been here 7 or 8 times and my stays get better ands better!! A bit more pricey but worth every penny!!

title: Always a pleasant experience
text: The most attentive staff, especially Henry!!!! Clean, well kept old world style. Breakfast is AMAZING. We definitely will be returning very soon!!!!!! Right in the heart of Manhattan, It's a hidden gem. There is no request that they cannot accommodate.

title: Fabulous Stay!
text: My family and I had a wonderful experience! This is not our first visit to this hotel, and it will certainly not be our last! Everything was great. Walther at the front desk made us feel very welcomed. The room was great, and so was the included breakfast. The staff at the bar could not have been friendlier! The location is second to none.  I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC!

title: Michaelangelo
text:
This hotel has a wonderful staff and a great old world charm. A nice change from the generic, modern, cookie-cutter boutique hotels that proliferate in NYC these days.

The front desk staff and the doorman, the wonderful Henry, are stellar. But I do miss hav8mg an in-house concierge rather than a service.

title: Beware the hidden residence fee
text: Loved the hotel until I realized they are a rip off organization that fools customers into thinking they are paying $46/ night less than the true room rate. Total crap way to do business, left a very bad taste in my mouth.

title: Poorly organized, unprofessional staff
text: We have been staying here regularly because of the location. With each subsequent stay, the experience has gone down hill. This time I had called to say exactly when I was arriving (a little after check in time) As it happened, I arrived nearly an hour late. But the room was still not ready. No apology, no recognition that I had called explicitly to be sure that the room would be ready and confirmed that it would be. All I got was an "we pre-assign the rooms." Yes! You do. And that is exactly why I called to make sure that I was pre-assigned a room that would be ready when I arrived. Breakfast service is equally as bad. Tables aren't cleared. There aren't enough servers. If the staff were more apologetic, it might be okay, but poor service combined with poor atitude makes for a problem.
