title: Amazing place!!
text: Loved everything about this hotel. The staff were very accommodating. Henry made our trip most enjoyable. The location was perfect, close to everything we wanted to see. Rooms were very clean and everyone we came across was pleasant and professional.

title: NYC hotel
text: We like the location that it is near the theater district, restaurants, and other attractions all within walking distance.  The staff is always helpful and friendly.  The doormen are the best.  We have stayed when they have a special with breakfast included and the food is great.

title: Exceptional service
text: The rooms are great and the staff is super-helpful. When I enquired if there was a coffee maker in the room, they said their wasn’t but that they would be happy to place one. Close to Times Square but still far away that it’s very quiet at night.

title: Great location, beautiful rooms, friendly staff
text: This was our second time staying at the Michelangelo.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite (last time it was a grande one bedroom suite).  Both suites were beautiful, clean, spacious, and quiet.  Check in was smooth and we valeted our cars.  We arrived before check-in so they kept our luggage while we went out on the town.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  The only thing is there were no views out of the windows but we don't care because we just come back to the room to relax and sleep.

title: Should Have Been a 5 Star Review!
text: I was in town for a quick visit to see the Christmas Spectacular and it was important to me to find a hotel in close proximity to Radio City Music Hall.  That must have been everyone else's plan too because every hotel was sold out.  Due to a supply and demand situation I was able to book one night at the Michelangelo Hotel that with taxes came to slightly over $800 for one night.  I have clearly paid that amount for a hotel room before but with that price point comes a high standard of customer service. That is where the Michelangelo fell short. My biggest complaint is when we picked up our luggage from the doorman who had been holding it for us after we checked out.  We had been clearly told by the front desk that when we picked up our luggage the doorman would help us with any transportation we needed.  After we collected our luggage from him I asked him if he could help us get a taxi.  He asked me where we were going and when I told him Penn Station he told me to walk to Seventh Avenue and I could get a taxi there. I understand that Seventh Avenue is in close proximity but really?  What kind of customer service is that?  I guess a handsome tip means nothing to him! This still irritates me to this day and with so many other amazing hotels in NYC it bugs me just enough for me to go elsewhere in the future.

title: Exceptional Experience at the Michelangelo NYC
text: I have been in the hospitality indistry for 40 years and serve on the board of a major hospitality company.   I can say without question that my experience at the Michelangelo which visiting NYC with my two young sons was flawless

title: Weekend getaway
text: The lounge area needs to be extended.  The weather was very poor and most guests stayed in to eat and relax.  The staff had difficulty handling everyone.  Although, the food was satisfactory, the staff seemed to be overwhelmed.

title: Wonderful hotel in NYC
text: This hotel is in a wonderful location, within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Times Square, fine restaurants and great shopping. Beds were super comfortable and room was spacious and quiet. Lots of storage space and beautiful furnishings. The staff was excellent, and Henry went out of his way to make us feel extra special. Super personality and recommended the best Gyro I've ever had at a street vendor directly across the street from the hotel. Would definitely recommend and hope to return!

title: Great Place to Stay In New York City
text:
It is hard to describe this hotel in terms that haven’t been used many times before. It’s luxurious and ornate, trimmed in an elegant, Italian style; clean and very quiet (even though the room overlooked busy 7th Ave.); had wonderful service but was also affordable (for New York City that is.) 

Travelling with the family it was great to have a spacious room (larger than a typical room in Manhattan) to call home, with cozy, stylish furniture, comfortable beds and pillows and a good, strong shower. Centered just blocks from Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park, the location made it easy for us to take a break in the middle of a day of sightseeing. 

The service went above and beyond what we expected. One example was when we had to wait for our room to be ready after we arrived and they gave us complementary drinks and upgraded us to a corner suite with king beds. Another was when they had to replace a broken blind on a window and gave us a nice bottle of Italian wine for the inconvenience. This in spite of the fact we weren’t bothered by either event. 

Free Internet; a large flat-screen TV; valet parking; baggage storage by the front entrance; friendly doormen; close to the subway; a block away from Broadway (‘Wicked’ is playing 5 minutes from the hotel.) Plus, a chocolate on our pillows each day! 

We highly recommend the Michelangelo when visiting New York.

title: Average at best
text:
This hotel is set in a wonderful location. It’s extremely close to all the main sites. However I found it to be a bit of a let down considering many of the reviews I’d read. 
The staff are excellent - that’s for sure. Helpful and nothing is an issue but I really felt the hotel had seen better days and was run down - especially our 1 bedroom suite. That was definitely looking quite old... 
A good hotel but not up to the standard of other 5* equivalents

title: Always a comfortable stay
text: I've stayed at the Michelangelo hotel a few times now. Every time has been great. My last stay was in a one bedroom suite, which I LOVED. It was extremely spacious for NYC, which was a luxury in and of itself. The bathroom is comparatively a little small, but that was fine. Lots of drawers and storage space. Overall a very comfortable stay and I would do it again!

title: Great location for both business and pleasure
text:
Excellent option when traveling to NYC. Do want to go out for a run at Central Park, visit museums or different shows, as well as great dinning? look no more, this a a great option.

M&M World, Disney Store, Broadway shows, il Gatopardo, Rockeffeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall are just a few options for you to visit during your stay

title: Perfect location
text: My wife and I spent a long weekend in NY to see a couple of shows and visit with a friend.  This location is fantastic.  Only steps away from Times Square, but removed enough to avoid the noise and crowds outside the door.  Spacious room, friendly staff, and great value.  I highly recommend!

title: SENTIRSI A CASA
text:
Siamo ritornati dopo un po di anni, e anche per il soggiorno in occasione delle appena concluse feste di Natale 2019, riconfermiamo l'eccellenza.
Hotel molto curato, camere super confortevoli ,letti King size e sevizio in generale impeccabile,nel pieno centro della citta' in ottima posizione per qualsiasi esigenza.
Indimenticabile la sera del 31 dicembre, quando a pochi minuti da mezzanotte  alcuni addetti dell 'Hotel ci hanno portato in centro strada  della 7 Avenue ad ammirare il countdown con la discesa della ball drop.
Esperienza indimenticabile ,da fare almeno una volta nella vita.
Complimenti al manager Sig. Marco Gianni,sempre presente e puntuale per consigli o info,o anche solo per un saluto ,quando ci vedeva arrivare, davvero gentile.
Veramente tutto alla perfezione, molto gentili anche i collaboratori Ceasar e Henry.
Ritorneremo sicuramente

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: Large room, quiet room, great friendly staff, nice shower. Excellent location. Five minutes from Central Park and five minutes from times square. The only issue was coffee wasnt until 7 AM. Other than that really good place.

title: A  LITTLE GEM
text:
For many years I have wanted to stay at The Michelangelo. This time I managed it & was not disappointed. For a tourist that loves theatre & shopping such a wonderful position on 51st W
Staff are all long standing, I know that's not always a good thing but in this case nearly everyone was excellent. A terrific breakfast served. Plus & this is a big plus, terrific sized rooms for central Manhattan. 
This is a hotel in the old style & to my taste. Antique furniture, Marble walls & floors, Lush carpets, Silk curtains Etc.

title: Arrivederci Michelangelo
text:
I will start by saying that for many years, when I have had to visit New York on business, I have stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel due to the location and the satisfactory experiences I've had.  This is not a cheap place to stay, but I suppose their rates are in-line with other similar establishments in the area. 

This most recent business stay at this hotel from December 8-December 10 has changed my impressions to the extent that I will more likely than not choose different lodgings for my next trip.  

First:  When arriving at the hotel, there was no bellman to assist with the luggage or even to open the door, which is difficult when you are bogged down with luggage.
 
Second:  I arrived for check in at approximately 2:45 PM (normal check-in is 3:00) and was told that my room was not ready.  I was informed it should be ready shortly and that they would notify me by text when ready.  I told them I would wait in the lobby with my luggage since the delay was supposed to be short.  At 3:30, after no word, I wen to the front desk to inquire the status and was immediately handed a room key -- they said the room had been ready --- but obviously no notification.  Another person at the front desk said that he had texted me, which was either a lie or he was mistaking me for someone else.  In any event, this got the stay off to a bad start. 

Third:  the toilet in the room was defective, in that the only way to get a full flush, you had to keep the handle depressed and then release it at just the right time.  I put in a request at the front desk for someone from maintenance to look into it, but the problem was not addressed since the same issue continued.  I received no notification that the hotel had looked into the issue. 

Fourth: On the second day of my stay, upon arriving to the room in the late afternoon after a business meeting (approximately 4:30 PM) I find that the room had not been serviced at all.  I go downstairs and ask to see the manager, and then had to wait for 15-20 minutes before she came out.  She did apologize and asked if I wanted to be comped dinner at the small open restaurant adjacent to the lobby, but I said no.  She did take off approximately $25 for the "resort fee" or whatever they call it where the hotel adds-on to the bill for the gym, wifi, or other BS add-on fees.  Just give a room price and be done with it. 

To conclude, I was very disappointed with the Michelangelo this trip.  There was not one issue, but several, including to me a less than enthusiastic attitude toward customer service.  This is especially offensive given the very high price paid for the room, upward of $1,000 a night.  

I will be staying elsewhere on my next business trip to New York.

title: Nice hotel
text: The hotel was very nice but I left my keys in my room and was told they did not have them. After calling and getting no answer I went to the hotel and took an hour for them to realize they do in fact have them.

title: 25 year anniversary celebration!
text: Without exception each of the hotel staff that we interacted with were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful.  Our stay was perfect.  Special commendations must be given to Caesar the door man  we met on arrival, Jose the doorman who assisted are departure and Gerard the bartender who provided us with good conversation and great drinks... thank you Gerard.

title: Not a good experience
text:
I researched many hotels in NY before booking my 4 day stay here. I know New York is expensive and I wanted a nice hotel so I budgeted $1600 for 4 nights of hotel accommodation.  About $400 a night. 

I booked an executive suite via hotels.com at the Michaelangelo. The pictures were amazing and with the room charge and additional $48 daily fee it came out right at my $1600 budget. 

After a 6 hour plane ride I arrived at the hotel and waited in line for about 15 minutes and was given my "executive" room".  Upon opening the door to the room I was very sad to find an old, unclean, very small room with worn out, extremely old furniture. 

I am a gold hotels.com member and this is a VIP hotels.com hotel. That means they are supposed to try upgrade me. I researched and discovered that they actually downgraded my room without telling me, while still charging the executive room rate!!!!

I called down and they confirmed that they did indeed downgrade me and forgot to tell me, or adjust the rate accordingly. They said they would upgrade me to my executive room tomorrow. I must deal with it for tonight. 

Ummm. It's not an upgrade when you give me less than what I paid for without telling me and after I complain say that the next day will give me what I actually paid for. And I am still waiting for them to actually give  me what I paid for. Although they can never give my back the time they have ruined on my vacation so far having to deal with this and spend in this horrible room. I only have the downgrade room they tried to sneak in at the rate I paid for the better room as of this review. 

Added to this, it's not a clean room. But a picture paints a thousand words so I'm posting pictures of what they represent on hotels.com and what I was given. I really hope they choose to make this right. I will update my review one way or the other.

title: Our home away from home in NYC
text: A classic hotel with old world charm, wonderful staff, good food and the perfect location for shows, shopping and museums. Have stayed here many times and feel fortunate to have found such a great property.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
Did read reviews before booking ....Have to say best Hotel by far..... fabulous location 
Looks lovely when entering the Hotel.... stayed for 7 days .... The staff are very welcoming and the rooms are amazing...Arrived 28 December everything was brilliant and much more .... New Year’s Eve dancing ..... around the Christmas tree with members of staff everyone having fun .....The rooms so clean ...... But most of All the doormen ..... Do a fabulous Job
So Helpful..... They go out of there way and beyond 
Never ever does my husband praise me on Hotel s......... But this time got 💯......
Said I did well ...... Now that s going to cost him ....😂......
Well done ..... We are coming back 
Will take away all the lovely memories at your Hotel 
Lots of love Philip Christina Crote ❤️

title: Sweet Hotel in a perfect location
text:
My goodness this is a fun place to stay. It’s trying to be fancy but not in a bad way. The doorman, Theodoro is so good. The managers, Marco, Patrick, Jessica and the gang are so good at their jobs. The rooms are so big and nice. We were a party of 9 and 5 of us stayed in one room. My hubby, me, and our 3 littles who are now 9, 9, 12. Still young enough to think we are fun. The hotel accommodations are just amazing.  No restaurant, lobby bar is great. Perfectly positioned to run out for any meal. From push carts with great Greek food to Majestic diner, to a very nice bakery. All these options are less than a block away. Our first planned outing was to a play at the Gershwin. It was a block away. 
What can I tell you, Sweet Hotel. Perfect location.

title: The Best Place to Stay
text:
I have already written a review.  We appreciated having having the newspaper each morning.
We looked forward to the breakfast. The tv selection was good.  We could not get the internet to work properly.

title: Great place for many reasons
text: Location, staff, service, quality and cleanliness. Always my pic when in NYC during the Xmas and New Year. This place has never disappointed and has always been accommodating of our large family get together.

title: Beautiful Hotel!
text:
Michelangelo is a well run, clean and beautiful hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the service is fantastic. The food is delicious at the lobby restaurant and the Location is convenient for a holiday trip to the city! 

Five stars!

title: Terrific service, big rooms, wonderful location.
text: A little known hotel that is like a home away from home.  Clean, big rooms, kind staff.  Would stay again.  Included breakfast was good.  Not the most fashionable or high end, but it's a super quality operation.  Comfortable bed!  I had a super quiet room.

title: Exceptional stay -- great service!
text: We had a great deal which was made even better by an upgrade.  The staff was incredible -- very kind and professional. And the location was ideal!  (This seems like a very minor detail, but the elevators ran quickly and promptly.  Often in hotels, we find delays, not at the Michelangelo -).  We had a fast trip to NYC and the Michelangelo made it special.

title: NEW YEARS EVE AT THE MICHELANGELO 2020
text:
Our experience was that of a lifetime.  From the front door of the Micheleangelo to our room we were treated like family. A very warm and inviting vibe.  Everyone at the Michelangelo are very friendly and accommodating.  We nothing but praises for the the General Manager Mr. Vikram Sardana, Hamadi Sissoko, Marco Giannai, Casey Parmelee, Gerrard, Luna and the rest of the staff.
My family and I are excited to visit the Michelangelo again in the near future.

title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
text: first time here on a recommendation. quiet convenient just off Broadway. Staff excellent, rooms impeccably clean. European style which means dark wood, muted colors. i will definitely come back here as it is not a large hustle bustle place. When we are here in NYC we like all the loud fast pace stuff to happen outside. only 4 stars because their website is not updated and the bath was small. Business center was up to date and computers fast. Mezzanine was a nice place to sit and read.

title: Times Square Luxury Hotel
text: We checked into the Michelangelo on New Year's Eve for the Times Square Ball drop.  We are native New Yorkers and had done this in 2016, only to experience it again for 2020 per our daughter's wish.  Family gathered around and the hotel was wonderful.  Awesome staff, great place and everything was just wonderful.

title: Awful intimidating staff
text:
I went here to meet one of my friends for a drink and walk around time Square.
Dressed casually in jeans flat boots scarf and a big jacket  Whilst waiting for my friend I was questioned three times by large Male staff members about what I was doing there and why I was at the hotel foyer.
I feel very intimidated and victimised. I am not sure what kind of establishment they run but when a single business woman is judged and treated so disgustingly by the staff it’s pretty worrying.

I felt humiliated and horrified.
Needless to say I don’t recommend

title: My favourite hotel in NYC
text: I love the Michelangelo Hotel.  It's perfectly located...walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  We stayed in one of their larger suites...two king size beds with amazing mattresses for 3 travellers....lots of space and the bathroom and walkin closet were so appreciated.  Having breakfast included with our stay made morning easy so we could head out and enjoy our days.

title: Excellent Place
text: Excellent Hotel.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly answering all our questions with a smile.  The room was very clean, comfortable and spacious, giving a great place during our down time.  The location was perfect, within walking distance to everything we needed, if not the Subway was closely located.   I would recommend this hotel. Two thumbs up for a great place to stay!

title: Celebrating my husbands 60th Birthday where he grew up! NYC
text: Our family came to NYC to celebrate my husbands 60th Birthday.  We wanted a location that was centrally located to everything.  The Michelangelo was that place and more. The accommodation were superb.  The rooms were spacious and beautiful. Valet Parking was a plus.  The staff was so warm and welcoming.  I highly recommend the Michelangelo for a magical vacation stay with an amazing location to all you famous spots in NYC.

title: Nice
text: Michelangelos and outstanding hotel we had terrific experience their rooms were clean neat the restaurant area was clean and neat the staff was a fairy accommodating we even had a rollaway bed in that room put in that was very Comfortable

title: Absolutely excellent!!!
text: This is our family’s 4th stay at the Michelangelo . I cannot say enough about the wonderful attentive service that we received. I especially want to recognize our breakfast attendant Jackie who never let my coffee cup get low and our wonderful valet Henry who was so pleasant and efficient! He took great care of us! You will love the Michelangelo! See you next year!

title: Great property-great staff
text: Beautiful property with smiling staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We would absolutely come back. Our first choice. It is in a very convenient location so it is extremely easy to get to restaurants, shopping and shows.

title: 2019 Christmas visit
text: Thoroughly enjoyable four day visit over Christmas. Very nice rooms, common area and restaurant/bar. And the entire staff (front desk, porters, housekeeping, restaurant) was uniformly cordial regardless of the traffic and time of day. The Michelangelo is always our first choice.

title: Charming boutique style hotel with Italian flair and terrific location.
text:
This hotel is a hidden gem, but for some reason had not been on my radar in the past. The hotel is gracious, beautiful -- so much more appealing than most chain hotels. Our room with very comfortable king bed was spacious and well-equipped. Everything was very clean and in excellent condition. The bathroom was spacious as well and even had a scale in it. 

Only issues were a reservation complication and inattentive service at breakfast.

title: Visitor
text: The Michelangelo is a fantastic hotel we had a great stay there everything was very clean and neat the staff was very friendly and the rooms were fantastic I highly recommend it they have a fantastic lobby bar great drinks the coffee is excellent in the morning and more than enough staff to accommodate all of the guest needs

title: ニューヨークの中にイタリア！
text:
7番街の側にあり、ロックフェラーセンターまでゆっくり歩いて7〜8分。
バスタブも広いし、シャワーもハンドがある。部屋も広い。ベッドも快適。スタッフも感じよく、居心地の良いホテルで、また行きたいと思います。

title: Wonderful stay and service
text:
While this hotel is not a new property, the rooms and facilities are in good condition and the location (1 block north of Times Square) is great.  We stayed there with our family and everyone felt very comfortable and welcomed by the staff.

Two things stood out:

1.  Hotel Desk Manager Jessica was very helpful in explaining our charges and making adjustments as an accommodation for us.

2.  Hotel Doorman Teodoro saved us!  On our trip home, through LaGuardia, our car service was delayed by street closures on Sixth Avenue.  Teodoro proactively saw that we could miss our flight, grabbed our suitcases and hustled us down the street so we could make our flight.  Way beyond the call of duty; without Teodoro we would have missed our flight!  We are so thankful to him.

We look forward to our next visit to the Michelangelo.

title: repeat visitor
text: We come to NYC twice a year and we always stay at the Michelangelo. It is perfectly located, the rooms are very spacious and after a hectic day in the city it is an oasis of tranquility. The staff are always welcoming when we return.

title: Great hotel in midtown
text: Great location and service. Hotel a bit tired and could use some remodeling. Breakfast staff very friendly but overwhelmed. Doormen excellent. We will definitely return. If you are shopping or seeing shows there is no better location.

title: very nosie, room not worth the money
text: not worth the money early check in not available as was told at time of booking it was good for 11 am did not get the room till 2PM paid $30.00 for up grade to 6th floor was told it was quieter there, from mid night till 1AM garbage truck grinding up construction debris no sleep that night

title: Always a pleasure
text: Each time I visit New York I stay at The Michelangelo....so often in fact that many of the staff know me by name and/or face.  The Michelangelo is a lovely hotel...a little oasis in the mayhem that can be NYC.  It is conveniently located ~ a quick walk to Times Square, Radio City, Central Park and Carnegie Hall, as well as to the subway.  The staff is warm, welcoming and helpful.  The hotel and its rooms are always clean.  This is the only hotel I stay at in NYC ~ you should make it your "home away from home" too.

title: We love this hotel!
text:
Our second time there and it was excellent again! Great room and the service is outstanding! Cesar the doorman is so kind and helpful!!  It is so convenient to walk to Times Square and any theater.  Great breakfast service as well!
Will be back.

title: Would not stay again
text:
This property is very tired - could really use an extensive updating .
The pros - 
Location and comfortable beds 
The cons -
Outdated furnishings , uncomfortable sofa , 
Stained carpets , mold in the shower .....
We were in room 503 - lots of street noise .

title: Great at any time of the year
text:
We have stayed at the Michelangelo at all different times of the year in our opinion it id the only place to stay.  It has a fantastic location, a great staff and the breakfast id wonderful. 
Will always stay here.

title: Good but...
text: Our suite was lovely and very spacious. However, none of the windows had a view and we kept the blinds closed for our entire stay. The WiFi was free and fast. We didn’t eat at the hotel but did have drinks in the bar (which was short staffed).

title: Christmas in new york
text: A very busy time so probably challenging for the staff. Breakfast was slow and the food not very good nor were the orders correct. I have stayed at less busy times and enjoyed the hotel, service and food.

title: Exceptional location great great service
text:
We just had the most wonderful week end.The hotel is exceptionally located, everything was great from start to finish.We arrived very early in the morning and as promised they texted us when the room was ready.Wonderful staff, everybody from reception, concierge to porter bar and maids and breakfast staff.The room was very beautiful and the level of cleanliness outstanding.Although our room was overlooking a big busy avenue absolutely no noise!
Highly recommend it!
Gianluca Passarella

title: New York 2019
text:
Came with a friend to see shows, eat and experience Christmas.  The staff as always was amazing.
It was my 3rd time staying here and will definitely return.
We have already starting planning our next trip.

title: Newcomers to New York - why stay anywhere else? A good base to explore.
text:
Harried, tired, and jet lagged - this is how Mama and I arrived at JFK. Tale as old as time. We were not sure if my aunt had transferred the booking into my name, and we were worried we would not have a place to stay in NYC. A quick phone call from the airport to the hotel resolved this issue with minimum fuss.

We arrived - beautiful, low-key lobby. Quick check in. The lift chime still sounds in my dreams. Evocative.

The room was clean and comfortable. The beds - dreamy.

We were right near Times Square but still felt a world away.

Oh we woke up and it was snowing! Coming from Australia, that was such a beautiful surprise. Snow in the city!

Our every request was met in a friendly and efficient manner. 

Dine in the lobby bar - the Italian is delicious.

For newcomers to New York, this is the best base for exploring.  

Travelled April 2018 - left it a little while to write this review but felt it deserved to be said.

title: excellent choice
text: I had never stayed at this hotel, but I have no reservations about recommending it.   The staff was very friendly, not pretentious and made me feel at home.  The room was large, comfortably appointed and the bathroom was very user friendly.  It was more like staying in a small apartment than a hotel.  I genuinely enjoyed my stay and would do so again.  Also, the breakfast service was excellent and, as with all oft the staff, my server was attentive and friendly.

title: Wonderful holiday season to NYC
text: The Michelangelo is one of our favorite hotels in NYC.  This year marked 25 years of staying at the Michelangelo.  The staff are very friendly and the hotel is beautiful.  Patrick H. is always a pleasure to deal with and helped us a great deal with our booking.  Front desk staff were very efficient in checking us in and out. We will be back!

title: Friendly Staff
text: We visit New York City several times a year and stay at The Michelangelo.  It's conveniently located. Broadway theaters are a quick walk as well as wonderful restaurants, 5th Ave shopping, Central Park and Times Square. The hotel staff is very friendly, especially Henry.  We love him and look forward to seeing his smiling face each visit. Henry and his co-workers  are willing to do anything to make your stay a pleasant one. The rooms are available when promised, not always a given at chain hotels! Also, they're very generous about "late check-out". Rooms are spacious and comfortable. It's a calm oasis in a big noisy city.

title: Outstanding Michaelangelo
text: The great location, attentive staff and beautiful facilities make The Michaelangelo our "go to" hotel anytime we are in New York. You can walk to everything!! Highest marks and we look forward to going back soon!

title: My Opinion
text:
Hotel is very good, people for cleaning and room service need a better training.
The men rest room at mezzanine was in poor shape for an entire day (November 30).
The warming system does not work properly.

title: Perfect Location
text: The Michelangelo was centrally located to what we were in NYC for - Macy's Day Parade, The Rockettes, Shopping, and Times Square.  There were various eateries close to the hotel as well.  The hotel rate was very reasonable and the breakfast package was acceptable.  The room was clean and sufficient for a party of two.  The hotel staff was very professional and polite.  Only concern was that the lounge seemed to close early on Thanksgiving.

title: Traveller
text: Very good hotel at good location and very nice reception, also the smell when u arrive is also good, i would stay here again for my next buiness trip at newyork again in next couple of month. Wish to expand the restourant to more bigger and widely type of food

title: Always a wonderful experience
text: The Michelangelo never disappoints.  My husband and I have stayed every year at the Michelangelo for Thanksgiving for the past several .  The service was even more personal than ever before.  The location in mid-town is perfect for the theaters, restaurants and shopping. We absolutely love this hotel.

title: Our stay at the Michaelangelo
text: Excellent.  We went for the first time to see the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade and we were not disappointed with this hotel.  Very clean,  very friendly staff,  checking in and out were very simple as the staff was very helpful.

title: Another brilliant stay!
text: The hotel is well managed, the rooms are comfortable and to a high standard of cleanliness and the staff are all well trained and give excellent service.  Nothing is too much trouble.  Regular visitor because I have never been disappointed! Location is excellent and very accessible for several subway lines.

title: Henry
text: We spent one week at The Michelangelo Hotel and everything was excellent; however, the excellence came when we were leaving.  Thanksgiving Day and all the cabs were locked out from the hotel and we were on the way to the airport.  Henry took our luggage and guided us 5 blocks away and secured a cab for us.  Otherwise, we would not have known what to do and ultimately missed our flight.  He was great everyday at the door, but this service was something I have never experienced before.  To the top management of the hotel, you are damn lucky to have an employee with this type of service credentials.  I travel for business all the time and this was a first.  This type of service puts your hotel above all others.

title: Nice Hotel great location
text: Nice hotel with a great location next to Times Square and all the other major central Manhattan tourist sights. Would recommend this hotel although be prepared to pay a Residency fee which you may consider a needless additional fee - especially if overseas visitor with no car.

title: DA RITORNARCI
text:
Vicinissimo a time square siamo stati con i nostri bambini e siamo stai bene.
Forse non nuovissimo ma personale cordiale e stanze pulite.
Buon rapporto qualità prezzo.
Ci ritorneremo la prossima volta

title: A Wonderful vacation home
text: We spent four nights at the Michelangelo in November.  We were very impressed with the hotel from the time we checked in until we checked out.  The lobby area is beautiful and our junior suite (to which we had been upgraded when we made our reservation) was spacious and lovely.  The staff was uniformly helpful, friendly and enthusiastic.  The location is perfect for theater and many sights.

title: Beautiful Hotel Conveniently Located
text: My husband and I stayed at the Michelangelo for 4 nights.  The room was large (400+ square feet), clean, and quiet.  We barely heard anyone in nearby rooms, and we usually had the elevator to ourselves.  A couple of the doormen were friendly and helpful.  The hotel was located close to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway, Carnegie Hall, the Ed Sullivan Theater, and Central Park.  The Empire State Building was within walking distance.  Many restaurants were nearby, my favorite being Patsy's (Frank Sinatra's favorite restaurant).  We took a cab here, but a much cheaper way from JFK would have been to take the Airtrain for $7.75 and the E subway line to W. 53rd St. for $3. Do the reverse to get back to JFK, and it's a reverse commute on a weekday morning.  Would definitely stay here again.  It was a bit of a splurge, but you get what you pay for.

title: New York experience!
text: The Michelangelo experience was first class.  Every person we interacted with was service oriented.  From check in to room service, housekeeping, the concierge, etc.  They were all helpful and made everything easy.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great weekend away at The Michelangelo
text: Great hotel in a very convenient location.  Walkable to Time Square/Theatre District as well as Central Park, subway/train station, etc. Comfy rooms/beds, nice sized bathrooms.  Pretty quiet although you are near Time Square so you do get some street noise at night, nothing terrible. Friendly and helpful staff.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Fabulous!
text: Very helpful, professional and friendly staff. Very well sized and characterful room, fully equipped. Bathroom/shower of high quality too, no remarks whatsoever. Really comfortable bed / pillows / temperature control, and efficient sound insulation (from NYC noise). Delicious food, excellent breakfast (even if one has to order rather than a buffet-breakfast), pleasant bar and atmosphere overall. Even though there is not ample sitting at the bar/lounge, this make it cozier and I never noticed any shortage of seating space. Overall I would say I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Michelangelo and it made my (business) trip more comfortable and pleasant.

title: Great
text: Stayed with my mom 2 nights on 7th floor. Perfect location to walk to shops and restaurants, Central Park runs were perfect, and Starbucks across the street. (Hidden in BNP bank building with awesome Lichtenstein mural and paintings) Service was wonderful from the start. Angel did nice job at check in and bring sure we were happy with everything. Henry was amazing upon departure, running up the street to get us a cab! He made us laugh and smile in our last few moments of nyc.

title: Great location, Italian hospitality in NYC
text: The hotel obviously has a great location, but it is the friendly and professional staff that make it worthwhile.  We especially liked the Italian touches throughout the hotel.   Rooms are surprisingly large for NYC.

title: The best of the best!
text: The Michelangelo Hotel is my top choice when visiting NYC. Great location, outstanding staff and beautiful rooms. You can't go wrong. When I walk through the doors at the Michelangelo, it feels like home.  Patrick Garmone - Ohio

title: Well-located hotel near Times Square in Manhattan
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Michelangelo Hotel.  It's location at 51st Street and 7th Avenue is very convenient.  It is close to Times Square and the theatre district; only 2 blocks from a subway station and very close to most of Mid-town Manhattan's main attractions. The hotel's service was excellent and the rooms very comfortable.

title: My usual NYC haunt
text: Have been staying here for years.  The Location  can’t be beat and the rooms are larger than the norm.  The prices have crept up so that it’s not the bargain it used to be, but it’s a nice place to stay.

title: Great Hotel
text: Small boutique hotel. It’s beautiful and clean. Great location and East to get to subway, park or Times Square. King room was wonderful. Staff was accommodating. Room service was hit or miss. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: A 5 night stay at the Michelangelo hotel
text:
I just spent 5 nights at the Michelangelo hotel in midtown Manhattan. Overall it was a pretty comfortable stay. Check in was a bit rough bc. I had requested an early check after a red eye flight from LA and alas...my room was not ready! So, I ate a lovely ( but expensive!!) breakfast and by 12.00 I was shown to my room. At first I was not happy! The carpets were stained pretty badly and the room felt dark although it was a pretty good size for me ( single occupant). I was told I could choose to wait for another room or switch the next day and decided to stay.
But, after settling in I ended up staying in the room all 5 nights. It was super comfortable and my carpets were shampooed the next day and I was lazy to gave to pack up and move again. I liked the bed and the shower was nice with a rain shower or hand held shower option. Lots of down pillows and a relatively quiet room to boot. ( for nyc!)
Their customer service is outstanding! They really try to accommodate their guests! I ordered room service twice and it was excellent... prompt, efficient and exactly right.
I had mentioned that it was my dad’s bday weekend and my parents were staying  on the same floor with me. Their room was beautiful and large.. almost a suite! Also my dad received a bottle of champagne and chocolate cake with a lovely card on his birthday from management... very thoughtful!
Although the furniture in this hotel is a bit worn and could use an overhaul I like how polite and personal the staff is. Everyone goes out of their way to make you feel like a welcome guest and that’s rare for nyc!
The tv worked well, the ac/ heater worked... the toilet flushed and shower drained perfectly and there was  hot water as much As desired .... plus good water pressure...  a comfy bed... nice big towels .....these are all the things that make a stay comfortable and I’ve stayed in 5 star hotels in NYC where I’ve had issues with one or more of these things so I don’t take them for granted  when staying in nyc! I think management really tries to make their guests happy and i think if they remodel and update this hotel it would deserve 5 stars. Unfortunately I can’t give 4.5 stars but I would definitely go back there again. Also the location is perfect for theater goers!

title: Anniversary trip
text:
We stayed at the Michelangelo on a trip to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary.
The hotel looked after us well and helped make our stay very special. 
The hotel is really well situated to visit all the main sites. Most of which we did on foot, but there is a subway station nearby as well.
Rooms are large, which I think is not that common in New York, well presented and comfortable.

title: 🌹クラシックな雰囲気が魅力のホテル
text:
今までニューヨークのホテルに色々泊まりましたが、こちらはアップタウンにあり、落ち着いた雰囲気でくつろげました。

ロビーの天井は高くシャンデリアが煌めき、赤いソファー、クラシックな絵画やベネチアングラスがお出迎え。

ここはローマのホテルかな？と思わせる雰囲気です。

お部屋はキングサイズベッド、テレビが寝室側とリビング側２面にあるという面白い造りでした。
お風呂はバスタブが大きく深く、湯量もタップリ。
ただ、レバーを蛇口からシャワー側に切り替えると湯量が弱くなる（蛇口の方にも漏れてしまう）のが難点。

ポットは無いけど鍵付きの冷蔵庫がありました。中身は有料ですが、少し空きスペースがあるので、買ってきたものを入れられます。

レジデンス・フィーとして１日50ドルほど追加なので４日宿泊した私は200ドル追加。
電話代、Wi-Fi、ラウンジバーにての10ドル分換金（ドリンクなど）等が含まれているのですが、宿泊代と会わせると中々の料金ですね・・・

ホテルガイドを見ていて、ここがスターホテルの系列ということを知りました。
以前ミラノでスターホテルアンダーソンを利用して良かったのでなるほど・・・と納得しました。
総じてニューヨークの真ん中でアクセスや環境を考えると、とても良いホテルだと思いますので、機会があればまた利用したいです。

title: Warm and Welcoming
text: Every encounter with the staff was warm, genuine and helpful. I enjoyed every conversation. Cesar, Yomar and Gerard were delightful. We had a wonderful chat with Carmen when we came back in the evening. Everyone really cares about the hotel and the guests. Our room was spacious and clean. We wish we were there longer. It’s a gem in a sea of hotels in NYC, can’t wait to go back.

title: Great location
text: Wonderful, classic hotel from the 20’s, in theater district, we walked everywhere. Very good restaurant, friendly staff focused on customer service, comfortable room. We used office equipment, & had room service, which was fast. Will stay again!

title: Old school and dated but comfy befs
text: When you walk is you feel like you’ve entered a faded version of a nice hotel. The older doors man literally never opened the door for us or helped with luggage( other 2 were great). Concierge was nice but that’s about it. Feels like a hotel the godfather would have filmed in. The hallways are definitely dated and ghostly but at least the beds were comfy and bathrooms was clean! Location is definitely a positive here . Will not return due to the price vs quality - there’s plenty of other hotel options around that would likely be better

title: Fabulous
text:
We stay for our 30th Anniversary and they treated us like Royalty. From the moment you enter you know you make the right choice. 

Close enough to walk to all Time Square and Brodway have to offer, yet far enough away to get out of the madness of the City lifel

Our room was the highlight. Much larger than expected, clean, and very quiet. Bed was so great we slept until at least 10 every morning.

The Staff was awesome with our every need and provided those we didn't know we needed. 

We know where we will stay next time in New York. Can't wait to return.

Any question you may have about the Michangelo Hotel will be answered with FABULOUS!

title: My stay
text: Everything was very clean and well maintained. The room, while didn't look exactly what was pictured was amazing and the two bathrooms were an excellent surprise. Overall would highly recommend, especially as it's in a good location.

title: A so-so hotel but good location
text: We stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel and found it very dark and a bit dreary. The more "inside" room with a light shaft for light was too dreary for a 5 night stay. The hotel did not call it an inside room, but it was. Over the phone I was assured about the concierge helping w/ certain services but once at the hotel they were no help. Something just seemed off as this is not what friends had said about this hotel. So while it wasn't "bad", I think there are other hotels in the same area that would be nicer. For our trip to NYC next week, we have chosen different accommodations.

title: Giving it 4 stars but it is 3.5
text:
We just returned from a weekend stay at The Michaelangelo.  

This is a boutique hotel.  The service is very personnel.  To ensure we were satisfied, our check in clerk texted us several times over the weekend.  Nothing was too much trouble. 

We booked through Hotels.com but the hotel could not be more accommodating about finding us a good room. I read some of the rooms were interior, some on 7th which is noisy and some on 51st. Also, that higher was better. I called to let them know my preferences and we were put in the excellent room 620 - corner, quiet, with windows on 51st. 

The  room and the hotel are traditional. Not for the W, Nomad crowd but for those of us who like our comforts, and a bit of elegance. We are middle aged as were most of the guests we saw. 

I thought the room was beautiful and it, and the premises as a whole, were in excellent condition.  

The room was also larger than a traditional NYC hotel room at about 400 square feet with room for two comfy chairs and a desk. There was a nice amount of drawer space with a 3 deep drawer dresser, a decent closet and two night tables with decent storage. 

The bathroom was divided in two with a sink/makeup mirror outside of the toilet, bath area. The bath was a soaking tub, with a combined shower, including a wand. There were robes and slippers and decent cosmetics. 

The hotel is at the corner of 7th and 51st so Midtown but considered Times Square.  Very close to the theaters and not far from Time Square itself.  

BUT.... the safe was so high up, even my 5"9 husband needed a chair to retrieve things. The closet was beside the bed and it was very narrow between the two. Really awkward to get anything..  On the plus side, the hangers were plentiful, wooden, and not attached like the hotel is worried they will be stolen. 

There was NOWHERE for your electronics.  We were searching for plugs.  

The bathroom has one sink - not a deal breaker - but the only place to put cosmetics was the sink area.  No other shelf. 

The mini bar was ridiculously expensive, eg. $12 M & M's. Yes, nicely packaged  in a glass jar but who cares?   The mini bar was also stocked with every type of liquor, even champagne. We did not take advantage of it but it had a real old time feel. Charming. 

However, there was no Keurig.  That was a big minus. The first day we were meeting a tour and wanted to eat breakfast in Lower Manhattan.  By the time we got to where we were going, w had been up for 2 hours and we were not happy we had yet to have a coffee.  

Not sure room service's hours but it was not available either at 4 or at 11 pm when we really needed it.  

We ate breakfast at the hotel the second day.  It was overpriced and mediocre.  $27 for an American breakfast where the potatoes consisted of 4 tiny potatoes and $18 for bagels and lox where the cream cheese was like Kraft, the bagel must have been Entemanns out of the plastic bag and you needed a microscope to see the fruit side.   The lox was good and plentiful at least. 

The Wifi is free but there is a $48 fee on top of your room rate, for amenities. 

Did not look for it but don't believe there is a spa of gym ( just not sure). 

Re location, we found that whether it was the line to get tickets at the subway or getting to the theater, or finding a diner, we encountered crowds we weren't used to because we usually stay more East. We were constantly walking in huge crowds if we took 7th or 8th. So good if that makes you feel part of the action. But we did not appreciate it and it definitely means you need more time to get places and you will wait around longer at the local eateries.  

Would we stay here again?  Definitely, if the price is right. We would just explore the area better for food choices and maybe bring stuff to our room.  Overall, we had  a good experience.

title: not good not bad
text: when we got to the hotel it looked a bit old however was very grand. the doorman who was very old was a bit grumpy and a bit rude but anyway. we walk in and check in and find out we cant get in till 3. even worse, they didnt have a bed for me, just a double bed for my parents. we found that appalling as we booked the room for 3 and they knew 3 people were staying. (the room had 3 towels so they obviously did). anyway we went out as we couldn't get in yet. he said he'd text us when its ready. about 4 hours passed with no text so we went back and it was ready, no bloody text. anyway the room was very posh, smelt nice, kinda clean etc. they bought a bed later and wanted 40 dollars per day for an single bed that takes 2 mins to get in which we didn't fall for, got the bed anyway. the bed had rips in it but at this point i couldnt care less it was comfy. few days pass no issues until my dad checks his bank and sees hes been charged 300 dollars for tax. runs down to the front desk and asks why and they said wifi, even tho it says free bloody wifi when booking. i suppose that's 300 dollars gone. rest of stay fine. got through it and had a good time in NYC

title: Lovely stay at The Michelangelo Hotel
text: I have stayed at The Michelangelo many times over the past twenty years and always appreciate it.  The staff is extremely courteous and helpful (which you would expect, but they really go above and beyond).  The location of the hotel is ideal for evening theatre excursions.  The size of the rooms is also a nice perk especially if you are staying several days.  Would highly recommend it!

title: Always Fantastic
text: Best hotel in the city.  I always look to stay at the Michelangelo. Great rooms and great service with a terrific location. I recommend this hotel to colleagues and clients as the class of NY. I love the hotel!

title: Amazing Hotel !!
text: The hotel is terrific!! with amazing super service, good taste as well as quality of food. The ambience is welcoming and the decoration has been done so well. It’s in the heart of the city and everything is so accessible from there. I enjoyed my time and will definitely go back!!

title: Stepping into your Living Room
text:
I love going to the Lounge.  it is like stepping into a friends living room.  Everyone is so inviting and attentive.  The food is delicious and never disappoints.
It is a great place to hold a meeting or meet up with friends.

title: Good Location, Decent Hotel
text: I stayed at the Michelangelo during Canadian Thanksgiving, and it did not disappoint. Not to say that it was the most incredible hotel, but it delivered what it promised: a nice hotel, clean rooms, and a great location. However, if you're expecting one of those beautiful New York City hotels, this might not be your place. I'd say it's on the lower end of luxury, but luxury nonetheless.

title: Great Stay
text: Booked a stay at this hotel for my parents this past weekend for my mother's birthday and they loved it! My father can be a little tough to please and he had nothing but wonderful things to say about the hotel.  Staff was wonderful and very attentive, hotel and room were clean and the location was great.  They said they would definitely stay again!

title: Good location
text: Close to 2 subway lines, theater district, Times Square, America’s Av. Service is good. Room are really big for NYC. I was concerned about the noise from the street but it was ok. It’s glamorous days are in the past and I hope they will renovate the hotel at some point. It’s. It bad, but feels outdated. At least you could fix up a bar.

title: Thumbs down
text:
We didn’t like it. Terrible non-descript room with no view. Windows were direct to another building making it feel claustrophobic. Service personnel friendly but there was something missing. Attempted to have drinks in lounge before going out to dinner but we were ignored long enough to leave without being acknowledged. 
Never stay there again.

title: Midtown Gem
text: My husband and I celebrate our birthdays and anniversaries annually in New York City and stay at the Michelangelo Hotel.  Not only do we love its location- walking distance both to Broadway’s theater district and Lincoln Center, but also the warm welcome we receive from the wonderful hotel staff.  The reservations staff, notably Patrick, the manager, is remarkable, providing first rate customer service and personal touches such as room upgrades and bottles of wine and sweets to add to our celebration. The rooms are lovely, quiet and clean. We have always enjoyed our time there.

title: Great Location
text:
The décor needs an upgrade, the food and beverage needs a makeover
Convenient location
Staff professional and well managed
We would return to this location
Overall experience was very good
Easy access to ground transportation and many attractions that NYC has to offer

title: A grande dame
text: The Michaelangelo is a wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle of NY City.  Ideally located in midtown but far enough out of Times Square to not be packed with hoardes of tourists.  Close to everything.  The staff is incredibly attentive and the rooms are large and plush.   Breakfast in the lobby bar is a plus.  One caution---bring a power strip as the hotel does not have outlets available to plug in devices at the desk.

title: Great experience.
text: Staff was professional, friendly very attentive and always available. Rooms were very clean and spacious, bathroom immaculate with plenty of amenities. Bar fully stocked ad kitchen had a very good menu with a nice selection. Centrally located for our purposes. Would definitely come back in the future  I highly recommend.

title: The perfect place to stay when visiting NYC
text:
I’ve stayed in many NYC hotels over the past 20 years and almost all of them have something negative or an area of opportunity (even the Plaza has flaws). I can’t find one flaw regarding the Michaelangelo. I stayed here for 3 nights while visiting the city this past holiday weekend. Start to finish, it was easily the best hotel experience I’ve had in the city. The offer valet parking which was efficient at drop off and pick up. The hotel lobby is beautiful yet comfortable. The check in process was easy and the staff was very kind. The room is large and comfy and has all the necessary amenities with some nice extras (room darkening curtains, very large bathtub, bidet). The housekeeping team was efficient and always made our room smell as if it was brand new. The lobby staff was phenomenal. Make sure to ask for Henry, our favorite team member who went above and beyond multiple times (including personally shining my shoes when I forgot to leave them out the night before). Henry greeted us off the elevator every day and night and always had a smile on his face. 
If you’re traveling to NYC, I absolute recommend The Michaelangelo as your hotel destination if you want the perfect hotel from start to finish.

title: Great location and room
text: I stayed four days and we had a great experience.  The room had two queens size bed, it was very large, beautiful and very clean.  I had a walking shower and it was great.  The room was facing the road, but it was not too noisy.  Location is perfect and close to restaurants, bars and theatres. I like to go back.

title: Great Location
text:
I had high expectations of this hotel given pictures on there website , our checkin with Angel was exceptionally quick and friendly. The hotel style whilst a bit dated was clean and well kept, my room was spacious and what stood out mostly during my stay was how clean and efficient the housekeeping staff where, the forgotten but most important cog in the wheel of a hotel. Almost invisible but so friendly and helpful, the bed linen and beds are by far some of the most comfortable I’ve stayed. 

Room service was ok the food average and cold. Some reception staff a little frosty but forgiven as a gentleman called Angel was by far the most helpful. 

The hotel is disable friendly although doorman would have to give you access to a side door where there must be a ramp or lift , there hotel lifts are really efficient never a long wait 

I would return if in New York and special price offered

Please commend housekeeping as they where outstanding

title: Wonderful stay at the Michelangelo!
text: My favorite New York hotel. I won't stay anywhere else. Great service and location. The staff goes out of their way to help. Delicious breakfast in the lobby restaurant. Very clean room. Overall perfect visit.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in NYC
text: I stay at the Michelangelo Hotel every fall and this year was as good as in the past!  Great location and excellent accommodations and customer service.  Rooms are spacious and well-appointed.  Highly recommend!

title: Ready for a refurbish
text:
We have stayed a number of times at the Michelangelo.  It has always been fine.
This time, while we were in a “junior suite”, there was a large cheaply modern piece of furniture in the center of the room.  It was peeling rather badly.
Breakfast was quite nice, both the food and the service.
The toilet and very high tub are in a separate room with the sink outside the door.  It is so tight in that room that when you sit on the toilet you are right up against the roll of paper and cannot move it!  We have never had these problems before.  Ready for a refurbishment....

title: First Time at The Michelangelo
text: The hotel is in a convenient location, close to everything and the biggest hotel room I have ever had in NYC.   Hotel service was excellent with a big thanks to Henry, who handled our luggage from the time we arrived until we checked out. I'm sorry to not have the name of the doorman, but also a real professional hailed cabs, helped with the bags, very friendly.

title: The Michelangelo..
text: A wonderful hotel situated in the perfect area to see New York on your doorstep. The staff were super friendly and very helpful and the hotel did not disappoint! My only grumble was the price of the coffee!

title: Lovely hotel, if slightly expensive.
text:
We stayed here for one night on the 21st September 2019 as we had a one night layover before travelling onto Martha’s Vineyard. 

Firstly, it was pretty expensive. £287 for one night, plus a £40 residents fee (a rough estimate in dollars would be approx $410 in total). I’m not quite sure what the residents fee is or why they can’t charge this within the upfront cost for transparency but never mind. We were informed of this at check in but were not told how much this would be (to be fair, I wasn’t present for check in and my friend omitted to ask this question, which I would have done). It would have been by the by, however, as we wouldn’t have been left with much option other than to pay it or find another hotel at late notice in a Saturday night in Times Square (whilst there was a UN summit taking place!). In the interest of fairness, I will say you do get a $10 beverage allowance and $10 off any transport booked through reception. 

The hotel itself is wonderful. The location is perfect for central Manhattan and the suite we stayed in was certainly luxurious. I can’t quite bring myself to agree to it being worth the price but I have to be fair and say it was maybe overpriced by around £50. Get rid of the residence fee and I would have been pretty happy with the price. I’ve added photos below to show how wonderful this room was. It was spotlessly clean, the temperature was just right and it was lovely and quiet. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. 

The staff were very friendly throughout. 

The hotel is perfect for a short or long stay and if I could come to terms with the cost, I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel in a superb location
text: I've recently returned from a highly enjoyable 5 night stay at the Michelangelo Hotel in New York. It was my first trip to the city and because my friends had booked the hotel I wasn't too sure what to expect. First and foremost, the hotel is perfectly located just a short stroll from Times Square. Considering the busy location, I was pleasantly surprised how quiet the hotel was and I enjoyed the best sleep. Seriously, the beds are super comfy you might find yourself struggling to get up in the morning. I will say that the decor of the hotel is a little dated in places and could do with a bit of TLC and modernisation. But it is spacious, charming and extremely clean and comfortable. On that note I'd like to give the housekeeping team a shout out for doing such a terrific job, they are a credit to the hotel. I'd also like to thank the Michelangelo for changing my room after initially not being too happy with my allocated room due to a strange musty smell, and the fact that I also wanted to be on the same floor as my friends. In my opinion the hotel was rather expensive, but I guess you are paying for the location and given that it was my first time in America I have nothing to compare it with. Would I recommend the Michelangelo? Yes, without doubt. The location is perfect for sightseeing and most of the staff I interacted with were very polite, friendly, helpful and accommodating. It's a shame the hotel rooms don't have tea and coffee making facilities but perhaps that is common for rooms in American hotels. However when we enquired about this, the staff provided us with a tea/coffee making machine. They clearly care about making sure their guests are happy and comfortable. Staying at the Michelangelo made my New York holiday all the more enjoyable and memorable, I only wish I'd been able to stay for longer.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: First time in New York and always nervous how our hotel will turn out in a new city.  We were not disappointed, based on TripAdvisor we chose The Michelangelo in the theater district of Manhattan. The rooms are spacious, very clean & a European ambiance. The hotel does not have a formal dining room but for breakfast and lunch and late night dining, is offered in the Wine/Cocktail bar which was perfectly fine. There are plenty of fine dining restaurants within walking distance (few blocks) of the hotel.  We would definitely return.

title: MOSTLY EXCELLENT
text: Room was find except for convenient outlets near bed or desk to charge devices.  Room furnishings seemed a bit dated. Size of room great.  Always like staying at Michelangelo’s and breakfast staff the tops.

title: Perfect in every way!!!!
text: Frankly, this hotel is way above my price range, however, I just can’t stay away. It is GORGEOUS!!!!!!  And, Very High End!!!!  The lobby is amazing, the rooms are large with luxury bedding and window treatments, robes, walk-in closet, amazing luxury bathrooms. Incredibly nicely located.  Half a block from RADIO CITY MUSIC HALL, a short walk from the stores of 5th Avenue. This is the most fabulous hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel staff is so accommodating and fantastic, I am now hopelessly spoiled!!!!!  A special thanks to Chester who holds our luggage just before and just after check in and check out allowing us to get the most out of our time in the city.  Chester also gets us a taxi and loads our luggage so graciously. We are SO appreciative, and can’t wait for our next trip!!!!

title: Classy hotel
text:
Nice lobby with marble floors for visiting or reading or just hanging out.
Very large rooms by NYC standards.
A good,location, with an easy walk to Theatres and museums, and Central Park, without being in the middle of the Times Square craziness.
Very friendly staff.

title: Very nice but showing its age
text: The Michelangelo has always been a good value and hidden gem in midtown, but now they have raised their prices to the point where the glory days are over and you might as well stay elsewhere. The value is no longer there for this slightly dated hotel in a slightly rugged location.  Not what it once used to be.... but still very decent & respectable.  Expect to give your wallet.

title: Painting Lounge
text:
Such an amazing experience! Came here for a random date night and it transorformed into celebrating my best friend forever mothers birthday and had a blast!

Our instructor, was so patient.Her step by step directions helped me turn my blank canvas into a work of art.

The Painting Lounge is ideal for almost any occasion: date night, birthday, or chilling with friends. Regardless of what occasion brings you here, Paint Night is sure to be a relaxing and satisfying experience.

I highly recommend coming here!

You get exactly what you bargain, plus more! and it is a fun and efficient process that builds the anticipation. 

The group was fun and got a little bit social at the end of the evening.

We enjoyed ourselves. The BYOB makes it more relaxed. Although i didn't bring any, Management and the hotel made sure my glass was always full..6 glasses total *coughs*

Overall in the end, Walking out with our artworks makes the evening a nice unforgettable memory.

title: Wonderful Stay At This Beautiful Hotel
text: My partner and I spent two nights here and had a wonderful time. Our suite was beautiful with dramatic Italian decor and two bathrooms. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room had everything we could possibly need. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. As soon as you walk in the door of the hotel you are greeted with a lovely scent and the grand entrance is very opulent and unique. The location is perfect and despite being so central the room was very quiet. The breakfast and dinner options are great and the waiters are fabulous. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.

title: Great food,good taste friendly
text: I stay there one night find the hotel nice and warm,very attractive location easy to travel to other places,convenient and friendly and helpful staff.Breakfast was excellent.Highly recommend!Menu has multiple selective enjoy the bread butter yogurt parfait and omelette

title: Enjoyable stay at The Michelangelo
text: This is a smaller friendly hotel with impeccable service.  We asked for a quiet room and that is what we received.  The room was spacious and well appointed.  Service from the doormen,  to the onsite restaurant and the front desk was always polite, helpful and  excellent.  Concierge was extremely knowledgeable about New York City and how to get around.  Restaurant was elegantly decorated and food was delicious.

title: Excellent stay
text: Quiet and peaceful in a very convenient location. Room was spacious and very clean. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Centrally located so very easy to get to shopping, dining and theaters. Will definitely be back.

title: Spacious but very average grand one bedroom suite
text: Recently, three of us stayed in the grand one bedroom suite. Living room has a large sofa (but not a sofa bed). The two rooms have nice furnitures but dated. Having 1.5 bathrooms was a plus. Shower pressure was good but slow drain. Musky old smell in the master bath room was quite disappointing. Found some errors on the bills when checked out but took a few days to get the credit back. Our hotel stay was just an average.

title: Great location but some disappointments
text:
Pros: 
1) Perfect location near Times Sq and central park 
2) Stylish interior decor.

Cons
1) Annoying ‘residency’ charge of $48 per night. What even is a residency charge?When I pay for a hotel room surely I am paying to reside in it??
2) Appalling and very irritating WiFi. There were 4 of us in a family room and the WiFi limits you to 4 devices. We had phones and IPads so we’re constantly having to sign out and in again
3) Overly noisy air con 
4) Questionable electric sockets which felt very loose

title: Lovely!
text: Perfect location and lovely room. Relaxed atmosphere but with the luxury you want after a day on the streets in NYC. Room had lots of space to relax. Staff all very helpful and friendly. Will be back!

title: Hidden gem in NYC!
text: What an incredible experience staying at the Michelangelo hotel over the weekend. We stayed there for a couple of days and felt welcomed and pampered from the moment we stepped in the lobby. The staff especially Juan, Edwin, and Carol were delightful and warm. The hotel is luxurious but not ostentatious! It’s close to broadway and Central Park and very easy to get on the subway.

title: PERFECT home away from home
text:
This hotel is a sanctuary...it's locatin in a very busy Times square is very deceiving in that when u walk into the lobby u find PEACE n QUIET...truly a paradise!!  The staff always welcomes u like family.
The location is perfect for walking to so many NYC attractions!  TRULY perfection!!

title: Great Location, comfortable and quiet room
text:
We couldn't have been more pleased. The location was in the Theatre District, so close to shows and restaurants. Close enough to Times Square but not too close. There were several subway stations within a couple of blocks which made it easy to go most anywhere. The room itself was spacious and comfortable (especially for Manhattan). It was also surprisingly quiet. Not a lot of street noise (again especially for Manhattan). The room was very nice as well. Loved the water pressure and heat. 

Staff was very friendly and helpful (except for the bartenders who always seemed too bothered to do anything - and we were simply asking for a bottled water). But outside of that everything was wonderful. I would highly recommend and would definitely stay there again.

title: One of my favorite hotels in New York!!
text:
I love everything about this hotel, it is very spacious, beautiful and first class white glove all the way!  
 We stay here every time we are in New York!  My only gripe is why are you charging for coffee!!  It should be free, not $6.00!

title: Fantastic location
text: Staff was nice and polite, and the rooms were clean and well maintained. It's in a great location if you're visiting NYC for the Broadway shows. The hotel also sits only a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: It's a great location for theater going and a quiet retreat from the frenzy of the city.  The rooms are spacious and very well kept.  The staff is friendly and extremely helpful.  The elevators respond quickly.  It's a very comfortable base of operations if you're visiting mid-town.

title: Amazing value, location and service
text: I love the 51 st and 7th area! The hotel rooms were renovated and large. The service made the stay. The front desk folks are amazing! Nothing was too hard to solve and always with a smile.  There is evening turn down service which is important to me and they always put ice int he bucket! Little things count. Excellent bed and pillows

title: Our hotel experience at the Michelangelo Hotel
text: hotel needs refurbishment  and advertises a no smoking hotel, even though our first room smelled like cigarette smoke.  Carpeting in rooms is spotted and dirty.  Lack of a feeling of security with one night no one at the front doors or at the front desk.  The rooms are large and so are the bathrooms.  Toilets are way to low for older adults and should be replaced.  Some of the staff were very nice.

title: Always a good experience
text: Not much to say except how its always a good experience to stay at the Michelangelo when we go to NYC. Took the train up from DC, went to a couple of plays, had some good food. Overall a perfect short vacation.

title: Midtown Manhattan Gem
text: The Michelangelo is a nice boutique hotel about midway between Times Square and Central Park on the west side. The rooms are nice and spacious and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. One of my favorites there is Henry Diaz. There probably isn’t anything he wouldn’t do to make your stay more enjoyable. There is a full service bar and restaurant in the lobby. I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great visit to NYC, loved the staff!
text: We really enjoyed the staff at this hotel. They were all personable and friendly, especially our friend Henry! We loved speaking with all of them during breakfast, and they even let us borrow umbrellas when it was pouring rain. They also gave a nice little cake to my sister for her birthday 😊 very happy with the customer service here.

title: Exceptional Service
text: Was very impressed with the Michelangelo, particularly its level of service.  Was treated exceptionally well at check-in, but a long-time business traveler comes to expect that,  But that level of service was maintained, if not excelled, throughout my stay.  It was the small things, like the bartender remembering my name and favourite drink two days later, to random staff pushing elevator Up buttons while passing by in the lobby, to receiving a sincere apology from another staffer about having a loose piece of litter on the floor of the elevator we shared (which he immediately picked up).  While the furnishings are perhaps not as polished as those at a Four Seasons or Peninsula Hotel, the way a guest is treated is certainly on that par.

title: Viihtyisä viiden tähden hotelli
text: Tähtiensä arvoinen hotelli. Erittäin hyvällä paikalla Keskuspuiston ja Times Squaren välimailla. Hotelli oli rauhallinen, huoneeni oli 51 Streetin puolella eikä ääniä kantautunut huoneeseen satunnaista ambulanssin ääntä lukuunottamatta. Muista huoneista tai käytävältä ei kuulunut hiiskaustakaan. Huone oli iso, siisti ja viihtyisästi kalustettu. Paikat olivat puhtaat ja hyvässä kunnossa pienestä kuluneisuudesta huolimatta. Tekniikkaa oli riittävästi ja TV sekä netti toimivat moitteetta. Henkilökuntaa pitää kehua, vastaanotto oli todella ystävällinen ja kaikkia asioita käsiteltiin yhtä palvelualttiisti. Todella mukavia ihmisiä ovimiehestä manageriin, eikä missään kohtaa tuntunut teennäiseltä. Italialaistunnelmaan oli pyritty ja päästy, aula ja yleiset tilat tuntuivat kruusauksesta huolimatta jopa kodikkailta. Käyn toistekin.

title: Wonderful experience
text: This was one of our stay in NYC ever. Wonderful staff,room services were great and the breakfast at the restaurant in the front lobby was excellent. Shoutout to Henry for taking care of us.will surely stay there again.

title: Great Location, A Little Tired
text: Michelangelo's greatest selling point is its location, just walking distance from the theatres and shopping spots. The rooms are extremely large by New York standards, but could use a little updating, specially the floors.

title: Great Hotel, Better Staff!!
text:
We have been staying at the Michelangelo  2 or 3 times a year for last 15-20 years.  The Hotel itself is beautiful, it's in the perfect location for Broadway shows.  It's nice to have a stress free walk to all the theaters and not have to worry about traffic. Rooms are large, comfortable and well laid out.  

Again, the hotel itself is amazing but the staff is even better.  Henry has been providing us with exceptional service for years and always has a smile on his face and no request is too much trouble.  Come to think of it, when we first came to the Michelangelo, Henry was the reason we rebooked there on our next trip.  At this point the Michelangelo has become our Home in NYC,  there is no thought involved, If we're going to NYC we're booking at the Michelangelo.  This time we took our 3 Nieces/Nephew to discover NYC and by the end of the trip Henry was on a first name basis with them as well.  Can't wait to come back!!

title: Charming gem amidst the crowds
text: Our family had a lovely stay in this great hotel, which was surprisingly quiet despite being right off Times Square. Good sized room, comfortable beds, roomy bath area made our stay very pleasant. Lovely breakfast lounge, too, with a friendly and helpful young woman managing the tables and staff. Highly recommend!

title: Exceeded expectations
text:
The Michelangelo is a classic style hotel.  Unlike many older hotels it is very clean and well maintained.  We chose it because the room sizes were more substantial than other NYC hotels at this price point.  The room exceeded our expectations, huge and very well furnished, and very quiet bearing in mind the central location.  The mattress was the most comfortable I have experienced for a long time.  It would have been nice if tea/coffee making facilities had been included in the room.

The staff were on the whole excellent.  I had a delivery arranged and they called me immediately after they had taken receipt of the package.  Likewise an issue with the room (my fault) was resolved within minutes.  Reception and doormen were always engaging and helpful.

I most certainly would return to the Michelangelo and  not consider alternatives.

title: Great location and lovely staff, but take care with the electrical outlets.
text: This is a grand-dame hotel. The location of this property makes it central to everything, being on 51st street near 7th Ave. The decor is elegant, the staff outstanding, and every effort is to make your stay as pleasant as possible. If eating breakfast downstairs, go early as seating is limited. Our room was slightly older, and I had one issue with a sparking outlet that didn't care for sharing space with my iPhone charger, so do be careful.

title: Birthday weekend
text:
I have stayed at this property in the past and it was great. This time hotel fell short!! Check in clerk (Angel) was great, check out clerk (Walter) great as well. 
Reserved the One Bedroom Grand Suite, was assigned #628 room is outdated and ZERO views all windows in this suite faced walls which made this suite VERY DARK... especially for a $500 a night suite. 
Had a situation in regards to a request made upon my reservation, upon entering room request was not fulfilled, I brought it up to the female desk clerk and male clerk and I was made to feel as if it was my fault that my request was not fulfilled.

title: Great location.
text:
Fabulous location - making most key sites walkable. Friendly staff. 
Very clean room, great maid service.
We had an inner room which was very dark but nicely laid out and a good size. 
The air con is ridiculously noisy and the rooms are pretty hot. 
Not a room we wanted to spend much time in but a great base for sightseeing.

title: Quite satisfied overall & great location
text:
I had not been to NYC in a long time and this hotel came highly recommended to me by my boss.  I was very impressed by the warm greeting provided by Asha at the Front Desk and the room was very comfortable and quiet.  
Gerard in the lounge was also very warm, welcoming and friendly, the fresh Cavatelli with Sausage & Kale was mouth wateringly delicious, and he shared some great stories with us about the fresh Limoncello that came with our dessert.
I found the service to be first rate, the room attendants were courteous and professional, we could walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, the subway and I would definitely stay at this property again.  If you are looking for a first class hotel in the city, I highly recommend The Michelangelo - it's quite a little gem!

title: WoW !
text:
Renaissance.... pendant un long roadtrip.... 
une halte parfaite :)
Hôtel très bien situé à quelques pas de la 5th avenue, de Times Square..... 
service de voiturier rapide disponible.... 
personnel efficace.... Suite très propre même si elle est un peu vintage... 
Du cosy, de la sérénité... 
Tout est très facile au Michelangelo....
une literie exceptionnelle..... une salle de bain hyper pratique..... J’AIME !! Rétro à souhait mais terriblement cosy !

title: Ausser der Lage leider enttäuschend
text: Wir hatten das Hotel aufgrund seiner guten Lage & der eigentlich guten Bewertungen ausgewählt.
