Ja, die Lage ist absolut top (Nähe zum Central Park & zu mehreren Linien der U-Bahn), der Rest war leider eine Enttäuschung. Das Personal an der Rezeption war sehr kühl, das Zimmer schon etwas abgewohnt und teilweise schmuddlig (Flecken am Teppichboden, Bettlaken mit mehreren Löchern & Rissen sowie Flecken auf der Bettdecke). Das Bad entsprach mit dem Duschvorhang & der Badewanne nicht dem heutigen Standard & schon gar nicht dem eines Vier Sterne Hotels. Zimmerreinigung: Das Auffüllen des Duschgels klappte nicht immer & bei der Ankunft fehlte das 2. Paar Schlappen. Was mich persönlich stark störte da wir relativ viel Sport machen & ein Fitnessstudio für mich ebenfalls ein wichtiges Auswahlkriterium war: Kein Hygienespray im Fitnessraum. Die Geräte sahen teilweise entsprechend aus. Musste mehrmals an der Rezeption angefragt werden & dauerte einige Tage bis sich hier etwas bewegte. Empfehlen würde ich dieses Hotel nicht.

title: Super Location
text: In the heart of midtown, easy to walk all directions and find things to do.  We just stayed here for the eighth time.  Consistently good experiences.  Super friendly staff.  We had a lovely room, very clean.

title: Vacation in Newyork
text: If you are looking for a good quality hotel in mid-town New York you can not go wrong with the Michelangelo.  Fantastic location just off Broadway and between Rockefeller center.  It is clean, staff are very helpful, beds were excellent and despite being in centre of Newyork I slept very well and it was quite.  Exceptional and will be first choice on another trip to Newyork.

title: Prime location & classic NYC vibes
text: I love this hotel! I stayed here for my bachelorette weekend because the location is central to everything! If you are looking for a hotel that represents the classic Italian history of New York (with modern amenities) then I highly recommend this hotel! The interior is incredible and the rooms were spacious, comfortable, and clean. The views were amazing and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. I can’t wait to come back!

title: Great stay, clean and close to everything in Mid-town Manhattan
text: Great place.  It was very clean and close to all the best attractions.  Only downside is they have a residence fee for the privilege of using their amenities, non of which we used.  But our room was great and both my husband and I slept great.

title: Weekend visit
text: Came in to see show for wife’s birthday. Hotel is older but well maintained and rooms are plush and large. Food is limited and only fair, but very expensive... simple breakfast for two was $70.00. I was hit with a hidden residential fee of $42.00 per night on checkout. In spite of this, my wife and I will return because our overall experience was very good.

title: Superb Hotel
text:
The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square.  The subway station close by, the subway is easy to navigate, cheap and way faster than cabs.

The hotel itself is spotless, rooms are spacious and have great facilities.  The staff are polite, attentive and helpful.  The hotel manager, Marco, is the same as his staff, a great example of leadership.

I will definitely stay when I visit NYC again, would highly recommend.

title: Great place to stay
text: Had a wonderful 3day stay here with my daughter, staff so friendly and helpful, especially the doormen. Lovely room, spoilt by the not very nice view from the window, have to close the blinds, so we really did not know what the weather was like in the morning. Another comment, toilet roll holder is too far away from the toilet, should be a little nearer, other than that will definitely return

title: Theater trip
text: Stayed for two nights. Great location easy to walk to Times Square, Broadway,  Hells Kitchen. Everyone was great that works there, very helpful, always a good morning and can I help you with anything,  good evening and have a great night out, can I help you with anything.  Very attentive doormen, helpful with directions and hailing cabs and suitcases. Thanks.  Highly recommend this hotel for these reasons alone.

title: Exceptionnel
text: Franchement très bien. Pour notre 1ère fois à New-York on ne regrette pas du tout. La situation est vraiment top. Le personnel très très agréable. La chambre est spacieuse et propre. Les prestations sont au rdv. C'est dans son jus. Vieil hôtel mais modernisé. On est sur du 5* quand même !!! On le recommande vivement.

title: Best Hotel experience I have ever had!!!
text: As I travel to NYC often, I have to say this is the absolute best hotel experience I have ever had. We had to wait a few minutes before checking in because of a new air conditioner being installed and we were given a bottle of wine (even thought I don't drink alcohol). The staff on all levels were extremely courteous and friendly and bent over backwards to make sure our stay was comfortable. This is the absolute best customer service I have ever experienced. When we were leaving, it was pouring down rain and the doorman guarded our bags when I went to the garage to get the car. He even went half way down the block to help when I was not able to pull up in front of the hotel. The room was so clean and with the best amenities ever- the beds were especially comfortable. I wil definitely book here again. Thanks you to all who made our stay so memorable.

title: Always Exquisite
text: This is our 9th stay here, and there is a reason we keep coming back. There is not a better value for a spacious, comfortable, well appointed, suite in the city. But, what makes it extra special are the people who work here. Henry, the doorman, is the most gracious host a person could hope for. He is always smiling and helpful. On our way to dinner each night, we always say, we hope Henry is working tonight.

title: Superior boutique hotel in the heart of NYC!
text: Walking into the Michelangelo is a luxurious respite in the heart of NYC!  From the doormen (Henry) to  housekeeping, front desk to waiters, the staff truly works to make your stay as comfortable as possible.  Don't stay anywhere else!

title: Perfect stay
text: Had a great time. Staff was excellent. Really nice hotel. Perfect location. Can’t wait to stay there again only a few blocks from theater district and Times Square  plenty of restaurants and coffee shops

title: The Perfect Home in NYC
text:
The hotel offers outstanding room service, always on time.
The rooms are comfortable and have everything you would want.
Excellent house keeping.
Perfect location.
Henry and many others on the staff are so helpful.

title: Excellence in a superb location!
text: Recently had the pleasure of staying at the Michelangelo while in town for a dance competition at a venue in Times Square. This will now be the only hotel I would consider in the area - it is that good! Staff is phenomenal, rooms and bathrooms are clean and spacious and extremely well-appointed. Building is beautiful, and both the snacks and the breakfast we had were quite good. They even graciously accommodated a request for late check-out due to our dance competition schedule. I cannot think of a single thing I would change about the experience here. The location is only a couple blocks from all the action in Times Square, and the value you get for your money is unbeatable. Kudos to absolutely every single member of the staff we encountered here - I cannot recommend this place highly enough!

title: Very clean and spacious
text: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel.  The room and bathroom were very spacious.  It was in a great location between Central Park and Time Square.  I would definitely stay here again when traveling for pleasure.

title: A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE
text: When planning a trip to NYC for a long weekend, my friend told me he had stayed at the Michaelangelo many times in the past, and suggested it for our visit.  From the moment we arrived, we were taken care of with valet parking, the doormen, one of which was Teodoro, but they were all very  friendly and helpful.  We had requested an early check-in, which was available, and a beautiful suite. Breakfast was included in our stay, and the service was great.  Housekeeping did a wonderful job. The location can't be beat, as it is convenient to Broadway, where we saw three shows that weekend.  I look forward to returning!

title: Wonderful stay!
text: The staff at The Michelangelo are top notch! We had an exceptional stay in a one bedroom Grand Suite. The large room and two full baths were perfect for a family. Thank you to Vikram and all the hotel staff. We will definitely be back!

title: Two words:  Gérard Dis
text:
Having stayed at the Michelangelo twenty years ago, I expected the lushly appointed, quiet-as-tomb, marvelous location with pitch perfect service.  I was not disappointed.  The surprise was Gérard, the incredible bartender, who defied the stereotype of the sage listener by being so entertaining, he justified a trip to New York City by himself.  

My husband and I went to celebrate our tenth wedding anniversary in 1998 and returned for our thirty-first.  We saw Hamilton.  We saw Stephen Colbert.  I will tell my friends to see them.  I will also tell them to go to 51st street for Gérard, a raconteur of a very different sort, but worth finding at the Michelangelo.  

Breakfast on the premises is delightful.  The spacious room, sumptuous bed, and deep-to-your-chin soaking tub will provide a perfect ending to your day.  Housekeeping does a fabulous job.  But if you’re really lucky, Gérard will regale you, spinning a yarn about taming bears and making crêpes that you will remember long after you have forgotten your cocktail (he makes a killer Bloody Mary and the Riesling is flawless).  Book a room at the Michelangelo.

title: Large Rooms
text:
Nice hotel in a very good location.  Rooms and bathroom are large, especially for NYC!
Our carpet had several stains; one was the size of a baseball.  But otherwise, the rooms appeared very well kept.  No coffee maker in the room and the coffee in the lounge was quite expensive.

title: The Michelangelo is a peaceful refuge amidst the hustle of NYC.
text: I will definitely stay at the Michelangelo again when I return to NYC.  It was the best night's sleep I've ever had in NYC!  The food was great, we had breakfast and a late night snack.  The room was well appointed and beautiful! The staff was very accommodating and friendly!

title: MIchelango - Family Vacation
text: Amazing location and great service.  The breakfast add on was a great addition!  Enjoyed the evening bar credit so we could have a nightcap.  Friendly staff and very helpful. Rooms were clean and our Junior Suite was large and could easily accommodate our family of 3.

title: Quick weekend trip
text: I was in NYC for a quick business trip and based on the reviews picked the hotel. The hotel is ideally located in mid town close to Central Park and a lot of NYC attractions. The room, bathrooms were immaculate condition and the hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful. I will highly recommend the hotel

title: Rooms need renovation, lack cleanliness & poor working AC units.
text: Avoid Room #418:  The shower/bath tiles & grout have fungus and mold.  It's been along time since the bath tiles have been cleaned.  Door frame from the bathroom was in need of caulking and paint.  One window shade was completely broken and on the floor.  The TV was not working but only needed to be plugged in correctly something we should not have to worry about.  Our AC unit broke on the 2nd night and could not be fixed. The AC unit looked pretty old.  We had to move to a much smaller room because of availability issues and they would only give the Resort fee per night as credit.  Also avoid room #510:  The AC in that room broke too and we had to move our relatives to another room.  There was a shortage of bath & hand towels for whatever reason.  Our rooms would get cleaned around 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm and only when we complained.  The resort fee was supposed to be deducted from the bill.  When we got our bill management forgot to give us the deductions they were suppose to give us for our trouble.  We had to wait for management to be available to make the adjustment to our bill. Our whole family reserved 4 rooms and spend around $7500+ and only got around $360 credit for our trouble.  I believe this will be our first and last stay here.  Special note; the bellmen and bartenders were excellent.

title: A Gem in the City
text: My husband & I enjoyed our stay at The Michelangelo this past weekend.  Close to Times Square, but far enough to be away from the crowds and noise.  Large room compared to other in the city.  Staff was friendly and accommodated all of our needs.  Only one negative comment- there is a strong perfume scent in the lobby.

title: Henry the Bellman
text: Henry was very pleasant and had great conversation with us. He made sure our bags were taken care of and got us a taxi to the airport. Would highly recommend this hotel. The whole staff is wonderful and accommodating!

title: Outstanding value for NYC
text:
This hotel is an outstanding value located right near Time Square.  The rooms are clean and nice.  The reason I did not give it 5 stars is because:

--the fitness room is substandard--2 ellipticals and a tread mill--no real weights etc

--we asked for early check in and arrived at 10am and were told they would call us when the room was ready before 3pm check in--THEY NEVER CALLED

--they have no complimentary coffee in the lobby on Saturday morning and wanted to charge $6 a cup--really?--put out some coffee for your guests!!!

If u want good value near Time Square this is good

title: Superb hotel even in a blackout
text:
My teenage daughter and I stayed here for a weekend visit to NYC.
We were upgraded to a junior suite and loved the location and restaurant. 
We were there during this saturday’s 6 hour Manhattan blackout and the hotel’s generator meant we weren’t affected at all. 
Thank you for a lovely stay

title: Great location but...
text: The location of this property is terrific - close to theaters, restaurants and the subway.  The room was very spacious.  But.  The cleanliness of the carpeting, perimeter of the room, walls and bathroom floor and shower walls was sorely lacking.  No excuse for this.

title: Great Experience
text: Went with my wife to New York for her birthday. We love this hotel.   This is our second time and will continue to come here when we travel to New York.  This hotel is central to all of midtown locations.  1 block away from Broadway and just a few blocks away from time square.

title: Great property
text: Amazing hotel! Really enjoyed my stay and the location is pretty awesome - the heart of Manhattan. The staff was super friendly and helpful especially for confused tourists like me:))! Definitely recommend!!!

title: Wonderful Hotel In The Heart Of Times Square
text: My wife and I loved the Michelangelo. Perfect location in Times Square. And the Italian restaurant on premise is fantastic. The Assistant Hotel Manager, Casey, was a sweetheart and very accommodating.

title: A Hidden Gem
text: We were pleasantly surprised by so many things especially the size of our room.  We had a room with 2 king beds!  We weren't expecting to find that in NYC!  Everyone from the doorman to the front desk was extremely courteous and helpful. Its a beautiful classic hotel and is like an oasis in the middle of midtown...you don't even hear the noises from the street

title: Still The Best Place For Us
text:
We have stayed here several times and feel it is the best for our needs.  We like a quieter hotel away from the craziness just outside on Broadway.  We always get a suite with 2 baths which enables us to get ready at the same time.  Housekeeping is wonderful, they really clean the room, not just give it a cursory wipe down.  We were there 8 night and they even replaced our robes every 3 or so days so they were nice and clean. My favorite housekeeper Susana was there and I got to say hello to her.
She is has been there for many years and is just lovely.  

 They now have a  nominal residence fee added to your bill.  Part of it gives you a credit toward your beverage, either coffee in the morning or a drink in the bar. Even with that fee it is still a good value in NYC

 I see another guest was not pleased that they were told not to make noise in the lobby.  The staff making sure that the lobby is enjoyable and quiet for all the guests is what makes this place so special.  I know Walter, he is great.  I am sure he was trying to ensure others were not disturbed.  The lobby is a great place to relax, visit with friends, or enjoy a drink without unwanted annoyances.  The Michelangelo is like a home away from home for us.

title: Very good hotel bus a rude guest service agent
text: The Hotel os very confortable and very well localed. Room service is excellent. The only bad thing was that I was playing with an electric toy in the lobby of the hotel and Mr. Walter Faranda, without even assessing what the toy was about, in a very rude way, forces me to stop using the toy. I understand that there may be security reasons but Mr. Faranda's rudeness is unacceptable. if this man was not in the hotel for sure I give the 5 stars to the hotel.

title: Beautiful Classic Hotel
text: This hotel is located in the Times Square area and is a classic old hotel.  The lobby is small but very nice.  The rooms are located down a catacomb of hallways, much like many old hotels in large cities.  My room was very large and perfectly functional.  The decor was old and beautiful. The bathroom was  not ‘new’ and sort of plain.  What I liked was the hotel was very quiet and despite being full, seemed very calm. This is quite different than most Times Square hotels.  This was an excellent value.

title: Great Stay
text: This is a lovely hotel and I had a very spacious king room. The restaurant/lounge area in the lobby had very good food and drinks. It was convenient to the theaters but just far enough from Times Square to be quiet, yet had everything around that you could possibly need.

title: Great Hotel
text: Hotel is in a great location, near theaters, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and subway stations. Rooms are  extremely large for NYC.  Bed was comfortable  and room extremely quiet, unable to hear any hall or outside noise.

title: Fantastic location and a luxurious comfortable stay
text:
We stayed 6D/6N and it was very comfortable,  and spacious for a NYC hotel room.  

The location was fantastic because it was walking distance to many theaters and fine restaurants,  We did not even have to take the subways.  And not too far from the jazz clubs which we went to by Lyft.

Our room has a king-sized bed, a mini fridge, a chest of drawers with plenty of space, a writing desk with chair, in a corner a large soft armchair with a standing lamp behind, a spacious wardrobe with iron/board, a room safe, 2 baggage rests;  there is even a nook with a make-up/vanity mirror, built-in table with a Bose radio/CD player, and a cushioned stool.  

The bath area was suitably roomy with hair dryer, enough counter top space for personal toiletries.  Under the counter top was a cushioned stool. The towels were thick and soft.  Bathrobes and bedroom slippers were also provided.  The hotel toiletries were of  good quality.

The ambiance of the hotel is old Italian luxury with emphasis on heavy ornate furniture and drapes and gilded lamps.   And it has only one F&B outlet  -  a bar which provides breakfast in the mornings, and bar snacks throughout the day.  Hence the lobby is rather pleasantly quiet unlike other big multi-roomed hotels with lobbies like Grand Central Station.

Service was friendly and efficient .  Housekeeping was excellent . 

However, we were a bit surprised by the resort tax of $50 a day.   We remembered paying a daily city tax during previous visits to NYC at other hotels.  And many hotels in Europe do impose a daily tourist tax on visitors, but $50 per day is still a lot.  Because of this I am rating value only a 4 instead of 5.

title: Worst hotel service/valet parking service
text: If you care about your time, we recommend not to stay in this hotel. We chose to use their valet parking service for convenience and efficiently by paying extra money. It was the worst experience ever we had. We wasted our time at the city just waiting for our car to show up. It took an average of 45min for them to bring our car. The parking lot was right next to the hotel! We stayed there two nights and both times, we had to wait outside without any explanation. Just waiting. When we finally went to talk to a hotel manager, he said there was nothing they can do and told us to wait. We frequently travel and enjoy staying at a hotel, but this was the first time we regretted our choice and had a strong urge to write a bad/honest review of our unpleasant experience.

title: Michelangelo hotel
text: Nice hotel. great location overall  good experience . The only issue is resort fee. Not really sure why as I used nothing or not sure what it covers. Everyone was nice and staff pleasant.  Clean and pretty hotel

title: Unbelievable rooms in the heart of NYC
text: Last year we found the amazing hotel.  After going to New York City for five years for our daughters national dance convention my wife found the Michelangelo.  We just returned from a 10 day trip staying at the Michelangelo.  Previously we had stayed at the Sheridan, packed in like sardines.  The rooms at the Michelangelo are amazing, The staff is extremely friendly and the elevators are quick.  Our room which I believe was a standard room had a desk, a love seat, a chair, an extra large chest of drawers and room for the requested refrigerator, and believe it or not a roll away twin bed and we still had room to walk around the room.  The bathroom had a separate shower and toilet area from the vanity, again with plenty of room.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Home away from home
text:
We also stay at Michaelangelo Hotel when in the city! They have a great selections of rooms. Cesear, is amazing staff member who always remembers us by name. He greats us with a smile and a hug! 
I do wish the breakfast service was more efficient.

title: a bit disappointed with service
text:
The room and lobby were very spacious, quiet, and luxurious and the location is very central for midtown tourist attractions.

We had booked a room for 4 people with 2 king beds. Our room was not ready until 4:30 so we left to sight-see, but upon return, we were told that the room we reserved had been given to someone else and we would have 2 queens instead. This made our sleep much less comfortable and we were not offered anything to make up for the inconvenience.

In addition, there were not enough towels for the four of us and we felt that the front desk staff were rather cold and aloof when we asked for more.

There is no coffee in the room, and the $10 beverage credit is not enough for two cups of the outrageously-priced coffee in the lobby, which feels stingy. (However, the woman serving coffee at the bar in the morning was the one person we encountered at the hotel who was actually warm and amiable.)

Overall, while it has some virtues, we found it to be a very formal and not especially friendly hotel.

title: Great location
text: We had a 36 hour layover in nyc and wanted to see 2 shows.  We wanted to be close to everything and the michaelangelo fit the bill.  The rooms are a decent size by nyc standards.  The lobby and downstairs bar are perfect for a drink before or after the show.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay !
text:
Great Hotel near Time Square and Central Park. Room was super cleaned, comfortable and good view. Very fast and friendly check in. Everybody from housekeeper to the bar was professional and hospitable.
Raccomanded.

title: Perfect Hotel
text: Very nice hotel ,perfect service ,good location very close to Times Sq Made it very easy for us to use hop on hop off and also all restaurants are nearby ,the bar at the hotel is great. Rooms are spacious

title: Awesome Hotel
text: What a great hotel , lovely property, perfect location , great staff , perfect room , great sizes ! I am not the quite a city person but I got the much needed space and pampering in the middle to Manhattan

title: Hidden Paradise in NY
text: Great location, quiet and very good rooms. Staff is great, specially at beakfast. Relax and work, this is a place to always come back. It is a good place for vaccation and for convention. Internet works well with no extra charge.

title: Great Customer Service
text: This hotel is amazing. Goes above and beyond to accommodate you during your stay.  They upgraded us at no extra charge. Check-in was so easy. Room was clean and large I highly recommend this hotel.  The service was Great.

title: Another great New York stay !
text: I continue to return to the Michelangelo Hotel due to the great service, beautiful hotel, and superior service.  Marco and his team do a wonderful job, and one has to wonder in New York City, how they can stand out to personalize your stay to the point of feeling welcomed and valued as a return client.  This hotel has excellent leadership.

title: What a gem
text: Great location; great room; great service; GREAT rate.  Over the top value.  Only regret is that we hadn't discovered it years ago!  Will DEFINITELY be back, again, again and again. Probably the best value in the city that I have found.  Thank you!

title: Great Hotel close to everything!!
text: This hotel has a great location!! Right in the middle of everything you need, above the chaos of time square and close to the subway. The rooms are large and spacious and the staff is super helpful and friendly.

title: Culinary Instructor
text: Stayed one night to attend an event in the city.  Fantastic service.  I felt special.  They knew my name and acknowledged my special requests.  The room was beautiful, spacious and clean.  Definitely, I will go back.

title: 3rd visit n still great
text: this time I got a standard room facing 7th avenue. I thought it will be noisy but wow, what windows. As a business traveller, that was a great benefit. Super quiet. Staff was good, eager to help. Had the french press coffee in the morning- it is really good. I think this is my go to hotel now for NYC,

title: Warm and welcoming in Times Square
text: Doorman were pleasant and welcoming as you entered into the peaceful quiet from the bustle of Times Square. Friendly and efficient staff in the lobby bar. Well looked after and clean areas. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Greatest Hotel YET!
text: My Stay in New York city couldn't have been any better. The staff of The Michelangelo Hotel made my experience in New York city very pleasant. They went above and beyond to always make me feel at home. staff was very friendly and the hotel was very well kept. Their customer service was  "A" quality. will most definitely stay with them again.

title: Great hotel and location. Restaurant/Bar was particularly enjoyable
text: My family stayed there for a long weekend. We've stayed at many mid-town hotels over the years for business and personal trips. This is now one of our favorites. The rooms are clean and large. Among other nice experiences, Gerard, the bartender sung (in French) to our young daughter (who's learning French). We booked directly through the hotel's website and feel like we got a reasonable price for 2 rooms. The package deal included a drink credit and free breakfast. The breakfast credit was ultimately applied, but the process was a little clunky (wait staff were very helpful, but didn't know how to apply the credit). We plan to stay here again. We were very happy with the overall experience.

title: It’s the BEST
text: I have not one complaint!!!  AMAZING!!! This place was so awesome, especially EVERY staff member I came in contact with.  Willie, Jackie and the afternoon Bar server, the most friendly people I’ve ever met.  The bellmen, the room, front desk staff, LOCATION... all AWESOME!!  This place rocked everything I hoped our NYC hotel would.  Honored my request for high floor. I would highly suggest staying here, especially if you have a teenager that will want to walk to Time Square at least 3 times a day!!!  Short walk to EVERYWHERE.  We were literally 3 short blocks (3 min) to Time Square an two long blocks to 5th Ave (8 min walk) shopping.  I will defiantly stay here next time!!

title: Great Location But Could Provide More & Useful Amenities
text: As I was aware upon leaving they charge you $192.50 for what they say for amenities. The only amenities I could have used is the $10 drink ticket but I don't drink so it was useless. A Hotel like this for this charge should give you a daily paper and have free coffee available in the lobby or a pot in your room. Instead, they place these drinks and snacks in your room hoping you will consume them so they charge you an enormous price. The room is very roomy but the bathroom door slides open instead of having a door and this sucks! The room was clean and the bed was outstanding- I slept like a baby! The staff were nice especially the bellhops. So again when you think you have a good price on their rooms remember to add $192.50 to your bill as explained in the small writing. Around the corner is a great place to eat the Majestic Deli, they serve good breakfast too and stay open till 1:00 AM. Again for a 5-star hotel, they offer little at the hotel in useful amenities! It probably has the most room space than other hotels in NYC and there is a safe in each room to use as most hotels have.

title: Very good but signs of deterioration from last visit
text:
It would have been a five, but the housekeeping was very haphazard (missing soap or gel or towels etc). Plus the quality of our daily coffee varied unacceptably! Luna makes the best.
But we were very grateful for an early checkin, the desk staff were always very pleasant and helpful. We were staying for six nights and were given a nice room in the depths, a good private and intimate feel with no noise. Their rooms are always spacious and well dimensioned, great bathtub. Location is so convenient.

title: Wonderful the Michelangelo hotel
text:
Very comfortable hotel in the hearth of Manhattan. The rooms are very spacious and all the spaces are very clean. All are very kindly. Very fast check-in and checkout. Very good the cockatil served by the bartender. 
Approved!

title: Room is not clean even on snack bar.It’s quite disappointed me.Atmosphere for overall is ok.
text: Room is not clean even on snack bar.It’s quite disappointed me.Atmosphere for overall is ok.location ok.Staffs there are bad when they expect tip from just arrived customer that sometime no change to t

title: visit to NYC
text: Great hotel, liked the value and location, nice staff. Henry was especially helpful and engaging. We were in a room that was amazingly quiet for NYC. We will definitely look at Michelangelo on our next trip to NYC.

title: Exceptional!
text: This hotel was perhaps the best place I stayed in all my years of traveling to the city. The service was phenomenal and I felt that I was special even with staying one night there. The staff noticed it was my birthday and provided some nice treats so I could celebrate! I really appreciated everything and would definitely stay here again.

title: Henry is the best!!!!
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel for our summer vacation, and it really was a pleasant stay. Henry did an amazing job helping us with all of our room details, luggage, etc. He always had a smile on his face and is definitely an asset to this hotel! We will be back to see you, Henry!! 

Doise family
Louisiana

title: Convenient to Times Square; excellent customer service
text: Room was large and bed was comfortable.  Bathroom had large tub with decent water pressure.  No view from room; hotel on lower levels of building.  No coffee maker in room.  Great fast customer service when we had a problem in the room.

title: Conveniente
text:
Local ideal para quem procura conforto e tranquilidade na cidade que não para um instante. Excelente atendimento em todos os tipos de serviços.
Este hotel fica próximo do central parque, da quinta avenida,carnage hall, time square, teatros da broadway etc.
Próximo a ele podem ser encontrados muito bons restaurantes e delicatessen.
Excelente hotel!

title: A beautiful hotel with a sense of luxury
text: The Michelangelo is perfect for any time of the year. It is in a central location in Times Square so you are in walking distance to most of the main attractions. This hotel is on the expensive side but worth it if you can spare the cash.

title: Generally a good stay with some problems
text: This is my favorite hotel in NYC. However, on this particular stay we ran into a few problems. On our first night at 2 am I woke up in a sweat only to discover our air conditioner was not working properly and our thermostat was broken. I called down to ask for someone to come up and help but was told there are no night shift maintenance staff at the hotel. An offer to switch rooms was made but my husband was in a deep sleep and i did not want to wake him so the hotel brought up a fan to circulate the hot air. The next morning it was fixed by the day time staff but no offer of compensation of any kind was made for our terrible first night. On our last morning I realized the maid had not left the condiment packs for coffee and called down to request that three packets be brought up.It took over 45 minutes and three calls to make that happen delaying my shower and cutting short our time to do some last minute souvenir shopping. Again no offer of compensation was made -- not even a complimentary coffee. Not the best stay this time. This used to be my favorite hotel but the Hotel has poor guest relations practices.

title: Great bar and staff!
text:
Luna at the bar was very helpful and friendly. Very attentive to customers. The pizza is a must have.
Great variety on the wine list. Overall great spot nearby Times Square for a quick bite and drink before a Broadway show.

title: Quality hotel with great NYC location
text: Have stayed at the Michelangelo on several occasions and enjoyed each stay.  The hotel is a quality hotel with a friendly and attentive staff.  Rooms are well maintained.  Great value in a great location to the theater district, central park and great restaurants.

title: Simply Amazing !!
text: Such an amazing place and highly recommend if you are looking to stay in NYC. The staff are attentive and made me feel right at home. The hotel is maintained wonderfully and the rooms were spacious and clean. It's hard to find good service but you will find it at The Michelangelo. I can't wait for my next trip I know where I will be staying!!

title: Over Charged
text: Over charged at check out. Bill was substantially higher than agreed figure at time reservation was made. Staff would not adjust overcharge despite proof that the agreed upon fee was significantly lower.

title: Good choice
text: They do a nice job. Great location and access to every everything in Midtown. Usually stay at Hilton but thought we would give it a try and were not disappointed. Bell staff was competent and attentive.

title: Wonderful Location, Great Staff
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend.  We went to see Hamilton, short walk from the hotel.  Staff helped us out with parking and our needs.  We did not breakfast there, but did enjoy a lovely cheese platter and drinks.

title: 3 rooms for 3 days
text: Make sure you have the room ready when the guests arrive.  Friends room had wet carpet and they had to put up with fans in the room for two days.  Not a first time good impression for them.  My room 610 was fine as usual, but, I felt badly for them, three sisters.  Edwards and Smith.  So I'm committing on their room.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: This is the third time I’ve stayed at this hotel with a group of friends. The rooms are enormous in comparison to most hotel rooms in New York City. Location is perfect for getting around town, the staff is more than happy to accommodate any and all of your needs. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable, and I have found that every time I have stayed at this hotel, I have slept better than I do at home! You’re in the middle of downtown Manhattan but for some reason there is no noise! It is my absolute favorite place to stay in the city. Special shout out to “Henry” who is always so helpful and accommodating.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Foyer was opulent, room was grand but had to upgrade to get daylight and lose some of the noise from the external air conditioning system.
The quality of staff ranged from one extreme to the other . One barmaid who during a 5 night stay served us on 3 occasions and managed to speak directly to us only once. She seemed more interested in chatting to her friend.  At the other end of the scale there was an exceptionally nice friendly guy who couldn't have been more helpful. From a lovely helpful female receptionist to a male one who preferred to address everyone in the foyer rather the person asking for help. From a doorman who watched us lift our cases up the stairs, didn't even bother to open the door to help to the chatty smily one where nothing was a bother. Customer care refresh training required for some..
On the day we checked out, we had housekeeping ringing the bell 3 times starting at 8am. No communication obviously between them and reception . Completely avoidable with good organisation.
Didn't spoil our stay in the city though, would choose a different hotel next time.

title: Jamie- Upstate NY
text: Excellent. Love the location. It’s central to everything we wanted to go see and was in walking distance. Staff was very friendly. Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. Wish we had a better view of the city (7th floor), but if that’s the worst complaint I had then their doing well.

title: New York
text: What a hidden gem, I went with my daughters, so we all shared a suite, it was beautiful. Very reasonably priced hotel. I would highly recommend to all. Very close to time square,Broadway and just a bus ride to most of the things you would like to see.

title: recent stay
text:
Nice room, good location, two windows none usable due neighbors, but one good to main street.  Very comfortable and GREAT room service by our housekeeping!!!
We will come back again due to the great staff and friendly atmosphere.  
HVAC not so great.  Fans on blowing 100% or off.  Got used to it.  Tough in a big building.

title: A Disappointing Stay
text:
This was our 3rd stay at the Michelangelo, and compared to the other two visits, this was a big disappointment. Upon check-in, we found that our bathroom had not been cleaned properly....there were several black human hairs in the tub, whether from a housekeeping staff member or the previous guest, it was not acceptable. 

When we returned to our room the following afternoon, none of the Keurig coffee supplies that we had used that morning had been taken away or replenished. 

After a day of sightseeing, we arrived back to our room the next afternoon to find that some of the used glasses, swizzle sticks, and wastebasket trash had not been removed, nor had the carpet been vacuumed. 

Each time that we talked to a hotel staff member at the front desk about the issues, they said they were sorry. 

The fact that the hotel bar ran out of several of the most popular brands of liquor by Friday, May 31, was the “icing on the cake”, so to speak.....especially when we found out from people who frequent the bar that this often happens by month’s end. We had planned to mention this to a manager, but by then we were just tired of complaining, and ready to leave. 

All of that said, the hotel’s location is wonderful, the staff is very friendly, and the rooms (although needing some freshening up and better wall plugs), are large by NYC standards. I’m just not sure that the positives outweighed the negatives enough for us to return again.

title: Busy location
text:
Just returned from 5 night stay with husband and son. 
Shown to the room. 2 double beds.. beds were on the small size of double. Corner room in 4th floor,so good views of the street. Quiet noisy even with the triple glazing. Quiet noticable was the absence of drink making facilities which should be standard in 4 star hotel. Mini bar eye wateringly expensive,  so our son was told  not  to  touch a thing. Nice touch was the mobile phone.. free international calls. This was to off set the daily hotel tax. 
Room cleaned lovely by Suzana. Beds turned back nightly. Nice touch. Ooms clean. Plug sockets a bit dated. Our chargers(uk) kept falling out. Didn't eat in at all but the menu wasn't extensive and as its on top of time square for eatreys, I'd say book room only.
Location good. Literally straight ahead Time square was 2 min walk,very very busy . Turn left Rockafella and St Patrick church no more than 5 min walk. Central park a nice 8 minute walk. Location couldn't be better for the theatre... 5 min to Broadway. Just be aware. Lots street traders selling bags watches, more bags CDs accosting you constantly in this area,  not so much of this further away from time square, so if that's ok, this hotel is for you. Turn left lots of bakerys for breakfast, again avoid time square for food. Overall good for first timers in New York.

title: Perfect Girls Trip
text: Henry our doorman was the BEST.  Hotel was great very accommodating was able to stow our luggage as we arrived considerable before check in and called us when our room was ready.  Steps to Times Square and Broadway.  We felt welcome without being smothered.  Clean and quiet even so close to Times Square.

title: Great location; very comfortable.
text: A beautiful hotel with a great location. The inside is surprisingly serene compared to the hustle and bustle of outside. Restaurant area is very nice. Rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly.

title: Fabulous hotel!!
text: My husband and I stayed at the Michaelangelo for Memorial Day weekend.  The hotel was beautiful, clean  and close to everything.  The staff could not have been friendlier.  This will be our hotel the next time we come to NYC and anytime we stay in the city.  Thank you guys so much for making our visit so special.

title: May 2019
text:
We have stayed at the hotel over 10 times in as many years.
I feel the central reservation system is not effective.  This is a small boutique type hotel and personal onsite service has always been a value..not so much any longer.
The bathrooms are very outdated.
When you finally get to the hotel all is good,

title: Great value, great stay
text: In town for the weekend for the Blue Note, Broadway & a race in Central Park. Great location as others have noted. Not bad walk if the weather is nice to/from Greenwich Village. Rooms are quite large by NYC standards and everyone was very attentive & friendly. This is a great value in midtown Manhattan. Will definitely stay here again

title: ANOTHER GREAT STAY AT THE MICHELANGELO HOTEL
text:
From my wife's and my arrival to our checkout, our current stay at The Michelangelo Hotel was flawless.  The Door and Bell staff - Henry, Caesar, Ney, Teodoro, Carlos - could not have been warmer, more friendly, or more welcoming.

Our reception and departure at Registration/Check-out was extraordinarily smooth, quick, and efficient.  Joseph and Walther are the quintessential pros at the Front Desk,

Lounge Servers, Jimmy, Carmen, Jackie, Jose' and Juan, are efficient and thorough, with the added quality of being welcoming, warm, and friendly.

Manager Dayo is everywhere but is completely discrete and unobtrusive.  Clearly, he is on top of everything. 

General Manager Vikram Sardama clearly sets the tone of The Michelangelo.  His personal welcome and concern for my wife's and my satisfaction were readily apparent.  It is no wonder to us why the staff, under his leadership, is second to none.

Our room - a Junior Suite - was exceptionally clean, well-maintained, roomy, and strikingly attractive.  We did not hear any external noise - either from within the hotel or from the street.  

Overall, this weekend's visit at The Michelangelo Hotel was great.  Of course, that is not surprising to us.  Each of our visits - time after time, year after year -  to The Michelangelo Hotel has been great.  It is what my wife and I have come to expect from The Michelangelo Hotel, and The Michelangelo Hotel has always exceeded our high expectations.

My wife and I will return soon.

title: It’s all in the deetails
text:
You’ll likely stay here because it is well-located Hotel for a reasonable walk to many destinations like Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and MoMA. Of course, a place with a name like The Michelango has marble - everywhere. The room has real glassware and striped wallpaper as is usual in hotels in this price range. The furnishing are appropriately themed and more upscale but the lighting is abysmal. The lamp on one nightstand is turned on with a rotary in-line switch on the cord that disappears out of reach and out of sight against the wall. The other lamp features the classic, socket-style switch tucked under the lampshade accessible by only someone with elfin hands. Not to worry, there’s plenty of light in the room courtesy of the Barclay’s multi-story, LED billboard that shines incessantly through the inadequate curtains. The bathroom has a tub versus a walk-in shower and you might consider avoiding rooms with a tub unless you’re gymnastically inclined as the step-over is high and wide. The water pressure was fine and the dual-head shower is a nice touch but the soap dish holds water so the next time you use the soap it’s water-logged mess and blown up like an 8-day toad. Please, explain why any hotel has an iron and ironing board, nowadays? Maybe it’s for the same, non-existent crowd of travelers who would use the available, in-room, ‘Handy Smart Phone’ or the Play-Skool inspired alarm clock radio. The room didn’t have a coffee maker so you were forced into going without or getting up, getting dressed and schlepping down to the lobby for obscenely priced food and beverage items from the lounge food area. $5 dollars for a carafe of hot water for tea is a tax on convenience and a proper gouging. ‘Anywhere but Here’ is the takeaway for food and beverage at the MIchelango. As you come and go from the Hotel, several things are notable, the staff is friendly, the lobby is fumigated with a choking scent and the elevator can be accessed by anyone with the hight and a finger to push the buttons. When you get to your floor, be prepared for the maze that awaits you. The short, zig-zagging hallways might seem baffling but they have the benefit of dampening the sounds of people in the hall so the room was quiet save for the siren soundtrack that is NYC. I wanted to like this room but the disconnect between the price, amenities and miscues with the detail left me disappointed.
The folks operating the Starwood Hotel chain need to stop claiming to, “…get the details right..” Too many little things, let’s call them ‘details’, are amiss to warrant the prices charged. This corporate branding is lazy and cynical. I find it both comic and criminal that a Hotel chain that purports to be upscale, can fail to offer me a coffee maker but will give me an iron and a worthless, pesdo-smartphone. Offering guests things they don’t want and wouldn’t use, then padding the amenities list with these garbage bullet points is maddeningly absurd. One of the details I’m going to get right the next time I travel is to avoid Starwood Resorts. 
Luxury pricing for budget amenities is a poor value.

title: Always a great stay athe Michelangelo
text: I've stayed here each of the last 5 years and the hotel, staff and amenities are always top notch.  Rooms are spacious, clean, food and restaurant staff are friendly and helpful.  I always enjoy coming back to the Michelangelo

title: Dated in midtown
text:
We used American Express platinum travel to book this property.  Let me be clear - the staff is  great and responsive, from the front desk to housekeeping.  Five stars.

The property itself is in need of a refresh.  Our suite had stains on the carpet and furniture.  The bed wasn’t a caliber commensurate with what we expected.  It needs carpet, paint, flooring, drapes and fixtures to be worthy of four stars.  Hard to know clean because worn doesn’t look clean.

If your going to stay here make sure you get a good rate.  Location is good.

title: The Michelangelo Hotel continues to be a gem.
text: The staff at The Michelangelo makes you feel welcome.  Everyone is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The location, just above Tines Square and near the shopping areas makes it a ideal base for daily activities or theater.

title: Disappointed
text: The suite is nothing like those on line, they were dated and dark. Curtains and blinds could not be pulled properly and string on the blinds were broken so could not raise. Hotel location is perfect for Time Square and theatre land.

title: Best Hotel In NY
text: My husband and I have been staying at the Michelangelo for 20+ years.  We fell in love with this hotel when we first stayed there years ago and last week we had the best time ever.  It truly does get better.  Did I mention Location, Location, Location! Great rooms, wonderful staff that are like family and the customer service is 5 stars.  I would never stay anywhere else, I actually book my room at the Michelangelo before I book my flight.

title: Very Grateful for the Helpful Staff
text:
I have been a regular guest at The Michelangelo since 2007, and usually stay there twice a year for personal Broadway theater trips.  I have reviewed this hotel many times, and have always enjoyed the quiet atmosphere and friendly staff.  But on this most recent stay from May 1st to the 5th, they really went above to help me.

On my first night, I returned to my room from my performance only to find that I was leaving bloody footprints on the bathroom rug.  It was seeping through my socks.  I had not realized it, but the shoes that I was wearing had caused severe damage to my foot.  The bottom of my big toe had torn open, and was very raw looking.  During my stay, the staff was extremely helpful in assisting me, and seeking out medical care.

They sent someone from security up to help with the wound and wrap some bandages around it.  This person also directed me to a very good urgent care, City MD, which was not too far away from the hotel.  The staff at City MD were wonderful, and gave me some medications and ointment to help with the problem while I was in New York, until I could get home and see my regular doctor.  Fortunately, there was a drug store only a block away from the hotel, so I could pick up my medication easily.

During the week, the staff was very helpful, and always seemed interested in how I was doing.  Of particular note was Henry the bellhop, who has always been wonderful to me during my past stays, and would often offer to help to get anything I needed.  They also would send someone up twice a day to help me with the gauze and wrapping the bandage over my toe after I applied the ointment.  The staff really went out of their way to try to make me comfortable during my stay, and I appreciate their efforts.

Due to the injury, I wasn't able to do as much as I wanted on this trip, since I had to stay off my feet.  But, I still managed to see my six shows, and they were all wonderful.  I want to extend my heartfelt thanks again to everyone for their support and help, and I look forward to seeing the staff again when I return in November.  Hopefully it will go much smoother next time.

title: Great location, pleasant rooms
text: The rooms are quite spacious. The beds are a little soft for my taste, but fairly comfortable. The only  reason for my 4 stars is the incredibly chaotic and slow service for our (included) breakfast each of the four mornings we were there. Simply ridiculous.

title: Excellent place to stay and enjoy NYC!
text: It  was our first visit to NYC and we felt very welcomed and pampered during our stay.  The rooms are huge for the area and overall feel is luxurious.  Even though the location is only blocks from Times Square, once we were at the Hotel it felt very calm & private. The staff were amazingly helpful provided some good advice.  We won't hesitate to stay here the next time we visit NYC!

title: Excellent experience!
text: This hotel was very nice and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and the doorman was so kind to us. We will stay here again! The breakfast was great and we felt like we were coming home each time we walked back in.

title: A Pleasant Surprise - Great Location
text: I'd heard of the Michelangelo prior to this stay, but this was the first time I had the opportunity to make a reservation.  All of the staff were polite, and our room was very spacious for NYC standards.  The foyer and lobby were very elegant, including marble floors and ornate accents.  Our kids were impressed that we were staying at such a "fancy" hotel.  The lobby bar made some great cocktails, and the location was great!  The hotel is located in the Theater District, but it's also only a couple blocks from Times Square and one bock from Radio City and Rockefeller Plaza.

title: Great Hotel
text: Had superb stay here. The room is spacious and very comfortable. Staff was very nice and attentive to my needs. The location was great. Very near to Times Square and central park is just about 10 mins walk. Definitely will stay here again if I'm in Times Square.

title: Family Stay
text: Hotel staff was extremely accommodating, warm, and welcoming! The lobby was elegant accompanied by a royal greeting. Rooms were well kept and spacious. The fitness center was functional with a variety of options.

title: great, great and great
text: awesome location (central park,times square, theatre district are steps away), clean and very large rooms with two queens or two king beds.  Nice lobby for people watching with a bar and great breakfast.

title: Very lavish hotel with lavish prices
text: The hotel is beautiful and well-kept. Front desk staff was a little boorish. Came in a little early at 2:30 and was told the room would be ready at 3:00. I understand that. At 3:30, were given keys. For the price you pay (plus the resident fee) you would expect more, such as breakfast? Breakfast came at almost $100 for three people.  Room was well appointed. Oh, I did call ahead and ask if there was a mini fridge in the room and was assured that there was. What they left out was that it was fully stocked with soda, water, and alcohol for purchase. We had to pull a bunch of stuff out so we could use the fridge. No coffee maker in the room, no microwave, very limited on outlets. Did find a power strip for the clock and lamp so we could plug in phone chargers. Oh, and don’t accidentally grab a bath robe - $225.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: My husband and I enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and clean. We were in walking distance to restaurants and theaters. We needed a refrigerator and one was supplied.

title: Never stay anywhere else in midtown
text:
The reason the overall rating for this property is not a 5 is because of all the common negatives mentioned in other reviews...” a bit outdated”, “lack of complimentary water”, “resort fee”, etc.  I was just a little disappointed we were not given the welcome Prosecco and fresh flowers on our 5th visit but the coffee machine was provided upon request (filters a little late to arrive), but everything was as expected...THE BIGGEST AND BEST ROOM at this price in midtown barr none! We have always requested the Grand Suite outside location rm 721. It has two bathrooms and is app.800 sq ft.
If Room size and location are your priorities look no further.  
This will be the 3rd time we failed to utilize our $10 beverage allowance over 5 or 6 nights so for us it’s a bit of a waste. The TV choices and quality are woeful but with good internet I stream everything to my iPad Pro.... a new addition this time was a complimentary smart phone. BRILLIANT for me as I come from Australia and didn’t have a sim for Android phone and iPhones a pain to unlock.
I cannot comment on restaurant or room service because I much prefer to eat out or bring in but must give a huge shoutout to HENRY a most engaging and efficient long standing employee...He is great! (never got to know Carlos....he seems a little scary lol)
This review is written in great haste and so I’m sure I haven’t been praiseworthy enough. In addition, I 
know that my needs are different from the average traveler.  Suffice to say, the management has always come through on my requests, the location is perfect for ANY tourist and my sister and I absolutely LOVE the place with all its little faults which may be big ones for some I guess.  I will continue to stay at the Michelangelo on my twice yearly trips to the States until they tear it down, throw me out, or have some kind of infestation or something really awful because it is truely a special hotel.  Once again, ask for Henry and even if you don’t need the Grand Suite, all the other rooms are great too.... a tv in the bathroom?  Cool, very cool.

title: Nice visit
text: The rooms and hotel were well decorated with old world character. Was very clean and the staff very attentive. Check in and check out were very efficient. Room service came quicker then anticipated and better then average

title: Nice Hotel - lacking in a few areas
text:
We certainly enjoyed our stay, but were disappointed in a few areas.  First, was not having a coffee machine in the room, so one of us had to go down to the lobby to buy 2  $6.00/cup of coffee, which we did once but not twice.

Next the $40/day fee for really nothing more than the internet, for most people, is out of the norm and not worth the price.

The breakfast was really disappointing and very expensive for a "diner" quality eggs and bacon plus whole wheat toast.  We wouldn't visit the dining area again.

The AC system was very noisy and we discovered the next day that our interior windows were both open about 5" so the outside noise was disruptive.  We closed it the next day, and it was better. 

The hotel was a bit dated, and could use some renovations.  There are some beautiful touches, but areas that need some upgrading. 

We were received well on arrival, but one of the other receptionnists put a customer on hold and left and the new receptionnist who replaced him was clearly unaware that the customer on the phone was on hold for 5 minutes (and very unhappy) - that's not great customer service - so this made a bad impression.  This made us doubtful of the customer service ethic of the hotel.

We enjoyed our stay, but are not sure we would return.

title: Comfortbale and Convenient
text: The room was comfortable and location was very convenient. We could walk to museums, restaurants and theaters. Provided coffee maker and small refrigerator are very helpful. The wide closet was also helpful.

title: Location is awesome...nothing extra...you pay for everything
text: It is a really great location, central to everything and close to Times Square, but no coffee/water for free....you pay for every little thing. I would expect at the rate they charge that you could at least have K-cups in the room and a couple free waters, such a small thing, but you have to order room service to get coffee and it costs a lot, so I had to get up and try to get ready without water/coffee and buy it offsite...just a pain.  I can't justify high price for something like that.

title: Great stay!
text: My husband and I stayed for two nights and had an amazing time. Fabulous location. Valet and check-in were seamless. Clean, spacious, pretty rooms with comfortable beds. It was a rainy NCY weekend and the doormen worked hard to make sure we were comfortable, sheltering us with umbrellas as were got into our Uber’s. Special thanks to Henry and the other doormen (didn’t catch their names) for a wonderful job. Classy place with hardworking people.

title: Beautiful
text:
Wonderful weekend stay at this glorious hotel. The Suite was beautiful and the staff and their services were impeccable. Keep up the Great work. 
They also partner with a company called Nomi and we used their services. They take cake of hair, makeup and massages. It was so relaxing. 

We will definitely return.

title: Henry
text: Great guy. He welcomed us with open arms and great personality. He was very friendly and made sure we were well taken care of the whole time. He gave us directions to where we needed to go as well as recommendations to different places. Thanks Henry for making our stay at The Michelangelo so memorable.

title: Great stay!
text: Henry was great! Find him if you stay here, he’s such a happy presence! Our family went for a few days in New York City and he made our stay super seamless and easy. He had our bags up to our room very quickly and gave us some tips on how to get to Yankee stadium!

title: EXTRAORDINARY BOUTIQUE HOTEL
text: Absolutely our best hotel experience out of MANY stays in Manhattan over the years.  This hotel is TOPNOTCH and without any of the noise incurred (either inside or outside) we have experienced at  other nearby hotels.  All of the staff we encountered were extremely helpful and accommodating.  It was a total pleasure to stay here, and we cannot rate it more highly!

title: Recent Stay
text: Overall a wonderful experience.  It would be nice to have a cup of complimentary coffee, the staff was amazing and the hotel was quiet and clean- great location. I was a bit taken aback that 2 cups of coffee were almost $10 on top of the room charge

title: Weekend getaway
text: Great hotel. It is our go to hotel in NYC. Spacious rooms especially for New York. Great service. Rooms are a bit dated. Perfect location. Beware of added residence fee, which does not deter me from staying here. Bar area needs some work.

title: Cleanliness
text: Room was dusty and carpet stained. This is been a complaint of mine before. Much more attention should be paid today cleanliness. I love the hotel  will return in the future. Hope to see improvements.!

title: Wonderful service
text: Henry was an amazing host. So kind and willing to talk to my crazy aunts. The manager made us feel so at home. They compensated for any inconvenience and made sure we had the time of our lives. 96/100 will come again

title: Stunning Hotel
text: Exquisite hotel, simply beautiful.  Hotel rooms and conference rooms were perfect.   The food was great and the staff were all friendly and helpful.  I wish I could have stayed longer.  Thank you, I can't wait to come back.

title: NJW trip to NYC
text: This was my 2nd time at the Michelangelo.  The service is good and the rooms large and excellent.  The price is excellent also.  The location is great and walking distance to the Broadway shows and great restaurants and shopping.

title: Dio mio!
text: I had the pleasure to come here for a business lunch and im so glad I did! The burger was to die for and the prosciutto salad was light and very tasty. Definitely coming back I need to try that Nutella Pizza

title: Beautiful Hotel, Amazing food!
text: I visited The Michelangelo with friends and absolutely loved it!  Great service, staff courteous and attentive. The food to die for! We tried the prosciutto salad with shaved Parmesan, pickled mustard seeds and poached pears!, we tried the Gnocchi, veal and prosciutto meatballs and their signature Italian pizza! I highly recommend this NYC gem!

title: Yum!
text: The Italian Club Sandwich and the Burger are divine. So yummy. You have to taste it when you are staying at this beautiful hotel. AND don't forget to order the Bonbolini's for dessert. Little tiny donuts filled with lemon custard. Soooooo good.

title: Quiet, Safe, Beautiful, Close to everything.
text:
We just returned from our mini-vacation to NYC. We had minimal interaction with the staff other than Asha, who checked us in. She was wonderful and very helpful. There were 4 of us (my spouse and 2 kids with me). This location seems to be the perfect distance to Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Square and the MoMA. Everything was just a couple blocks away. The lobby and the hotel in general are beautiful and ornate. It reminds me of what a grand, old world hotel should look like. Warm and elaborate, not sleek and modern.

We booked a room with 2 king sized beds. The room was very spacious with a clean, 2 section bathroom. There was also a sizable walk-in closet. Slippers and robes were available in the closet. Our room looked over 7th Ave. The view was excellent. They have added an extra layer of windows that do a remarkably good job of keeping out the street noise. There were 3 windows, so there was no lack of natural lighting.

The only negative (as so many others have pointed out) is the residence charge. It is nice to get some of it back through a $10 drink credit each day.

If we are coming back to this part of the city again, we will certainly be staying there again. Definitely recommended.

title: Great Hotel
text: Michaelangelo is a great place to stay if your going to a show or the Met. Very convenient to everything.  Lobby, rooms, ambiance are great but the bar area seems slightly dated and in need of an upgrade.

title: Customer centric
text:
I strongly recommend staying at the Michelangelo on your next trip to NYC! 
I had booked a 4 night stay in NYC at Michelangelo. I picked this property because I had stayed there over 50 nights in 2009 and 2010. I was always impressed with the incredible staff and the luxurious intimacy of the property. 
One of our family members became ill one day before we were supposed to arrive. As usual the staff in reservations impressed me again ( 10 years later!) and because of the illness fully canceled our reservation without penalty! They truly do care about their customers! We will be back soon!

title: Perfect weekend stay in NYC
text: My 7-year-old daughter and I went to NYC for a long weekend to see a Broadway show, visit the Central Park Zoo, and check out Times Square.  She had never been to NY before, and I wanted to be close to all the action.  This hotel is in a perfect location - right in Times Square and the Theater District, and just a short walk to Central Park.  The hotel itself is gorgeous.  Our room wasn't ready right at 3pm as promised, so we were upgraded to a HUGE suite (unheard of size for Manhattan!).  The furniture was beautiful and comfortable, the A/C worked great, and there was zero hotel or street noise.  The lobby and small lounge are lovely, and the staff are friendly and helpful.  I would absolutely stay here again, and highly recommend it.  I can't imagine you could find anything better at this price!!

title: Recent visit for my 50th
text: Loved this boutique hotel in the middle of everything!  The staff was very nice, gave us a lovely room (especially after I mentioned my milestone birthday) and I enjoyed everything about our visit.  The staff was attentive, the lobby and room was gorgeous and well appointed and everything was clean.  I slept in until 10a on the day we departed....in a hotel!  Quite unheard of when there's usually doors slamming and vacuum cleaners running.  The highest compliment I can give is that I felt at home here.  Recommend to anyone that wants a quiet adult getaway in the middle of the bustling city.  Thank you Michelangelo for a memorable stay!

title: Beautiful Hotel Perfectly situated in the city
text: We had a wonderful weekend at this hotel.  It was perfect to explore New York City.  The rooms were well appointed, a good size and the kept the noise of the city out while we slept.  The staff was incredible.  I highly recommend.

title: Great hotel
text: I recently stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel in NYC. The location was incredible and the hotel was beautiful. The staff took very good care of us and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The price was reasonable for very spacious rooms too!

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel in a fabulous location in New York City. Safe. Clean. Spacious rooms with walk-in closet. Friendly and helpful staff. Lots of windows with beautiful and natural light. Reasonable rates. Highly recommend and will stay there again.

title: Stylish and pricey
text:
Our check-in was handled by a bored receptionist, but it got better. The room was spacious and very clean. The King bed was comfortable and featured big, fluffy pillows. We had a street view, but minimal traffic noise on the 7th floor. The in-room safe was conveniently located for anyone 6-2 or above. I like the "Green Policy" with towels and linens, but like in most hotels, all towels still get changed every day no matter what. Lots of mirrors made the room look even larger. Old-style bathroom with shower in the tub. No coffee maker--surprising for this level of hotel.  Check-out was cheerful and the doorman very helpful with storing our luggage.

We had a drink in the bar one night, and watched the outnumbered, single waitress trying to keep up with dirty tables and loud guests. Not the best experience.

Style comes with a price tag! Beware that the guest room charge is only the first chapter.  Add to that the state sales tax, the city sales tax, the occupancy tax, Javits Center tax, residence fee, state sales tax residence fee, and city sales tax residence fee (8 items in total!) and you get a sum that makes me think twice about coming back. Granted, the hotel is not to blame for the taxes, but the high base rate + residence fee generates a lot extra when multiplied by proportional taxes.

There are some fabulous glass vases on display in the corridors.

The location is great for show-hopping around Broadway.

title: Skip it
text: Air conditioning did not work, and walls so thin the elevator arrival bell woke me up more than once. The hotel was expensive, over $500 including the always-deceptive “residence fee” on top of the published rates. For that kind of money, there are better choices.

title: A wonderful NYC hotel
text: It was just like being in Italy.There were no flaws. It was right in the middle of all the action and had a location that is hard to beat. Great restaurants and all of the Broadway Theaters are within walking distance.The hotel is topnotch and reasonable in price.

title: En pleno centro!!!
text: Precioso hotel, majestuoso, a dos calles de Times Square, las habitaciones perfectas y súper espaciosas y el servicio excelente. El bar de la recepción siempre está muy animado y con vistas a Broadway.  👍🏼😀👍🏼😀

title: Very Nice Quiet Guest Hotel in the Theater District
text: This hotel is always a pleasure to stay at as the rooms are all clean, large and luxurious.  Staff are universally nice and helpful which is not often found in NYC hotels.  The Times Square/Theater District is quite hectic but coming back to the hotel is always relaxing and pleasant.

title: Great location , rooms & Staff
text: The staff, location and service cannot be beat!! Beautiful rooms and bedding. This is the12th time we have stayed at this Hotel and would highly recommend it to both families and business persons .  You will not be disappoint !!

title: Gene Foster
text: What a great find. An absolute gem in this big city. Here to take in theatre and taking in the sights. This is my first time at this hotel and have visited New York many times and stayed in many nice places but this place in terms of attitude and service exceptional . A special shout out to Henry Diaz and Walter Faranda.

title: Great location, quiet beautiful room, staff is very friendly and helpful
text: This was a 20th Wedding Anniversary trip and could not have been better.  Hotel is beautiful, people are so helpful and nice.  Great central location and room was a good size, room service food great.  Henry at the hotel is so nice and helpful.  Made the stay feel like home.

title: Wonderful birthday stay
text: Went to New York City for my daughters birthday.  We were greeted in our room with champagne and cake.  Henry greeted us and could not have been more helpful.  We were able to check in early which was great!  The rooms are very spacious and hotel is close to theater district and Times Square but very quite.

title: OTTIMA POSIZIONE, MA NON CI TORNEREI
text:
Vecchio hotel rilevato e rinnovato dall'italiana starhotel. Il suo punto forte e' la posizione, 
davvero comoda e centrale un po per tutto.  La struttura risente comunque degli anni.
Camere discretamente arredate.  Bagni da rivedere.  La tenda nella vasca-doccia e' davvero da eliminare.  Colazione servita nel bar discreta.  Personale nello standard americano.  Impianto di climatizzazione antiquato e rumoroso

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Stayed for 10 days in the Grande 1 BR Suite and it was perfect for this business trip that my wife joined me on.  Its always good to have plenty of space with everything she packs and brings on a trip this long.   The bar was excellent and services were great.

title: A wonderful gem in the best location
text: With staff determined to make your stay their personal pleasure, generous rooms, wonderful location and prompt service, its hard not to really like this small hotel in mid-town.  It full focus on old world styling with lots of fabrics and grace, so those whose taste is more modern or for only wood or tile floor surfaces may not be as appreciative, but we found it a gem.  The management was most accomodative  in helping us get adjoining rooms for kids.

title: Great hotel. Excellent location
text: Excellent location, however quiet rooms. Very nice and comfortable beds. Spacious bathroom. Really friendly personell, ready to help. Would in any case come again to this hotel on my next stay in NY. Warmly reccommend it

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Hotel was amazing as is the staff throughout the hotel! Everyone is very pleasant and always will try to accommodate you in any way. We visit each year and have never had a problem. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great service
text: Stayed at Te Michelangelo for a family reunion. Our reservation had breakfast included. The service provide at the lobby restaurant was outstanding. Jimmy, Juan and “ Pancho Gafas” treated us like family. Thanks for the attention and great service. This gentleman will be the reason why I would come back tho stay at The Michelangelo.

title: Great location
text: Great location with a European atmosphere. Great coffee and friendly staff, especially the evening bartenders. Room was very comfortable and quiet.  Lobby finishes were somewhat worn but enjoyable.........

title: Terrific boutique hotel
text: We've been going to the Michelangelo for years.  At 51st and 7th Ave., it's a perfect location for getting around New York.  The hotel is smaller than big chains; the hallways are shorter, the rooms (despite the location) comfy and quieter.  The staff, many of whom have been there for many, many years, are friendly, warm, and they remember you from visit to visit.  Excellent front desk staff; bellhops; and nice amenities.  We stay every chance we get.

title: Espelunca.
text: Estamos ainda hospedados. Atendimento digno de um hotel de meia Estela. Educação zero. A cada dia somos surpreendidos com uma cobrança extra: a maior delas - a cada pedida do carro é cobrado 10 dólares -. Em momento algum isso isso foi informado no check-in. Se bem que a educação no check-in passou longe dessa espelunca. Nota zero pra eles.

title: Friends weekend
text: Stayed with 7 friends for a night. Had a great time. Our rooms connected & had great views. They were clean & spacious. Hotel staff even sent some extras for the special occasion we were celebrating! Would definitely stay again!

title: Amazing hotel, Must Stay!
text: When you walk into the hotel, you forget you are in NYC next to Times Square. Rooms are quiet and very clean, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Don’t stay anywhere else in NYC, you will not be disappointed at all from this hotel except when it’s time to leave.

title: Our 1st time at Michaelangelo Hotel
text: the room was beautiful and so clean, from the gentleman at the front opening the door to checking out, very impressed with this hotel! thank you Michael Angelo and staff for a beautiful stay at your hotel

title: Just a Casual Stay
text:
Wonderful staff and service - we got a last minute upgrade to a grand suite.  Very clean rooms!  Delicious breakfast and very friendly service.
Great location too - pretty much walkable to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th ave shopping, Central Park (Columbus Circle) 
It was our first time here, will definitely come back!

title: Our daughter's wedding
text: A great stay! The staff is amazing, helpful and super friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed their hospitality and genuine interest in our comfort and overall stay.  The rooms are clean and a good value. We would do this again.

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: I recently stayed at this hotel on a 3 night business stay in New York City. I booked through a third party last minute hotel app and got a great rate. Check in was seamless. Literally less than one minute. I was upgraded (without asking) into a 1 bedroom suite. I had seen some of the comments about the hotel being "dated," but I found it charming. Soft classical music was playing when I got to my room. Spotlessly clean, lots of space and well apportioned mini bar and bathroom. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Carmen and Jimmy at the bar treated me and my guests very well. Convenient location to Times Square and Midtown office buildings. Would definitely try to stay here again the next time I am in New York City!

title: Wonderful staying
text: The Michelangelo is my preferred hotel, always it is best staying, as stay at home for comfortable rooms, service, personnel, food and position in town. I hope to be back very early! as since many year.

title: Always welcome!
text:
We have been coming here for over 15 years.  
Always welcoming to me and my family.  Service is always great and on spot.  Location is perfect for theatre and shopping.  Rooms are larger than most hotels un the area.

title: Excellent location, comfortable accomodation
text: Few yeards from Times Square and 12 minutes walk to Central Park - ideal location. Very comfortable large rooms, and cosy beds. No complaints. One star deducted for the very average room service food, and the pricey breakfast.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: This quaint European styling of this elegant hotel in the virtual middle of the action was a pleasant surprise to us. The staff was pleasant and outstanding in every way. Will be back for sure and I highly recommend it to everyone.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Our stay at The Michelangelo was great from start to finish.  It was my first time traveling with my 5 month old daughter and Asha at the front desk was fantastic (offering us an electronic tea kettle and a crib).  Room was spacious and very nice.  Asha and the head of security also assisted when my husband left our bags in the back of our taxi.  They were indispensable in helping us find the most luggage.  All of the doormen were friendly and helpful.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a great place to stay not far from the heart of the city.
