The management of The Michelangelo should be proud of the people that work there!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The rooms here are lovely and spacious and the staff really looks after you. I'd prefer a coffee maker in the room but overall it's charming. Go see Gerard in the bar. He's terrific. Great experience.

title: A bit of European flare in Hell’s Kitchen
text: Stunning hotel, top notch service, a stones throw away to everything NYC has to offer!!  The staff is beyond accommodating, the rooms are very neat and clean...like mini studios!   The in house bar/lounge is very convenient!

title: Recent Visit
text:
Recent Stay
Have been here many times
Excellent location
Very friendly staff
Will definitely return
Quiet hotel near theaters
Bar is well stacked
Food is quite good
I have absolutely no complaints
Staff were very helpful

title: First time visit to New York and found this great place to stay
text:
Wonderful hotel to stay at we lucked out for our first time stay plenty of room with a teenage child to give us Space for all of us in the suite 
The hotel was clean and beautiful 
A few hic cups with check in but in the end it was an amazing first time trip

title: Really Nice Boutique Hotel
text: I grew up in NYC and my wife and I visit often. The Michelangelo is definitely up there  with our favorites. The location is wonderful convenient to everything. The staff was super friendly. The Doorman couldn't have tried harder to please! Room was expansive, especially by NY standards. It was quiet, well appointed and clean. Lobby bar was fun for happy hour and breakfast. Staff there might be a bit overworked, but did fine. I heartily recommend the Michelangelo when in NY, we will definitely return.

title: Great hotel
text:
Great hotel. Great location, steps away from Times Square. 
Thank you Walter, at the front desk, for you great accommodating skills, you made our stay so much better. My partner has asthma and Walter was able to find a suite with no carpets in it. The suite was beautiful, very spacious, very quiet, clean, had 2 full bathrooms. We ordered room service, it was great. Thank you for a wonderful stay, and we surely be back again soon.

title: Nicely decorated rooms, service questionable
text: The rooms were sizable and nicely appointed.  The hotel provides a smart phone with maps of the city and major attractions that you can take with you as you explore.  Broadway and shopping are within easy walking distance.  Bar service was terribly lacking with only one bartender and no wait staff in the early evening hours.  I left after 30 min. of no service.  Content to try the hotel, but will not return.

title: Hidden Fees
text: Room was clean and comfortable; however the total price of room should be clearly stated with no additional fees in small print.  Adding a $45.00 residence fee when checking in is devious. The cost of Internet should be in the total price.

title: Great Location!
text: Small hotel in a great location - very convenient to theaters. Excellent staff and fairly priced for NYC! European and nicely appointed rooms. Like the big rooms with two king beds- good for families.

title: Gorgeous hotel, excellent value, superb service
text: Attempted to check in early and at first it seemed like a bit of an icy response at reception. Once I did check in, the service from the bell and housekeeping went to what you’d expect from a five star hotel. The room was incredible- huge by NYC standards, comfortable, dark (perfect for sleeping)! Only suggestion is to offer more amenities for guests with the resort charge such as a complimentary cocktail or breakfast.

title: Home away from home
text: Exceptional staff and a great place. Superb location and excellent service. We were in vaccation and we had a quiet room with our personal phone (hotel's complimentary to all guests). We will come again!

title: Bellman lazy
text: Just checked out of hotel this morning. Had a heavy luggage and bellman just stared without helping as there are stairs to go up to street level. Disappointed in the service. When mentioned a comment to him, he was not even apologetic. Laziness at its finest.

title: High end stay in superb location
text: We couldn't have picked a better hotel for our 4 night stay in Manhattan! We had a luxurious room with a classic Italian flare. The room was a corner room facing the the theatre and time square. The carpet was plus and felt so good on the feet after walking all day. The bedding and pillows were to die for - We slept so good. Mini-bar was well stocked. The closet was large and the bathroom was luxurious. Worth every penny. We had wonderful service from the doorman, bell hop, reception, housekeeping and waitstaff. My only complaint is that the bartender who was serving us left without saying good bye and handing us off to our new server.

title: Awesome stay!
text: We visited NYC for my son’s birthday and had a great time.  This hotel is in great location, it is very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. We would recommend it and will definitely stay again!

title: Great.
text: This is a really perfect hotel with beautiful clean rooms in the middle of it all. My new favorite. On the upper edge of Times Square, but once you're inside you will feel relaxed and peaceful. Room service is terrific. Suites are bigger than expected.

title: Great Stay!
text: My family had a great stay at The Michelangelo!  The staff was extremely helpful and very nice!  Everyone from the doormen to the wait staff to the front desk staff went out of their way to make sure my family was comfortable.  The location was perfect for us - close to Times Square and all the sights we wanted to see.  And the breakfast was delicious. The rooms were large -  especially compared to other hotel rooms we've stayed in while visiting NYC!  We will definitely be back!

title: Great place to stay
text: The hotel is in a great location if Broadway is your passion.  The room was large and well appointed.  The staff could not be nicer. Breakfast was delicious. Theo at the front door made us feel welcome everytime we left or arrived.the hotel.

title: VERY GOOD STAY
text: All staff encountered at the Michelangelo were great. The hotel is just north of Times Square. Convenient to theater, shopping,and great restaurants. My only suggestion would be to improve the quality of food in the lounge at night, and add some extra help.its a nice hotel.

title: Scam residence fee AVOID.
text:
This hotel charges almost $50 per night extra as a so called residence fee. This fee is not optional even if you will not use the services. 
This fee is nothing but a scam so the hotel can look more competitively priced.

killresortfees com/newyorkcity

* $10 Beverage allowance per day, redeemable in the Lobby Bar. Allowances to be reflected on the guest room folio. 

* Unlimited Local, Long Distance and International phone calls.
* In Room High Speed Wireless Internet (Wi-Fi). 
* $10 discount on any car service, when booked directly through the Hotel’s Concierge. 
* $10 deduction off entry fee to the swimming pool at the Equitable Center’s Athletic & Swim Club (located across the street from hotel) 
* Unlimited use of our 24/7 Fitness Center, equipped with Technogym ® treadmills, stationary bikes, elliptical machines and free weights. 
* Unlimited use of our Business Center, including printing, scanning and faxing. 

So we are being charged £30 for discounts we won't use.

title: Great stay!!
text: Our stay at the Michelangelo was well worth the money we spent. The staff was very professional including the bellmen, Edwin and Henry and the doormen, Rageed and Marco. We had an overall wonderful experience and looking forward to our next trip to NYC where we would love to stay at this hotel again!

title: Outstanding Service!
text: This was my first return to this hotel since mid 2018.  The service continues to be impeccable.  As a business traveler, I recommend this hotel if you have business in Manhattan.   Marco is the Manager, and I would encourage you to ask for him.   The bar/restaurant is excellent, and the location of this hotel provides easy access to different parts of Manhattan.  I would ask for Marco, Joseph, or June.  They sincerely want to help you!

title: Lovely break away
text:
We had an amazing week in NY staying at the Michelangelo . The staff were fantastic and couldn’t do enough. Room service which we used for breakfast couldn’t be faulted. The hotel was perfectly located to lots of the tourists attractions in NY. Our room  716 was so large with a lovely comfy bed. 

I have not given the hotel 5 stars as there was traffic noise from outside which was slightly annoying but we were in the front so just put this down to being in a central location. The fan in the heating system was also quite noisy which did wake us in the evening but as the week went on we got used to this. Really we should have said something but didn’t. 

Robes and slippers were greatly appreciated.

title: UK guest
text: If you can look past the tired looking lobby everything else about the hotel was very good. Room Was excellent as was the service. Location is perfect, just a short walk from 51st Avenue Subway 1 station.

title: Amazing hotel
text: We love everything about this hotel. Great location, excellent staff, beautiful rooms, and very large rooms. One of the best hotels in New York City and elsewhere. Been there many times and will continue to return.

title: Great for families
text: Large rooms with a great location, very near to many attractions.  We had two king beds for a family of four, which was great.  Hotel personnel was very attentive and helpful, especially Henry Diaz.  Thanks for a great vacation!

title: Manhattan Vacation
text: Excellent facility. Great staff, very helpful, friendly and attentive. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was exceptionally quiet. Centrally located to the theaters and great restaurants, and of course the subway system.

title: Our getaway weekend
text:
We had a fantastic time at the Michelangelo! Thank you so much for the outstanding service and personal
care. Your staff is superior, friendly and always very pleasant. We also enjoyed spending time in the lobby lounge!

title: NY's Italian Luxury Hotel The Michelangelo
text: The Michelangelo is one of those rare city hotels situated in an elegant, pre-war building where walls between guest rooms are so thick that they block noise from adjacent guest rooms and outside street noise.  Steps away from Broadway’s main theatres, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and global headquarter office buildings, this luxury class Italian hotel has an impressive lobby which is decorated like a luxury Roman villa with warm tones of Carrera marble and plush velvet armchairs and a massive chandelier in the lobby.  A haven for visitors seeking an unpretentious and gracious experience during their visit to one of the world’s most energizing metropolises, the grand staircase in the lobby leading to a mezzanine public space was the perfect design compliment for my stay which coincided with the Academy Awards broadcast of the Oscars. I felt like a celebrity with the warm welcome from the entire Front Office staff!  The hotel room was spacious, plush and comfortable. The hotel's special pizzas are worth enjoying in the lobby lounge area.

title: Repeat Customer
text:
This was the second time I've stayed at this hotel. As others have said, the hotel location cannot be beat being near both Times Square and Central Park. It is just enough off the main street to feel tucked away, resulting in a welcome quiet experience. The hotel property is lovely with marble floors in the entry. The colors and decorations truly reflect European charm. There's a small bar off to the side of the lobby with a great collection of whiskeys. It also doubles as the restaurant. The rooms are incredibly spacious and clean.  The suites are down right cavernous.  It would also be nice if there were more outlets in the room, but that's a minor complaint. The service is efficient and perhaps a bit perfunctory, but they get the job done and quickly.

Note: If you're a business traveler you will not get iprefer credit if your company requires you to book through corporate travel.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We stayed as a family of 3 in February half term to celebrate 3 birthdays so this was our first time to New York and we wanted to stay somewhere special.  The Michelangelo Hotel didn't disappoint.  Fabulous location near Times Square but had a wonderful relaxing feel. All the staff were lovely.. particularly Henry and Theodore. We met our housekeeping lady too who was also lovely.  We were lucky to have an executive double room which was perfect for us. Lots of space and beautifully decorated.  I would love to stay here again and hope to revisit soon. Thank you x

title: A wonderful Hotel... in Manhattan with the taste of Europe.
text: The Michelangelo was our home away from home for a 5 day “staycation” for a couple from Brooklyn. This hotel has a marvelous location for the Theater District without being in the center of the noise and hubbub of Times Square. The hotel has an excellent combination of European romanticism along with all of the modern amenities of a modern hotel. And... the staff capably merges professionalism with friendly warmth. Well recommended for a stay in NYC.

title: Incredible stay
text:
A truly perfect hotel stay. The guestroom, the level of service from all areas of the hotel, and the overall experience were all truly flawless. 

Need to specifically recognize the most attentive doormen I’ve ever come across in NY. I didn’t open a door on the way in nor the way out of the hotel throughout my 3 days here, and I was greeted with a smile each time. Same goes for the staff at the Lobby Lounge.

Keeping up with an aging set of luxury hotels in this area of the city is probably not easy...This is the one that’s leading the way.

title: Monsieur Dis
text: Absolute gentleman. Cannot thank Gerard enough. Thank you so much for having us at the bar and lounge of The Michelangelo! You have well and truly made our trip and made us feel at home! All the best to you & your family. Love you always. The Goodfellow’s xx

title: February 2019 convention.
text: Overall an excellent experience from dropping the car off at the nearby garage, checking in, and the quality of the rooms as we visited several to see friends who were also staying at the Michelangelo.  The seating area near the lobby bar was a popular meeting place and the 2nd floor mezzanine area also allowed for somewhat larger informal gatherings for the attendees.  Will be back in the future.

title: A pleasant experience
text: This is our 3rd or 4th stay at tthe Michelangelo and as always pleasant. aiy is conviently located. Staff is friendly and helpful.We have stayed there for both business & pleasure trips over the years.

title: Midtown Luxury
text: This boutique hotel is perfect for those who want to be close (but not too close) to midtown.  Very romantic setting--great for anniversaries or other special occasions.  The lobby is gorgeous and some of the rooms are massive for NYC.

title: A Hotel you Can Trust
text: We enjoyed our recent visit to the Michaelangelo. We stayed in Room 336 which was an executive king room along the 51 st Street side. Very quiet. Room is clean. Bed is comfortable. Water pressure in shower is fine. Everyone in hotel is friendly throughout. We really like to visit here. And hope to return soon

title: Michelangelo is exceptional
text: The Hotel Michelangelo is consistently wonderful. The service is exceptional, the rooms lovely, spacious and quiet. They somehow manage to even make the hallways appealing. This hotel is perfectly located for touring museums and historic sites, seeing Broadway shows or dining at great restaurants. Their lovely bar area is a great early evening stop before a night out.  This will always be our first choice for a NYC weekend.

title: Wonderful elegant hotel.
text: In the area of Times Square - busy - but the hotel is quiet and elegant.  Friendly staff and lovely clean room.  Nice area to sit and have drinks or snacks near the lobby. We didn’t try the food here, drinks were pricey but done well.

title: 夕日と共に
text:
ツアーガイドさんが、時計を気にしながらの車中
日没時間が迫り、フィレンツェが、夕日に、染まる景色を、是非！と、気遣い。色々な、しゃしんを撮っているうちに、空がピンクに。この夕日のために、各国の、若者達はグループで瓶ビールを片手に、乾杯🍷

title: Lovely comfortable hotel in the thick of things!
text:
I was checked in really pleasantly by June for my stay at the Michelangelo. I had a lovely cosy comfortable room - extreeeemely spacious by Manhattan standards! Guests receive $10 credit for the hotel bar daily - a nice touch. I was upgraded to high-speed wifi for my week-long stay, which was a much appreciated extra. I noticed that the hotel tends to be quite warm. I couldn't seem to control the heat/cool in my room very well, so asked for it to be made cooler which it was, and seemed better after that. The foyer and bar are pleasant; the bar is nice to sit in for a drink before bed and jazzy music plays softly in the background - it would be even nicer with slightly more atmospheric lighting. The barman was especially friendly and helpful. A kettle was delivered to my room on request which was good - I wonder if tea/coffee-making facilities should automatically be in rooms perhaps, for this price. Doormen are friendly and helpful, and cleaning was v.good. The location is just at the top of Times Square - convenient for me as I am a solo female traveller and l felt safe. Recommended if you can handle the garish bustle of Times Square (many don't, but I like it!!). The Michelangelo is a great tourist base near several key subway stations, so that it's easy to get downtown etc. It's also situated right by all the Broadway theatres, so it's handy if you're seeing shows as you can walk to them. And of course, just a stone's throw from Central Park :) I truly loved my stay here, I had a very happy week at the Michelangelo and would definitely return.

P.S. There is a lovely bakery (part of a chain but so nice) with amazing cookies up behind the hotel on 51st between 6th & 7th Avenues, called Maison Kayser…

title: Theater lovers paradise...
text: If you are visiting for plays and mid-town shopping, you cannot beat the location of this hotel.  Friendly staff.  Rooms a nice, a little bit worn for the wear and only slightly dated, but totally acceptable and I would stay there again if I wanted that location.  Use the safe for valuables.

title: Would like to live at The Michelangelo
text: Have stayed too many times to count and the experience keeps getting better. From the charming doormen, to the maids upstairs, everyone is so kind. As often happens, I was upgraded to a  roomy studio further enhancing  my experience.

title: Michelangelo Hotel
text: The hotel staff is great. Big Shoutouts for Luna the bartender and Henry Diaz who helped keep me upright on the icy sidewalk.  Great customer service from everyone there. I recommend and will plan to stay there again.

title: 25thWEDDING ANNIVERSARY TRIP TO NYC-
text: We visited NYC from the 25/11/2019 to 30/11/2019 and stayde at the best hotel we have ever stayed in.As soon as we arrived at the hotel the staff made us feel so relaxed after a 2 hour car trip from JFK.The hotel has a style of its own and you feel very special right from the start.Having been to NYC before the usual size of the bedrooms is somewhat on the small size,fear note at the Michelangelo the bedrooms are wonderful,especially room 416 which has a great view of 7th Avenue.The bed was to die for after a long in the Big Apple.We will return to this hotel and would once again like to say thank you to all staff(reception,bell boy,doorman and by no means least the chambermaids)who made our special trip so special.PS TRY the Westway Diner on 9th Avenue -10 mins walk for breakfast awesome.-614 Ninth Avenue

title: Incredible Stay
text: If you enjoy supporting small Italian boutique hotels in prime locations at reasonable prices, then this is the hotel for you!  From the first step inside, one could tell that this family-owned hotel is run with passion and efficiency, everything from the Venetian Glass mirrors and vases. to the great Italian coffee.  I loved the Handy cell phone that allowed us to call for free internationally.  That  was a nice touch.... I will be back!!!

title: Amazing anniversary trip!
text: The stay there was amazing, from the moment you arrived, the bell person / door man day and night was very friendly and warm!! also the staff at the front desk and the barman was very knowledgeable!! Housekeepers was very friendly, we happens to be at the room anytime they try to do turn down, they was very friendly and the chocolates was  great! Also the  room was very spacious and impeccable clean! the location is unbeatable, around the corner of everything, but in a quiet spot to rest, will definitely recommend to anyone looking for class, romanticism and tradition to go, and feel as warm as home!

title: Anniversary trip
text:
This is our second time starting at the Michaelangelo. We love this place for its beauty, elegance and location. The only reason I have dropped the star rating to 4 stars is because of the $45 resort fee which basically gives you $10 to spend at the bar. Incidentally,  2 cups of coffee is $11 not including tip, and there is no coffee in the rooms. 
If they were to offer a coffee bar in the morning and reduce the resort fee,  I think this would br one of the highest rated hotels in the city.  And we have stayed at many of them, including the Waldorf Astoria and the Plaza. 
The walls and windows are so well made that even on the corner of 51st and 7th Ave you still can barely hear what's going on outside. Makes for a great night's sleep. 
Very nice place.

title: Delightful!
text: My husband and I were celebrating our birthdays. We got a beautiful one bedroom suite. As we entered our room we were surprised to find a lovely birthday message from the staff along with a bottle of Proseco and a delicious little chocolate cake. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Special notice to Ney, who took such good care of us and to Patrick, who was so helpful with our reservations. The room was well appointed and so quiet. We enjoyed breakfast downstairs too. We look forward to returning for future celebrations.

title: Weekend getaway
text: Always a pleasant  experience.  An interesting diversity of guests at breakfast .  The bed was very comfortable.  Hotel was conveniently  located for the Broadway musical we attended as well ah shopping  on 5th avenue

title: Old World Charm.
text: We stayed in the king junior suite.  What a gem.  It consisted of a bedroom sitting area bar with stools dressing area and bath with an oval tub. We have stayed in New York frequently but we were shocked at the size of the room.  We love this place.

title: Quiet Oasis in Manhattan
text: My husband and I stayed in the grand suite which was well worth every penny. The room is beautifully appointed with a separate living room and half bathroom, spacious bedroom with another bathroom with oversized tub, and plenty of closet and drawer space so you can unpack and feel right at home. Every member of staff we encountered greeted us with a cheery hello. The best part, though, was the absolute silence in the entire suite. You can’t hear a thing - not an elevator, ice machine, voices in the hallway, neighbors above or around, outside noise....nothing. Exactly what we needed for a getaway without our five kids. We slept so well and even though we enjoyed being out and about in the city, returning to the Michelangelo was always something to look forward to.

title: An elegant jewel in Midtown
text: The Michelangelo Hotel, part of the Star Hotels group of Italian luxury hotels, is our favorite hotel in Manhattan. Located in Midtown, a short walk to Central Park and the Theater District, this elegant hotel features spacious rooms (a rarity in NYC), beautiful furnishings, a cozy bar, and an unfailingly attentive staff. We've been guests at various times over a decade, and the hotel has consistently provided high quality service and accommodations..

title: Very satisfied
text: I am a travel agent, therefore I look at many details in every hotel, personnel, food.Michelangelo's exceeded my expectation in all areas, very close to the theater district, Times Square, and the staff in all areas were very accommodating, it had a nice historical aspect with a lot of Italian marble

title: A new favorite NYC hotel for us
text: We have stayed at many hotels in NYC and usually base our choice at least partially on what we are in the city to do. On this occasion, we were celebrating my daughter's 14th birthday by taking her to the Harry Potter plays. So, great location for the theatre district. A short walk to most theatres. All staff members were extremely friendly and helpful. Upon hearing that it was a birthday celebration they sent a nice surprise to our room. Very thoughtful. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Couldn't ask for more. Will definitely return.

title: Consistently sharp
text: The staff anticipates your needs and cohesively provides the NYC Class caliber experience.The guest base is so sustainable that you see familiar faces on most visits.The concierge provides a wider repertoire than any other in Manhattan.

title: A Gem of a place to stay!
text: We love to stay at this charming hotel. The staff is friendly and always remembers your name. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy. From the time you arrive until you leave...you will feel pampered...a great feeling in NY. Once you stay here, you will never want to stay anywhere else.

title: Great deal for its excellent location
text: You may not think that paying $250 a night is a great deal but relatively speaking it is a steal for the location of this through back hotel so near the theatre district. With a style out of a Rome or Florence hotel, The Michelangelo is comfortable with some limits on the spectrum of restaurants or amenities. Still, the room was very nice, accommodations clean and comfortable and staff was very engaging.

title: SUPERB SERVICE, OUTSTANDING ACCOMMODATIONS
text: Last week, my wife and I returned to The Michelangelo Hotel for a combined business conference and relaxation visit.  For this trip to NYC, there was no question where we would stay - The Michelangelo Hotel.  The Michelangelo Hotel has been our 'GO TO' NYC hotel for years.  Over the years each of our stays at The Michelangelo Hotel was superb.  This recent visit, though, our stay was even better. The Michelangelo Hotel accommodations are very, very comfortable.  The rooms are well maintained and spacious.Each of the staff with whom we came into contact treated us as if we were family members.  Each of the staff is friendly, courteous, welcoming, and extraordinarily helpful.  There is absolutely no question in our minds: my wife and I will return to The Michelangelo Hotel on our trip to NYC.Thanks, The Michelangelo Hotel.

title: Needs improvement
text: Condition of hotel and room are deteriorating. Staff still very good. We have stayed many times over the years has always been good. Very convenient for broadway. No evening turndown service, breakfast room service dishes left in room all day until evening return. not the same level of service as in past.

title: Great New York Hotel
text: This being my 8th visit to New York, I decided to use a new hotel in Manhattan and was pleased with everything. My previous experiences in New York has not been the best, but Michelangelo has now become my new favorite hotel to stay at and recommend. The location is great with a short walking distance to Time Square & other popular attractions. The best thing that I liked was the spacious room size which is not a norm in New York. Great service from staff and always friendly.

title: Busines Stay well done
text: Stayed here for a conference at the Hilton  was a pleasure to be close and away from the elevator ad lobby crowdhotel staff was great , had a room ready in morning so I was able to drop my things before heading to meetingsrooms were nice size and very comfortable 4 rather tha 5 is only because it is an older property but for right price will stay here more often.

title: Birthday surprise
text:
I took my lovely bride here as a surprise for her birthday. We had been here the previous year and thoroughly enjoyed it. The suite was comfortable. The hotel staff were excellent, from check in to room service.
We look forward to our next visit.

title: Great location, clean rooms
text: Great location, in middle of all the action. Clean, spacious rooms. Would benefit from a legitimate restaurant in the hotel but there’s so much within short walking distance, not a big deal. Have stayed there 4 times, all have been pleasant stays.

title: Great place to stay,close to almost everything!
text: We recently stayed at the Michelangelo hotel, and it was incredible. The room was clean and inviting, the staff was attentive and friendly. We asked if there was a microwave that we could warm up a Katz’s Pastrami sandwich and they brought one up to our room in ministers. We were close enough to walk to everything in Times Square, a little bit longer of a walk to Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. It was a great time!

title: Gerard’s Margaritas!!!
text: This is our favorite hotel in the city. Huge rooms, very clean, and amazing staff. Gerard makes the most amazing maragaritas!!  We will stay here again and again. Perfect location. We would stay here again and again.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: From the time I walked in, I was greeted by Theo who was beyond nice. Offered to grab my bags. June checked us in and could not have been any more pleasant, helpful and informative. My room was spotless, beautiful and very comfortable. The only thing I had an issue with were the lack of outlets in the room. I had to unplug the light to iron. Then I couldn’t see what I was ironing. But, not the end of the world.  That night my friend and I went to dinner and I lost my key. Thomas Ficken happily let me in my room and reassured me it was not a problem. He also offered to grab me a coffee or Advil because I mentioned I had a headache. Everything and everyone helped make my best friends visit from Florida an absolute memorable one!

title: Great Location, Lovely Hotel
text: The staff was super friendly, breakfast was delicious and the room was lovely and spacious with very comfortable beds and a great set up -- and we loved that it did not feel like a "chain hotel".  I would have loved to have a coffee maker in the room but that really was my only "complaint"!

title: beautiful quiet classic hotel in Midtown
text: Have stayed at the Michelangelo many times over the years - it is very stable, has lovely suites and a distinctive lobby and lobby bar/restaurant. Everyone who I've encountered who works at the hotel has been very nice. It would be nice to have more accessible plugs in the rooms for computers and other devices. Otherwise, if you like a classic type of hotel in a fine location with nearly soundproof rooms, the Michaelangelo is the right location.

title: Henry is the best!
text:
Recently stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel, again, :) and you absolutely receive the best customer service at this hotel! Everybody is so helpful!
Henry went above....as he always does! Thank you Henry!
Nancy

title: Always A Great Stay at The Michaelangelo!
text: Have stayed at The Michaelangelo many times over many years. Always a great staff - friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and very spacious rooms. Great location and a reliable hotel. Only suggestion to Management is that it is time to replace the hotel towel selection. They are too thin and poor quality for such a lovely hotel!

title: January in New York
text: Nice large rooms Large impressive lobby . Very nice lobby bar. Always good service. Good location for theater. Only complaint needs in room coffee maker, so can have coffee without getting dressed. Staff very helpful. Very pleasant stay.

title: Very good city hotel, super clean and perfect location!
text:
Excellent hotel with friendly staff at a perfect location. 

I was at this hotel for 4 nights regarding a business trip. It was a great experience. 
The hotel is 5 min walk to the Times Square. And you can walk around within Midtown without any problem. The hotel has a nice old school italian NYC vibe.

The rooms are very large and the washrooms are big as well, definitely something rare in NYC. I always had the impression that the hotel is very clean. The breakfast is a la carte and very good. 

All in all I was very satisfied and will definitely come back.

title: Wonderful place to stay!
text: Conveniently located and beautiful, spacious rooms.  I stay here regularly for board meetings three times a year.  They always remember me and I love the rooms.  I wish my stays were longer!  It is close to subway stations, great restaurants, Times Square and Radio City Music Hall.

title: Lovely
text:
We stayed here over Christmas. When arriving we were happy to find ourselves in an impressive entrance lobby.  An understated elegance that is echoed throughout the hotel.  The front of house staff were friendly and informative. 

The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was amazing.  A huge spacious bath and a dressing room. 

The bed was incredibly comfortable. The bedding first class. The best pillows... I wanted to take them home! 

It was only the bar staff that put a slight dampener on our stay. There was on man working over Christmas that seemed to chat to everyone except us. It felt very excluding.  I believe he may have been new. However, the hot chocolate was fabulous. 

The location was perfect. Everything was in easy walking distance. Times square, theatres, Rockerfella centre, Bryant Park, Central Park, 5th Ave, Empire State Building. 

We would absolutely stay again.

title: Great hotel in a perfect location!
text:
We recently stayed at The Michelangelo for a 3 night break and were very pleased with our stay! We had one minor blip where we were rushed through check in and given no information at all about anything but we came back down after dropping our bags to the room and there was a different lady on reception who was very friendly and very helpful (and apologetic!). 

We had room 622 which was lovely. Spacious, very clean, bed was lovely and comfy, there was a huge bath tub, WiFi was great and even a hotel issued smartphone to use if we needed to! 

Every other staff member we came across was lovely and attentive and the hotel lobby was decorated beautifully for the festive season. 

With Times Square on the doorstep we couldn’t have asked for a better hotel. Would definitely stay here again!

title: An Amazing 10 day trip to NYC in a beautiful comfortable Hotel
text:
Where do I start, from check in to check out, everything was perfect!  We chose this Hotel because of it's location and it's reviews on Trip Advisor.  We were not disappointed.
The welcome by the doormen was always lovely, even giving us bags for dripping umbrellas.  Bar staff were happy to serve and went out of their way to find me my favourite wine.  Room service fast and efficient.  Housekeeping did a fantastic job of cleaning and tidying our room (a mean feat considering we were here for 10 days and did lots of shopping etc).   
Absolutely no noise can be heard from other bedrooms, except the occasional slamming of the door next to us (by the family staying in the room, not the staff I hasten to add).  We had 10 nights wonderful sleep, which gave us plenty of energy for all the walking we did around this amazing city!  Spent New Years Eve on a rooftop bar on 5th Avenue, it was awesome!!  Thoroughly enjoyed everything about our stay. Will definitely return and stay at this Hotel again.
Only one small comment that I would mention, as feedback only, apart from the lovely girl who checked us in, and the gentleman who checked us out, we found the other reception staff quite unwelcoming and not overly helpful.  But this did not ruin our stay but something to note, as all receptionists should be smiling and willing to help at all times.
Thank you all for a lovely stay, we hope to return soon!!
Mark & Helen Simpson.

title: Continuing Greatness at The Michelangelo Hotel
text: Returning to The Michelangelo Hotel after several years, it was great to see this beautiful property still maintains its excellence. The entire staff at The Michelangelo was fantastic! In particular: Jesus at the front desk was terrific, welcoming and very helpful. Henry Diaz was amazing and did everything he could to make our stay wonderful. The  evening doorman during our stay (I apologize I did not note his name) was always welcoming, very friendly and helpful.

title: Birthday Visit
text: This was an excellent Hotel our stay was perfect the location was perfect the staff and their customer service was excellent.  The hotel was quiet the room was very clean the food was also very good.  I want to especially that Henry Diaz he was extremely helpful.  I would recommend this hotel anyone

title: Ótima localização
text: Estivemos no The Michelangelo do dia 30/12 até dia 14/01 a passeio! A localização é ótima, super perto de metrô, restaurantes de todos os tipos, para todos os bolsos, perto da Time Square e Rockefeller! O hotel e limpo, o quarto e bem espaçoso e não cobra taxas para receber itens de compras on line . O atendimento da recepção deixou a desejar por conta da atendente June, grosseira, e de má vontade, sempre com respostas negativas e nunca pronta para ajudar, sempre preocupada em olhar o computador...juntamente com alguns mensageiros que nem te olham na cara se vc não der “tips”! Vale a pena pela localização e se procura quarto grande.

title: Location is great
text: Close to Radio City Music Hall and a 10 minute walk to Central Park means the location of this hotel is ideal. We have stayed at the Casablanca Hotel by Times Square but preferred this location as it is quieter. There were good, made in Italy toiletries, an iron and board in our room and the staff were always pleasant. The shower is over the bath which could cause problems for people with mobility issues. Our Executive room (1 king bed)  by New York standards was large but the hotel is a bit dated and i would rank 4 star only. On our Expedia booking we were advised we had to pay the Residence Fee of USD $45.90pn on check out as this was not included in our pre booked Expedia rate. As we had free internet anyway (being Expedia gold members) we got no extra benefits from this Residence Fee which we found rather irritating.

title: Great location and very spacious rooms
text: Went to New York between Jan 4-9 stayed at the Michelangelo hotel and let me tell you this hotel is the perfect location if you want to be near Times Square broadway and Central Park and Rockefeller center and 5th Avenue! The hotel was literally walking distance from the destinations. The rooms are very spacious especially for New York! Staff was very attentive and was there ready to go whenever you needed them. We arrived early morning around 5 there was no rooms available but they got us in a room right away at 9 which was perfect I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I plan to visit New York

title: Mostly good, but falls short of 5 star
text:
Overall, a great location and a good place to stay if you get a deal for it.  We stayed 2 nights in a suite.  Very spacious and warmly decorated. Friendly staff and helpful door/bell men.  The problems? We found some stains on our sheets - eww.  No plugs for electronics -a pet peeve, it is 2019 people, throw in a power bar! Called for coffee from room service and heard a message that they weren't offering room service that morning.  5 star hotel where I can't get coffee service? Attempted to order room service another night after getting in late - they offer ordering on the TV.  Nice option, except at least 1/3 of menu items aren't in the digital menu.  Stored bags for a day after checkout and as I was reaching for my wallet, the doorman says "we store the bags for free, but we accept tips." Um, yours just went down.

So, all in all the problems were fairly minor, and the location really is great, so if you go in not expecting true 5 star experience and not paying full price, you'll enjoy it!

title: DISCRETO
text:
Location ottima, lo ricordavo come un hotel molto curato ma in questa ultima esperienza mi è sembrato molto datato e scarsamente manutenuto.
Personale non molto cortese in perfetto NY style; camere mediamente non curatissime nè pulitissime. Breakfast migliorabile decisamente.
Nel complesso rapporto qualità prezzo non convincente

title: A Hidden Gem!
text:
Our family of three stayed here four nights over New Year’s Eve. We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff and their attention to detail. Everyone we encountered- from the staff at the front desk to the housekeepers- was genuinely kind and friendly. Anna at the front desk went out of her way to connect with our daughter and make sure our room could accommodate a third person. Our room was even ready a bit earlier than the stated check in time.

The bellman, Henry, is hands-down the nicest person you’ll ever meet. He made sure we were taken care of and our seven year old just adored him. She had a blast dancing with him in the lobby on New Year’s Eve and he made sure our night was unforgettable. We were sad to say goodbye to him on our last full day at the hotel.

I highly recommend the Michelangelo for stays at any time of the year, but especially for Christmas though New Year’s Eve.

title: Special Day
text: Date weekend for my wife and I!  A Tradition every year for her Birthday and a broadway show of hr choice!  Great relaxing and romantic stay!  Service was great, food was on time and fresh.  Hotel right in the middle of everything!

title: The Michelangelo is Marvelous
text: Best value location staff and bar!  Once again The Michelangelo proves to the best in its class of 4 star hotels .  Welcoming and friendly -feels like home away from home .  We would not stay anywhere else in NYC , nor should you .

title: Excellent
text: The trip was fantastic. Hotel was clean and staff were priofessinal. We would stay here again. Location was perfect. Room was comfortable and quiet. Food and bar were not crowded and service was good.

title: Smoke and getting the shaft
text: Booked for three days, checked out 7:30 AM after two days because of a death in the family and management sticks us for the third night saying we didnt give them 24 hour notice. Keep the money guys, wont be staying here again. Oh and by the way the room stunk of smoke.

title: Worth Staying
text: Value for money. Excellent location, close to Times Square and everything. Very welcoming staff. Always there to help and guide. I would strongly recommend this beautiful hotel. Needs some upgrades in lobby furniture and carpets.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: My partner and I just returned from a weeks stay at The Michelangelo Hotel...what a wonderful establishment. All staff are very friendly and helpful, the room was stunning...the most comfortable hotel bed I’ve ever slept in. As we were celebrating our honeymoon the staff left a bottle of Prosecco and Chocolate Strawberries in our room on our first night, such a lovely surprise. We highly recommend The Michelangelo and if we ever return to NYC we will be sure to stay here.

title: NYC
text: Had an amazing time at the Michelangelo.  Everyone was so polite and courteous. The staff treated us like family. The room we stayed in was very clean and spacious. Keep up the good work. I would definitely visit again.

title: Fabulous stay
text: I am from Mauritius and I came all the way to New York. I believe I was lucky I found the best hotel in New York. Too bad I had already spent 2 days at a crappy hotel across the street before finding this one. I cannot find one bad thing to say about this hotel. I loved everything about this hotel. The room was huge and clean. I loved how it had a walk-in closet to keep luggage. There is a sitting area. I made international calls to my parents-in-law and my parents. It was all included in the price. There was US Open during the time I was there and there were tennis balls as decorations in the lobby. The nice people at the reception gave my little boy a tennis ball. He was so happy. We still have it as a souvenir. But we are already planning to come to New York again and I will definitely choose The Michelangelo again.

title: Happy New Year!
text: The Michelangelo Hotel was a wonderful place to spend First Night. The champagne was excellent, and the desserts were delicious. The best part was our bartender Gerard. He was an absolute delight! Highly recommend going, especially when Gerard is working!

title: Family vacation in Manhatten
text: Loved the hotel and the whole experience of manhatten during the holidays! Great location, and especially the doorman was so helpful and friendly every day! The suite was large and very well layes out, we would stay here again and probably will look for other star hotels in our upcoming travels

title: Bel hôtel, accueil chaleureux
text: Pour mon 2 eme séjour à New York, j ai choisi de séjourner à nouveau au Michelangelo qui a une situation idéale pour visiter New York. Chambre spacieuse, lit hyper confortable, propreté excellente, comme l’an dernier.  Le personnel est chaleureux et très à l’ecoute. L’accueil au bar le soir est parfait, notre petit coup de cœur va à une barmaid et à Gérard qui nous ont toujours accueillies avec beaucoup de gentillesse et de professionnalisme. Gérard est un personnage qui a toujours une petite anecdote à  raconter... et pour nous faire plaisir s’exprime en français avec nous. Bref, que de bons moments

title: Excellent Stay
text: We stayed four nights.  Reception staff were great, always friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations.  Housekeeping was also very good, graciously accommodating our late sleep ins, and scheduling room cleanings around us (not all hotels do this well).  Henry the doorman was an exceptional standout, making sure we were well taken care of, especially after we checked out our last day but left our luggage, etc.  Our room (2K, corner with great view, higher floor) was spacious and exquisitely appointed.  Sleep quality was excellent, with very good black out curtains and very little noise even though we faced a busy street with lots of lights.  Ruth Chris’ steakhouse and Duke’s deli are great and right next door, and iconic Junior’s is just a short walk away, so the lack of an on-site restaurant is no big deal at all.  There also is no pool, spa, gift shop,etc, it’s more akin to full service luxury NY style apartments.  For us, it was perfect and we will stay again!

title: Great Times Square boutique hotel
text: Stayed here with family just after Christmas to see a Broadway show and couldn't have been more pleased with the experience.  The hotel rooms are huge, clean, cozy and very quiet.  It is a little oasis in the city and very convenient to the theater district, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and Grand Central Station.  We highly recommend!  Love it here.

title: Amazing bartender, Gerard!
text: Our experience at the Michelangelo was absolutely made by Gerard the bartender! He is truly wonderful! I have never had more attentive service... satisfactory is an understatement! He waited on us hand and foot while making the most delicious cocktails despite the busy crowd coming in. The overall stay was great... will be coming back in the future !

title: Mixed exoert
text: Hotel is in excellent location and very clean. Rooms are very nice and spacious.  Front desk personnel very pretentious and not particularly helpful and not familiar with room packages.  Manager was excellent and resolved all issues.  Restaurant service was very slow.

title: A Great Way to Celebrate Christmas
text: The Michelangelo Hotel made our Christmas all the more special with great service, a beautiful room and fantastic staff.  The hotel is perfectly located minutes from Rockefeller Center, Times Square and other great sites. We had a great time and will definitely be back soon

title: My new favorite NYC hotel
text: What a gem! The location to Broadway, Times Square and Fifth Avenue shopping is perfect. The hotel is beautiful. From the moment you walk in you feel as though you are special and treated like family. All the staff is wonderful. The rooms are beautifully appointed and incredibly spacious. We will return whenever we are in New York. It is definitely my new favorite hotel.

title: Midtown Hotel in NYC
text: Family vacation in NYC.  We booked two rooms for our family and were located right next to each other.  It was a great hotel in a great location with no big problems.  The staff were very courteous and accommodating.  The location was excellent and provided easy walkability to Central Park, Times Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral and more.

title: A hidden gem in the city
text: A hidden gem in the city, spacious suite with plenty of amenities available and polite attentive staff.  I'll definitely be back.  I only wish I was able to enjoy the stay longer than the 3 days I was there!.

title: 13 Consecutive Years At the Michelangelo
text: Spectacular as always.  Service is impeccable.  Employees, including maids, doormen and front desk staff, are friendly, helpful and gracious, always with a smile and a hello.  Location is ideal.  Rooms are large, tastefully decorated, clean and most of all quiet.  It's easy in and easy out.  We can't ask for much more.  Our June trip is "just around the corner".

title: Pre Christmas Experiance
text: Great location. Clean room, wonderful staff. Took my wife and daughter ( 8 ) on a CHRISTMAS trip to NYC. always wanted to experience the holiday there. Hotel, room and staff did not disappoint. walked and shopped all day....slept like babies at night.

title: Perfect
text: I’ve never spent Christmas away from home and family. At first I was worried but they made me feel right at home. Upon pulling up to The Michelangelo the doorman, Henry Diaz, was eager to help and helped in any way that he could. Mr. Diaz was willing and ready to assist me with anything I needed from getting my bags to my room to assisting with getting a late checkout. On top of the great service the lobby and my room were both beautiful. Room service was also delicious and pricing was on par with restaurants in the area. Christmas in New York is amazing, Everyone at The Michelangelo made it even better. My stay even ended with Henry giving me a hug as I headed back to my car. It wasn’t much appreciated and I will certainly be visiting again thanks to his service.

title: Wonderful experience
text: We travelled to NYC for my daughter’s birthday and to take in a show. The hotel staff were incredibly welcoming and accommodating. Rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel to others.

title: Great location, staff but dated lobby, room
text: Booked a Grand Suite and was excited about the stay.  Requested a quiet room and was given an interior suite location.  The fabric of the pillows to one of the sofas and bedroom chair were worn.  The decor was uninviting.  The room was not quiet as it was next to some mechanical blowers belonging to the building next door (not part of hotel).  One the positive side, the staff was very welcoming and the location was excellent.  Unfortunately, this is not enough to repeat a stay.

title: Stunning hotel in the best location
text:
The Michelangelo hotel is beautiful throughout, complimented by their incredibly warm and helpful team. We felt welcome the second we stepped inside to the moment we left. The decor inside is wonderful and the rooms are beautifully comfortable and a pleasure to stay in, with everything you need. 

The hotel is in the best location possible, it’s 2 minutes from Times Square, 2 minutes from The Rockerfeller and Central Park and it’s within walking distance to nearly every single major attraction and restaurant in New York. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and it played a major part in making our trip to New York so special. I’d love to be back one day, thank you.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The Michelangelo is always our first choice in New York City. It's an oasis of calm from the bustle outside as soon as you enter.  The staff is attentive, the rooms are lovely and the bar/dining  area is intimate and welcoming. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent!
text: It’s in a prime location. Bonus points for being a few doors away from Ruth’s Chris steakhouse. I loved the decor in the junior suite. It was a decent size. The staff was friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed the service. The drinks at the lounge were pretty good. I would definitely recommend. Though next time I’ll go with a bigger room.

title: Wonderful experience!!
text: We stay here every time we are in New York!  It is expensive, but worth every penny.  Excellent level of service in every aspect!!  The rooms are large and very clean.  Every employee we met was friendly and helpful.

title: 4th Visit
text:
Just returned from our 4th visit to this wonderful hotel. Will always return 

Rooms are spacious and so comfortable

Walter Faranda is becoming like family. Always makes us feel so welcome

Can't wait to return

title: First Class Hotel with a Heart !
text: Great location, beautiful facility, but the most outstanding feature of the Michelangelo is the warmth, professionalism, and individual attention of the Michelangelo team. Making memories with the granddaughters here was a joy !

title: Great hotel in super location
text: Staff is friendly hotel is accommodating. Customer service is outstanding. Easy walk to good restaurants and broadway shows. Lounge breakfasts are convenient and very good. Jackie is a top notch serve front desk staff is very helpful. Rooms are big and super clean.

title: Italian elegance
text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times. It has a great location, quiet rooms, friendly staff and a great bar. The beds are most comfortable and the sheets divine. The location is perfect for shopping and going to the theatre.

title: Christmas Sight Seeing
text: My husband and I came to visit NYC at Christmas time. The location was perfect. The hotel was beautiful. After being flustered by the chaos of driving through New York City, we were welcomed by a kind and friendly man. We enjoyed our stay very much, and would recommend it.

title: WOnderful
text: We have stayed here many times over the years and would never stay anywhere else in NYC. MOst accommodating staff ever ! FAntastic location, great rooms and overall charm.We appreciate the willingness of the entire staff to help- even in the madness of the Christmas season.

title: Well Done
text: The Michelangelo is in a great location near Time Square and the theaters and is easy to get to anywhere in Manhattan. The rooms are well appointed, clean and quiet.It is primarily a business hotel--we did not see any children when we stayed there recently for 4 days. The hotel does not have an actual  restaurant, but does serve breakfast in the bar area and room service is also available for breakfast and during the day. The staff are all friendly and helpful

title: Consistently Good
text: We go to Manhattan at least once a year and for the past many years we have stayed at the Michelangelo. Consistently courteous with good service.  The breakfast (sometimes you can get a deal where breakfast is included) is just right, and the breakfast staff is exceedingly solicitous.  The location is really great - one or two short blocks to several subway lines, easy walk to the theatre district, Central Park, museums, and other attractions. The “resort” fee drives me a little crazy - another tacked on add-on that doesn’t always show up when you book, and which, other than wi-if (which should be free), is just another profit center.  The rooms are decent-sized, very clean, and in good shape, with most of the usual amenities.  There are nice sitting areas off the lobby and on the second floor promenade, and the dining area and bar, while adjacent to the lobby, are pleasant, and a nice place to meet other travelers.  I’d call this a reasonably priced luxury hotel - not cheap, but not too over the top either.

title: december in NYC
text: December is s wonderful time to visit NYC. Wonders of Christmas lights, shopping, shows, dinning. It is truly magical as an adult or a child! The Michalangeli Hotel isWithin walking distance of most attractions. It gives you luxury with still intimacy! Thank you Michelangelo Hotel for a magical stay! We will be back!

title: The best part of our trip!
text: I love this hotel! A wonderful staff, beautiful decor and comfortable, luxurious rooms. We will certainly be back. It is A little gem in midtown. Easy walk to all the midtown attractions and shows and the rooms are large and unusually quite for this part of town.

title: Very nice stay
text: This is a very nice hotel with a lovely lobby and nicely furnished rooms. We stayed in a larger king room and it was very comfortable and the staff is great. The front desk helpful,efficient and friendly.. The bar is small but the service is very good. The bell staff was extraordinarily helpful in getting cabs and with the baggage. They got us taxis on rainy nights which is not easy in New York. I would definitely stay here again.  Minor quibbles: there is not an easy place to plug in ones cell phone  ( I hate having to crawl around to plug it in; the lamps are dim and have inconvenient line switches. The location is a mixed bag. Easy to walk from the hotel to many areas for shopping and  sites. But getting a cab is difficult on 7th Ave and the southbound flow takes you into Times Square traffic.

title: SO WELCOMING AND BEAUTIFUL!!
text: Had the most wonderful experience at the Michelangelo; My stay was brief yet a fantastic one! Why? because I was greeted so warmly and welcoming at the door and from there every staff member was the same. I felt at home as everyone goes out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. It's location is perfect right in the heart of New York; all staff are knowledgeable, they helped with directions and suggestions to best things to see, restaurants, tours and even told me about the best shows on Broadway! Rooms are so clean and with plenty space. The European decor is beautiful. I definitely loved everything about the Michelangelo. On my last day it was raining and on my way out, I was even handed an umbrella, how thoughtful is that? I look forward to coming back soon to New York and stay here again!

title: A Little Jewel in Hectic NYC
text: We stayed in Suite 303 and loved our stay.  Everything was perfect except for the two televisions in the sitting room and the bedroom; they were back to back with no panel separating them.  If both  were on, the audio was annoying. The Management and Staff were wonderful and went out of their way to accommodate any request. There was no coffee maker in the room and I was not aware of the option to get one. So if you like in-room coffee, make sure you request one! The Keurig was great and excellent coffee. As a native New Yorker  it was a special treat to spend a week here with my Italian husband.  Grazie Marco e Carolina>

title: Watch the Tax
text: Hotel is exceptional but be wary of the Residency and State Taxes. Location cant be beaten and attention to detail is hard to beat. Room was very clean and comfortable but need to check the air conditioning system, better regulator needed. Overall would recommend to anyone on a short break as long as costs understood

title: Fabulous
text:
This was my second visit here and just like my first time I could not fault it. Back this time to celebrate our wedding anniversary. From the cheery welcome from the doorman on duty when I first arrived, followed by an effortless check-in from the lovely young lady at the reception. Delighted with the room, so large and warm with all the facilities that you should require. The other great advantage that this hotel gives is that it is so handy to the theatres, with a few of them only 3-4 minutes away on foot. Ellen's Stardust Diner is the nearest restaurant and we used that everytime the queues were short. 
Staying in the Michelangelo Hotel on our next trip will be an easy decision for me.

title: Best cosmo I’ve ever had!
text: This is a lovely, historic, conveniently located hotel. But the best part is the bar. Gerard, the bartender, made me the best cosmo I’ve ever had using his secret recipe. 10/10 recommend! He was an attentive, talkative bartender who helped us order food before the kitchen closed. Thanks Gerard for your great hospitality and conversation! I’ll totally come back to stay here next NYC trip!

title: Super satisfeita
text: Localização perfeita, quarto e sala super confortável com dois banheiros, mimo para meu filho que fez aniversário, elevadores muito rápidos, entregas sem custo, staff atenciosa.  Tivemos um problema com o barulho do ar condicionado que foi prontamente resolvido. Todas as solicitações eram imediatamente atendidas. leve barulho da rua, mas que não atrapalhou a estada. Volto com certeza!

title: Fantastic Stay
text: What a fabulous hotel. Right in the midst of Time Square - yet not too close so you can get some sleep :).Every staff member is professional, friendly and helpful. Gerard in the lounge is friendly, entertaining and helps you feel like you're at home. We have stayed at numerous hotels in the city and this one is by far at the top of the list. We stayed in a Grand One Bedroom Suite - while our older kids stayed in a Studio with 2 King beds. The rooms are very spacious, with large bathrooms. Beds and sofas/chairs in the rooms are comfortable. So much better than the larger chain hotels with 500+ rooms. Will definitely return.

title: Beautiful Hotel at Time Square
text:
Went to NYC for Business and pleasure. Hotel staff took wonderful care and upgraded my room. Nice rooms and wonderful
Bedding. Great location to take in some sights and theater. Love the Street life. Room service was excellent, high quality.

title: Can't Get Over How Accommodating They Are
text: I haven't written a review before but felt compelled to weigh in after an amazing stay at the Michelangelo Hotel in NYC.   I looked at a hundred places and picked this based on location and room size.  However, they offered so much more.  Every member of the staff were kind, helpful, and super accommodating for whatever requests we had.  You made my daughter's first trip to Broadway so memorable, thank you!

title: Fantastic new york find
text: We had not visited New York for a few years so we had planned plenty places to see. We wanted a central location so picked the michelangelo,  we did well.  compared to other New York hotel rooms this is very spacious with lovely furniture . Hotel is within easy walking distance of 5th avenue , radio city, rockefella centra and time square.  All the staff do a great job and helped make our new york holiday memorable.  Will not wait so long before returning this time.

title: Favorite Hotel in the Theater District
text: The Michaelangelo is our hotel of choice when we visit NYC for a number of reasons.  It's quite elegant and lovely without being the least bit pretentious, starting with the entrance and the lobby and including the rooms and suites.  The staff is welcoming and thoughtful and do more than expected to ensure that you have a wonderful stay.   The rooms are very spacious, well-appointed and comfortable, and they vary widely in space and layout.   We love the location, close to all the Broadway (and some off-Broadway) theaters, City Center and Carnegie Hall.  And it's not too far from Lincoln Center.  It's also very convenient to Rockefeller Center and shopping on 5th Avenue, MOMA, and lots of other places.  Staying there is like being a guest in a very small boutique hotel with the excellent staff and personalized service but with all the amenities you'd expect from a larger hotel like this.  My husband and I have stayed several times and have recommended it to friends and relatives who have enjoyed it as well.

title: Another Fantastic Stay
text: This is our favorite hotel to stay when we are in New York! Excellent location- the staff are fabulous! Will stay here again. The room was very clean and comfortable. The lounge offered an excellent variety of beverages, and the breakfast was perfect.

title: The Michelangelo
text: Nice Hotel in the middle of Broadway, close to nice restaurant, theaters, and many attractions. The room are huge, compared to other hotels in the area. The service overall is very good. There,s a small bar and restaurant in the property excellent for a bite and or drink before any show.

title: Awesome
text: From the moment my team walked through the doors, we were treated like royalty.  Everyone was extremely polite, service was amazing and the entire experience will be remembered for a very long time.  The room was outstanding from every aspect.  Definitely look forward to returning.

title: Convenient location, spacious, but Doorman can be rude
text:
I had to travel for business from Nov 9th to Nov 13, so chose this hotel because I was also bringing the wife and kid.  The location is excellent because it's down the street from Rockefeller Center, American Girl, and a lot of access to different restaurants and attractions within a 10-15 minute walk.  So don't need to worry about hailing an Uber/Cab or jumping on the subway with a toddler.

We stayed in the grand suite and the room was absolutely massive.  So this was very convenient and comfortable for the family, and the hotel arranged a crib for no charge.  One compliant was that the decor, furniture, and room items were a bit dated.  The rug was severely stained and grimy, there was a rice kernel encrusted on the lamp shade, the faucets leaked (I fixed it for them), and there were stains on the bed sheets.  The laminate flooring is very dark in color, so every speck of dust and lint shows through (makes the room seem a lot more dirty).  This isn't really a fault of the hotel, but a remodel or update may be in order sometime in the future.  This is something for guests to keep in mind if you're splurging $600+ a night on a room.  The housekeeping was very attentive and helped us a lot, and freshening up the room for turn-down service.

We encountered 3 different doormen during our 5 day stay.  Theodoro by far was the nicest.  Every time he saw us coming down the lobby he would rush to open the door for my wife while she was pushing the stroller.  He would even help her lift the stroller up the steps (there's no ramp).  He had such enthusiasm and hustle no matter what time of the day we saw him.  He was also very helpful with directions and other small tasks.  As for the other doormen on staff, my wife would mention every day that they would completely ignore her and never offered any help.  I thought this was strange until I experienced it myself the last day of our stay.  It was around 12 noon on Tuesday Nov 13th and we had already checked out.  We were pushing 3 pieces of luggage plus a stroller through the lobby and the doorman walked past us to assist a couple that wasn't even leaving!  He was telling the couple that he could hold their luggage for them while they toured the city since their flight wasn't until the evening.  So my wife turns to me and says "You see? That's the guy that's been ignoring me the last 5 days".  Luckily I ran outside and our driver came inside the lobby to help with the luggage.

My toddler was playing with my wedding band the last day and misplaced it.  The hotel staff was very helpful, sealing off the room and having the security team comb through.  Marco the head of security even gave me a follow up call after to see if we found it after unpacking our luggage.  Luckily my kid put the ring in her backpack and we found it after returning home to Los Angeles.

title: Not going the right way
text: The Michelangelo used to be a great hotel but needs to know to be careful and invest versus competition.Housekeeping is very average for the price we pay.Barmen are very nice and location is of course fantastic

title: Great Hotel and location
text: 2 night stay at the Michelangelo Hotel.  When we arrived we were greeted by Henry who was very helpful and friendly.  Hotel check in was quick and easy, rooms were clean and very comfortable.  I recommend!

title: Surprisingly Great Place to Stay
text: Stayed one night only, chose the place just to be close to the VIP buses to the NYC marathon.But boy was I surprised! Even though it was overpriced due to the 120,000+ Marathoning families and friends flooding Manhattan over the weekend, I'm pleased to say this is going to be my next NY stay.Stay away if you can't sleep with street noise though, as even with double windows, 52nd and 7th traffic honks and sirens do come trough.

title: Don’t park your car here
text: Hotel is nice, good service, great location. Just don’t even think about valet parking here. We have been waiting well over an hour and still no car. Stood there and watched the bellman specifically tell the guy which car to get and he returned 30 minutes later with another car. Absolutely ridiculous.

title: Great stay at The Michelangelo
text: 5 Night stay at this wonderful hotel.  Classic style NYC hotel, with some of the best hotel staff we have experienced in NYC.  Our room was larger than an average NYC hotel room, and very quiet.  We really appreciated the central Midtown location.  We will be returning to the hotel for our next NYC visit!

title: The Michaelangelo
text: I love this hotel!  It's a wonderful "Plaza" feel.  Big rooms with good size bathrooms as well!  It's just not your typical NYC hotel.  I am such a bed snob and the beds are wonderful.  Great linens, too! I stayed here with 2 of my daughters last season and I loved it so much that I booked again this month. Again, it did not disappoint!   The location is wonderful, too!

title: Great hotel with large rooms
text: Very nice hotel. Location is excellent and central to everything. It is not modern, but everything is great, great mattress, carpet, lobby, and staff. The exceptionally large size of the rooms (for a Manhattan hotel) makes it so much more comfortable.

title: Simply the best!
text: This is the second time we stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel and I’m happy we choose it again!Location is Perfect! Rooms are huge compared to other hotels in NYC and the service is exceptional! Before our arrival My husband called and told the front desk that we’re celebrating our anniversary - not only that we were upgraded to a bigger And a beautiful room, we received a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries! Looking for luxury hotels in midtown?Don’t hesitate! You won’t find any other hotel similar to this in NYC  !

title: Well located hotel but not as good as it used to be
text: The Michelangelo hotel is well located with quiet and reasonably spacious rooms.  We have stayed there many times but found the hotel to be not quite as welcoming or well appointed as on previous occasions

title: Its my new home in NYC
text:
The rooms are large, well kept and very clean. The staff definitely has
A crew that knows how to service the clientele. We used their meeting room facilities and they are confortable and well equipped.

title: A delightful stay
text: We stayed for a 2 night weekend celebrating my wife's birthday, in NYC.  The location is great, because it's so close to the theater district and many restaurants.  The lobby is a boutique setting, with a European flair.  The room was large, well appointed and clean.  We enjoyed the room and setting, as well as our trip to NYC.

title: Deteriorated Badly
text:
My husband used to stay here often when on business in New York, the last time being about 10 years ago: I would sometimes accompany him. We used to love staying here.

The hotel is not what it was sadly.

The furnishings in the lobby are shabby and tired. The same is true of the bedrooms. There's plainly no replacement, refurbishment or maintenance programme here. It's very disappointing because this used to be a lovely hotel.

Be aware, there is no restaurant. The space which was formerly Limoncello is no longer part of the hotel and is now a gift shop, with an entrance from the street.

Breakfast is now served in an area off the lobby, which is a wholly inadequate arrangement, furnished as it is, with very low arm chairs and sofas, so deep that it is impossible to sit up to the tables to eat the food comfortably. 

Service was absolutely shambolic, with unprofessional, chaotic staff and apparently their equivalents in the kitchen. Nothing came promptly or without at least three requests, elements of the meal either didn't appear at all, were wrong or were so far apart that the items which initially appeared were stone cold by the time everything was united on the plate. All we could hear was a chorus of complaints from all the other diners. One man got up to cancel his pancakes which were so long in the cooking that he was in danger of missing his flight.

If we hadn't been hungry each morning and had breakfast as part of our package, this would have been entertaining, so extreme was it. The Keystone Cops come to catering. Each day we were treated to this spectacle to one degree or another.

We complained to the charming lady duty manager who was very apologetic (but interestingly did not appear surprised to hear what we were saying) and generously said that by way of compensation she would look at our room rate and make an adjustment. But she never did.

title: Breve ma intensa esperienza
text:
Non ho avuto modo di soggiornare in questo hotel ma solo entrando nella hall sono rimasta stupefatta!ogni dettaglio è curato nei minimi particolari ed è veramente elegante!
Abbiamo bevuto una birra al bar ed il servizio è stato ottimo!personale estremamente cordiale e gentile!

title: Great place to stay
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in September. The hotel is well placed with many attractions (Times square, central park, 5th avenue etc) on the door step. The room was spacious and very comfortable. And surprisingly quiet given the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. Staff were friendly and helpful

title: Ladies trip!
text:
I just celebrated my sisters 50th with her and 5 other ladies in NYC. We stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel for 4 nights. Fantastic stay and here is my ‘review’ of the hotel.

I researched various hotels in the area. We could have spent quite a bit more/night and likely a little less but I feel like we got very good value here. Personally I am less moved by ‘sparkle’ and put more importance on the actual experience. However, cleanliness is paramount for me - I can’t compromise in that area. The Michelangelo Hotel is old and beautiful. The location is terrific (we took the subway and were walking the streets of SoHo in under 20min). Unique, Italian decor. The staff was excellent - warm, helpful, real people. I think this is why I am on trip advisor right now.  

The room was spotless, bed was very comfortable, good water pressure in the shower - no real deficiencies at all. Our breakfast was included with our room rate and we had 2 gluten free eaters. There were many good gf options on the menu and the breakfast in general was great! Our experience here was very good and I would definitely stay here again!

title: Always a pleasure
text: We have enjoyed several stays at The Michelangelo & the staff have the knack of creating a real sense of welcome. The hotel is ideally situated for those, like us, who enjoy Broadway (on & off). The proximity of restaurants & the Duke's cafe & grocery store are also bonuses. Our favorite room, so far, is 428. Joseph at reception & Jimmy in the bar are both wonderfully helpful & great sources of information. Whilst singling out these two, it would be less than appropriate not to add that everyone on the staff is polite, friendly, cheerful & discrete. We always look forward to our stays at The Michelangelo. P.S. Don't miss the great coffee at the bar!

title: Fabulous!
text: A wonderful stay for our anniversary weekend. Beautiful room, clean, extremely comfortable. Professional, courteous staff. Will definitely be returning. Thanks to the team for making our stay so memorable.

title: Great place to stay
text: Good size rooms  with very comfortable beds - a hotel with a quiet, serene feel to it - with high levels of personal service. The location just north of Times Square is ideal for visiting Manhattan. Breakfast is good value and very relaxed

title: Perfect weekend Getaway
text: I could not have selected a better hotel for the perfect weekend getaway. The Michelangelo was perfectly located and a short distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Broadway Theaters, and short walk to Central Park. The staff good have not been more friendly, or helpful.

title: Posizione ottima, buon servizio ma struttura "datata"
text:
Ho soggiornato per 5 notti in questo hotel situato all'incrocio tra la 7 av. e la 51 street. La posizione è fantastica e consente di visitare comodamente tutte le principali attrazioni di Manhattan. Servizio nel complesso buono, ottima la pulizia sia generale sia delle camere.
Ciò detto bisogna riconoscere che la struttura non è sicuramente "moderna", anzi si può tranquillamente affermare che è piuttosto "datata". La camera che ho utilizzato, una "Suite Grand", decisamente spaziosa ma completamente buia (sembrava di essere in un bunker) con vista inesistente, anzi, luce esterna inesistente. Un vero peccato...

title: Anniversary Stay
text: From the moment of arrival to our departure we had a fantastic stay at The Michelangelo where all the staff are so customer friendly and you felt as you were their special guest. I will definitely book and also recommend The Michelangelo to friends and family.

title: The Michelangelo Hotel is reliable
text: We have stayed at the Michelangelo many times.  The front desk staff and doormen are always helpful.  The room appears to have been updated.  Overall a great location as it is just above Times Square and also close to other attractions.

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text:
We just spent 10 nights at this wonderful hotel.  It truly feels like a home away from home.  We like the suites with the 2 bathrooms, the price is great for that amount of space, large living room, bedroom and 2 full baths.  It is so nice to come into a tranquil place, away from all the madness on the streets.  They have a quaint bar area that is nice for relaxing, as well as nice chairs and tables in the lobby.    The front desk staff is so nice and courteous.  Walter was my favorite he always addressed us by name and was so nice.  Marco the manager is also excellent, eager to please in any way he can. He has been with the hotel since it was new.  Same for any of the other staff, doorman, housekeeping, always smiling and friendly.  We caught colds while there and had room service for breakfast 5 mornings.  I usually hate room service in NYC ,the food is never hot by the time you get it and it aways takes a long time.
