Not to mention the cost,  which you wouldn't mind if it was good, but it usually isn't. Our breakfasts were delicious,they arrived within 20 minutes and were piping hot.  Even the bagels and toast  were hot. That almost never happens !  Coffee is great, not too strong or weak. All I can say is this place is one of the best.  I also love the location, so close to Broadway and right across the street for one of NYC's best restaurants Le Bernardin. Capitol Grill and Ruth's Chris is just a couple of doors down as well as other great options in walking distance.
We love it and are spoiled by the great service.  We just won't stay anywhere else!

title: Traditional elegance
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Michelangelo. The hotel is stylish and comfortable. It has maintained its level of service through the years. Each member of the staff treats you as a special person. Repairs are carried out immediately; every request is answered with care. The rooms are spacious, the corridors elegant. The restaurant in the lobby offers excellent breakfast; we didn’t try lunch or dinner. Complimentary copies of the New York Times. Be ware of a $40 residency tax: it covers phone calls, use of the business centre and a $10 coupon for the restaurant/bar. 

Wonderful place if you want to explore this part of Manhattan: Central Park, Times Square, the museums, the shows, shopping.

title: Great Hotel in Mid-Manhattan
text: The Michelangelo Hotel is in a great location within walking distance of Time Square, Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue shopping.   It is one of my regular "go-to" boutique hotels in NYC because it is a great value for the price.   The hotel is clean with nice decor, and the beds are very comfortable.  The staff is always friendly and helpful and the food is good.  I've stayed at The Michelangelo numerous times and have never been disappointed.

title: Lovely place in mid Manhattan
text: Our room with 2 queen size beds was surprisingly large for Manhattan. It appeared to be recently remodeled and was lovely, very clean and quiet despite its Times Square proximity location. One big negative was the lack of reading lights in the bedroom. There was only one large lamp between 2 large beds which made reading virtually impossible without disturbing each other. A coffee maker would have been a nice addition. The front desk and lobby staff, particularly Henry, were excellent. They were efficient and helpful.

title: Excellent in every way
text:
This is a GREAT hotel to stay in New York!  This was the third time we've stayed for a week, and we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.  Everyone who works here is sincerely friendly and helpful -- from the doormen, the bellmen, to the front desk staff and the manager.  Our junior suite #608 was lovely and spacious: comfortable furniture, big living room sitting area, a great bed, huge bathroom, dressing area.  And it was always kept sparkling clean by the terrific housekeepers.  
The location can't be beat.  It's easy walking distance to theaters, and surrounded by literally hundreds of restaurants, cafes, bakeries.  Close to subway and bus stops, which makes it simple to get around the city.  We had a fantastic week of museums, activities, sightseeing and shows.  And every night we got to come back to our beautiful home away from home.  If you're coming to New York, don't bother looking any further.  You've found the perfect hotel.

title: Fantastic Hotel.
text: The Michelangelo is in the perfect location. Midway (roughly) between Times Square and Central Park. Only a few minutes walk to either place. Management and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again if we found ourselves in New York.

title: Nice hotel
text: This hotel was nice the room was very spacious and had things that we needed such as an umbrella. The staff was pleasant and I have no complaints. It was convenient to Times Square and Rockefeller center. The bellman was great at checkout when we needed a cab to the airport. He jumped out in the middle of the street and used a light and whistle to hail a cab in a traffic jam due to parade traffic. I got the room for a reasonable price for New York and it was comfortable and clean. Would definitely recommend for others. We had breakfast at the hotel which was included and the food was good as well.

title: Great Choice in the Heart of NYC
text: We had to stay near Times Square to be near family members, and the Michelangelo was a great choice. It’s about four blocks from Times Square, but it feels much calmer and there’s no neon. Our room was very nice and felt clean, with plenty of space. The bed was comfortable! The decor wasn’t very modern, but quite charming. And the complimentary breakfast was delicious. The staff were consistently friendly and helpful. So, overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay close to Times Square.

title: Theater district boutique hotel
text:
Jose Rosete, Jackie, and Jimmy Seferi in the restaurant offer excellent service. Best way to start the day. The concierge Robin was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Super hotel. The location is in walking distance to Times Square as well as Lincoln Center.
The hotel is very quiet and the lobby has plenty of seating to relax after a long day. Nicely appointed.

title: Great Place to stay in NYC
text: Great staff!!!From the doorman, valet, Bell Boy, receptionist, bartender all happy to see you and warm.  Rooms are spacious, and clean and have control of room temp.Great location near theaters. We will be back.

title: Great opera weekend
text: I love the location, comfort, cleanliness, and hospitality of this marvelous hotel.  We come to NYC often for the Met Opera, so being within walking distance is great.  The Michelangelo is just enough beyond the congestion of Times Square and close enough to Central Park to make it the perfect spot.

title: A wonderful experience
text: This hotel is simply marvelous.The concierge are very clever.Mr. Marco Gianni is the most professional person in the hotel.Very, very good. A beautiful experience at the centre of Manhattan, very close to Times square, Broadway theatres and fifth avenue.

title: Charming hotel in great location
text: This hotel is in an unbeatable NY location. The service is excellent. It is an old building but that can be overlooked. It is clean. The rooms and bathrooms are well cleaned. we liked the cosy arm chairs in our bedroom. Toiletries, robes and slippers are provided. The front desk staff is very friendly and anxious to please. Special kudos to Adam.

title: Great spot in Midtown
text: Fantastic Hotel ! Great check in and service. Room is very clean and quite. The Bar in the lobby is very charming with  great food and service. Luna was the best and the food was great. We had Pizza, hamburger and veglie. All very fresh and delicius . Will be back !

title: Wonderful Experience
text: The Michelangelo is a distinctively styled and well kept smaller hotel that has everything you need in a calm and relaxing atmosphere. It is very conveniently located for walking to sights or taking the subway. All the staff were very friendly and welcoming. Check in and check out was easy and quick. Housekeeping was great; room service was prompt; and the doormen were very helpful. We joined the "I Prefer" club and were able to book a junior suite for a reasonable rate. Upon check in they noted that it was our anniversary and upgraded us to a one bedroom suite which was spacious and lovely. We stayed four nights and had no problems. It was a wonderful experience and we would stay there again and recommend it to others.

title: West side Gem!
text:
The Michelangelo is a Gem! Beautiful, spacious, and comfortable rooms. Staff is amazing! Carmen at the lobby bar and Walter at the front desk are standouts! 
You will love staying. Location is perfect as well!

title: Exceptional  As Always!!
text: Overall stay was excellent!Front Desk Staff - Walter F.  and Stef -Helpful and FriendlyDoorpersons/Bell Captain Henry and Cesar always smiling, courteous and helpfulHousekeeping- Punctual & professional

title: A Charming Hotel in a Great Location
text: My wife and I have stayed here several times before. The staff is friendly and it feels like partly a New York hotel and partly like a European one. On this trip Walter at the front desk, Jimmy and Jose in the dining room, Henry with our luggage and Robin at the Concierge desk were particularly helpful. In short, this a friendly, elegant but not snobby home for when you are in NYC.

title: First time...Well
text: Well done....A great stay in a really good hotel. We had never stayed there before and people like Jimmy, Jose, Henry and Walter all made us feel very welcome. The rooms are clean and updated, the bar was ell stocked and the food was really good.

title: Fantastic hotel stay
text: Just returned from a fantastic 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. Agree slightly dated but we found it quite elegant and ideal for our stay.  My 5th visit to New York and I have never had such a large room (507) which was a corner room with nice street views, 2 large beds, 2 part bathroom which was ideal for my daughter and I. Large bedroom with sitting area with easy chair and settee. Hotel was convenient for all the major sites and so much better than staying in Times Square which was so noisy and busy. Beds were so comfortable and room cleaning etc was excellent. All the staff we had dealing with reception, bar and concierge were excellent (especially Henry who stored our luggage and arranged our taxi back to the airport. They are all a credit to the hotel and make for a lovely stay in this beautiful city. We didn't have anything to eat in the hotel but enjoyed a couple of drinks in the bar. Would definitely stay here on our next visit and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

title: Amazing hotel in convenient location
text: I had such a wonderful stay here with family. It is located near all the action, so it was super convenient to be able to wake up and hit the city. Its probably not the most modern hotel regarding technology, it has more a classic feel especially with the chandeliers, but definitely the nicest staff on hand. Everyone was a delight to interact with, from Ming(?) at the door, Jackie at breakfast, Walther & Carolina at the front desk. I would love to come back sometime, this hotel and its staff were phenomenal.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Great Service
text: Upon entry we were struck by how gracious and helpful the staff are. The doormen helped store our luggage when we arrived early and delivered it to our room when it was ready despite one suitcase losing a wheel in transit to the hotel. The front desk staff and concierge were fabulous, and the room was large, well appointed, and quiet despite being in midtown. Wonderful experience.

title: 以外と静かなホテル
text: タイムズスクェアに近く便利なところなので喧しいのかと心配してましたが、以外と静かでした。最近のデザイナーホテルと違い壁等が分厚いのか3階と7階に泊まりましたがゆっくり出来ました。NYにしたら部屋も広くベッドのクッションも良かったです。ターンダーンサービスは有りませんでしたが十分でした。

title: Excellent hotel in the theater district convenient to Rockefeller Plaza
text: Wonderful hotel with fantastic beds.  The most comfortable hotel beds ever.  Excellent helpful staff. The barman was excellent and all the doormen were so helpful and friendly.  Made us feel so welcome.  Very relaxed atmosphere once you came through the doors as opposed to the hectic pace outside.  The décor and atmosphere remind us of the Monteleone in New Orleans.

title: Lovely hotel and large bedroom
text: What a lovely hotel! Very close to Times Square, a 5 min walk to Central Park and as soon as you walk through the door, the New York noise is left behind. Friendly staff and the bedrooms are a fair bit larger than most other hotels we researched. We were on our honeymoon and were pleasantly surprised with a room upgrade and bottle of prosecco with strawberries, compliments of the hotel. A lovely touch and completely unexpected, thank you! A great place to stay!

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Personal amable, ubicación inmejorable, habitaciones de buen tamaño y muy cómodas. Es la primera vez que me quedo en el hotel y estaré por 6 noches, me siento muy complacido por mi elección. Recomendable.

title: Fabulous Hotel.  Absurd cost for parking
text: The Michelangelo is without a doubt the finest hotel either my wife or I have ever stayed.  Everything about the hotel was wonderful.  The staff was incredibly congenial and the room was amazing.  The proximity to Broadway had us within walking distance of the show we were in town to see.  The view from our room was a Traditional Manhattan Brick Wall, but we didn't mind that at all (when in Rome, ....)  We didn't have time to try out many of the services, but breakfast at least "looked" very nice.  However, the cost to valet park our car definitely qualified as "Manhattan Stupid Expensive".  Other than that ding, the stay was a truly great experience.

title: SIMPLY THE BEST!!
text: This is my go-to NYC hotel.  The staff is so friendly and proficient, particularly Guest Service Agent Walther, Barman Jimmy and Bellman Henry...their customer service is outstanding!  The check-in is seamless, no waiting for elevators and you're in your room in no time.  The rooms are attractive, incredibly spacious and always clean and tidy.  Location is perfect...steps away from subway, restaurants, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, to name a few.  Close to Times Square but far enough away from the hustle, bustle and noise.

title: Another fabulous stay!
text: This hotel is top notch in all ways! The staff has been around for years - it's like coming home! No detail is overlooked and customer service is top priority.  The rooms are absolutely plush and huge... We ONLY stay here!

title: Great hotel in an excellent location
text: The suite was very comfortable and up to the standard of a luxury hotel. The extra toilet was a bonus especially since we were traveling with our 2 year old. The hotel is walking distances from times square and central park. Good places around to eat.

title: Michelangelo Experience
text: The hotel and staff perfectly met our needs in terms of quality of service, room excellence and location of hotel. Courteous and attentive staff. Close to many attractions and restaurants. We would recommend this hotel to others.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: Spacious rooms, very helpful staff. Central location, 2 blocks off Times Sq, far enough to avoid the noise. Small but nice restaurant with a a nice breakfast menu, more than the usual menu, superb food, excellent staff, especially Jimmy.

title: Excellent Location and Great Rooms
text: This boutique hotel in mid-town Manhattan is the best kept secret in NYC.  The One Bedroom Suite was absolutely huge, the staff professional and courteous, and the location can't be beat if you are interested in Broadway shows, Museums, Central Park, and mid-town shopping.  Or hop on the subway  only a block away.

title: Birthday getaway
text: Air unit did not function properly. The room was constantly humid. The hallways were much better than the room. It affected our sleep quality greatly. I raised this issue to the staff, and their remedy was to adjust the temperature 2 degrees lower. This did not affect the high humidity level. I spoke to the management upon departure. This inconvenience was worth a $40 credit.  I was not pleased by this , nor by the appropriate lack of concern over the affect this had on my wife and I .

title: Anniversary trip to NYC
text: Michaelangelo is our go-to NY hotel. I love the place and the people.  This particular trip was a bit underwhelming as the a/c unit in our room experienced a major problem necessitating one night without a/c, and 2 big fans in the room to dry out the carpet on 2 of our 4 days.  In fairness, on the 2nd days of fans, we were offered to move to a room on a lower floor but packing and unpacking is a pain as well and we declined that option. No other consideration was forthcoming.

title: A Top Hotel In NYC
text: Very nice and clean hotel in the heart of NYC. Wonderful staff, from the doormen, to the team at the front desk. I am always greeted in a friendly and professional manner when I stay there. Nice size rooms, and quiet at night.

title: Really nice and great location
text:
Only stayed the one night here this week - we have reservations at Le Bernadin opposite.

Lovely place, spacious room which was all really well decorated and looked amazing. In fact, this place is somewhere to take a loved one. Staff were attentive and polite. The practice of a facility charge £48 is just something I wish the industry would stop doing in the US. We did not use anything, not even the $10 credit against the bar as we were dining out.

Aside from that, and that the inner rooms not street facing were very dark, I would highly recommend The Michelangelo. One of the best in NYC and ideally situated for pretty much all of Midtown.

title: Great stay!! Super attentive staff, definitely coming back!
text: I had a lovely stay from the moment I stepped foot to the hotel from the warm welcome at the front door to lovely attentive staff. Perfect getaway in Times Square and appreciate the upgrade! Will definitely come back.

title: wonderful trip to New York City
text: We have stayed at the Michelangelo before. The staff is fantastic, the rooms much larger than normal hotels in the City and a great location. 51st and 6th..We would not stay anywhere else in the City.

title: Girls trip!
text: Love this hotel!   Been staying here for years!   Great location, service is impeccable. Cozy and beautiful.  Staff is so accommodating.   You can go shopping on 5th Avenue, see a show,Rockefeller Center right around the corner!

title: Hidden Gem
text: This hotel is a hidden Gem. We thoroughly enjoyed our staff and we very well treated by your staffRoom rate included breakfast and was very reasonable the lobby and lounge were warm and inviting and our room was spacious and well equipped. We will be Back !

title: Great location
text: Four of us ladies shared a room with two king beds....very spacious...never felt crowded..The location is great...close to Rockefeller Center and Times Square...very elegant lobby area...we would stay here again..

title: Best Vacation Ever in New York City
text: We came to New York for our 27th Wedding Anniversary.  This hotel and their staff were Absolutely Wonderful. We stayed in the Grande Suite for 9 days and it was very clean and quiet.  The staff (Angel, Joseph, Cesar and Jonathan) were Awesome!!! From the time we checked in, to the time we left, they made sure we enjoyed our stay.  They gave us suggestions of things to check out on our first trip to New York. The location is great! This hotel is close to everything and the food was very good.

title: Heerlijk hotel op een geweldige plaats
text:
Een week hier verbleven en waar het buiten een drukte is hoor je daar binnen niets van. Mooie ruime kamer, heerlijk bed, alles keurig netjes en in orde. Personeel heel vriendelijk dus alles voor een goede uitvalsbasis om NYC te gaan verkennen. Het ligt zowat op Times Square tussen winkeltjes, restaurantjes en metro om de hoek.
Wij vonden een week genoeg en hebben alles gezien wat we wilden zien dus komen niet meer terug, maar als we terug zouden komen zou het zeker naar dit hotel zijn.

title: Buen hotel pero si pagas los extras
text:
Es un buen hotel, excelentemente situado y con calidad de todo, eso si, si pagas más de lo que pagas por la habitación. Por el precio de una noche (tirando a alto) bien podría incluir agua o televisión por cable o productos del minibar. Pero no. Tampoco tiene calentador de agua para hacerte un te en la habitación, sólo servicio de cafetería si lo pagas. 
Por lo demás en un buen hotel; algo antiguo. Buena calidad de sueño en la ciudad que nunca duerme. El personal del hotel amable y agradable (se agradece ya que en algunos hoteles de New York no siempre ocurre). En recepción no se habla español aunque los botones y porteros si que lo hablan.
Espacio en la cafetería algo pequeño para los desayunos.

title: Beware, guests! Minibar is used to give you extra charges!
text:
I stayed at the Michelangelo on August 18-22, 2018. The stay went fine. However the day left I received an unexpected extra $8 charge. I had to contact the hotel to learn that it was due to 'minibar usage'. I did not use the minibar at all, so I sent an email to the Micheangelo requesting an explanation (what was missing at the minibar, when it was noticed...). 
I received no response at all, but of course they kept the $8. 
Sounds shabby, but that's how the Michelangelo does business.

title: Outstanding hotel
text: We stay here every year and always will. Top notch hotel, service, food. Everyone treats you like royalty. Bed and pillows are so comfortable you never want to leave your room. Beautiful decor everywhere.

title: An amazing and convenient location!
text: We have stayed at this hotel several times now.  It is a terrific hotel that is well-located in midtown, only a short walk from Times Square and therefore great if you are seeing Broadway shows.  The rooms are quite large.  We have stayed in rooms with 2 kings and also with 2 queens.  Worked nicely for a family with 2 children.  Beware of the residence fee which was not disclosed at the time of booking and also I would say that this hotel needs renovating as the carpet and furnishings are quite tired.  Although that being said, it's a super value for a midtown hotel and a terrific place for a family weekend getaway.

title: Top of the Manhattan
text:
Sin dall'inizio della preparazione viaggio a NY, questo splendido Hotel era nella nostra lista, posizionato al 1° posto. Osservando e valutando decine e decine di hotel tra i vari siti e recensioni (con foto viaggiatori), non ho avuto più dubbi.... L'alloggio a NY doveva essere al THE MICHELANGELO. :-)
Il contatto diretto è stato superlativo, peraltro la cortesia e la professionalità l'avevo già trovata in altre strutture di IAMSTAR in altre città (Milano soprattutto). Poi quì anche la fortuna di trovare il manager Marco Gianni che oltre ad essere un Italiano, è stato davvero il mio interlocutore speciale, grazie anche al contatto della gentilissima Laura Baroncelli (REGIONAL DIRECTOR OF SALES - STARHOTELS) con la quale ho avuto il piacere di affidare la mia richiesta, prontamente soddisfatta poi dal pregiatissimo Marco Gianni.
L'Hotel The Michelangelo? ..... vorrei solo trasferirvi le emozioni sensoriali per carpirne la qualità, l'ospitalità, la raffinatezza, il pregio, il profumo avvolgente e sobrio appena si entra nella splendida hall che potete osservare dalle mie foto..., ma soprattutto il sorriso sincero della gentilezza e cortesia di tutto il personale che abbiamo trovato. 
La suite che il sig. Marco Gianni ci ha riservato è a dir poco favolosa, ampia con 2 grandi letti matrimoniali (eravamo in 4) e con una cabina armadio comoda e con tutto il necessario (quando si va a New York, non si può andare per 4 notti....almeno 11), ed un bagno con antibagno ampio e spazioso fornito di ogni cosa. Frigo Bar, accappatoi e ciabattine oltre ad asciugamani profumati (e non come quelli che spesso troviamo in certi Hotel anche a 4/5* che emanano un odore sgradevole)! Una doccia fantastica con varie opzioni di getto d'acqua e poi una insonorizzazione giusta per la posizione, nessun rumore stradale (eravamo al 6° piano), ma la veduta con ben 3 finestre è favolosa. 
Ahhhhh, forse una pecca l'ho ricordata (peraltro dimenticandomi di segnalarlo in reception, ma l'avrebbero risolta all'istante), ovvero il Phon aveva il filo elettrico troppo corto, pertanto era sovente che si staccasse dalla presa mentre ci si asciugava i capelli.... :-)))))). Si, proprio una enorme enorme enoooooorme pecca!!! (ahahahah sorrido per il curioso rilievo ahahahaha.
Sei all'angolo della 7th AV con l'accesso dalla 51st un vero preludio di immagini e colori che avvolgono questo strepitoso Hotel. Ne ho visti davvero tantissimi e ho anche avuto contatti con decine e decine di viaggiatori che hanno alloggiato altrove, lamentandosi tutti degli spazi ridottissimi tali da non poter neppure aprire i bagagli (e non hai solo il trolley quando si va a NY.......!!!!!
Non è stato per noi importante prenotare anche la Colazione, benchè viene servita se richiesta, perchè NY offre una infinità di posti e luoghi caratteristici e/o storici che meritano di provare (scriverò recensioni anche su di essi). Inoltre proprio a 2 passi dal The Michelangelo, ci sono posti favolosi per degustare colazioni ottime ed anche ad un prezzo ragionevolmente inferiore a quello dell'hotel (ovviamente.....).
Insomma 11 notti piacevolmente trascorsi in un affascinante Hotel che con le su 5*Stelle, io e la mia famiglia siamo stati davvero benissimo e soddisfatti di ogni cosa.
Non capita sempre che solo il giorno dopo si riceve in stanza la piacevole telefonata del manager dell'Hotel, il sig. Marco Gianni, che ti chiede se abbiamo dormito bene, se tutto apposto, se serve qualcosa oltre il disponibile, insomma essere al centro dell'attenzione per un ospite è il massimo che si possa desiderare, a completamento di una pulizia giornaliera e trovare i letti preparati alla sera con cioccolatino e accappatoi sempre sostituiti anche sino al giorno prima della partenza.
Grazie, infinitamente Grazie a tutti Voi, un affettuoso abbraccio al Sig Marco Gianni, alla superlativa Laura Baroncelli ed un ringraziamento anche a tutto lo staff con cui abbiamo avuto piacere di conoscere.
Sicuramente anche in altre città cercherò di trovare Hotel IAMSTAR.

title: Perfect getaway!
text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days. The hotel was so classy, and the service was amazing. We have never been treated better. They have a great wine list at the bar and the food was very good and Italian-inspired cuisine. The hotel is also in walking distance to a lot of scenic places in the city and fun things to do. I would highly recommend booking your stay here.

title: New York City Adventure
text: We recently visited NYC for the first time and stayed at The Michelangelo. The hotel was very close to Times Square and the Broadway theaters. We had a very clean and comfortable room but no view. The hotel staff was extremely helpful in every way. I especially would like to single out Henry Diaz and Ceasar who went out of their way to help and make our trip enjoyable.

title: Great Location
text: The Michelangelo is a very comfortable hotel in a great location -- not right in Times Square but close enough to walk.  And close enough to walk to the Park as well. For New York, the rooms are very commodious and well-appointed.

title: Great hotel in a perfect location.
text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  The rooms were incredibly spacious ( compared to other New York City hotels) and the staff was very helpful and accommodating.  I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York.

title: Renaissance meets the New York state of mind!
text: A 'Wow!' on so many counts, it's not funny at all! I was there spending my holidays and the place and the staff were an absolute treat. This property is a lovely addition to the theater district in midtown (a bounce away from MoMA, the Rockefeller Center and Carnegie Hall). The staff is very attentive to details, especially at The Lounge. I enjoyed my breakfast sitting and watching the Manhattan mania at full pace from there. The Vermentino was a great find for me, stuck to that for the rest of my time there. "Mangia bene!" as Luna, the bartender would often say to me. The rooms have a certain italian flavour, llovely, spacious and well appointed. All amenities are top dollar. Had a memorable time and stay in NY, an experience I will cherish for a long time. Grazie! Ci vediamo!

title: New York Trip
text: Small hotel property conveniently located to Times Square and Central Park.  Staff friendly and attentive. Rooms are nicely sized and prices are reasonable.  Bar is small but intimate. Good place for coffee in morning and mid day wine with spouse and friends.

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text:
I highly recommend this hotel. Good midtown location. Easy walk to theatre district but not in the middle of the crowds. 
Excellent options for breakfast 
Large rooms
Staff was excellent. We had a small problem with time of our room being cleaned. Management responded very quickly to resolve issue In addition, manager went out of his way to make up for this small problem 
Was very impressed with how staff handled our questions. In addition, was very happy with their suggestions for restaurants
Look forward to my next stay there

title: Weekend get away.
text: Went for a long weekend away over Labour Day weekend. Prices were really expensive in the area but we found this hotel and one of their top rooms for a good price. Went to check in and was greeted with really friendly and helpful staff.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We have stayed here numerous times and have always had a good experience. The service is fantastic all around. On this trip we received exceptional service from Henry Diaz, a bellman. Our room was not ready on arrival. He took care of getting our bags to our room while we were out, even offering to hang clothes. The hotel is well located and a good value. Rooms are large for Manhattan.

title: Great to be back in our New York "home"
text: We first stayed at The Michelangelo 20 years ago! Back then we were back the following year but the last time we were in New York (17 years ago now!) we couldn't get a room...…...this time we were making sure that didn't happen.It was great to be back and even better to find that the same level of excellence & service still exist, it was ALL as we remembered it to be and when we came back in through the front doors of the hotel every evening (not our room door but the lobby) it just felt like a relaxing sanctuary - the noise and bustle of New York City (and Times Square which is only a 10 min walk) were instantly left behind!Once in our room it almost felt like home from home and it was SO quiet - they is some serious sound proofing in that hotel...……..it was wonderful...…..we WILL be back!

title: Atendimento e localização excelentes
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado, confortável e limpo. Quarto amplo, com TV, frigobar e facilidades. O atendimento é ótimo. Sempre simpáticos e eficientes. Estávamos hospedadas eu e minha mãe, mas minha irmã veio e dormiu uma noite em nosso quarto. Pedi uma a cama portátil para ela, fui atendida sem qualquer problema e não cobraram nenhuma taxa extra por isso. 
Só deixou a desejar no tamanho das toalhas no banheiro e por não reporem a toca de cabelo descartável. Mas, são detalhes pequenos. No geral, excelente opção!

title: Susan Seal
text: Having stayed here for 20+ years, we have consistently noticed the downgrade and services provided. The last straw was this year, when we reserved a suite, told them we would be having a early arrival of an 11AM  but we’re not given access to our suire until 4:30 PM. In addition, we’ve always received some type of gift item such as a bottle of wine or Prosecco when reserving a suite - this year -nada!  In addition, this year that was no turn down service. Sayanaya  Michelangelo! We will move on to another property!

title: Disappointment
text: Rooms need updating. Chipped furniture, holes in walls where bathroom fixtures were, stained carpets. Not sure if this a poor GM issue or the fact that the owner will not spend the money.Will only stay again because of the wonderful, professional staff!

title: Desapareceu minha camisola que ficou em cima da cama
text: Péssimo pois não localizaram a camisola que desapareceu do meu quarto que deixei em cima da minha cama e não se ofereceram para indenizar o prejuízo😡 Todos os dias meu esposo precisava repetir o que havia ocorrido para o gerente que por vezes era o mesmo e a resposta: amanhã teremos uma solução! Mas chegou o dia da nossa vinda para o Brasil e a solução não aconteceu😢. Conselho: Com tantas opções maravilhosas em termos de hotelaria em NY, eu mesma já fiquei em 9 hotéis diferentes e nunca me aconteceu nada parecido, não escolham este hotel. Evitem um potencial aborrecimento!

title: Fantastic location, beautiful hotel.
text: Second time we have stayed at the Michelangelo this year and both times it has been fantastic.  It is situated 2 mins from Times Square (and this time we could see It from our window), 10 minutes from Central Park, 5 mins from 5th Avenue, 15 mins to Hells Kitchen.  Hotel is clean and rooms are spacious.  Staff are friendly and will go out of the way to help you.  Would definitely recommend for an easy relaxing break in New York.

title: Best staff in New York City! Great rooms!
text: Great location, big and very comfortable rooms. Everyone is so friendly and nice. Most of staff has worked for the hotel for years! We stayed on the 7th floor and Norsy and Luz(not sure on spelling) were awesome. All the wait staff in bar/restaurant were great, Jimmy, Gerard, Carmen, and Jackie, can’t remember all their names. The food is excellent in the restaurant. Very quiet hotel and never have to wait on an elevator. We will never stay any where else!

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan!
text: I love the Michelangelo. You are treated like royalty from the second you enter to the second you leave. The staff really knows the meaning of "customer service". The location of this hotel is wonderful. It is 1 block from Radio City, and a couple of blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center in the heart of the Theater District. The subway is about a block away.

title: Grand suite, but not.
text: The suite we got was far less then I booked and prepaid. It did not go not noted, and you all swept it under the rug. I expected more professional service  oh well. I would hope that th his is not the general treatment shown to your customers.

title: excelente
text: O hotel é ótimo. Quarto espaçoso, limpo, cama e banheiro excelentes. Atendimento em geral e Serviço de quarto excelentes, ótimo atendimento. A localização é perfeita, ao lado da Times Square, lojas e restaurantes. Destaque especial ao barman Gerald, do bar do hotel, muito simpático e atencioso, faz a diferença! Pena só não conseguirmos um late checkout (teríamos que pagar meia diária por algumas horas a mais). Não ficamos mas nos deixaram guardar as malas no hotel por um período.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Situated just blocks from Time Square, the theaters, and restaurant row, staying in the heart of the city can either be super pricey or super dingy. We found the Michelangelo to be very reasonably priced and the room was spacious, clean, and well appointed. The building had character and charm and the staff was fantastic, friendly and helpful. We will be back.

title: Family trip
text: Cleaning has to improve. It makes a big difference a clean room to a not so clean. Specially when staying at 5 star hotel. Also the quality of pastry was not so good. It has been much better before. Bye

title: Perfect Midtown location, quiet and elegant!
text: This was our first stay at The Michelangelo.  It is perfectly located near the Theater district and Times square.  The hotel has some old world charm and it is beautifully maintained.  Rooms were clean and in good condition.  The hotel staff went out of their way to help us celebrate our 20th Anniversary.  We will be back the next time we stay in NYC.

title: 2nd time; even better than the first
text: Great place and location.  Near tons of restaurants, shopping, the theaters and Central Park. Large well maintained rooms with comfortable beds.  Excellent staff - loved Joseph at the front desk — make you feel welcome.  An added plus - I love the hotel’s signature scent.

title: Will Definitely Be Back
text: Wonderful!  Hotel is quiet and actually smelled good as we walked in.  We had a King Suite, which was very spacious. There was a full bathroom as well as one with just a sink & toilet!  Both were very clean.  In the past, we've stayed at hotels in the heart of the Times Square area and it's just too noisy and overrun with crazies.  This hotel is very convenient to everything--Times Square, restaurants, metro, etc.  We will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful stay at The Michelangelo Hotel
text:
Truly amazing hotel!!!  Everytime I stay with my friend at this hotel the service, accommodations and friendliness are over the top!  We especially love the bartender - Jimmy Casillo!  Jimmy is friendly, efficient and makes THE BEST Bellini's!  Looking forward to my next visit.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  
Mary Daley

title: Lovely Italian hotel in Times Square
text: The Michelangelo is a lovely hotel with a very European feel. No sleek, modern decor here, but it is tasteful and classic. The service was very good overall, and the rooms are GIGANTIC by NYC standards. I've never seen a room this large anywhere, let alone in New York. We had two King size beds, which were extremely comfortable. We were only on the fifth floor, but it was very quiet, and you'd never know that you are right in the Times Square area. When booking, I thought it was a little removed from the touristy craziness of this area, but it's pretty much in the middle of everything. That's simply a matter of preference. I wouldn't stay in this neighborhood again, but I would recommend this hotel to someone who would, especially if seeing a show.

title: Quick stay with high class service
text:
My husband and I had an over night layover in NYC before heading back home after a long flight back from the UK.  I am in property management and very particular about where I will lay my head at night.  After researching literally hundreds of reviews of NYC hotels, we decided to give The Michelangelo Hotel a try.  We chose to take the airtrain from the airport and connected to the subway into the city and got off at the 7th ave stop.  The hotel was only two short blocks away.  We were greeted by the bellman who helped us get our luggage down the stairs and then at the front desk by Walter.  He was friendly and very welcoming.  I let him know we were only staying a short time but we were going to make it an experience while we were in New York.  He spoke with his manager and we were upgraded to the Grand Suite.  His kindness and generosity gave the service at The Michelangelo Hotel 5 stars in my book.  The hotel has an old world Italian feel which added character to our short stay.  When arriving to our room on the 7th floor, it felt like we were coming home to a NYC penthouse apartment.  The marble floors and Italian decor continued into the living room and hallway to our bedroom.  There were two nicely appointed bathrooms and the suite was very spacious at 800 sq. ft.  The linens were clean and comfortable, though there was some wear on the carpet simply from the age of the hotel, the accommodations were still very luxurious.  We went to the hotel lounge where the hotel bartender Gerard was equally as warm and friendly as the front desk staff.  He offered us cappuccino martinis as we were feeling slightly jet lagged and recommended several places for us to enjoy dinner and more NY experiences on our quick stay.  The hotel was conveniently located within walking distance to Times Square and the Theater district without being right in the middle of NYC chaos.  When we arrived back to our room, the bed was very comfortable and our suite was quiet and relaxing.  Having two restrooms in our suite was a plus!  We enjoyed our stay and I highly recommend The Michelangelo Hotel to other picky travelers like myself who like the luxury experience and first class accommodations.  Thank you Walter and your staff for giving us that.  I would absolutely stay here again when visiting NYC.

Sincerely, 
Mrs. Van Cleave
Property Manager
Queen Bee Suite Critic

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Very, very helpful and friendly staff. They were all ready to help with any queries. Our room was lovely and spacious. Hotel is central to many tourist attractions. Really enjoyed our stay at The Michelangelo.

title: Decent hotel for work trip
text: I stayed at The Michelangelo Hotel for a work trip and selected it due to its proximity to Rockefeller Center. This hotel is in a great location if you are looking for a hotel with walkability to Times Square, Central Park, etc. The rooms were surprisingly spacious for a New York hotel. I am rating the hotel as average because the amenities were very simple, including a dated gym and a small, over-priced restaurant.

title: A great Stay
text: Our go to hotel in NYC Theater District.  The rooms are nice size and updated furnishings.  There is an . Intimate bar area. Carmen and Jimmy very pleasant and helpful. Hotel is convenient  to Rockefeller Plaza, Saks and American Girl store. There is a small Deli, Cafe Duke a few doors away. Nice salad bar. . Henry Diaz at the door is very helpful with directions wherever you need to go

title: WonderfulHotel
text:
Great location  Excellent service  Walter at the reception was beyond helpful. Ming looked after all our needs and they both made our trip with our 2 grandsons memorable
We will always return to our favorite hotel in NYC

title: An oasis of calm
text: This place is a small, elegant oasis of calm .  I love the buzz of NYC but love stepping through the doors into the elegant and comfortable lobby area.  The staff are courteous and professional and very helpful.  The rooms are beautifully finished in muted tones.  Also, considering our room was right in the heart of Manhattan it was sooooo quiet.  This is probably one of my top 3 hotels !

title: Patrick in Reservations is an angel!
text: Today I had an emergency.  I needed to cancel a trip due to my friends accident.  Patrick in reservations granted us a refund on a non-refundable reservation (we were not aware that we booked it that way)  Always look at the fine print when making your reservations. Never, never book a non-refundable trip.  We go every year to New York at this time and always stay at the Michelangelo.  We have always been happy there, but now we are truly loyal customers forever!!!  Thank you Patrick!!!!!    Patricia, Dallas Texas

title: Great Hotel
text: Excellent hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Staff were all very welcoming & helpful. Bedrooms were very comfortable & very clean. Would definitely recommend this hotel and if we are back in New York would stay again.

title: Great location, terrible furnishings
text: Great location. Stayed in a suite that the furniture was so run down we could not use the den at all. Stayed here several time a few years ago and it was very nice. Unless they upgrade, I will not be back.

title: Classy and Friendly
text: My wife and I spent five nights at the hotel last week and couldn’t have been happier. The room was very spacious, quiet and bright (Room 611). The bed was comfortable and the furnishings were tasteful. The staff was uniformly friendly and also ready to help. I like the size of the hotel too. Situated between Rockefeller Center and the Theatre District, it was an oasis of calm. Parking with the hotel discount was reasonable too! Two big thumbs up to Walter Faranda and his staff!

title: Great location and friendly staff!
text: Check in was good. Angel upgraded us from a 2 queen bedroom to a 2 king bedroom. How fantastic! It made all the difference and it was very much appreciated. Thank you so much! Plenty of room for three women to stay for a long weekend.  The bellman in the evening on Saturday evening was also there Sunday morning. He helped us with a nice club to try Saturday evening and helped us with our bags with our airport transfer Sunday morning. Nice, handsome fellow and so polite! I can’t say enough about our experience. I wish I never left! I forgot to mention great location and I always felt safe in and around the hotel.

title: Largest rooms in town
text: Unlike the usual NY hotel in which you need to come into the room sideways, this place had enormous rooms, with sitting chairs and a desk. It was well furnished and seemed more expensive than it was. A couple of small peeves — no plugs near the bed, and the drone of HVAC (but it was quite hot out). Very well situated in midtown and Times Square.

title: Nice service but rooms are dated
text: We recently stayed here for a weekend.   We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.    However, we found the room and hallway dated.   The smells were of a space that was old.   The location is good.  The bar service was average.

title: As charming as ever
text:
I have been staying regularly at The Michelangelo since December 2007, and have found it to be a wonderful home base for my Broadway theater trips.  The service has always been wonderful, but on my recent visit during the July 4th weekend, the service really stepped up when I needed some help.

I had booked transportation from the airport to the hotel with the help of The Michelangelo's Concierge.  After I arrived and had been checked into my room, I was shocked to discover that my smart phone must have fallen out of my pocket at some point during the ride to the hotel.  I immediately went down to the lobby to inform the Concierge what had happened, since she had been the one who had booked the ride.  She immediately helped me out by contacting the transportation company and getting in touch with the driver, who indeed did find my phone in the back seat, and dropped it off at the front desk that evening before I was to attend my first performance on that trip.  I am grateful for the quick and immediate service she provided, and for being so helpful in getting my phone back so quickly.

As always, the rest of my stay was worry-free.  I was upgraded to a gorgeous and large suite, and being a regular at the hotel, so many people at the hotel seem to know me by name, and are genuinely happy to see me whenever I come back.  The Michelangelo also has a very quiet and intimate atmosphere that you just don't find very often in New York, and is always welcome to return to after a long day in the city.

Whenever anyone I know is headed to Manhattan, I always tell them to try The Michelangelo.  I will be returning for another visit in December with a couple of my friends, and I look forward to not only returning, but to seeing their reaction as well. (One came with me last summer and loved it, the other is going to have their first experience.) Thank you again, Michelangelo staff, for your help and for another great stay!

title: The Michelangelo Hotel
text: The hotel was very nice. All the staff was very pleasant and always ready to help which made the experience more comfortable. The doorman, Henry was always willing to help guide me in the right direction and give excellent recommendations for restaurants and fun things to do in New York City.

title: Sehr gutes Stadthotel
text: sehr schönes Hotel an der Ecke zur 7th Street 51 W - man konnte problemlos viele Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuss erreichen; sehr schöne Eingangshalle; überaus nettes Personal und schöne, grosszügige Zimmer (hatten eine Junior-Suite); überall sehr sauber und es herrschte in dieser hektischen Stadt immer eine gute und ruhige Ambiance - kann es wirklich weiterempfehlen

title: First time at the Michelangelo.
text: Other than the parking charge being different than what I was told, our stay was very nice.  Location was great for all the things we were doing in the City.  Thought noise would be an issue but it was not.

title: Beautiful Italian style hotel in Manhattan
text:
Amazing hotel.
We stayed here and want to go back again.
Beautiful decor and friendly staff.
The rooms are a great size for New York and the bed was so comfortable. 
Close to everything you would want to do in New York but still not too noisy.

title: Classy and Elegant - A league of its own. Special Thanks to Walther and June
text:
This place exemplifies elegance and classic luxury. It has a very eclectic spirit, coupled with authentic Italian hospitality. The rooms are spacious, inviting, and not intimidating like some modern, chic luxury hotels can be at times. The crowd is older, professional, and classy. And so is the staff. They go out of their way, are patient, kind, and made my stay here memorable. 

Cannot say one negative thing - these guys are some of the best. The lobby alone is quite the spectacle, is open, inviting, and screams class in a non-pretentious way. That is not an easy to pull off in NYC, kudos to the architect. 

Special thanks and shout out to Walther - He made my stay worth it, I will be coming back, and greeted me with steadfast service the moment I arrived. Also, thank you to June, who allowed for a much needed late checkout. These little things go a very, very long way.

title: Absolute Great Stay
text: The hotel still has a good amount of the old school charm of the former Taft Hotel.  The rooms are comfortable and spacious for NYC.  The staff makes the place.  In all my years as a biz traveler I never had a bellman / doorman give me a bro hug.  These guys have every connection needed.  It wasn't a stay, it was an experience and its in a GREAT location.  Great job!

title: Best hotel in NYC
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our weekend NYC getaway. This hotel offers beautiful and spacious rooms. We upgraded to a junior suite and it was worth it. Location is great—close to restaurants, theatre and shopping! I have already booked this hotel
 Again for my next trip to NYC in February!

title: A great hotel in a great location
text:
This hotel offers room space about double that of other fine NYC hotels. 
It is located in the Theater district and very close to transit stations. From here you have good access to everything NYC has to offer. 
The staff are outstanding and super responsive as well as friendly and efficient.

title: New York
text: Stayed for 7 nights at the michaelangelo hotel. Ideally located just round the corner from times square. Hotel was really nice. Our room was massive the only down side was the window faced onto the next building so could not see anything. There was a gym which was included in the price. It was only small not much equipment. The staff were friendly. There was a shop two doors down Cafe Duke that was open 24/7 this sold everything. We would go there for breakfast.

title: A gem of a hotel at a reasonable price
text: The hotel staff here couldn't have been nicer.  I had spent hours searching online sites for a reasonably priced, well-located hotel in NYC that had adequate air conditioning when I found The Michelangelo. We could not have been happier with our stay here, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again on future trips to NYC.

title: Great hotel, great staff.
text: Really enjoy this hotel.  Staff are friendly and very helpful. Great location and really nice accomodations. Close to everything but not in the chaos of times square. Excellent hotel.  I'll stay there again.

title: Brilliant
text:
Absolutely stunning hotel, right in the heart of time square.

Staff very attentive and accommodating, rooms absolutely gorgeous and very spacious. Lovely bathroom. Large beds that are so comfy. Great views from the room of Times Square. Nice breakfast but if you don’t want to pay for it you can walk out the door and have so many other cheaper options. Would definitely return here. Had a great time.

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: We have stayed many times at this hotel and always found it to be wonderful - clean, friendly, excellent service, nice bar, good food, very nice rooms, and an excellent location. The concierge is always very helpful, the air conditioning actually workls well, and there are good deals available through

title: Amazing Hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Michelangelo. It is in a great location convienent to the places we wanted to go.  We walked almost everywhere we went. The room was spacious enough for 3 of us and very clean.  The service was excellent and they worked with us when our flight was unexpectedly cancelled and we needed to stay another night.  The bellman Henry was extremely helpful to us with our luggage, directions, and even provided us with umbrellas on a rainy afternoon!  He met us with a smile each day and made us feel welcome. Henry is amazing!

title: Extraordinary always!
text:
The Michelangelo is an outstanding and elegant 4 Star hotel located in the heart of the theater district and Times Square. We have stayed there exclusively over the decades when we travel to New York City with very good reason: the hotel sparkles and is likely the cleanest and most comfortable we’ve ever stayed in. The staff is welcoming and competent and treats each guest like royalty (which we are not.) Walther is a fixture at reception and we recently met Angel. They are so accommodating and gracious -ready to answer all questions and to make the stay fabulous. We met Ming at the front door, and he is amazing too! He was welcoming, funny and extremely helpful, whether suggesting where to pick up coffee or starting our morning off with a warm greeting. It makes so
much of a difference. There is self parking a couple of doors down. Incredibly enough, rates are very competitive if you make reservations early and ask the hotel about special packages. This hotel is extraordinary!!!
